					<h1 id="firstHeading" class="firstHeading mw-first-heading"><span class="mw-page-title-main">List of organisms named after famous people (born 1900–1949)</span></h1>
							
<div id="p-lang-btn" class="vector-dropdown mw-portlet mw-portlet-lang">
	<input type="checkbox" id="p-lang-btn-checkbox" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" data-event-name="ui.dropdown-p-lang-btn" class="vector-dropdown-checkbox mw-interlanguage-selector" aria-label="This article exist only in this language. Add the article for other languages">
	<label id="p-lang-btn-label" for="p-lang-btn-checkbox" class="vector-dropdown-label cdx-button cdx-button--fake-button cdx-button--fake-button--enabled cdx-button--weight-quiet cdx-button--action-progressive mw-portlet-lang-heading-0" aria-hidden="true"><span class="vector-icon mw-ui-icon-language-progressive mw-ui-icon-wikimedia-language-progressive"></span>

	</label>
	<div class="vector-dropdown-content">

		<div class="vector-menu-content">

	<div class="vector-menu-content">
		
		<ul class="vector-menu-content-list">
			
			<li id="ca-view" class="selected vector-tab-noicon mw-list-item"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_organisms_named_after_famous_people_(born_1900%E2%80%931949)"><span>Read</span></a></li><li id="ca-edit" class="vector-tab-noicon mw-list-item"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_organisms_named_after_famous_people_(born_1900%E2%80%931949)&amp;action=edit" title="Edit this page [Alt+Shift+e]" accesskey="e"><span>Edit</span></a></li><li id="ca-history" class="vector-tab-noicon mw-list-item"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_organisms_named_after_famous_people_(born_1900%E2%80%931949)&amp;action=history" title="Past revisions of this page [Alt+Shift+h]" accesskey="h"><span>View history</span></a></li>
		</ul>
		
	</div>
</div>

							</nav>

	<div class="vector-dropdown-content">

							</div>
		</nav>
					</div>
				</div>
				<div id="bodyContent" class="vector-body ve-init-mw-desktopArticleTarget-targetContainer" aria-labelledby="firstHeading" data-mw-ve-target-container="">
					<div class="vector-body-before-content">
							<div class="mw-indicators">
		</div>

						<div id="siteSub" class="noprint">From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia</div>
					</div>
					<div id="contentSub"><div id="mw-content-subtitle"></div></div>
					
					
					<div id="mw-content-text" class="mw-body-content"><div class="mw-content-ltr mw-parser-output" lang="en" dir="ltr"><div class="shortdescription nomobile noexcerpt noprint searchaux" style="display:none">This description is intentionally empty</div>
<p>
In <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biological_nomenclature" class="mw-redirect" title="Biological nomenclature">biological nomenclature</a>, organisms often receive <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scientific_name" class="mw-redirect" title="Scientific name">scientific names</a> that honor a person. A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taxon" title="Taxon">taxon</a> (e.g., <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Species" title="Species">species</a> or <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genus" title="Genus">genus</a>; plural: taxa) named in honor of another entity is an <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eponym" title="Eponym">eponymous taxon</a>, and names specifically honoring a person or persons are known as <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patronym_(taxonomy)" class="mw-redirect" title="Patronym (taxonomy)">patronyms</a>. Scientific names are generally formally published in peer-reviewed journal articles or larger <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monograph" title="Monograph">monographs</a> along with descriptions of the named taxa and ways to distinguish them from other taxa. Following rules of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Latin_grammar" title="Latin grammar">Latin grammar</a>, species or subspecies names derived from a man's name often end in <i>-i</i> or <i>-ii</i> if named for an individual, and <i>-orum</i> if named for a group of men or mixed-sex group, such as a family. Similarly, those named for a woman often end in <i>-ae</i>, or <i>-arum</i> for two or more women.
</p><p>This list is part of the <b><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_organisms_named_after_famous_people" title="List of organisms named after famous people">List of organisms named after famous people</a></b>, and includes organisms named after famous individuals <b>born between 1 January 1900 and 31 December 1949</b>.
 It also includes ensembles (including bands and comedy troupes) in 
which at least one member was born within those dates; but excludes 
companies, institutions, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/People" title="People">ethnic groups or nationalities</a>,
 and populated places. It does not include organisms named for fictional
 entities, for biologists, paleontologists or other natural scientists,<sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>note 1<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
 nor for associates or family members of researchers who are not 
otherwise notable; exceptions are made, however, for natural scientists 
who are much more famous for other aspects of their lives, such as, for 
example, Japanese emperors <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hirohito" title="Hirohito">Hirohito</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Akihito" title="Akihito">Akihito</a>.
</p><p><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sir_David_Attenborough" class="mw-redirect" title="Sir David Attenborough">Sir David Attenborough</a>
 was formerly included in this section of the list as one of these 
exceptions, since despite his formal training as a natural scientist, he
 is more widely known to the public as a documentary filmmaker. However,
 due to the high number of taxa named after him (over 50 as of 2022), he
 has been removed; his patronyms can be found in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_things_named_after_David_Attenborough_and_his_works" title="List of things named after David Attenborough and his works">List of things named after David Attenborough and his works</a>.
</p><p>Organisms named after famous people born earlier than 1900 can be found in:
</p>
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_organisms_named_after_famous_people_(born_before_1800)" title="List of organisms named after famous people (born before 1800)">List of organisms named after famous people (born before 1800)</a></li>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_organisms_named_after_famous_people_(born_1800%E2%80%931899)" title="List of organisms named after famous people (born 1800–1899)">List of organisms named after famous people (born 1800–1899)</a></li></ul>
<p>Organisms named after famous people born later than 1949 can be found in:
</p>
<ul><li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_organisms_named_after_famous_people_(born_1950%E2%80%93present)" title="List of organisms named after famous people (born 1950–present)">List of organisms named after famous people (born 1950–present)</a></li></ul>
<p>The scientific names are given as originally described (their <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basionym" title="Basionym">basionyms</a>): subsequent research may have placed species in different genera, or rendered them <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Synonym_(biology)" class="mw-redirect" title="Synonym (biology)">taxonomic synonyms</a> of previously described taxa. Some of these names may be <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unavailable_name" class="mw-redirect" title="Unavailable name">unavailable</a> in the zoological sense or <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nomen_illegitimum" title="Nomen illegitimum">illegitimate</a> in the botanical sense due to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Senior_homonym" class="mw-redirect" title="Senior homonym">senior homonyms</a> already having the same name.
</p>
<meta property="mw:PageProp/toc">
<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="List_(people_born_1900–1949)"><span id="List_.28people_born_1900.E2.80.931949.29"></span>List (people born 1900–1949)</h2><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_organisms_named_after_famous_people_(born_1900%E2%80%931949)&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" title="Edit section: List (people born 1900–1949)"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1236090951">.mw-parser-output .hatnote{font-style:italic}.mw-parser-output div.hatnote{padding-left:1.6em;margin-bottom:0.5em}.mw-parser-output .hatnote i{font-style:normal}.mw-parser-output .hatnote+link+.hatnote{margin-top:-0.5em}@media print{body.ns-0 .mw-parser-output .hatnote{display:none!important}}</style><div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">This is a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:WikiProject_Lists#Dynamic_lists" title="Wikipedia:WikiProject Lists">dynamic list</a> and may never be able to satisfy particular standards for completeness. You can help by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:EditPage/List_of_organisms_named_after_famous_people_(born_1900%E2%80%931949)" title="Special:EditPage/List of organisms named after famous people (born 1900–1949)">adding missing items</a> with <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Reliable_sources" title="Wikipedia:Reliable sources">reliable sources</a>.</div>

<div style="margin:auto;">

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abba_transversa" title="">Abba</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Castanheira &amp; Framenau, 2023</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ABBA" title="ABBA">ABBA</a></td>
<td>A genus of Australian <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orb-weaving_spider" class="mw-redirect" title="Orb-weaving spider">orb-weaving spiders</a> whose name "honours the Swedish pop group ABBA whose songs and subsequent musicals <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mamma_Mia!_(film)" title="Mamma Mia! (film)">Mamma Mia!</a></i> (2008) and <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mamma_Mia!_Here_We_Go_Again" title="Mamma Mia! Here We Go Again">Mamma Mia! Here We Go Again</a></i> (2018), provided hours of entertainment for the authors."</td>

<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Abichites_shahriari&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Abichites shahriari (page does not exist)">Abichites shahriari</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Korn <i>et al.</i>, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ammonite" class="mw-redirect" title="Ammonite">Ammonite</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Shahriar, Mohammad-Hossein"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mohammad-Hossein_Shahriar" title="Mohammad-Hossein Shahriar">Mohammad-Hossein Shahriar</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Permian" title="Permian">Permian</a> of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aras_(river)" title="Aras (river)">Aras river</a> valley, on the border between <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran" title="Iran">Iran</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Azerbaijan" title="Azerbaijan">Azerbaijan</a>,
 named "After Mohammad-Hossein Shahriar (1906–1988), the last poet of 
the lineage of classical legendary Iranian Azerbaijani poets."</td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acanthobunocephalus_scruggsi" title="Acanthobunocephalus scruggsi">Acanthobunocephalus scruggsi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Carvalho &amp; Reis, 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catfish" title="Catfish">Catfish</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Scruggs, Earl"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earl_Scruggs" title="Earl Scruggs">Earl Scruggs</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"Named after Earl Scruggs, a prominent American banjo player known 
for popularizing a three-finger banjo picking style, also known as "<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scruggs_style" title="Scruggs style">Scruggs style</a>", which is characteristic of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bluegrass_music" title="Bluegrass music">bluegrass music</a>. The name of the species also makes an allusion to the common name given to aspredinid species in general (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Banjo_catfish" class="mw-redirect" title="Banjo catfish">banjo catfishes</a>), and the remarkable resemblance of the new species with this musical instrument."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Earl_Scruggs_2005.JPG" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Earl_Scruggs_2005.JPG" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Earl_Scruggs_2005.JPG 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Earl_Scruggs_2005.JPG 2x" data-file-width="667" data-file-height="890"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-7"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>6<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-ETYFish2020_8-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ETYFish2020-8"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>7<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acanthophis_hawkei" title="Acanthophis hawkei">Acanthophis hawkei</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_W._Wells" title="Richard W. Wells">Wells</a> &amp; Wellington, 1985</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snake" title="Snake">Snake</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Hawke, Bob"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_Hawke" title="Bob Hawke">Bob Hawke</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>An Australian <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acanthophis" title="Acanthophis">death adder</a> "Named for the Prime Minister of Australia, the Rt. Hon. Robert J. Hawke, in recognition of his part in saving the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tasmania" title="Tasmania">Tasmanian</a> wilderness." This species was described in one of the papers involved in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wells_and_Wellington_affair" title="Wells and Wellington affair">Wells and Wellington affair</a>
 and is one of the few from those papers that is accepted as valid by 
the scientific community and has not been synonymised. In turn, a 
military vehicle of the Australian Army, the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hawkei_PMV" class="mw-redirect" title="Hawkei PMV">Hawkei PMV</a>, is named after this species.</td>
<td></td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Acrogonyleptes_cheguevarai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Acrogonyleptes cheguevarai (page does not exist)">Acrogonyleptes cheguevarai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">DaSilva &amp; Pinto-da-Rocha, 2010</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harvestman" class="mw-redirect" title="Harvestman">Harvestman</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Guevara, Che"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Che_Guevara" title="Che Guevara">Che Guevara</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"In honor of Che Guevara (1928–1967), the famous Argentine socialist
 revolutionary, who undertook the battle for the people's freedom in 
Latin America and Africa."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Che_Guevara_-_Guerrillero_Heroico_by_Alberto_Korda.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Che_Guevara_-_Guerrillero_Heroico_by_Alberto_Korda_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="127" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Che_Guevara_-_Guerrillero_Heroico_by_Alberto_Korda.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Che_Guevara_-_Guerrillero_Heroico_by_Alberto_Korda.jpg.webp 2x" data-file-width="2827" data-file-height="3274"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Acropora_sirikitiae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Acropora sirikitiae (page does not exist)">Acropora sirikitiae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Wallace, Phongsuwan &amp; Muir, 2012</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coral" title="Coral">Coral</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sirikit" title="Sirikit">Sirikit</a></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stony_coral" class="mw-redirect" title="Stony coral">stony coral</a> found on the coast of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thailand" title="Thailand">Thailand</a>,
 "named to honour the 80th year of Her Majesty Queen Regent of Thailand,
 Somdetch Phra Nang Chao Sirikit Phra Baromma Rajini Nath, who has 
supported biodiversity and conservation of Thailand's reef, and improved
 the lives of poor fishermen of Thailand, by her restoration project 
providing artificial reefs in Thai waters."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Queen_Sirikit_1960.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Queen_Sirikit_1960.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="159" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Queen_Sirikit_1960.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Queen_Sirikit_1960.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1600" data-file-height="2311"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Actinopus_dioi" title="Actinopus dioi">Actinopus dioi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Miglio, Pérez-Miles &amp; Bonaldo, 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Dio, Ronnie James"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ronnie_James_Dio" title="Ronnie James Dio">Ronnie James Dio</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The specific name is in honor of musician Ronald James Padavona or Ronnie James Dio, one of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Sabbath" title="Black Sabbath">Black Sabbath</a> vocals, affiliated to several bands of heavy metal in addition to his solo career."</td>

<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Ronnie-James-Dio_Heaven-N-Hell_2009-06-11_Chicago_Photoby_Adam-Bielawski_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ronnie-James-Dio_Heaven-N-Hell_2009-06-11_Chicago_Photoby_Ad.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="114" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ronnie-James-Dio_Heaven-N-Hell_2009-06-11_Chicago_Photob_002.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="363" data-file-height="375"></a></span></td>

<td>"The specific name is in honor of musician John Michael Osbourne or 
Ozzy Osbourne, the founder of heavy metal, affiliated to a band called <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Sabbath" title="Black Sabbath">Black Sabbath</a>, in addition to his solo career."</td>
<td></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Adaina_jobimi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Adaina jobimi (page does not exist)">Adaina jobimi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Vargas, 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moth" title="Moth">Moth</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Jobim, Antônio Carlos"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ant%C3%B4nio_Carlos_Jobim" title="Antônio Carlos Jobim">Antônio Carlos Jobim</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"dedicated to the memory of the great Brazilian musician Antônio 
Carlos Brasileiro de Almeida Jobim, best known as Tom Jobim, for his 
huge contribution to the development of the "<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M%C3%BAsica_Popular_Brasileira" class="mw-redirect" title="Música Popular Brasileira">Música Popular Brasileira</a>" and his admiration of nature".</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Ant%C3%B4nio_Carlos_Jobim_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ant%25C3%25B4nio_Carlos_Jobim_(cropped)_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="135" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ant%25C3%25B4nio_Carlos_Jobim_(cropped)_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ant%C3%B4nio_Carlos_Jobim_(cropped).jpg 2x" data-file-width="1580" data-file-height="1936"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Adenomera_chicomendesi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Adenomera chicomendesi (page does not exist)">Adenomera chicomendesi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Carvalho <i>et al.</i>, 2019</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frog" title="Frog">Frog</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Mendes, Chico"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chico_Mendes" title="Chico Mendes">Chico Mendes</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"named after Francisco Alves Mendes Filho, better known as Chico 
Mendes, in recognition of his efforts and sacrifice as an 
environmentalist in the Amazon rain forest, especially in the Brazilian 
state of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acre_(state)" title="Acre (state)">Acre</a>,
 his homeland [where the type locality is]. He also fought for the human
 rights of indigenous peoples and rubber tapper communities of the 
region. As a consequence of his activism, Chico Mendes was assassinated 
on 22 December 1988 in his hometown of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xapuri" title="Xapuri">Xapuri</a>, in Acre."</td>
<td></td>

<td>A Polish beetle, posthumously named for the Pope's birth name, Karol Wojtyła. Subsequently synonymised with <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Aegomorphus_obscurior&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Aegomorphus obscurior (page does not exist)">Aegomorphus obscurior</a></i>.</td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Aetana_abadae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Aetana abadae (page does not exist)">Aetana abadae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Huber, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Abad, Pacita"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pacita_Abad" title="Pacita Abad">Pacita Abad</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cellar_spider" class="mw-redirect" title="Cellar spider">cellar spider</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippines" title="Philippines">Philippines</a>,
 "Named for Philippine-born cosmopolitan artist Pacita Abad (1946–2004),
 famous for her vibrant, colorful abstract work, but also for her 
paintings of tropical flowers and animal wildlife."</td>
<td></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Aetana_manansalai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Aetana manansalai (page does not exist)">Aetana manansalai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Huber, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Manansala, Vicente"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vicente_Manansala" title="Vicente Manansala">Vicente Manansala</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cellar_spider" class="mw-redirect" title="Cellar spider">cellar spider</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippines" title="Philippines">Philippines</a>,
 "Named for the Filipino painter and illustrator Vicente Silva Manansala
 (1910–1981), most famous for his 'Madonna of the Slums'"</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Vicente_Manansala_2010_stampsheet_of_the_Philippines_2_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Vicente_Manansala_2010_stampsheet_of_the_Philippines_2_(_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="131" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Vicente_Manansala_2010_stampsheet_of_the_Philippines_2_(_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Vicente_Manansala_2010_stampsheet_of_the_Philippines_2_(crop.jpg 2x" data-file-width="220" data-file-height="261"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Huberetal15_23-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Huberetal15-23"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>22<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Aetana_ocampoi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Aetana ocampoi (page does not exist)">Aetana ocampoi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Huber, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Ocampo, Hernando R."><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hernando_R._Ocampo" title="Hernando R. Ocampo">Hernando R. Ocampo</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cellar_spider" class="mw-redirect" title="Cellar spider">cellar spider</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippines" title="Philippines">Philippines</a>,
 "Named for the Filipino artist Hernando Ruiz Ocampo (1911–1978), famous
 for his work reflecting the harsh realities of his country after the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Second_World_War" class="mw-redirect" title="Second World War">Second World War</a>, but also for his interest in depicting <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wildlife_of_the_Philippines" title="Wildlife of the Philippines">Philippine flora and fauna</a>."</td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Huberetal15_23-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Huberetal15-23"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>22<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afgekia_mahidoliae" title="Afgekia mahidoliae">Afgekia mahidoliae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/B._L._Burtt" title="B. L. Burtt">B.L.Burtt</a> &amp; Chermsir.</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legume" title="Legume">Legume</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Srinagarindra" title="Srinagarindra">Srinagarindra</a></td>
<td>A climbing vine from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thailand" title="Thailand">Thailand</a> "dedicated, with permission, to Her Royal Highness, the King's Mother, whose interest in the Thai flora is well known."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Bangkok_Photowalk_1,_Bangkok_08.10.2023_(12).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bangkok_Photowalk_1,_Bangkok_08.10.2023_(12)_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="83" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bangkok_Photowalk_1,_Bangkok_08.10.2023_(12)_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bangkok_Photowalk_1,_Bangkok_08.10.2023_(12).jpg 2x" data-file-width="2592" data-file-height="1944"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Princess_Mother_Srinagarindra.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Princess_Mother_Srinagarindra.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="162" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Princess_Mother_Srinagarindra_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Princess_Mother_Srinagarindra_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="400" data-file-height="590"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-24" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-24"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>23<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Afghanella_tereshkovae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Afghanella tereshkovae (page does not exist)">Afghanella tereshkovae</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Leven, 1967</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Protist" title="Protist">Protist</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Tereshkova, Valentina"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Valentina_Tereshkova" title="Valentina Tereshkova">Valentina Tereshkova</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Foraminiferan" class="mw-redirect" title="Foraminiferan">foraminiferan</a> found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Permian" title="Permian">Permian</a> deposits throughout <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eurasia" title="Eurasia">Eurasia</a>, described from a holotype collected from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pamir_Mountains" title="Pamir Mountains">Pamir Mountains</a> in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tajikistan" title="Tajikistan">Tajikistan</a> (formerly part of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_Union" title="Soviet Union">Soviet Union</a>).</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:RIAN_archive_612748_Valentina_Tereshkova.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/RIAN_archive_612748_Valentina_Tereshkova_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="111" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/RIAN_archive_612748_Valentina_Tereshkova.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="1014" data-file-height="1024"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-25" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-25"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>24<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agathidium_bushi" title="Agathidium bushi">Agathidium bushi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Miller &amp; <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quentin_D._Wheeler" title="Quentin D. Wheeler">Wheeler</a>, 2005</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Bush, George W."><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_W._Bush" title="George W. Bush">George W. Bush</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>This beetle was named by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quentin_D._Wheeler" title="Quentin D. Wheeler">Quentin D. Wheeler</a>, and President Bush was pleased with the gesture, even calling Wheeler to thank him for the honor. Because of the problematic <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Public_image_of_George_W._Bush" title="Public image of George W. Bush">public image of Bush</a>
 and his cabinet, and the fact that this is a slime-mold beetle which 
feeds on decaying fungi, some interpreted the naming to be intended as 
an insult; however, Wheeler clarified that this species, as well as <i>A. cheneyi</i> and <i>A. rumsfeldi</i>,
 were meant as homages: "We admire these leaders as fellow citizens who 
have the courage of their convictions and are willing to do the very 
difficult and unpopular work of living up to principles of freedom and 
democracy rather than accepting the expedient or popular". Co-author 
Kelly Miller said "We intended the names to be honorific... We were two 
conservatives in academia working together (which is not common). It was
 early in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iraq_war" class="mw-redirect" title="Iraq war">Iraq war</a>
 period, and we were both in favor of intervention there... And finally,
 we love our beetles! We wouldn't name a new species after someone we 
didn't like. [In interviews,] we compared it to the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lewis_and_Clark_expedition" class="mw-redirect" title="Lewis and Clark expedition">Lewis and Clark expedition</a> naming the three forks of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Missouri_River" title="Missouri River">Missouri</a> after <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_Jefferson" title="Thomas Jefferson">Jefferson</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Madison" title="James Madison">Madison</a>, and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_Gallatin" title="Albert Gallatin">Gallatin</a> (President, Vice President, and Secretary of the Treasury [at the time])."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:George-W-Bush.jpeg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/George-W-Bush.jpeg.webp" decoding="async" width="110" height="146" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/George-W-Bush_002.jpeg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/George-W-Bush.jpeg 2x" data-file-width="2267" data-file-height="3000"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Agathidium2005_26-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Agathidium2005-26"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>25<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Cornell1_27-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Cornell1-27"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>26<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><br><sup id="cite_ref-28" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-28"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>27<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-29" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-29"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>28<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Cheney, Dick"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dick_Cheney" title="Dick Cheney">Dick Cheney</a></span></span></span></td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agathidium_rumsfeldi" class="mw-redirect" title="Agathidium rumsfeldi">Agathidium rumsfeldi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Miller &amp; Wheeler, 2005</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Rumsfeld, Donald"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Rumsfeld" title="Donald Rumsfeld">Donald Rumsfeld</a></span></span></span></td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Rumsfeld1.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rumsfeld1.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="138" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rumsfeld1_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rumsfeld1_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2400" data-file-height="3000"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Agathidium2005_26-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Agathidium2005-26"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>25<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Cornell1_27-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Cornell1-27"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>26<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Agmasoma_aquinoae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Agmasoma aquinoae (page does not exist)">Agmasoma aquinoae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Enriquez &amp; Sprague, 1988</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fungus" title="Fungus">Fungus</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Aquino, Corazon"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corazon_Aquino" title="Corazon Aquino">Corazon Aquino</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>This species of marine <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microsporidium" class="mw-redirect" title="Microsporidium">microsporidium</a> was first identified in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippines" title="Philippines">Philippines</a>. It is a parasite of prawns of the genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penaeus" title="Penaeus">Penaeus</a></i>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Corazon_Aquino_1986.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Corazon_Aquino_1986_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Corazon_Aquino_1986_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Corazon_Aquino_1986.jpg 2x" data-file-width="894" data-file-height="1192"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-30" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-30"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>29<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agra_schwarzeneggeri" title="Agra schwarzeneggeri">Agra schwarzeneggeri</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terry_Erwin" title="Terry Erwin">Erwin</a>, 2002</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Schwarzenegger, Arnold"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arnold_Schwarzenegger" title="Arnold Schwarzenegger">Arnold Schwarzenegger</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>Named "in reference to the markedly developed (biceps-like) middle 
femora of the males of this species reminiscent of the actor's 
physique."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Arnold_Schwarzenegger_by_Gage_Skidmore_4_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/120px-Arnold_Schwarzenegger_by_Gage_Skidmore_4_(cropped).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="140" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/250px-Arnold_Schwarzenegger_by_Gage_Skidmore_4_(cropped).jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="2030" data-file-height="2588"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Erwin2002_31-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Erwin2002-31"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>30<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Sylvainhugiella_cesairei&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Sylvainhugiella cesairei (page does not exist)">Agraecia cesairei</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Hugel, 2009</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katydid" class="mw-redirect" title="Katydid">Katydid</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Césaire, Aimé"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aim%C3%A9_C%C3%A9saire" title="Aimé Césaire">Aimé Césaire</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>This species is endemic to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martinique" title="Martinique">Martinique</a>. It was subsequently transferred to the monotypic genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Sylvainhugiella&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Sylvainhugiella (page does not exist)">Sylvainhugiella</a></i>, named after the scientist who described it.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Aime_Cesaire_2003.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Aime_Cesaire_2003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="158" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Aime_Cesaire_2003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Aime_Cesaire_2003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="454" data-file-height="653"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-32" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-32"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>31<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-33" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-33"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>32<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Agrilus_updikei&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Agrilus updikei (page does not exist)">Agrilus updikei</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Hespenheide, 2012</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Updike, John"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Updike" title="John Updike">John Updike</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jewel_beetle" class="mw-redirect" title="Jewel beetle">jewel beetle</a> that mimics <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diptera" class="mw-redirect" title="Diptera">flies</a>,
 "named in honor of the late writer John Updike. Although Updike 
published sparingly on Neotropical beetles (1963), his use of metaphors,
 widely admired by critics, recommends this honor because, in a sense, a
 species which mimics another is a kind of metaphor for the mimicked 
species and benefits by being confused for its model by uncritical 
predators."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:John_Updike,_author_at_PEN_Congress,_cropped.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/John_Updike,_author_at_PEN_Congress,_cropped_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="165" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/John_Updike,_author_at_PEN_Congress,_cropped.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="666" data-file-height="997"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Akihito_(fish)" title="Akihito (fish)">Akihito</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Watson, Keith, &amp; Marquet, 2007</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">Fish</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Akihito" title="Akihito">Akihito</a></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sicydiinae" title="Sicydiinae">freshwater goby</a> endemic to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vanuatu" title="Vanuatu">Vanuatu</a>. "The new genus name honors Emperor Akihito for his many contributions to goby systematics and phylogenetic research"</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Emperor_Akihito_cropped_1_Barack_Obama_Emperor_Akihito_and_Empress_Michiko_20140424_1.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Emperor_Akihito_cropped_1_Barack_Obama_Emperor_Akihito_and_E.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="137" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Emperor_Akihito_cropped_1_Barack_Obama_Emperor_Akihito_a_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Emperor_Akihito_cropped_1_Barack_Obama_Emperor_Akihito_a_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="996" data-file-height="1242"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-WatsonKeithMarquet_2007_35-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WatsonKeithMarquet_2007-35"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>34<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Aleiodes_kingmani&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Aleiodes kingmani (page does not exist)">Aleiodes kingmani</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Shimbori &amp; Shaw, 2014</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Kingman, Eduardo"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eduardo_Kingman" title="Eduardo Kingman">Eduardo Kingman</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parasitoid_wasp" title="Parasitoid wasp">parasitoid wasp</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ecuador" title="Ecuador">Ecuador</a>,
 "named after Eduardo Kingman (Loja, February 23, 1913 – Quito, November
 27, 1997), one of the greatest Ecuadorian artists, who dedicated his 
art to portray the indigenous people of Ecuador."</td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-ShimboriShaw_2014_36-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ShimboriShaw_2014-36"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>35<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Niven, Larry"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Larry_Niven" title="Larry Niven">Larry Niven</a></span></span></span></td>

<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Butcheretal2012_37-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Butcheretal2012-37"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>36<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allende_(spider)" title="Allende (spider)">Allende</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Álvarez-Padilla, 2007</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Allende, Salvador"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salvador_Allende" title="Salvador Allende">Salvador Allende</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A genus of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Long-jawed_orb_weaver" title="Long-jawed orb weaver">Long-jawed orb weaver</a> spiders native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chile" title="Chile">Chile</a>.</td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allendia" title="Allendia">Allendia</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Noonan, 1974</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Allende, Salvador"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salvador_Allende" title="Salvador Allende">Salvador Allende</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The genus is named for Salvador Allende, the late president of Chile, and is dedicated to his memory." This genus is native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chile" title="Chile">Chile</a>, and was named one year after Allende's death.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Salvador_Allende_Gossens-.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Salvador_Allende_Gossens-_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="142" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Salvador_Allende_Gossens-_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Salvador_Allende_Gossens-.jpg 2x" data-file-width="325" data-file-height="421"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-39" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-39"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>38<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allobates_algorei" title="Allobates algorei">Allobates algorei</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Barrio-Amorós &amp; Santos, 2009</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frog" title="Frog">Frog</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Gore, Al"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al_Gore" title="Al Gore">Al Gore</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"We name this species after the former American vice-president and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobel_Peace_Prize" title="Nobel Peace Prize">Nobel Peace Laureate</a>
 Al Gore to recognize his ecumenical efforts to alert the people of the 
planet about the global warming crisis. Amphibians are among the 
organisms most affected by this crisis, even without direct prosecution 
by humans. Concretely, the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venezuelan_Andes" title="Venezuelan Andes">Andes of Venezuela</a>
 [where this species is native from] have suffered an evident decimation
 of amphibian populations due to known and unknown causes."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Al_Gore_by_JD_Lasica,_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Al_Gore_by_JD_Lasica,_(cropped)_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="157" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Al_Gore_by_JD_Lasica,_(cropped).jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Al_Gore_by_JD_Lasica,_(cropped)_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1545" data-file-height="2200"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-40" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-40"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>39<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allocybaeina_littlewalteri" class="mw-redirect" title="Allocybaeina littlewalteri">Allocybaeina littlewalteri</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Bennett, 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Little_Walter" title="Little Walter">Little Walter</a></td>
<td>"The specific epithet is a patronym honouring the late musician 
"Little" Walter Jacobs whose ground-breaking approach to blues harmonica
 in the 1950s and 1960s set the standards for all subsequent players".</td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-41" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-41"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>40<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Alterosa_amadoi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Alterosa amadoi (page does not exist)">Alterosa amadoi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Dumas, Calor &amp; Nessimian, 2013</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caddisfly" title="Caddisfly">Caddisfly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Amado, Jorge"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jorge_Amado" title="Jorge Amado">Jorge Amado</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bahia_state" class="mw-redirect" title="Bahia state">Bahia state</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil">Brazil</a>,
 "dedicated to the deceased Brazilian writer Jorge Amado, who was born 
in Bahia state in 1912 and died in 2001. Amado is one of the most 
acclaimed contemporary Brazilian novelists, whose 32 novels have sold 
millions of copies. Among his best-known works are <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captains_of_the_Sands" title="Captains of the Sands">Capitães de Areia</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gabriela,_Clove_and_Cinnamon" title="Gabriela, Clove and Cinnamon">Gabriela, Cravo e Canela</a></i>, and <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tieta" title="Tieta">Tieta do Agreste</a></i>. In 2012, Brazil celebrated the centenary of his birth."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Jorge_Amado,_Headshot_2,_1988_(cropped).png" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jorge_Amado,_Headshot_2,_1988_(cropped)_003.png" decoding="async" width="110" height="163" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jorge_Amado,_Headshot_2,_1988_(cropped)_002.png 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jorge_Amado,_Headshot_2,_1988_(cropped).png 2x" data-file-width="2843" data-file-height="4208"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Alterosa2013_42-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Alterosa2013-42"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>41<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Alterosa_caymmii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Alterosa caymmii (page does not exist)">Alterosa caymmii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Dumas, Calor &amp; Nessimian, 2013</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caddisfly" title="Caddisfly">Caddisfly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Caymmi, Dorival"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dorival_Caymmi" title="Dorival Caymmi">Dorival Caymmi</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bahia_state" class="mw-redirect" title="Bahia state">Bahia state</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil">Brazil</a>,
 "named in memory of Dorival Caymmi, considered one of the most 
important Brazilian songwriters. Caymmi was born in Bahia state in 1914 
and died [in] 2008. He became a national icon with his lyrics that 
evoked the charm of Bahia's fishing villages, beaches and beautiful 
women, like "O Que é Que a Baiana Tem?", "Marina", "Rainha do Mar", 
"Samba da Minha Terra", among others".</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Dorival_Caymmi_1946_rev_Carioca.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Dorival_Caymmi_1946_rev_Carioca_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="161" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Dorival_Caymmi_1946_rev_Carioca.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Dorival_Caymmi_1946_rev_Carioca_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1302" data-file-height="1903"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Alterosa2013_42-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Alterosa2013-42"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>41<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Amaurotoma&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Amaurotoma (page does not exist)">Amaurotoma zappa</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Plas, 1972</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snail" title="Snail">Snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Zappa, Frank"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Zappa" title="Frank Zappa">Frank Zappa</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil species from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Permian" title="Permian">Permian</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nevada,_USA" class="mw-redirect" title="Nevada, USA">Nevada, USA</a></td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Frank_Zappa_1973_2.JPG" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Frank_Zappa_1973_2.JPG" decoding="async" width="110" height="136" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Frank_Zappa_1973_2.JPG 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Frank_Zappa_1973_2.JPG 2x" data-file-width="1091" data-file-height="1345"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Plas1972_43-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Plas1972-43"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>42<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-CSN_44-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CSN-44"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>43<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ambocythere_amadoi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ambocythere amadoi (page does not exist)">Ambocythere amadoi</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Bergue &amp; Coimbra, 20218</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crustacean" title="Crustacean">Crustacean</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Amado, Jorge"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jorge_Amado" title="Jorge Amado">Jorge Amado</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ostracod" title="Ostracod">ostracod</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pleistocene" title="Pleistocene">Pleistocene</a> of Brazil, "In honor of the Brazilian writer Jorge Amado (1912–2001), born in Bahia State, on whose coast lies the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Camamu" title="Camamu">Camamu</a> Basin." (the type locality).</td>
<td></td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Neischnocolus_panamanus&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Neischnocolus panamanus (page does not exist)">Ami bladesi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Pérez-Miles, Gabriel &amp; Gallon, 2008</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Blades, Rubén"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rub%C3%A9n_Blades" title="Rubén Blades">Rubén Blades</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>This species was described from a specimen collected in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Col%C3%B3n_Island" title="Colón Island">Colón Island</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panama" title="Panama">Panama</a>.<br>Subsequently synonymised with <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Neischnocolus_panamanus&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Neischnocolus panamanus (page does not exist)">Neischnocolus panamanus</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Petrunkevitch, 1925</span>.</td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Millipede" title="Millipede">Millipede</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Adams, Ansel"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ansel_Adams" title="Ansel Adams">Ansel Adams</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Troglobiont" class="mw-redirect" title="Troglobiont">troglobiont</a> species found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sequoia_National_Park" title="Sequoia National Park">Sequoia National Park</a>, California, named "After the late Ansel Adams, an extraordinary photographer whose finest pictures depict the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sierra_Nevada" title="Sierra Nevada">Sierra Nevada</a>."</td>

<td>"The species name [...] honors singer, songwriter, environmental 
advocate, Carole King in recognition of the music career, a pearl by any
 standard." (This species belongs to the family <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perlidae" title="Perlidae">Perlidae</a>)</td>

<td><span data-sort-value="Taylor, James"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Taylor" title="James Taylor">James Taylor</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The patronym honors singer, songwriter James Taylor in appreciation
 of his attention to environmental causes, particularly those in the 
rainforests of South America where <i>Anacroneuria</i> occurs."</td>

<td>"The specific name honours Marsha P. Johnson [...], a black trans woman activist, who led the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stonewall_riots" title="Stonewall riots">LGBTQI+ liberation movements that started in June of 1969</a>, in the United States of America, and then spread across the world."</td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bee" title="Bee">Bee</a></td>

<td>A species from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peru" title="Peru">Peru</a>, whose name "honors the Peruvian writer, politician, journalist, and 2010 <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobel_Prize_in_Literature" title="Nobel Prize in Literature">Nobel laureate</a> Jorge Mario Pedro Vargas Llosa."<br>Subsequently transferred to genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Luisanthrena&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Luisanthrena (page does not exist)">Luisanthrena</a></i>.</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anillinus" title="Anillinus">Anillinus docwatsoni</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Sokolov &amp; Carlton, 2004</span></td>

<td><span data-sort-value="Watson, Doc"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doc_Watson" title="Doc Watson">Doc Watson</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species known from a single locality in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rutherford_County,_North_Carolina" title="Rutherford County, North Carolina">Rutherford County, North Carolina</a>, named "after Arthel "Doc" Watson, legendary bluegrass musician from North Carolina."</td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Anomala_arkhipovi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Anomala arkhipovi (page does not exist)">Anomala arkhipovi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Limbourg, Dekoninck &amp; Seidel, 2024</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Arkhipov, Vasily"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vasily_Arkhipov" title="Vasily Arkhipov">Vasily Arkhipov</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"Dedicated to the Soviet Navy Officer Vasili Alexandrovich Arkhipov 
(1926-1998), credited with preventing a Soviet nuclear strike during the
 <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cuban_Missile_Crisis" title="Cuban Missile Crisis">Cuban Missile Crisis</a> (1962)."</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anthrenocerus_schwarzeneggeri" title="Anthrenocerus schwarzeneggeri">Anthrenocerus schwarzeneggeri</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Roach, 2000</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Schwarzenegger, Arnold"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arnold_Schwarzenegger" title="Arnold Schwarzenegger">Arnold Schwarzenegger</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"named in admiration after Mr Arnold Schwarzenegger, a 
multi-champion body builder, movie star, and businessman, because of 
their similarities in pleural development."</td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aphanogmus_kretschmanni" title="Aphanogmus kretschmanni">Aphanogmus kretschmanni</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Moser, 2023</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Kretschmann, Winfried"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winfried_Kretschmann" title="Winfried Kretschmann">Winfried Kretschmann</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The specific name is a patronym for Winfried Kretschmann, the current Minister-President of the state of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baden-W%C3%BCrttemberg" title="Baden-Württemberg">Baden-Württemberg</a>
 (Germany) [where the specimens were collected], to honour his 
scientific curiosity and commitment to preserving biodiversity in his 
political environment."</td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aphonopelma_hollyi" title="Aphonopelma hollyi">Aphonopelma hollyi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Smith, 1995</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Holly, Buddy"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buddy_Holly" title="Buddy Holly">Buddy Holly</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>Discovered in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lubbock,_Texas" title="Lubbock, Texas">Lubbock, Texas</a>, birthplace of Holly.<br>The <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Holotype" title="Holotype">holotype</a> has been lost and no <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Type_(biology)#Neotype" title="Type (biology)">neotype</a> specimen has been found, so this is now considered a <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nomen_dubium" title="Nomen dubium">nomen dubium</a></i>, possibly a synonym of <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aphonopelma_hentzi" class="mw-redirect" title="Aphonopelma hentzi">Aphonopelma hentzi</a></i>.</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Arenivaga_haringtoni&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Arenivaga haringtoni (page does not exist)">Arenivaga haringtoni</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Hopkins, 2014</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cockroach" title="Cockroach">Cockroach</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Harington (writer), Donald"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Harington_(writer)" title="Donald Harington (writer)">Donald Harington (writer)</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"This species is named in honor of Donald Harington, author of <i>The Cockroaches of Stay More</i>, a priceless novel about wonderful animals."</td>

<td></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Arenivaga_66-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Arenivaga-66"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>65<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Arenivaga_pratchetti&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Arenivaga pratchetti (page does not exist)">Arenivaga pratchetti</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Hopkins, 2014</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cockroach" title="Cockroach">Cockroach</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Pratchett, Terry"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terry_Pratchett" title="Terry Pratchett">Terry Pratchett</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"This species is named for the one and only Terry Pratchett, creator of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Discworld" title="Discworld">Disc World</a>
 and many happy hours of reading. May the strength and durability of 
these creatures I so love impart those gifts to him in full measure in 
his fight against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alzheimer%27s" class="mw-redirect" title="Alzheimer's">Alzheimer's</a>."</td>

<td>A species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morning_glory" title="Morning glory">morning glory</a> native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maharashtra" title="Maharashtra">Maharashtra</a>, India (Pawar's home state); "The specific epithet <i>sharadchandrajii</i> is chosen after Shri. Sharadchandraji Pawar, former <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minister_of_Agriculture_(India)" class="mw-redirect" title="Minister of Agriculture (India)">Union Minister of Agriculture</a>, Government of India, New Delhi for his valuable contribution to Indian agriculture."</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Arianops_gorei&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Arianops gorei (page does not exist)">Arianops gorei</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Carlton, 2008</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Gore, Al"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al_Gore" title="Al Gore">Al Gore</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rove_beetle" title="Rove beetle">rove beetle</a> found only in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tennessee" title="Tennessee">Tennessee</a>, "named after Al Gore, Tennessee native, former <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vice_President_of_the_United_States_of_America" class="mw-redirect" title="Vice President of the United States of America">Vice President of the United States of America</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobel_Peace_Prize" title="Nobel Peace Prize">Nobel Prize</a> laureate, and champion of environmental causes."</td>
<td></td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Aricidea_bbkingi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Aricidea bbkingi (page does not exist)">Aricidea bbkingi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Barroso, Paiva &amp; Ranauro, 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polychaete" title="Polychaete">Polychaete worm</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="King, B.B."><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/B.B._King" class="mw-redirect" title="B.B. King">B.B. King</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"named after Riley Ben King, known as B. B. King, which means Blues 
Boy King, one of the best guitar players that ever played, and who the 
authors very much admire. B.B. King played almost until the end of his 
life. He passed away in 2015, at the age of 90. We are very grateful to 
this man for all the wonderful songs and guitar solos."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:B.B._King_(46264650642).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/B.B._King_(46264650642).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="133" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-B.B._King_(46264650642).jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-B.B._King_(46264650642).jpg 2x" data-file-width="862" data-file-height="1046"></a></span></td>
