<td></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-HuberCarv19_71-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HuberCarv19-71"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>70<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Aryalidonta_itishreea&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Aryalidonta itishreea (page does not exist)">Aryalidonta itishreea</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Subedi &amp; Kasalo, 2023</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Groundhopper" class="mw-redirect" title="Groundhopper">Groundhopper</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Aryal, Bhairav"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bhairav_Aryal" title="Bhairav Aryal">Bhairav Aryal</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A new genus and species native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nepal" title="Nepal">Nepal</a>;
 "The genus is named in honor of the late Bhairav Aryal (Nepali: भैरव 
अर्याल), an iconic satirist of Nepali literature popularly known as the 
Emperor of Laughter (Nepali: हाँस्य सम्राट). The second part of the 
name, -donta, derives from the Greek word "ὀδών", meaning "tooth", and 
is a reference to Bhairav Aryal's iconic smile." "The specific epithet 
is derived from the Nepali word "itishree", which is the title of one of
 Bhairav Aryal's books and translates to "The End". The name is also a 
reference to the tragic end of Bhairav Aryal's life, as well as to his 
unyielding belief that an end is an invitation to a new beginning."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Bhairav_Aryal_photo.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bhairav_Aryal_photo_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="121" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bhairav_Aryal_photo_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bhairav_Aryal_photo.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2021" data-file-height="2227"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-72" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-72"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>71<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Aspidolobus_sebastianpinerai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Aspidolobus sebastianpinerai (page does not exist)">Aspidolobus sebastianpinerai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Vidal, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Piñera, Sebastián"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sebasti%C3%A1n_Pi%C3%B1era" title="Sebastián Piñera">Sebastián Piñera</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Darkling_beetle" title="Darkling beetle">darkling beetle</a> native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chile" title="Chile">Chile</a>
 and "dedicated to the President of the Republic of Chile, Mr. Sebastián
 Piñera Echenique, for his great contribution to the development of the 
country."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Presidente_Pi%C3%B1era_2018_crop.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Presidente_Pi%25C3%25B1era_2018_crop_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="137" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Presidente_Pi%C3%B1era_2018_crop.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Presidente_Pi%25C3%25B1era_2018_crop_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1282" data-file-height="1601"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-73" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-73"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>72<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Asteriomyzostomum_monroeae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Asteriomyzostomum monroeae (page does not exist)">Asteriomyzostomum monroeae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Jimi, Moritaki &amp; Kajihara, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polychaete" title="Polychaete">Polychaete worm</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Monroe, Marilyn"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marilyn_Monroe" title="Marilyn Monroe">Marilyn Monroe</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"named after the American actress Marilyn Monroe. The protruded mouth in the new species is reminiscent of her puckered lips."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Marilyn_Monroe_in_1952_TFA.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Marilyn_Monroe_in_1952_TFA.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="165" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Marilyn_Monroe_in_1952_TFA.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Marilyn_Monroe_in_1952_TFA.jpg 2x" data-file-width="752" data-file-height="1128"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Astyanax_kennedyi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Astyanax kennedyi (page does not exist)">Astyanax kennedyi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Géry, 1964</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">Fish</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Kennedy, John F."><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_F._Kennedy" title="John F. Kennedy">John F. Kennedy</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>This species was described shortly after Kennedy's assassination, and named in his memory.</td>

<td></td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit)_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="130" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit)_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit).jpg 2x" data-file-width="657" data-file-height="778"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Australopicus_nelsonmandelai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Australopicus nelsonmandelai (page does not exist)">Australopicus nelsonmandelai</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Manegold &amp; Louchart, 2012</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bird" title="Bird">Bird</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Mandela, Nelson"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nelson_Mandela" title="Nelson Mandela">Nelson Mandela</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Woodpecker" title="Woodpecker">woodpecker</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pliocene" title="Pliocene">Pliocene</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Africa" title="South Africa">South Africa</a>, "dedicated to Nelson Rolihlahla Mandela on the occasion of his 94th birthday on 18 July 2012."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit)_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="130" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit)_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit).jpg 2x" data-file-width="657" data-file-height="778"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Austrogena_nerudai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Austrogena nerudai (page does not exist)">Austrogena nerudai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Krylova, Sellanes, Valdés &amp; D'Elía, 2014</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bivalve" class="mw-redirect" title="Bivalve">Bivalve</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Neruda, Pablo"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pablo_Neruda" title="Pablo Neruda">Pablo Neruda</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The species is dedicated to Pablo Neruda (1904–1973), the renowned Chilean poet, awarded with the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobel_Prize_in_Literature" title="Nobel Prize in Literature">Nobel Prize of literature</a>
 in 1971, who was also a keen collector of shells. The poet's grave and 
one of his houses, 'Isla Negra', now a museum, are located at the 
seashore of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/El_Quisco" title="El Quisco">El Quisco</a> nearby the collection site of the new species."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Pablo_Neruda_1963.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Pablo_Neruda_1963_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="140" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Pablo_Neruda_1963_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Pablo_Neruda_1963.jpg 2x" data-file-width="738" data-file-height="936"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-78" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-78"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>77<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Austrotinodes_lattesi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Austrotinodes lattesi (page does not exist)">Austrotinodes lattesi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Dumas, de Souza &amp; Rocha, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caddisfly" title="Caddisfly">Caddisfly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Lattes, César"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C%C3%A9sar_Lattes" title="César Lattes">César Lattes</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil">Brazil</a>, "Dedicated to the Brazilian physicist Cesare Mansueto Giulio Lattes, who was born in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Curitiba" title="Curitiba">Curitiba</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paran%C3%A1_state" class="mw-redirect" title="Paraná state">Paraná state</a>
 in 1924 and died in 2005. César Lattes was one of the most 
distinguished and honored Brazilian physicists, and his work was 
fundamental for the development of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atomic_physics" title="Atomic physics">atomic physics</a>. He was one of the discoverers of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pion" title="Pion">Pion</a> (pi meson), a subatomic particle, and one of the main personalities behind the creation of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conselho_Nacional_de_Desenvolvimento_Cient%C3%ADfico_e_Tecnol%C3%B3gico" class="mw-redirect" title="Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico">Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico</a> (CNPq) and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Centro_Brasileiro_de_Pesquisas_F%C3%ADsicas" title="Centro Brasileiro de Pesquisas Físicas">Centro Brasileiro de Pesquisas Físicas</a> (CBPF)."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:C%C3%A9sar_Lattes_(1954).tif" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/lossy-page1-110px-C%C3%A9sar_Lattes_(1954).tif.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="161" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/lossy-page1-165px-C%C3%A9sar_Lattes_(1954).tif.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/lossy-page1-220px-C%C3%A9sar_Lattes_(1954).tif.jpg 2x" data-file-width="974" data-file-height="1423"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Austrotinodes2017_79-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Austrotinodes2017-79"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>78<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Autosilis_annisettaekoppelae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Autosilis annisettaekoppelae (page does not exist)">Autosilis annisettaekoppelae</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Fanti &amp; Damgaard, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Koppel, Annisette"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annisette_Koppel" title="Annisette Koppel">Annisette Koppel</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soldier_beetle" title="Soldier beetle">soldier beetle</a> found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eocene" title="Eocene">Eocene</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baltic_amber" title="Baltic amber">Baltic amber</a>, "named in honour of the Danish singer Annisette Koppel (born Hansen), in recognition of her long career."</td>
<td></td>

<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-FantiDamgaard2018_80-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FantiDamgaard2018-80"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>79<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avahi_cleesei" class="mw-redirect" title="Avahi cleesei">Avahi cleesei</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Thalmann &amp; Geissmann, 2005</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lemur" title="Lemur">Lemur</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Cleese, John"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Cleese" title="John Cleese">John Cleese</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"Named in honor of British actor and comedian John Cleese for his promotion of conservation issues in movies such as <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fierce_Creatures" title="Fierce Creatures">Fierce Creatures</a></i> [ <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fred_Schepisi" title="Fred Schepisi">Schepisi</a> &amp; <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Young_(director)" title="Robert Young (director)">Young</a>, 1997] and documentaries such as <i>Born to be Wild: Operation Lemur With John Cleese</i> [Kershaw &amp; Cleese, 1999]."<br>Cleese
 said: "I was really touched, and indeed, honoured when Urs Thalmann 
told me they would like to name the lemur after me. I'm absurdly fond of
 the little creatures, and if I had to show any of my programmes to St 
Peter, upon my arrival at the Pearly Gates, I think I would show him my 
documentary made about them in Madagascar. I help with conservation a 
bit, here and there, and so will re-double my efforts for our furry 
friends."</td>
<td></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ayacucho_vargasllosai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ayacucho vargasllosai (page does not exist)">Ayacucho vargasllosai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Benedetti &amp; Pinto-da-Rocha, 2022</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harvestman" class="mw-redirect" title="Harvestman">Harvestman</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Vargas Llosa, Mario"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mario_Vargas_Llosa" title="Mario Vargas Llosa">Mario Vargas Llosa</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peru" title="Peru">Peru</a>, "dedicated to the Peruvian writer, politician, journalist, essayist, filmmaker, college professor and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobel_Prize_in_Literature" title="Nobel Prize in Literature">Nobel Prize</a> winner Jorge Mario Pedro Vargas Llosa (born 1936)"</td>

<tr id="B">
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Peribacillus_glennii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Peribacillus glennii (page does not exist)">Bacillus glennii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Seuylemezian <i>et al.</i>, 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bacterium" class="mw-redirect" title="Bacterium">Bacterium</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Glenn, John"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Glenn" title="John Glenn">John Glenn</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>This bacterium was isolated from the vehicle assembly building at <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kennedy_Space_Center" title="Kennedy Space Center">Kennedy Space Center</a> where the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viking_program" title="Viking program">Viking spacecraft</a> were assembled, and "named after John Glenn, a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NASA" title="NASA">NASA</a> astronaut who was the first American to orbit the Earth."<br>Subsequently transferred to genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peribacillus" title="Peribacillus">Peribacillus</a></i>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:JohnGlenn.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/JohnGlenn_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="137" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/JohnGlenn_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/JohnGlenn.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1590" data-file-height="1987"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Seuylemez20_86-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Seuylemez20-86"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>85<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Gupta2020_87-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Gupta2020-87"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>86<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Peribacillus_saganii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Peribacillus saganii (page does not exist)">Bacillus saganii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Seuylemezian <i>et al.</i>, 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bacterium" class="mw-redirect" title="Bacterium">Bacterium</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Sagan, Carl"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Sagan" title="Carl Sagan">Carl Sagan</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>This bacterium was isolated from the vehicle assembly building at <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kennedy_Space_Center" title="Kennedy Space Center">Kennedy Space Center</a> where the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viking_program" title="Viking program">Viking spacecraft</a>
 were assembled, and named "referring to Carl Sagan, a well-known 
American astrophysicist with experiments on the Viking mission landers."<br>Subsequently transferred to genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peribacillus" title="Peribacillus">Peribacillus</a></i>.</td>

<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barbaturex_morrisoni" class="mw-redirect" title="Barbaturex morrisoni">Barbaturex morrisoni</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Head et al., 2013</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lizard" title="Lizard">Lizard</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Morrison, Jim"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jim_Morrison" title="Jim Morrison">Jim Morrison</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>An extinct genus of lizards from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eocene" title="Eocene">Eocene</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Myanmar" title="Myanmar">Myanmar</a>, whose name "honors Jim Morrison, vocalist and lizard king".</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Barbaturex_morrisoni_fossil_jaws.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Barbaturex_morrisoni_fossil_jaws.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="98" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Barbaturex_morrisoni_fossil_jaws_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Barbaturex_morrisoni_fossil_jaws_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1280" data-file-height="1137"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Jim_Morrison_1969.JPG" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jim_Morrison_1969.JPG" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jim_Morrison_1969_003.JPG 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jim_Morrison_1969_002.JPG 2x" data-file-width="658" data-file-height="877"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-90" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-90"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>89<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Fossia_sirikitae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Fossia sirikitae (page does not exist)">Barsine sirikitae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Volynkin &amp; Černý, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moth" title="Moth">Moth</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sirikit" title="Sirikit">Sirikit</a></td>
<td>"dedicated to Sirikit, the queen mother of Thailand, because the holotype and the part of paratypes [<i>sic</i>] were collected near the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Queen_Sirikit_Botanic_Garden" title="Queen Sirikit Botanic Garden">Queen Sirikit Botanic Garden</a> in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chiang_Mai_Province" class="mw-redirect" title="Chiang Mai Province">Chiang Mai Province</a> of Thailand."<br>Subsequently transferred to genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fossia" title="Fossia">Fossia</a></i>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Queen_Sirikit_1960.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Queen_Sirikit_1960.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="159" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Queen_Sirikit_1960.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Queen_Sirikit_1960.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1600" data-file-height="2311"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-91" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-91"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>90<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-92" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-92"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>91<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baru_darrowi" class="mw-redirect" title="Baru darrowi">Baru darrowi</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Wilis, Murray &amp; Megirian, 1990</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crocodile" title="Crocodile">Crocodile</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Darrow, Paul"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_Darrow" title="Paul Darrow">Paul Darrow</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil crocodile from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miocene" title="Miocene">Miocene</a> of Australia. "The specific name honours British actor Paul Darrow, best known for his role in the television series <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blake%27s_Seven" class="mw-redirect" title="Blake's Seven">Blake's Seven</a></i>, in recognition of his support of continuing palaeontological investigations of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riversleigh_World_Heritage_Area" title="Riversleigh World Heritage Area">Riversleigh deposits</a>."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Baru_darrowi.png" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Baru_darrowi.png" decoding="async" width="110" height="71" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Baru_darrowi_003.png 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Baru_darrowi_002.png 2x" data-file-width="2512" data-file-height="1624"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Paul_Darrow.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Paul_Darrow_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="130" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Paul_Darrow.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Paul_Darrow.jpg 2x" data-file-width="530" data-file-height="628"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-93" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-93"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>92<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bastanius" title="Bastanius">Bastanius</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Mirshamsi, Zamani &amp; Marusik, 2016</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Bastani Parizi, Mohammad Ebrahim"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mohammad_Ebrahim_Bastani_Parizi" title="Mohammad Ebrahim Bastani Parizi">Mohammad Ebrahim Bastani Parizi</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"honouring the late emeritus professor of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University_of_Tehran" title="University of Tehran">University of Tehran</a>
 Dr Mohammad Ebrahim Bastani Parizi (1924–2014), who was an Iranian 
historian, translator, poet, essayist and author of non-fiction books. 
His numerous publications are mostly popular reads on the history of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran" title="Iran">Iran</a> and the history of his hometown, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kerman" title="Kerman">Kerman</a>." The type locality of the type species of this genus is in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kerman_province" title="Kerman province">Kerman province</a>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Bastani_Parizi.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Bastani_Parizi.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bastani_Parizi_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bastani_Parizi.jpg 2x" data-file-width="768" data-file-height="1024"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Bathyceradocus_hawkingi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Bathyceradocus hawkingi (page does not exist)">Bathyceradocus hawkingi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Jażdżewska &amp; Ziemkiewicz, 2019</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crustacean" title="Crustacean">Crustacean</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Hawking, Stephen"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stephen_Hawking" title="Stephen Hawking">Stephen Hawking</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"named to commemorate Professor Stephen Hawking [...], in 
appreciation of his great contribution to the popularisation of natural 
sciences, and to underline that the deep sea is as poorly known as the 
cosmos."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Stephen_Hawking.StarChild.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Stephen_Hawking.StarChild.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="158" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Stephen_Hawking.StarChild_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Stephen_Hawking.StarChild_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="250" data-file-height="359"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Batillipes_kalami&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Batillipes kalami (page does not exist)">Batillipes kalami</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Vishnudattan, Rubal &amp; Bijoy Nandan, 2023</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tardigrade" title="Tardigrade">Tardigrade</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Kalam, A. P. J. Abdul"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A._P._J._Abdul_Kalam" title="A. P. J. Abdul Kalam">A. P. J. Abdul Kalam</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The specific epithet, <i>kalami</i> refers to Dr. A. P. J. Abdul 
Kalam, Indian aerospace scientist and eleventh president of India, also 
known as the "Missile Man of India", who was native to the type locality
 of the current species".</td>
<td></td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fly" title="Fly">Fly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Dio, Ronnie James"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ronnie_James_Dio" title="Ronnie James Dio">Ronnie James Dio</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"Named after the late Ronnie James Dio, according to the senior author the greatest rock singer of all times."</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Beksitanais&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Beksitanais (page does not exist)">Beksitanais</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Jakiel, Palero &amp; Błażewicz, 2019</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crustacean" title="Crustacean">Crustacean</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Beksiński, Zdzisław"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zdzis%C5%82aw_Beksi%C5%84ski" title="Zdzisław Beksiński">Zdzisław Beksiński</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A genus of deep-sea <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tanaids" class="mw-redirect" title="Tanaids">tanaids</a> found in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clipperton_fracture_zone" class="mw-redirect" title="Clipperton fracture zone">Clipperton fracture zone</a> of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pacific_Ocean" title="Pacific Ocean">Pacific Ocean</a>, which was described by scientists of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University_of_%C5%81%C3%B3d%C5%BA" title="University of Łódź">University of Łódź</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poland" title="Poland">Poland</a>.</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Belesica_madiba&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Belesica madiba (page does not exist)">Belesica madiba</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Rousse &amp; Van Noort, 2014</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Mandela, Nelson"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nelson_Mandela" title="Nelson Mandela">Nelson Mandela</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parasitoid_wasp" title="Parasitoid wasp">parasitoid wasp</a> endemic to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Africa" title="South Africa">South Africa</a>.
 "We respectfully dedicate this rare gem to "Madiba" Nelson Mandela, for
 the enlightenment he brought to South Africa and the remainder of the 
World. Enkosi uhambe kakuhle Tata Madiba [Thank you and go well Tata 
Madiba]."</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belisana_keyti" title="Belisana keyti">Belisana keyti</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Huber, 2005</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Keyt, George"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Keyt" title="George Keyt">George Keyt</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cellar_spider" class="mw-redirect" title="Cellar spider">cellar spider</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sri_Lanka" title="Sri Lanka">Sri Lanka</a>, "Named for George Keyt (1901–1993), one of the most outstanding Sri Lankan painters. The eternal theme of devine [<i>sic</i>] and human love is the thread that runs unbroken throughout his prolific artistic career."</td>

<td></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-100" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-100"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>99<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Bembidion_brownorum&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Bembidion brownorum (page does not exist)">Bembidion brownorum</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Maddison, Sproul &amp; Will, 2023</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Brown, Jerry"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jerry_Brown" title="Jerry Brown">Jerry Brown</a></span></span></span> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anne_Gust_Brown" title="Anne Gust Brown">Anne Gust Brown</a></td>
<td>"The specific epithet [...] refers to Jerry and Anne Brown, former <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Governor_of_California" title="Governor of California">Governor</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/First_Lady_of_California" class="mw-redirect" title="First Lady of California">First Lady of California</a>,
 respectively. The name is formed in their honor as it was their 
hospitality and openness to allowing access for research of insects on 
their ranch, the type locality, which led to the discovery of this 
species. Additionally, this honors their long commitment to 
environmentalism and continued efforts in the international 
climate-change movement."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:California_Governor_Jerry_Brown_(8577347663).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/California_Governor_Jerry_Brown_(8577347663).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="85" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/California_Governor_Jerry_Brown_(8577347663)_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/California_Governor_Jerry_Brown_(8577347663)_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1560" data-file-height="1200"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Biancolina_suassunai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Biancolina suassunai (page does not exist)">Biancolina suassunai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Andrade &amp; Souza-Filho, 2022</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crustacean" title="Crustacean">Crustacean</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Suassuna, Ariano"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ariano_Suassuna" title="Ariano Suassuna">Ariano Suassuna</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>An <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amphipod" class="mw-redirect" title="Amphipod">amphipod</a> described from specimens collected from the coast of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pernambuco" title="Pernambuco">Pernambuco</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil">Brazil</a>,
 named "in honor of the famous writer Ariano Vilar Suassuna for his 
efforts towards promoting and strengthening cultural awareness of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northeast_Region,_Brazil" title="Northeast Region, Brazil">Northeast Brazilian region</a>. Also, the first author was born on the same date as Ariano Suassuna (June 16th)."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Ariano_Suassuna.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ariano_Suassuna_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="176" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ariano_Suassuna.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Ariano_Suassuna.jpg 2x" data-file-width="552" data-file-height="885"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Bistriopelma_peyoi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Bistriopelma peyoi (page does not exist)">Bistriopelma peyoi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Nicoletta <i>et al.</i>, 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peyo" title="Peyo">Peyo</a></td>
<td>"The specific epithet is a patronym in honor of the Belgian 
cartoonist Pierre Culliford (1928–1992), mostly known by his pseudonym 
'Peyo', who created the comic strip <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Smurfs" title="The Smurfs">The Smurfs</a></i>. The type locality of this new species is located near the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pampachiri" title="Pampachiri">Pampachiri</a>
 Stone Forest, which is known as Smurf's house because of the conical 
rock formations. Moreover, the prominent projection of the cephalic 
region of the male resembles the shape of the Smurfs' hats."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Peyo_(1990)_by_Erling_Mandelmann.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Peyo_(1990)_by_Erling_Mandelmann.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="164" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Peyo_(1990)_by_Erling_Mandelmann.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Peyo_(1990)_by_Erling_Mandelmann.jpg 2x" data-file-width="201" data-file-height="300"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Bobmarleya&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Bobmarleya (page does not exist)">Bobmarleya</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Hilário &amp; Cunha, 2008</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polychaete" title="Polychaete">Polychaete worm</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Marley, Bob"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_Marley" title="Bob Marley">Bob Marley</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The generic name is given as an allusion to the shape of the tentacular crown in which the tentacles largely resemble <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dreadlocks" title="Dreadlocks">dreadlocks</a>, a hairstyle popularised by the reggae singer and songwriter Bob Marley."</td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Bohadschia_cousteaui&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Bohadschia cousteaui (page does not exist)">Bohadschia cousteaui</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Cherbonnier, 1954</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_cucumber" title="Sea cucumber">Sea cucumber</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Cousteau, Jacques"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jacques_Cousteau" title="Jacques Cousteau">Jacques Cousteau</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>Described from specimens collected by Cousteau's ship, the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RV_Calypso" title="RV Calypso">RV <i>Calypso</i></a>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Cousteau1972_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Cousteau1972_(cropped).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="154" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Cousteau1972_(cropped).jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Cousteau1972_(cropped).jpg 2x" data-file-width="755" data-file-height="1060"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Borealarges_calei&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Borealarges calei (page does not exist)">Borealarges calei</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Adrain, 1994</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trilobite" title="Trilobite">Trilobite</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Cale, John"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Cale" title="John Cale">John Cale</a></span></span></span></td>

<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-BorealargesDicranogmus_107-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BorealargesDicranogmus-107"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>106<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bowie_(spider)" title="Bowie (spider)">Bowie</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_J%C3%A4ger" title="Peter Jäger">Jäger</a>, 2022</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Bowie, David"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Bowie" title="David Bowie">David Bowie</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A genus of Asian and Australian <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wandering_spider" title="Wandering spider">wandering spiders</a>
 "named after David Bowie (1947–2016) for the creative, innovative and 
unique kind of music he composed and performed." Jäger added: "On the 
occasion of David Bowie's 75th birthday, I wanted to commemorate this 
incomparable artist who left us much too early.[...] However, what 
matters most to me here is the idea of conservation: we only protect 
what we know – and an attractive name is much more likely to be 
remembered." Many species in the genus have been named after David Bowie
 albums and songs.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:David-Bowie_Chicago_2002-08-08_photoby_Adam-Bielawski-cropped.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/David-Bowie_Chicago_2002-08-08_photoby_Adam-Bielawski-cr_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="129" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/David-Bowie_Chicago_2002-08-08_photoby_Adam-Bielawski-cr_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/David-Bowie_Chicago_2002-08-08_photoby_Adam-Bielawski-croppe.jpg 2x" data-file-width="342" data-file-height="400"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-108" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-108"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>107<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-109" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-109"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>108<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Brachystegus_nikitini&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Brachystegus nikitini (page does not exist)">Brachystegus nikitini</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Nemkov, 2004</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Nikitin (author), Yuri"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yuri_Nikitin_(author)" title="Yuri Nikitin (author)">Yuri Nikitin (author)</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>This species, native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nepal" title="Nepal">Nepal</a>,
 was described by a Russian scientist and "is dedicated to the famous 
Russian writer and amateur of entomology Mr. Yu. A. Nikitin."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Yury_Nikitin1.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Yury_Nikitin1.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="166" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Yury_Nikitin1_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Yury_Nikitin1.jpg 2x" data-file-width="329" data-file-height="496"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-110" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-110"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>109<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Bradleya_victorjarai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Bradleya victorjarai (page does not exist)">Bradleya victorjarai</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Bergue &amp; Coimbra, 2023</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ostracod" title="Ostracod">Ostracod</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Jara, Víctor"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/V%C3%ADctor_Jara" title="Víctor Jara">Víctor Jara</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil species from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miocene" title="Miocene">Miocene</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chile" title="Chile">Chile</a>,
 named "In honor of the Chilean poet, singer, and political activist 
Victor Lidio Jara Martínez (1932–1973). A beautiful species for a 
respectful soul."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Victor-Jara-in-Helsinki-1969_(cropped)2.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Victor-Jara-in-Helsinki-1969_(cropped)2.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="130" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Victor-Jara-in-Helsinki-1969_(cropped)2_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Victor-Jara-in-Helsinki-1969_(cropped)2_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="634" data-file-height="751"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-111" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-111"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>110<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Branchioperla_ianstewarti&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Branchioperla ianstewarti (page does not exist)">Branchioperla ianstewarti</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Sroka &amp; Staniczek, 2019</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stonefly" class="mw-redirect" title="Stonefly">Stonefly</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ian_Stewart_(musician)" title="Ian Stewart (musician)">Ian Stewart</a></td>
<td>A fossil species found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burmese_amber" title="Burmese amber">Burmese amber</a>. "The naming [...] completes the "Rolling Stoneflies" [see also species in the genera <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Electroneuria&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Electroneuria (page does not exist)">Electroneuria</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lapisperla&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Lapisperla (page does not exist)">Lapisperla</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Largusoperla&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Largusoperla (page does not exist)">Largusoperla</a></i> and <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Petroperla&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Petroperla (page does not exist)">Petroperla</a></i>]. It refers to Ian "Stu" Stewart, keyboard player and founding member of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Rolling_Stones" title="The Rolling Stones">The Rolling Stones</a>.
 Often referred to as "the 6th member of the Rolling Stones", he was 
removed from the official line-up already in 1963, but continued to work
 with the band until his sudden death in 1985."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Ian_Stewart_-_The_Rolling_Stones_(1975).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ian_Stewart_-_The_Rolling_Stones_(1975)_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="110" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ian_Stewart_-_The_Rolling_Stones_(1975).jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ian_Stewart_-_The_Rolling_Stones_(1975)_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="222" data-file-height="222"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-112" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-112"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>111<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Brignolia_carlmulleri&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Brignolia carlmulleri (page does not exist)">Brignolia carlmulleri</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ranasinghe &amp; Benjamin, 2016</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Muller, Carl"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Muller" title="Carl Muller">Carl Muller</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Goblin_spider" class="mw-redirect" title="Goblin spider">goblin spider</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sri_Lanka" title="Sri Lanka">Sri Lanka</a> "Named for the Sri Lankan writer, poet and journalist Carl Muller, best known for his trilogy: <i>The Jam Fruit Tree</i>, <i>Yakada Yaka</i> and <i>Once Upon A Tender Time</i>."</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Brignolia_ondaatjei&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Brignolia ondaatjei (page does not exist)">Brignolia ondaatjei</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ranasinghe &amp; Benjamin, 2016</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Ondaatje, Michael"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Ondaatje" title="Michael Ondaatje">Michael Ondaatje</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Goblin_spider" class="mw-redirect" title="Goblin spider">goblin spider</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sri_Lanka" title="Sri Lanka">Sri Lanka</a> "Named for Sri Lankan-born Canadian novelist and poet, Philip Michael Ondaatje, best known for <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_English_Patient" title="The English Patient">The English Patient</a></i> and our favorite <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anil%27s_Ghost" title="Anil's Ghost">Anil's Ghost</a></i>."
 Ondaatje said "Well I am thrilled of course [...] I thought a small 
creek would be enough to have my name attached to or a lane like the one
 <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barrie_Phillip_Nichol" class="mw-redirect" title="Barrie Phillip Nichol">bp Nichol</a> got. But the goblin spider of Sri Lanka certainly raises the bar."</td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scorpion" title="Scorpion">Scorpion</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Rodríguez de la Fuente, Félix"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/F%C3%A9lix_Rodr%C3%ADguez_de_la_Fuente" title="Félix Rodríguez de la Fuente">Félix Rodríguez de la Fuente</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"a patronym honoring the great Spanish naturalist and documentary 
maker Félix Samuel Rodríguez de la Fuente [...], who tragically died in a
 plane crash on his 52nd birthday, while filming in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alaska" title="Alaska">Alaska</a>.
 His wildlife documentaries inspired a complete generation of biologists
 (ours) to observe and eventually study nature. A crucial part of his 
work was devoted to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Do%C3%B1ana_National_Park" title="Doñana National Park">Doñana National Park</a>, just south [of] the site where this new species was discovered."</td>

<td>This <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greece" title="Greece">Greek</a> species was described by scientists of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jagiellonian_University" title="Jagiellonian University">Jagiellonian University</a> and "Named in honour of President Lech Wałęsa, a Polish national hero and co-creator of our independence."</td>

<td>A fossil <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soldier_beetle" title="Soldier beetle">soldier beetle</a> found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eocene" title="Eocene">Eocene</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baltic_amber" title="Baltic amber">Baltic amber</a>,
 "named in honour of the Danish musician Bent Fabricius-Bjerre, 
internationally known as Bent Fabric, in recognition of his career as a 
pianist and composer."</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Calacalles_manriquei&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Calacalles manriquei (page does not exist)">Calacalles manriquei</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Stüben, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weevil" title="Weevil">Weevil</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Manrique, César"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C%C3%A9sar_Manrique" title="César Manrique">César Manrique</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"dedicated to César Manrique (1919–1992), the famous artist, 
sculptor, architect, but above all nature conservationist on the Canary 
Island of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lanzarote" title="Lanzarote">Lanzarote</a>.
 He has characterised the present appearance of this volcanic island 
with its unique fauna and flora." This species is endemic to Lanzarote.</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Calathotarsus_fangioi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Calathotarsus fangioi (page does not exist)">Calathotarsus fangioi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ferretti, Soresi, González &amp; Arnedo, 2019</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Fangio, Juan Manuel"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juan_Manuel_Fangio" title="Juan Manuel Fangio">Juan Manuel Fangio</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>This species is restricted to a small area of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buenos_Aires_Province" title="Buenos Aires Province">Buenos Aires Province</a> in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina" title="Argentina">Argentina</a>, and some of the specimens used to describe it were collected in Fangio's hometown, the city of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Balcarce,_Buenos_Aires" title="Balcarce, Buenos Aires">Balcarce</a>.</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Callicebus_bernhardi" class="mw-redirect" title="Callicebus bernhardi">Callicebus bernhardi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">van Roosmalen et al., 2002</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monkey" title="Monkey">Monkey</a></td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Arthrobotrys_shahriari&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Arthrobotrys shahriari (page does not exist)">Candelabrella shahriari</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Mekht.</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fungus" title="Fungus">Fungus</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Shahriar, Mohammad-Hossein"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mohammad-Hossein_Shahriar" title="Mohammad-Hossein Shahriar">Mohammad-Hossein Shahriar</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>This species was identified from samples of soil collected from Shahriar's grave in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tabriz" title="Tabriz">Tabriz</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran" title="Iran">Iran</a>.<br>Subsequently transferred to genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arthrobotrys" title="Arthrobotrys">Arthrobotrys</a></i></td>

<td>A freshwater <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capoeta" title="Capoeta">scraper</a> fish found in the Gamasiab river (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tigris" title="Tigris">Tigris</a> basin), <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran" title="Iran">Iran</a>, "named [in] honor of Mohammad-Reza Shajarian, an acclaimed Iranian classical singer, composer and master of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Persian_traditional_music" title="Persian traditional music">Persian traditional music</a>."</td>

<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cedrorestes_crichtoni" class="mw-redirect" title="Cedrorestes crichtoni">Cedrorestes crichtoni</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Gilpin <i>et al.</i>, 2007</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dinosaur" title="Dinosaur">Dinosaur</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Crichton, Michael"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Crichton" title="Michael Crichton">Michael Crichton</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The species name honors Michael Crichton for promoting the public's interest in dinosaurs through his <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jurassic_Park_(novel)" title="Jurassic Park (novel)">Jurassic Park</a></i> novels."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Left_ilium_of_Cedrorestes.png" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Left_ilium_of_Cedrorestes.png" decoding="async" width="110" height="135" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Left_ilium_of_Cedrorestes_002.png 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Left_ilium_of_Cedrorestes_003.png 2x" data-file-width="2049" data-file-height="2518"></a></span></td>

awareness of need for climate action, as exemplified by the award of the

<td>A fossil species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pacman_frog" class="mw-redirect" title="Pacman frog">Pacman frog</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pleistocene" title="Pleistocene">Pleistocene</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil">Brazil</a>,
 named "in honor of the eminent North American astronomer Carl Sagan 
(1934–1996), whose passion for the communication of science continues to
 inspire."</td>

(1934–2016) passed away, and we wish to name this species after him."</td>

<td><span data-sort-value="Watts, Charlie"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlie_Watts" title="Charlie Watts">Charlie Watts</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Butterflyfish" title="Butterflyfish">butterflyfish</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oligocene" title="Oligocene">Oligocene</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italy" title="Italy">Italy</a>,
 "named after the British musician Charles Robert Watts, drummer of the 
Rolling Stones, who sadly passed away during the preparation of this 
paper."</td>

<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Charlie_Watts_on_drums_The_ABC_%26_D_of_Boogie_Woogie_(2010)_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Charlie_Watts_on_drums_The_ABC_&amp;_D_of_Boogie_Woogie_(201_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="127" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Charlie_Watts_on_drums_The_ABC_&amp;_D_of_Boogie_Woogie_(201_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Charlie_Watts_on_drums_The_ABC_&amp;_D_of_Boogie_Woogie_(2010)_(.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1149" data-file-height="1328"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Charletonia_shahriari&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Charletonia shahriari (page does not exist)">Charletonia shahriari</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Saboori, Azimi &amp; Shirdel, 2012</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mite" title="Mite">Mite</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Shahriar, Mohammad-Hossein"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mohammad-Hossein_Shahriar" title="Mohammad-Hossein Shahriar">Mohammad-Hossein Shahriar</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>This species was described from specimens collected in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tabriz" title="Tabriz">Tabriz</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran" title="Iran">Iran</a>, and "named in memory of Mohammad Hossein Shahriar, one of the most famous poets of Iran from Tabriz (1906–1988)."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Shahriar_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Shahriar_(cropped).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="142" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Shahriar_(cropped)_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Shahriar_(cropped)_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="317" data-file-height="408"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Charletonia_terianae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Charletonia terianae (page does not exist)">Charletonia terianae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Hakimitabar, Saboori &amp; Seiedy, 2013</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mite" title="Mite">Mite</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Terian, Alenush"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alenush_Terian" title="Alenush Terian">Alenush Terian</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>This species was described from specimens collected from the grounds of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University_of_Tehran" title="University of Tehran">University of Tehran</a> in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran" title="Iran">Iran</a>,
 and "named in memory of Prof. Alenoush Terian (1920–2011), the mother 
of Iranian astronomy and first Iranian lady astronomer and physics 
professor. She was one of the founders of the solar observatory of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Institute_of_Geophysics" title="Institute of Geophysics">Institute of Geophysics at University of Tehran</a>, where she also worked until her retirement in 1979."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:%D4%B1%D5%AC%D5%A5%D5%B6%D5%B8%D6%82%D5%B7_%D5%8F%D5%A7%D6%80%D5%A5%D5%A1%D5%B6.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/%25D4%25B1%25D5%25AC%25D5%25A5%25D5%25B6%25D5%25B8%25D6%2582%25D5%25B7_%25D5%258F%25D5%25A7%25D6%258.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="177" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/%25D4%25B1%25D5%25AC%25D5%25A5%25D5%25B6%25D5%25B8%25D6%2582%25D5%25B7_%25D5%258F%25D5%25A7%25_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/%25D4%25B1%25D5%25AC%25D5%25A5%25D5%25B6%25D5%25B8%25D6%2582%25D5%25B7_%25D5%258F%25D5%25A7%25_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="424" data-file-height="684"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cheguevaria" title="Cheguevaria">Cheguevaria</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Kazantsev, 2006</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Firefly" title="Firefly">Firefly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Guevara, Che"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Che_Guevara" title="Che Guevara">Che Guevara</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A genus native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hispaniola" title="Hispaniola">Hispaniola</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Puerto_Rico" title="Puerto Rico">Puerto Rico</a>, "named after E. "Che" Guevara, the legendary Latin American revolutionary, very popular in the Caribbean region."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Che_Guevara_-_Guerrillero_Heroico_by_Alberto_Korda.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Che_Guevara_-_Guerrillero_Heroico_by_Alberto_Korda_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="127" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Che_Guevara_-_Guerrillero_Heroico_by_Alberto_Korda.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Che_Guevara_-_Guerrillero_Heroico_by_Alberto_Korda.jpg.webp 2x" data-file-width="2827" data-file-height="3274"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-142" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-142"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>141<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Camachoaglaja_juancarlosi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Camachoaglaja juancarlosi (page does not exist)">Chelidonura juancarlosi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ortea &amp; Espinosa, 1998</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_slug" title="Sea slug">Sea slug</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juan_Carlos_I" title="Juan Carlos I">Juan Carlos I</a></td>
<td>This species was described from specimens collected in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jardines_de_la_Reina" title="Jardines de la Reina">Jardines de la Reina</a> ("Gardens of the Queen") islands in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cuba" title="Cuba">Cuba</a>, and named after Juan Carlos I to celebrate the visit of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monarchy_of_Spain" title="Monarchy of Spain">King and Queen of Spain</a> to Cuba arranged for the following year after publication (1999) (the first ever by Spanish monarchs). The sea snail species <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volvarina_sofiae" title="Volvarina sofiae">Volvarina sofiae</a></i>, found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jardines_del_Rey" title="Jardines del Rey">Jardines del Rey</a> ("Gardens of the King"), was named concurrently after his wife <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Queen_Sof%C3%ADa_of_Spain" title="Queen Sofía of Spain">Queen Sofía</a>.<br>Subsequently transferred to genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Camachoaglaja" title="Camachoaglaja">Camachoaglaja</a></i>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Juan_Carlos_I_of_Spain_(2010)_cropped.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Juan_Carlos_I_of_Spain_(2010)_cropped_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="155" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Juan_Carlos_I_of_Spain_(2010)_cropped.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Juan_Carlos_I_of_Spain_(2010)_cropped.jpg 2x" data-file-width="288" data-file-height="407"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-KingSpain_143-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-KingSpain-143"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>142<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-144" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-144"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>143<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Chespiritos_bolanosi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Chespiritos bolanosi (page does not exist)">Chespiritos bolanosi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Kuwahara &amp; Marshall, 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fly" title="Fly">Fly</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chespirito" title="Chespirito">Chespirito</a></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sphaeroceridae" title="Sphaeroceridae">lesser dung fly</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico" title="Mexico">Mexico</a>, named "in memory of Roberto Gómez Bolaños, Mexican screenwriter, actor, comedian and creator of the character Chespirito."<br>(Genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chespiritos" title="Chespiritos">Chespiritos</a></i>, however, is not explicitly named after Bolaños; it had been created 20 years prior for a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Costa_Rican" class="mw-redirect" title="Costa Rican">Costa Rican</a> species, with no etymological information given; it was possibly named after <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://chespiritos.com/">a local restaurant chain</a>, which was, in turn, named after him.)</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Roberto_G%C3%B3mez_Bola%C3%B1os_Premios_Fama_2008.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Roberto_G%25C3%25B3mez_Bola%25C3%25B1os_Premios_Fama_2008_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="112" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Roberto_G%25C3%25B3mez_Bola%25C3%25B1os_Premios_Fama_2008_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Roberto_G%C3%B3mez_Bola%C3%B1os_Premios_Fama_2008.jpg 2x" data-file-width="883" data-file-height="900"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-145" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-145"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>144<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Marshall2000a_146-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Marshall2000a-146"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>145<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Danarma_garfunkel&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Danarma garfunkel (page does not exist)">Chiromantes garfunkel</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Davie &amp; Ng, 2013</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crustacean" title="Crustacean">Crustacean</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Garfunkel, Art"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Art_Garfunkel" title="Art Garfunkel">Art Garfunkel</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"Named for Art Garfunkel, who sang "<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bright_Eyes_(Art_Garfunkel_song)" class="mw-redirect" title="Bright Eyes (Art Garfunkel song)">Bright Eyes</a>" for the soundtrack of the 1978 animated film <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Watership_Down_(film)" title="Watership Down (film)">Watership Down</a></i>.
 Like the rabbit to which the song alludes, the new crab species also 
lives in holes, and is remarkable for its brightly shining eyes."<br>Subsequently transferred to the genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Danarma&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Danarma (page does not exist)">Danarma</a></i>.</td>

<td>A parasitic <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monogenean" class="mw-redirect" title="Monogenean">monogenean</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cameroon" title="Cameroon">Cameroon</a>,

singer-songwriter from Cameroon, who incorporated jazz and traditional 
Cameroonian elements into his music."</td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crustacean" title="Crustacean">Crustacean</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Mendes, Chico"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chico_Mendes" title="Chico Mendes">Chico Mendes</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>An <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Isopod" class="mw-redirect" title="Isopod">isopod</a> found in caves in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amazon_biome" title="Amazon biome">Amazon biome</a>,
 "named after Francisco Alves Mendes Filho, popularly known as Chico 
Mendes, a rubber tapper and activist who gained an international 
reputation for the defense of the Amazonian biodiversity. Furthermore, 
the present name honors all workers of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chico_Mendes_Institute_for_Biodiversity_Conservation" title="Chico Mendes Institute for Biodiversity Conservation">ICMBio</a> (in Portuguese, Instituto Chico Mendes de Conservação da Biodiversidade), who continue to keep alive Mendes' ideals."</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clavus_davidgilmouri" title="Clavus davidgilmouri">Clavus davidgilmouri</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Fedosov &amp; Puillandre, 2020</span></td>

<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colbertia" title="Colbertia">Colbertia falui</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Fernández <i>et al.</i>, 2021</span></td>
