<td><span data-sort-value="Falú, Eduardo"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eduardo_Fal%C3%BA" title="Eduardo Falú">Eduardo Falú</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oldfieldthomasiidae" title="Oldfieldthomasiidae">oldfieldthomasiid</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eocene" title="Eocene">Eocene</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salta_Province" title="Salta Province">Salta Province</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina" title="Argentina">Argentina</a>,
 named "In honor of Eduardo Falú (1923–2013), an Argentinian folk music 
composer and guitarist, strongly influenced by the folk traditions of 
Salta Province."</td>

<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coloborhynchus_spielbergi" class="mw-redirect" title="Coloborhynchus spielbergi">Coloborhynchus spielbergi</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Veldmeijer, 2003</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pterosaur" title="Pterosaur">Pterosaur</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Spielberg, Steven"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steven_Spielberg" title="Steven Spielberg">Steven Spielberg</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"in honour of Steven Spielberg, the director of the three <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jurassic_Park" title="Jurassic Park">Jurassic Park</a></i> movies [<i>sic</i>; he directed the first two but not the third] in which dinosaurs and pterosaurs were animated." <br>Subsequently transferred to genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maaradactylus" title="Maaradactylus">Maaradactylus</a></i>.</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Coloborhynchus_spielbergi2.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Coloborhynchus_spielbergi2_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="56" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Coloborhynchus_spielbergi2_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Coloborhynchus_spielbergi2.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3129" data-file-height="1590"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Steven_Spielberg_Masterclass_Cin%C3%A9math%C3%A8que_Fran%C3%A7aise_2_cropped.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Steven_Spielberg_Masterclass_Cin%25C3%25A9math%25C3%25A8que_Fr.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="143" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Steven_Spielberg_Masterclass_Cin%25C3%25A9math%25C3%25A8que_Fran%25C3%25.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Steven_Spielberg_Masterclass_Cin%25C3%25A9math%25C3%25A8que_Fr.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1545" data-file-height="2009"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-160" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-160"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>159<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Coloborhynchus_161-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Coloborhynchus-161"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>160<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Colomys_lumumbai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Colomys lumumbai (page does not exist)">Colomys lumumbai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Kerbis Peterhans, Giarla &amp; Demos, 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rodent" title="Rodent">Rodent</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Lumumba, Patrice"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patrice_Lumumba" title="Patrice Lumumba">Patrice Lumumba</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The specific epithet refers to Patrice Émery Lumumba, who was born on 2 July 1925 in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katako-Kombe" class="mw-redirect" title="Katako-Kombe">Katako-Kombe</a>,
 in the middle of the range of the new species. He was a Congolese 
politician and independence leader who served as the first Prime 
Minister of the newly independent <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Democratic_Republic_of_the_Congo" title="Democratic Republic of the Congo">Democratic Republic of the Congo</a> from June until September 1960. He was one of the principal individuals involved in the independence of the DRC and he led the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Congolese_National_Movement" title="Congolese National Movement">Congolese National Movement</a>
 party from its founding in 1958. This movement was inclusive and not 
based on ethnic lines. On 17 January 1961, he was assassinated by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katanga_Province" title="Katanga Province">Katangan</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belgium" title="Belgium">Belgian</a> forces following an independence effort by the former group."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:PatriceLumumba1960.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-PatriceLumumba1960.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-PatriceLumumba1960.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/PatriceLumumba1960.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1014" data-file-height="1352"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-162" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-162"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>161<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-163" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-163"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>162<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coltraneia" title="Coltraneia">Coltraneia</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Lieberman &amp; Kloc, 1997</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trilobite" title="Trilobite">Trilobite</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Coltrane, John"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Coltrane" title="John Coltrane">John Coltrane</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A genus of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Devonian" title="Devonian">Devonian</a> trilobites that has been found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany" title="Germany">Germany</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France" title="France">France</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spain" title="Spain">Spain</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Algeria" title="Algeria">Algeria</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morocco" title="Morocco">Morocco</a>.</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Coltraneia_dorsal_2.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Coltraneia_dorsal_2.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="180" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Coltraneia_dorsal_2_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Coltraneia_dorsal_2_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2136" data-file-height="3496"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Coltrane.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Coltrane_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="153" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Coltrane.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Coltrane_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="299" data-file-height="415"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-LiebermanKloc_164-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-LiebermanKloc-164"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>163<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Coniceromyia_niemeyeri&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Coniceromyia niemeyeri (page does not exist)">Coniceromyia niemeyeri</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ament, Kung &amp; Brown, 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fly" title="Fly">Fly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Niemeyer, Oscar"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oscar_Niemeyer" title="Oscar Niemeyer">Oscar Niemeyer</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"Considering the characteristically curved wing veins of this species, we name it in honor of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil">Brazilian</a> architect Oscar Niemeyer whose revolutionary work frequently has characteristic curved shapes."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Oscar_Niemeyer_1968.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Oscar_Niemeyer_1968_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Oscar_Niemeyer_1968.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Oscar_Niemeyer_1968_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="625" data-file-height="833"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Constrictoanchoratus_lemmyi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Constrictoanchoratus lemmyi (page does not exist)">Constrictoanchoratus lemmyi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ferreira, Rodrigues, Cunha &amp; Domingues, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flatworm" title="Flatworm">Flatworm</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lemmy" title="Lemmy">Lemmy</a></td>
<td>"in honor of 'Lemmy' Kilmister (1945–2015), leader of the heavy-metal band <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mot%C3%B6rhead" title="Motörhead">Motörhead</a>, of whom the senior author is a big fan."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Lemmy-02.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Lemmy-02.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="166" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Lemmy-02.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Lemmy-02.jpg 2x" data-file-width="498" data-file-height="750"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conus_regius" title="Conus regius">Conus gadesi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Espinosa &amp; Ortea, 2005</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_snail" title="Sea snail">Sea snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Gades, Antonio"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antonio_Gades" title="Antonio Gades">Antonio Gades</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>This species was described from specimens collected in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cuba" title="Cuba">Cuba</a>. "With the name <i>Conus gadesi</i>,
 for this beautiful animal with a red body and a white shell, the 
authors wish to pay homage to the brilliant Spanish dancer and 
choreographer Antonio Gades, committed to Cuba, with whose sea he 
declared himself to be fervently in love."<br>Subsequently synonymised with <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conus_regius" title="Conus regius">Conus regius</a></i>.</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Conus_regius_(royal_cone_snail)_(San_Salvador_Island,_Bahamas)_2_(16004640459).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Conus_regius_(royal_cone_snail)_(San_Salvador_Island,_Bahama.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="171" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Conus_regius_(royal_cone_snail)_(San_Salvador_Island,_Ba_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Conus_regius_(royal_cone_snail)_(San_Salvador_Island,_Ba_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1176" data-file-height="1824"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Antonio_Gades_statue_in_Havana_Vieja.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Antonio_Gades_statue_in_Havana_Vieja_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Antonio_Gades_statue_in_Havana_Vieja.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Antonio_Gades_statue_in_Havana_Vieja.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1944" data-file-height="2592"></a></span></td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Copidosomyia_abdulkalami&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Copidosomyia abdulkalami (page does not exist)">Copidosomyia abdulkalami</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Manickavasagam &amp; Krishnachaitanya, 2016</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Kalam, A. P. J. Abdul"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A._P._J._Abdul_Kalam" title="A. P. J. Abdul Kalam">A. P. J. Abdul Kalam</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chalcid_wasp" title="Chalcid wasp">chalcid wasp</a>
 from India "Named after the former President, Republic of India, Dr. A.
 P. J. Abdul Kalam, as this species description coincided with his 
sudden demise."</td>

<td><span data-sort-value="Hitchens, Christopher"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christopher_Hitchens" title="Christopher Hitchens">Christopher Hitchens</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The name is after Christopher Hitchens, a really missed and 
remarkable intellectual who defended reason and freedom in an 
indefatigable and erudite way."</td>

<td>"The epithet is in honor of the Canadian singersongwriter Joni 
Mitchell. She has written many songs for the protection of nature. Her 
most famous album "<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blue_(Joni_Mitchell_album)" title="Blue (Joni Mitchell album)">Blue</a></i>" suits well for the color of this species".</td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Grusonia_guccinii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Grusonia guccinii (page does not exist)">Corynopuntia guccinii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">D.Donati</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cactus" title="Cactus">Cactus</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Guccini, Francesco"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Francesco_Guccini" title="Francesco Guccini">Francesco Guccini</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"Dedicated to Francesco Guccini: I encountered the plant while 
listening to the song "Incontro", immediately realising that, more than 
any other succulent, it is "unforgiving and touching". I couldn't 
dedicate it to anyone else."<br>Subsequently transferred to genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grusonia" title="Grusonia">Grusonia</a></i>.</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Corynopuntia_guccinii_flower.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Corynopuntia_guccinii_flower.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="126" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Corynopuntia_guccinii_flower_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Corynopuntia_guccinii_flower_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1094" data-file-height="1257"></a></span></td>

<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Cosmobunus_sagani&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Cosmobunus sagani (page does not exist)">Cosmobunus sagani</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Palencia <i>et al.</i>, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harvestman" class="mw-redirect" title="Harvestman">Harvestman</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Sagan, Carl"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Sagan" title="Carl Sagan">Carl Sagan</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil species from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miocene" title="Miocene">Miocene</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spain" title="Spain">Spain</a>, named "In memory of Carl Edward Sagan (1934–1996), creator of the award-winning television series <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cosmos:_A_Personal_Voyage" title="Cosmos: A Personal Voyage">Cosmos: A Personal Voyage</a></i>, for his popularization of science that stimulated generations of school children and university students."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Carl_Sagan_Planetary_Society.JPG" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Carl_Sagan_Planetary_Society.JPG" decoding="async" width="110" height="150" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Carl_Sagan_Planetary_Society_003.JPG 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Carl_Sagan_Planetary_Society_002.JPG 2x" data-file-width="328" data-file-height="448"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Cowanomyia_hillaryi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Cowanomyia hillaryi (page does not exist)">Cowanomyia hillaryi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Jaschhof &amp; Jaschhof, 2009</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fly" title="Fly">Fly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Hillary, Edmund"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edmund_Hillary" title="Edmund Hillary">Edmund Hillary</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fungus_gnat" title="Fungus gnat">fungus gnat</a> endemic to New Zealand. "We name this new species in memory of Sir Edmund Hillary, the Patron of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NZ_Native_Forests_Restoration_Trust" title="NZ Native Forests Restoration Trust">New Zealand Native Forests Restoration Trust</a>
 until his death in January 2008, and to honour the Trust's dedicated 
work from which forest-dwelling arthropods, such as fungus gnats, should
 benefit greatly."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Edmund_Hillary_by_Kubik_2004.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Edmund_Hillary_by_Kubik_2004_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Edmund_Hillary_by_Kubik_2004_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Edmund_Hillary_by_Kubik_2004.jpg 2x" data-file-width="360" data-file-height="480"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Cremastus_tutui&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Cremastus tutui (page does not exist)">Cremastus tutui</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Rousse &amp; Van Noort, 2014</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Tutu, Desmond"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Desmond_Tutu" title="Desmond Tutu">Desmond Tutu</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parasitoid_wasp" title="Parasitoid wasp">parasitoid wasp</a> endemic to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Africa" title="South Africa">South Africa</a>. "Dedicated to Archbishop Desmond Tutu, one of four South Africans to have received the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobel_Peace_prize" class="mw-redirect" title="Nobel Peace prize">Nobel Peace prize</a>, in acknowledgment of his lifelong fight for Human rights."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Archbishop-Tutu-medium.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Archbishop-Tutu-medium_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="165" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Archbishop-Tutu-medium_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Archbishop-Tutu-medium.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1152" data-file-height="1728"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-RousseVN2014_99-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-RousseVN2014-99"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>98<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Cretalamna_bryanti&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Cretalamna bryanti (page does not exist)">Cretalamna bryanti</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ebersole &amp; Ehret, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shark" title="Shark">Shark</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Bryant, Bear"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bear_Bryant" title="Bear Bryant">Bear Bryant</a></span></span></span> and his family</td>
<td>A fossil species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Otodontidae" title="Otodontidae">mega-toothed shark</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cretaceous" title="Cretaceous">Cretaceous</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alabama" title="Alabama">Alabama</a>, USA, named "in honor of the Bryant family, whose commitment to education and ongoing support of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University_of_Alabama" title="University of Alabama">University of Alabama</a>, the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alabama_Museum_of_Natural_History" title="Alabama Museum of Natural History">ALMNH</a> [Alabama Museum of Natural History], and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/McWane_Science_Center" title="McWane Science Center">MSC</a> [McWane Science Center, where the holotype is stored] have enhanced the reputations and missions of all three institutions."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Cretalamna_bryanti_anterior_teeth.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Cretalamna_bryanti_anterior_teeth.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="49" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Cretalamna_bryanti_anterior_teeth_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Cretalamna_bryanti_anterior_teeth_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1180" data-file-height="528"></a></span></td>
<td></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-177" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-177"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>176<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-curious_64-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-curious-64"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>63<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Cretopiesma_suukyiae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Cretopiesma suukyiae (page does not exist)">Cretopiesma suukyiae</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Grimaldi_(entomologist)" title="David Grimaldi (entomologist)">Grimaldi</a> &amp; <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_S._Engel" title="Michael S. Engel">Engel</a>, 2008</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/True_bug" class="mw-redirect" title="True bug">True bug</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aung_San_Suu_Kyi" title="Aung San Suu Kyi">Aung San Suu Kyi</a></td>
<td>A fossil species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aradidae" title="Aradidae">flat bug</a> found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cretaceous" title="Cretaceous">Cretaceous</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burmese_amber" title="Burmese amber">Burmese amber</a>, named "in honor of Aung San Suu Kyi from Burma, the 1991 laureate of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobel_Peace_Prize" title="Nobel Peace Prize">Nobel Peace Prize</a>. Ms. Suu Kyi has spent 18 years [<i>sic</i>;
 actually 13 years at the time of publication] isolated in house 
confinement (from 1989–95, 2000–02, and 2003 to present [2008 at the 
time of publication; she would remain until 2010, and has been 
imprisoned again since February 2021]) for her promotion of democracy in
 Myanmar. It is fitting that a Burmese species, seemingly delicate but 
which has beautifully endured for so long, be named in her honor."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Remise_du_Prix_Sakharov_%C3%A0_Aung_San_Suu_Kyi_Strasbourg_22_octobre_2013-18_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Remise_du_Prix_Sakharov_%25C3%25A0_Aung_San_Suu_Kyi_Strasbou_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="152" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Remise_du_Prix_Sakharov_%25C3%25A0_Aung_San_Suu_Kyi_Strasbourg_2.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Remise_du_Prix_Sakharov_%25C3%25A0_Aung_San_Suu_Kyi_Strasbou_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2783" data-file-height="3842"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-178" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-178"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>177<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crichtonpelta" title="Crichtonpelta">Crichtonpelta</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Arbour &amp; Currie, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dinosaur" title="Dinosaur">Dinosaur</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Crichton, Michael"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Crichton" title="Michael Crichton">Michael Crichton</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A new genus created for a Chinese <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ankylosaur" class="mw-redirect" title="Ankylosaur">ankylosaur</a> originally designated as <i>Crichtonsaurus benxiensis</i>, after the authors considered <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crichtonsaurus" title="Crichtonsaurus">Crichtonsaurus</a></i> a <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nomen_dubium" title="Nomen dubium">nomen dubium</a></i>. <i>Crichtonpelta</i> is named "after Michael Crichton, author of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jurassic_Park_(novel)" title="Jurassic Park (novel)">Jurassic Park</a>, and <i>pelta</i> (Latin), a small shield, in reference to the osteoderms found on all ankylosaurs."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:MichaelCrichton_2.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/MichaelCrichton_2.jpg.webp" decoding="async" width="110" height="144" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/MichaelCrichton_2.jpg_002.webp 1.5x" data-file-width="701" data-file-height="919"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-systematics_ankylosaurid_179-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-systematics_ankylosaurid-179"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>178<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crichtonsaurus" title="Crichtonsaurus">Crichtonsaurus</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Dong, 2002</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dinosaur" title="Dinosaur">Dinosaur</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Crichton, Michael"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Crichton" title="Michael Crichton">Michael Crichton</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The genus name is dedicated to the famous science fiction writer Michael Crichton, author of the novel <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jurassic_Park_(novel)" title="Jurassic Park (novel)">Jurassic Park</a>. The release of the movie <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jurassic_Park_(film)" title="Jurassic Park (film)">Jurassic Park</a> made dinosaurs a household animal and greatly promoted dinosaur research."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Crichtonsaurus_skeleton.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Crichtonsaurus_skeleton.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="73" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Crichtonsaurus_skeleton_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Crichtonsaurus_skeleton_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="5184" data-file-height="3456"></a></span></td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Croton_suassunae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Croton suassunae (page does not exist)">Croton suassunae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Y.Rossine &amp; A.L.Melo</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flowering_plant" title="Flowering plant">Flowering plant</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Suassuna, Ariano"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ariano_Suassuna" title="Ariano Suassuna">Ariano Suassuna</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Croton_(plant)" title="Croton (plant)">rushfoil</a> native to the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northeast_Region,_Brazil" title="Northeast Region, Brazil">Northeast Region, Brazil</a>, whose name "honors Ariano Villar Suassuna, a lawyer, playwright, novelist, essayist, poet, and teacher, born in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Para%C3%ADba" title="Paraíba">Paraíba</a> State, and who, throughout his life, valued and promoted the art and culture of northeastern Brazil."</td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Culicoides_rulfoi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Culicoides rulfoi (page does not exist)">Culicoides rulfoi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Spinelli &amp; Huerta, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fly" title="Fly">Fly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Rulfo, Juan"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juan_Rulfo" title="Juan Rulfo">Juan Rulfo</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>The <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Holotype" title="Holotype">holotype</a> of this <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mesoamerica" title="Mesoamerica">mesoamerican</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biting_midge" class="mw-redirect" title="Biting midge">biting midge</a> was collected in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico" title="Mexico">Mexico</a>. "We are pleased to name this species after the Mexican writer Juan Rulfo, in recognition of his very important literary work."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Rulfo_por_Lyon.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rulfo_por_Lyon.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="153" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rulfo_por_Lyon_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rulfo_por_Lyon_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="724" data-file-height="1008"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Cunaxoides_shahriari&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Cunaxoides shahriari (page does not exist)">Cunaxoides shahriari</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Bagheri, Paktinat-Saeij &amp; Castro, 2016</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mite" title="Mite">Mite</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Shahriar, Mohammad-Hossein"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mohammad-Hossein_Shahriar" title="Mohammad-Hossein Shahriar">Mohammad-Hossein Shahriar</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northern_Iran" title="Northern Iran">Northern Iran</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Azerbaijan_(Iran)" title="Azerbaijan (Iran)">Iranian Azerbaijan</a>,
 "named in memory of "Mohammad Hossein Behjat Tabrizi, Shahriar" 
(1906–1988) who was a notable Iranian poet of Iranian Azerbaijani 
origin, who wrote in Azeri, Turkish and Persian."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Shahriar_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Shahriar_(cropped).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="142" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Shahriar_(cropped)_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Shahriar_(cropped)_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="317" data-file-height="408"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cuspicephalus_scarfi" class="mw-redirect" title="Cuspicephalus scarfi">Cuspicephalus scarfi</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Martill &amp; Etches, 2013</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pterosaur" title="Pterosaur">Pterosaur</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Scarfe, Gerald"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gerald_Scarfe" title="Gerald Scarfe">Gerald Scarfe</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"After artist/cartoonist Gerald Scarfe whose vicious caricatures mostly have very pointy noses." The generic name <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cuspicephalus" title="Cuspicephalus">Cuspicephalus</a></i> is derived from <i>cuspis</i>, Latin for "point", after the animal's pointed rostrum, and Latinised Greek <i>cephalus</i> for "head".</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Cuspicephalus_NT.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Cuspicephalus_NT_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="83" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Cuspicephalus_NT_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Cuspicephalus_NT.jpg 2x" data-file-width="500" data-file-height="375"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Gerald_Scarfe-2.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gerald_Scarfe-2.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="137" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gerald_Scarfe-2_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Gerald_Scarfe-2.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2971" data-file-height="3691"></a></span></td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Cyphochilus_leducthoi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Cyphochilus leducthoi (page does not exist)">Cyphochilus leducthoi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Sabatinelli, 2020</span></td>

<td>"Lê Đức Thọ was a Vietnamese general, diplomat, politician, and awardee (but refused to accept) of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1973_Nobel_Peace_Prize" title="1973 Nobel Peace Prize">1973 Nobel Peace Prize</a>, for his efforts in negotiating between the U.S.A. and Vietnam, the country from where the new species of <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyphochilus" title="Cyphochilus">Cyphochilus</a></i> is described."</td>

<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Face_detail,_Tenzin_Gyatso_-_14th_Dalai_Lama_(2012)_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Face_detail,_Tenzin_Gyatso_-_14th_Dalai_Lama_(2012)_(cro_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="137" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Face_detail,_Tenzin_Gyatso_-_14th_Dalai_Lama_(2012)_(cro_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Face_detail,_Tenzin_Gyatso_-_14th_Dalai_Lama_(2012)_(cropped.jpg 2x" data-file-width="738" data-file-height="920"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Cyphochilus2020_190-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Cyphochilus2020-190"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>189<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr id="D">
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Daisya_obriani&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Daisya obriani (page does not exist)">Daisya obriani</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Anderson, 2003</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weevil" title="Weevil">Weevil</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="O'Brian, Patrick"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patrick_O%27Brian" title="Patrick O'Brian">Patrick O'Brian</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"This species is named after Patrick O'Brian (1914–2000), an author of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aubrey%E2%80%93Maturin_series" title="Aubrey–Maturin series">a series of historical novels</a>
 set in the early 19th century British Royal Navy. The dedication was 
arranged through a donation to Nature Discovery Fund of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canadian_Museum_of_Nature" title="Canadian Museum of Nature">Canadian Museum of Nature</a> by <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.hmssurprise.org/">The Gunroom of HMSSurprise.org</a>,
 an internet group devoted to the publications of Mr. O'Brian. Many of 
his books tell of long sea voyages and there are often references to the
 weevils found in the ship's biscuit."</td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-191" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-191"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>190<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Dalek_nationi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Dalek nationi (page does not exist)">Dalek nationi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Noyes_(entomologist)" title="John Noyes (entomologist)">Noyes</a>, 2023</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Nation, Terry"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terry_Nation" title="Terry Nation">Terry Nation</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"This species is named in honour of Terry Nation, creator of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daleks" class="mw-redirect" title="Daleks">Daleks</a>, an alien species that has terrified children for the past 60 years." <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Noyes_(entomologist)" title="John Noyes (entomologist)">John S. Noyes</a>, who described the genus, said, "I thought [<i>Dalek</i>] was a good name for a genus and a bit of fun having been a big fan of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doctor_Who" title="Doctor Who">Doctor Who</a> in my early years."</td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-192" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-192"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>191<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-193" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-193"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>192<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Dalicrinus&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Dalicrinus (page does not exist)">Dalicrinus</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Cole <i>et al.</i>, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_lily" class="mw-redirect" title="Sea lily">Sea lily</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Dalí, Salvador"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salvador_Dal%C3%AD" title="Salvador Dalí">Salvador Dalí</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil genus of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crinoids" class="mw-redirect" title="Crinoids">crinoids</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ordovician" title="Ordovician">Ordovician</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spain" title="Spain">Spain</a>,
 named "in recognition of the Spanish surrealist painter, Salvador Dalí,
 with reference to the irregular plating of the interradial areas."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Salvador_Dali_NYWTS.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Salvador_Dali_NYWTS_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="143" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Salvador_Dali_NYWTS_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Salvador_Dali_NYWTS.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3140" data-file-height="4096"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Crinus2017_194-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Crinus2017-194"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>193<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Daptolestes_leei&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Daptolestes leei (page does not exist)">Daptolestes leei</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Robinson, Li &amp; Yeates, 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fly" title="Fly">Fly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Lee, Stan"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stan_Lee" title="Stan Lee">Stan Lee</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"Stan Lee's fly [...] shares his characteristic sunglasses and white
 moustache". In the same paper, other species were named after <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Comics" title="Marvel Comics">Marvel Comics</a> characters, such as "Thor's fly" <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Daptolestes_bronteflavus&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Daptolestes bronteflavus (page does not exist)">Daptolestes bronteflavus</a></i> (meaning "blond thunder"), "Loki's fly" <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Daptolestes_illusiolautus&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Daptolestes illusiolautus (page does not exist)">Daptolestes illusiolautus</a></i> (meaning "elegant deception"), "Black Widow's fly" <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Daptolestes_feminategus&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Daptolestes feminategus (page does not exist)">Daptolestes feminategus</a></i> (meaning "woman wearing leather"), and "Deadpool's fly" <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Humorolethalis_sergius&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Humorolethalis sergius (page does not exist)">Humorolethalis sergius</a></i>
 ("[The generic name] sounds like lethal humour and is derived from the 
Latin words humorosus, meaning wet or moist, and lethalis meaning dead")</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Stan_Lee_December_2016.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Stan_Lee_December_2016_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="144" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Stan_Lee_December_2016.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Stan_Lee_December_2016.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1101" data-file-height="1441"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-195" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-195"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>194<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-196" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-196"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>195<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><br><sup id="cite_ref-197" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-197"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>196<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daviesia_schwarzenegger" title="Daviesia schwarzenegger">Daviesia schwarzenegger</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Douglas_Crisp" class="mw-redirect" title="Michael Douglas Crisp">Crisp</a> &amp; <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lyn_G._Cook" title="Lyn G. Cook">L.G.Cook</a></span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legume" title="Legume">Legume</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Schwarzenegger, Arnold"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arnold_Schwarzenegger" title="Arnold Schwarzenegger">Arnold Schwarzenegger</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daviesia" title="Daviesia">bitter pea</a> from Australia. "Surprisingly, DNA sequence data showed <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daviesia_benthamii" title="Daviesia benthamii">D. benthamii</a></i> subsp. <i>humilis</i> to comprise two cryptic species that are more closely related to other species than to <i>D. benthamii</i>
 [...]. As they are unexpected and unlikely 'twins', we have named them 
after the actors who played an unlikely pair of twins in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Twins_(1988_film)" title="Twins (1988 film)">the eponymous Hollywood movie</a>: Arnold Schwarzenegger and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Danny_DeVito" title="Danny DeVito">Danny DeVito</a>.
 We have named this species after Schwarzenegger because he is much more
 robust than his twin: 'The embryo did split in two, but it didn't split
 equally. All the purity and strength went into Julius [Schwarzenegger's
 character]'. This difference between the actors parallels the growth 
habit difference between the two <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daviesia" title="Daviesia">Daviesia</a></i> species. We also wish to honour Arnold Schwarzenegger's leadership (as <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Governor_of_California" title="Governor of California">governor of California</a>) in pioneering the reduction of carbon emissions, and for advising the Australian government to do the same."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Arnold_Schwarzenegger_by_Gage_Skidmore_4_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/120px-Arnold_Schwarzenegger_by_Gage_Skidmore_4_(cropped).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="140" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/250px-Arnold_Schwarzenegger_by_Gage_Skidmore_4_(cropped).jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="2030" data-file-height="2588"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Daviesia_198-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Daviesia-198"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>197<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daviesia_devito" title="Daviesia devito">Daviesia devito</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Douglas_Crisp" class="mw-redirect" title="Michael Douglas Crisp">Crisp</a> &amp; <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lyn_G._Cook" title="Lyn G. Cook">L.G.Cook</a></span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legume" title="Legume">Legume</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="DeVito, Danny"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Danny_DeVito" title="Danny DeVito">Danny DeVito</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daviesia" title="Daviesia">bitter pea</a> from Australia. "The name refers to the actor playing the diminutive twin in the Universal Studios film <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Twins_(1988_film)" title="Twins (1988 film)">Twins</a></i> (1988). <i>Daviesia devito</i> is the less vigorous of two cryptic species into which we here divide <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daviesia_benthamii" title="Daviesia benthamii">D. benthamii</a></i> subsp. <i>humilis</i>, in contrast to the much more robust <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daviesia_schwarzenegger" title="Daviesia schwarzenegger">D. schwarzenegger</a></i>" [also in this list]</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Daviesia_devito_large.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Daviesia_devito_large_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="110" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Daviesia_devito_large.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Daviesia_devito_large_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2048" data-file-height="2048"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Danny_DeVito_cropped_and_edited_for_brightness.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Danny_DeVito_cropped_and_edited_for_brightness_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="128" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Danny_DeVito_cropped_and_edited_for_brightness.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="1732" data-file-height="2019"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Daviesia_198-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Daviesia-198"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>197<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Deltapliomera_humphriesi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Deltapliomera humphriesi (page does not exist)">Deltapliomera humphriesi</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">McAdams, Adrain &amp; Karim, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trilobite" title="Trilobite">Trilobite</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Humphries, Barry"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barry_Humphries" title="Barry Humphries">Barry Humphries</a></span></span></span></td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Barry_Humphries_July_2001.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Barry_Humphries_July_2001.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="162" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Barry_Humphries_July_2001_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Barry_Humphries_July_2001_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="702" data-file-height="1035"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Ibexaspis2018_199-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ibexaspis2018-199"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>198<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Thaiphusa_sirikit&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Thaiphusa sirikit (page does not exist)">Demanietta sirikit</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Naiyanetr, 1992</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crustacean" title="Crustacean">Crustacean</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sirikit" title="Sirikit">Sirikit</a></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freshwater_crab" title="Freshwater crab">freshwater crab</a> native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thailand" title="Thailand">Thailand</a>,
 named "in honour of Her Majesty Queen Sirikit [on] the occasion of Her 
Majesty's 60th birthday, as a token of respect and recognition of the 
great interest shown by Her Majesty in the natural history and 
conservation of wildlife in Thailand. Her Majesty the Queen graciously 
permitted the use of Her name for this remarkably colourful and most 
interesting species."<br>Subsequently transferred to genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Thaiphusa&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Thaiphusa (page does not exist)">Thaiphusa</a></i>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Queen_Sirikit_1960.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Queen_Sirikit_1960.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="159" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Queen_Sirikit_1960.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Queen_Sirikit_1960.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1600" data-file-height="2311"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-200" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-200"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>199<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dendropsophus_kubricki" title="Dendropsophus kubricki">Dendropsophus kubricki</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Rivadeneira, Venegas &amp; Ron, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frog" title="Frog">Frog</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Kubrick, Stanley"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stanley_Kubrick" title="Stanley Kubrick">Stanley Kubrick</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"[Kubrick] is one of the most brilliant and influential film 
directors of all time. We dedicate this species to him for his legacy to
 film culture and science fiction."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Amplexus_of_Dendropsophus_kubricki.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Amplexus_of_Dendropsophus_kubricki.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="72" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Amplexus_of_Dendropsophus_kubricki_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Amplexus_of_Dendropsophus_kubricki_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="747" data-file-height="492"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Kubrick_on_the_set_of_Barry_Lyndon_(1975_publicity_photo)_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Kubrick_on_the_set_of_Barry_Lyndon_(1975_publicity_photo)_(c.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="124" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Kubrick_on_the_set_of_Barry_Lyndon_(1975_publicity_photo_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Kubrick_on_the_set_of_Barry_Lyndon_(1975_publicity_photo_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="793" data-file-height="893"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-201" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-201"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>200<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dendropsophus_ozzyi" title="Dendropsophus ozzyi">Dendropsophus ozzyi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Orrico et al., 2014</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frog" title="Frog">Frog</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Osbourne, Ozzy"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ozzy_Osbourne" title="Ozzy Osbourne">Ozzy Osbourne</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The specific epithet [...] honors John Michael "Ozzy" Osbourne, a famous British rock singer, former vocalist of the rock band <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Sabbath" title="Black Sabbath">Black Sabbath</a>,
 for its contribution to modern music and culture. Ozzy is commonly 
associated with bats because of the famous episode in which, on stage 
while he was performing a gig, he bit off a bat's head thrown by a fan. 
He later stated that he thought it was a plastic toy.<br>When calling, this new <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dendropsophus" title="Dendropsophus">Dendropsophus</a></i>
 species can be vaguely associated with the high pitch sounds emitted by
 some bat species that are hearable to the human ear. When we heard this
 species in the field we immediately pictured a calling bat. Because of 
this "bat association" we take the opportunity to name this species 
after one of the biggest music legends of all time".</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:OzzyChangingHands02-20-2010.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/OzzyChangingHands02-20-2010_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="146" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/OzzyChangingHands02-20-2010_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/OzzyChangingHands02-20-2010.jpg 2x" data-file-width="449" data-file-height="594"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-202" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-202"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>201<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-203" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-203"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>202<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dendropsophus_salli" title="Dendropsophus salli">Dendropsophus salli</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Jungfer, Reichle &amp; Piskurek, 2010</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frog" title="Frog">Frog</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Sall, John"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Sall" title="John Sall">John Sall</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The new species is named after John Sall for his continuous 
generous contributions to forest conservation worldwide and especially 
in the Neotropical region."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:John_Sall_2012.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/John_Sall_2012.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-John_Sall_2012.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-John_Sall_2012.jpg 2x" data-file-width="480" data-file-height="640"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-204" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-204"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>203<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Desis_bobmarleyi" title="Desis bobmarleyi">Desis bobmarleyi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Baehr et al., 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Marley, Bob"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_Marley" title="Bob Marley">Bob Marley</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"we describe a new intertidal species from tropical Queensland and name it after Bob Marley, whose song "<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/High_Tide_or_Low_Tide" class="mw-redirect" title="High Tide or Low Tide">High Tide or Low Tide</a>" inspired us as it lives in a "high tide low tide" habitat". The common name "Bob Marley's Intertidal Spider" was proposed.</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Desis_bobmarleyi_male_holotype.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Desis_bobmarleyi_male_holotype.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="94" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Desis_bobmarleyi_male_holotype_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Desis_bobmarleyi_male_holotype_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="720" data-file-height="612"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Bob-Marley.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bob-Marley_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="164" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bob-Marley_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bob-Marley.jpg 2x" data-file-width="500" data-file-height="744"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-205" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-205"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>204<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Dichogaster_garciai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Dichogaster garciai (page does not exist)">Dichogaster garciai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">James, 2004</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earthworm" title="Earthworm">Earthworm</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Garcia, Jerry"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jerry_Garcia" title="Jerry Garcia">Jerry Garcia</a></span></span></span></td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Dichogaster_manleyi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Dichogaster manleyi (page does not exist)">Dichogaster manleyi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">James, 2004</span></td>

<td>This species is native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jamaica" title="Jamaica">Jamaica</a>.</td>

<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Michael_Manley.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Michael_Manley.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="138" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Michael_Manley_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Michael_Manley_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="753"></a></span></td>

<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Bob-Marley.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bob-Marley_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="164" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bob-Marley_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bob-Marley.jpg 2x" data-file-width="500" data-file-height="744"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-James2004_206-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-James2004-206"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>205<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Dicrotendipes_thanatogratus&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Dicrotendipes thanatogratus (page does not exist)">Dicrotendipes thanatogratus</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Epler, 1987</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fly" title="Fly">Fly</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grateful_Dead" title="Grateful Dead">Grateful Dead</a></td>
<td><i>Thanatos</i> is Greek for "death" and <i>Gratus</i> is Latin for "grateful".</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Grateful_Dead_at_the_Warfield-01.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Grateful_Dead_at_the_Warfield-01.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="72" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Grateful_Dead_at_the_Warfield-01_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Grateful_Dead_at_the_Warfield-01_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1024" data-file-height="666"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-CSN_44-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CSN-44"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>43<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Diplomaragna_feynmani&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Diplomaragna feynmani (page does not exist)">Diplomaragna feynmani</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Shear, 1990</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Millipede" title="Millipede">Millipede</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Feynman, Richard"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Feynman" title="Richard Feynman">Richard Feynman</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The species name honors Richard P. Feynman, physicist, teacher, 
artist, musician, raconteur, and personal hero of the author, whose 
untimely death prevented him from realizing his ambition to visit Tannu 
Tuva, now the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tuva_ASSR" class="mw-redirect" title="Tuva ASSR">Tuva ASSR</a>." (where the holotype was collected)</td>
<td></td>

<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dollyphyton" class="mw-redirect" title="Dollyphyton">Dollyphyton</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Retallack, 2019</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moss" title="Moss">Moss</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Parton, Dolly"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dolly_Parton" title="Dolly Parton">Dolly Parton</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil genus from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ordovician" title="Ordovician">Ordovician</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tennessee" title="Tennessee">Tennessee</a>, USA. "The generic name is in honor of Dolly Parton, whose <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dollywood" title="Dollywood">Dollywood</a> resort is near <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Douglas_Dam" title="Douglas Dam">Douglas Dam</a>" (where the fossils were found)</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Dollyphyton_boucotii_sketch.tif" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Dollyphyton_boucotii_sketch.tif.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="184" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Dollyphyton_boucotii_sketch.tif_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Dollyphyton_boucotii_sketch.tif_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="282" data-file-height="471"></a></span></td>
