<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dolomedes_venmani" title="Dolomedes venmani">Dolomedes venmani</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Raven &amp; Hebron, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Venman, Jack"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jack_Venman" title="Jack Venman">Jack Venman</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fishing_spider" class="mw-redirect" title="Fishing spider">fishing spider</a>
 from Australia, named "in honour of Jack Venman (13 August 1911–29 
December 1994), a farmer who, wanting to preserve the great biodiversity
 in the area, sold his 255 acres to the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Queensland_Government" title="Queensland Government">Queensland Government</a> [<i>sic</i>; actually the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shire_of_Albert" title="Shire of Albert">Shire of Albert</a>] in 1971 for $1."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Jack_Venman.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/120px-Jack_Venman.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="145" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/250px-Jack_Venman.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="649" data-file-height="854"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-RavenHebron_212-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-RavenHebron-212"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>211<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Doris_juanformelli&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Doris juanformelli (page does not exist)">Doris juanformelli</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ortea &amp; Espinosa, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_slug" title="Sea slug">Sea slug</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Formell, Juan"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juan_Formell" title="Juan Formell">Juan Formell</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cuba" title="Cuba">Cuba</a>
 named "in honour of Juan Formell (Havana, 1942–2014), a great bassist 
and composer who made the most of the expressive resources of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Son_cubano" title="Son cubano">son cubano</a>, founding the group <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Los_Van_Van" title="Los Van Van">Los Van Van</a>
 in 1969, true ambassadors of Cuban music, capable of making the 
broomsticks dance with songs like "El baile del buey cansao" or "La 
Titimanía". In 2013 he received a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Latin_Grammy_Lifetime_Achievement_Award" title="Latin Grammy Lifetime Achievement Award">Latin Grammy Lifetime Achievement Award</a>."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Juan_Formell_2013.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Juan_Formell_2013.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="185" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Juan_Formell_2013_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Juan_Formell_2013_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="261" data-file-height="438"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-213" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-213"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>212<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doris_parrae" title="Doris parrae">Doris parrae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ortea, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_slug" title="Sea slug">Sea slug</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Parra, Violeta"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Violeta_Parra" title="Violeta Parra">Violeta Parra</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species native to the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gal%C3%A1pagos_Islands" title="Galápagos Islands">Galápagos Islands</a>, "named in honour of Victoria [<i>sic</i>] Parra (4 October 1917, San Carlos – 5 February 1967, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Santiago_de_Chile" class="mw-redirect" title="Santiago de Chile">Santiago de Chile</a>), Chilean composer and singer, on the 100th anniversary of her birth, author of the song "<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gracias_a_la_vida" title="Gracias a la vida">Gracias a la vida</a>" ["Thanks to life"] that has so often been sung by those who saw their childhood dreams come true."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Parra01f.PNG" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Parra01f.PNG" decoding="async" width="110" height="142" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Parra01f_003.PNG 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Parra01f_002.PNG 2x" data-file-width="290" data-file-height="374"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-214" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-214"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>213<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Drepanoistodus_iommii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Drepanoistodus iommii (page does not exist)">Drepanoistodus iommii</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Rasmussen, Eriksson &amp; Lindskog, 2021</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">Fish</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Iommi, Tony"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tony_Iommi" title="Tony Iommi">Tony Iommi</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conodont" title="Conodont">conodont</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ordovician" title="Ordovician">Ordovician</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leningrad_Oblast" title="Leningrad Oblast">Leningrad Oblast</a>, Russia. "Named in honour of legendary guitarist Tony Iommi, founding member of heavy metal band <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Sabbath" title="Black Sabbath">Black Sabbath</a>."
 Iommi jokingly said "It's a shock that a fossil has been named after 
me, and of course you can imagine my friends now, the sort of abuse I've
 got now!", and also stated he was proud and thanked Eriksson for the 
honour.</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Drepanoistodus_(10.5852-ejt.2021.774.1533)_Figure_6.png" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Drepanoistodus_(10.5852-ejt.2021.774.1533)_Figure_6.png" decoding="async" width="110" height="127" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Drepanoistodus_(10.5852-ejt.2021.774.1533)_Figure_6_002.png 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Drepanoistodus_(10.5852-ejt.2021.774.1533)_Figure_6_003.png 2x" data-file-width="1893" data-file-height="2184"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Tony-Iommi_2009-06-11_Chicago_photoby_Adam-Bielawski.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Tony-Iommi_2009-06-11_Chicago_photoby_Adam-Bielawski.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="164" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Tony-Iommi_2009-06-11_Chicago_photoby_Adam-Bielawski_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Tony-Iommi_2009-06-11_Chicago_photoby_Adam-Bielawski.jpg 2x" data-file-width="800" data-file-height="1195"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-215" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-215"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>214<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-216" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-216"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>215<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Drepanosticta_adenani&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Drepanosticta adenani (page does not exist)">Drepanosticta adenani</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Dow &amp; Reels, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Damselfly" title="Damselfly">Damselfly</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adenan_Satem" title="Adenan Satem">Adenan Satem</a></td>
<td>A species identified in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lanjak_Entimau_Wildlife_Sanctuary" title="Lanjak Entimau Wildlife Sanctuary">Lanjak Entimau Wildlife Sanctuary</a> (LEWS) in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sarawak" title="Sarawak">Sarawak</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malaysia" title="Malaysia">Malaysia</a>, dedicated "to the late Tan Sri Adenan bin Satem (27 January 1944–11 January 2017), <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chief_Minister_of_Sarawak" class="mw-redirect" title="Chief Minister of Sarawak">Chief Minister of Sarawak</a>
 from 2014–2017, in recognition of his support for biodiversity research
 and conservation in Sarawak, and for starting the Research for 
Intensified Management of Bio-rich Areas (RIMBA) project, which includes
 LEWS."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Adenan_Satem_during_the_Sejiwa_Sanada_programme_at_Kota_Samarahan.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Adenan_Satem_during_the_Sejiwa_Sanada_programme_at_Kota__003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="135" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Adenan_Satem_during_the_Sejiwa_Sanada_programme_at_Kota_Sama.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Adenan_Satem_during_the_Sejiwa_Sanada_programme_at_Kota__002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="753" data-file-height="924"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Drosophila_kingmani&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Drosophila kingmani (page does not exist)">Drosophila kingmani</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Peñafiel-Vinueza &amp; Rafael, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fly" title="Fly">Fly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Kingman, Eduardo"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eduardo_Kingman" title="Eduardo Kingman">Eduardo Kingman</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drosophilidae" title="Drosophilidae">fruit fly</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ecuador" title="Ecuador">Ecuador</a>; "The species name honors Eduardo Kingman (1913–1997). Kingman was a famous painter and muralist and was born in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loja,_Ecuador" title="Loja, Ecuador">Loja</a> [very close to the type locality]. Kingman was a founder of the Ecuadorian impressionism movement."</td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-218" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-218"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>217<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Drosophila_teresae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Drosophila teresae (page does not exist)">Drosophila teresae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Pradhan &amp; Sati, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fly" title="Fly">Fly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Teresa, Mother"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mother_Teresa" title="Mother Teresa">Mother Teresa</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drosophilidae" title="Drosophilidae">fruit fly</a> from India named "in honour of Saint Mother Teresa (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobel_Peace_Prize" title="Nobel Peace Prize">Nobel Peace Prize</a> winner 1979), who was the founder of the order of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Missionaries_of_Charity" title="Missionaries of Charity">Missionaries of Charity</a>, a Roman Catholic congregation of women dedicated to helping the poor."</td>
<td></td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fly" title="Fly">Fly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Virén, Lasse"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lasse_Vir%C3%A9n" title="Lasse Virén">Lasse Virén</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drosophilidae" title="Drosophilidae">fruit fly</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Finland" title="Finland">Finland</a>, "Named in honor of the Finnish runner, four times Olympic gold winner, Lasse Viren"</td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Drypetes_kalamii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Drypetes kalamii (page does not exist)">Drypetes kalamii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">G. Krishna, Karthig., Arisdason &amp; Chakrab</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flowering_plant" title="Flowering plant">Flowering plant</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Kalam, A. P. J. Abdul"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A._P._J._Abdul_Kalam" title="A. P. J. Abdul Kalam">A. P. J. Abdul Kalam</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A tropical plant native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/West_Bengal" title="West Bengal">West Bengal</a>,
 India, which "honours Dr. Avul Pakir Jainulabdeen Abdul Kalam (Dr. 
A.P.J. Abdul Kalam), the 11th President of [the] Republic of India, 
professor and aerospace scientist, for being an inspiration to the 
entire scientific community, especially the students and young 
researchers."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:A._P._J._Abdul_Kalam_in_2008.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/A._P._J._Abdul_Kalam_in_2008.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/A._P._J._Abdul_Kalam_in_2008_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/A._P._J._Abdul_Kalam_in_2008_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1624" data-file-height="2165"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dudleya_hendrixii" title="Dudleya hendrixii">Dudleya hendrixii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">S.McCabe &amp; Dodero</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flowering_plant" title="Flowering plant">Flowering plant</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Hendrix, Jimi"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jimi_Hendrix" title="Jimi Hendrix">Jimi Hendrix</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>Discoverer Mark Dodero said to have been listening to Hendrix's "<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Voodoo_Child_(Slight_Return)" title="Voodoo Child (Slight Return)">Voodoo Child</a>" when he first saw it, near Colonet, Baja California, Mexico.</td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Dusona_franklinae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Dusona franklinae (page does not exist)">Dusona franklinae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Kittel, 2016</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Franklin, Rosalind"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rosalind_Franklin" title="Rosalind Franklin">Rosalind Franklin</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>Replacement name for <i>Dusona nigritibialis</i> <span style="font-size:85%;">(Gupta &amp; Gupta, 1976)</span>, which had originally been described as <i>Kartika nigritibialis</i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Gupta &amp; Gupta, 1976</span>, but upon being transferred to the genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dusona" title="Dusona">Dusona</a></i> in 1997, became a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Junior_homonym" class="mw-redirect" title="Junior homonym">junior homonym</a> of <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Dusona_nigritibialis&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Dusona nigritibialis (page does not exist)">Dusona nigritibialis</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">(Viereck, 1926)</span>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Rosalind_Franklin.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rosalind_Franklin_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="132" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rosalind_Franklin_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rosalind_Franklin.jpg 2x" data-file-width="521" data-file-height="626"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-89Replacement_224-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-89Replacement-224"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>223<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr id="E">
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Eidmanacris_suassunai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Eidmanacris suassunai (page does not exist)">Eidmanacris suassunai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Souza-Dias, Campos &amp; Nihei, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cricket_(insect)" title="Cricket (insect)">Cricket</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Suassuna, Ariano"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ariano_Suassuna" title="Ariano Suassuna">Ariano Suassuna</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil">Brazilian</a> species "named in honor of the Brazilian writer Ariano Suassuna (1927–2014). Ariano wrote a famous Brazilian play entitled <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Auto_da_Compadecida" title="Auto da Compadecida">O Auto da Compadecida</a></i>; the main character in this play is named "João Grilo" — "grilo" is the Brazilian common name for cricket."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Ariano_Suassuna.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ariano_Suassuna_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="176" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ariano_Suassuna.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Ariano_Suassuna.jpg 2x" data-file-width="552" data-file-height="885"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Eknomisis_dalioi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Eknomisis dalioi (page does not exist)">Eknomisis dalioi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Watling &amp; France, 2011</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coral" title="Coral">Coral</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Dalio, Ray"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ray_Dalio" title="Ray Dalio">Ray Dalio</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"This species is named in honor of Ray Dalio, for his dedicated service on the board of directors of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Fish_and_Wildlife_Foundation" title="National Fish and Wildlife Foundation">National Fish and Wildlife Foundation</a>.
 Dalio is an accomplished entrepreneur and conservationist with a deep 
interest in the protection of the ocean. His investigative and 
analytical nature continues to lead his pursuits deeper into ocean 
abysses and toward the discovery of new ocean life."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Web_Summit_2018_-_Forum_-_Day_2,_November_7_HM1_7481_(44858045925).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Web_Summit_2018_-_Forum_-_Day_2,_November_7_HM1_7481_(44_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="112" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Web_Summit_2018_-_Forum_-_Day_2,_November_7_HM1_7481_(44_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Web_Summit_2018_-_Forum_-_Day_2,_November_7_HM1_7481_(448580.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2992" data-file-height="3040"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-226" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-226"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>225<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Electroneuria_ronwoodi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Electroneuria ronwoodi (page does not exist)">Electroneuria ronwoodi</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Sroka, Staniczek &amp; Kondratieff, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stonefly" class="mw-redirect" title="Stonefly">Stonefly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Wood, Ronnie"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ronnie_Wood" title="Ronnie Wood">Ronnie Wood</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of 2 genera and 7 species of fossil stoneflies found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burmese_amber" title="Burmese amber">Burmese amber</a>,
 and named concurrently in 2018 after The Rolling Stones and its members
 on the occasion of Mick Jagger's 75th birthday (see also species in the
 genera <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lapisperla&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Lapisperla (page does not exist)">Lapisperla</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Largusoperla&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Largusoperla (page does not exist)">Largusoperla</a></i> and <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Petroperla&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Petroperla (page does not exist)">Petroperla</a></i>).<br>"Burmese amber is one of the oldest resins with insect inclusions, and stoneflies are one of the oldest <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pterygote" class="mw-redirect" title="Pterygote">pterygote</a>
 lineages. What lies closer at hand than to link fossil stoneflies in 
ancient stones with the Rolling Stones and to name the new species after
 the members of the oldest and greatest <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rock_%27n%27_Roll" class="mw-redirect" title="Rock 'n' Roll">Rock 'n' Roll</a>
 Band in the world. The [...] new family and genera are named after 'the
 Stones', and all present and former members of the Rolling Stones are 
honoured with their own species.[...] The name of this immature specimen
 refers to Ronnie Wood, guitar player of the Rolling Stones since 1975, 
and youngest member of the Rolling Stones."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Electroneuria_ronwoodi_holotype_Fig5_B.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Electroneuria_ronwoodi_holotype_Fig5_B_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="73" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Electroneuria_ronwoodi_holotype_Fig5_B_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Electroneuria_ronwoodi_holotype_Fig5_B.jpg 2x" data-file-width="578" data-file-height="385"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Ronnie_Wood_(55208398).jpeg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ronnie_Wood_(55208398).jpeg" decoding="async" width="110" height="138" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ronnie_Wood_(55208398)_002.jpeg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Ronnie_Wood_(55208398).jpeg 2x" data-file-width="1638" data-file-height="2048"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-RollingStoneflies_227-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-RollingStoneflies-227"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>226<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Elephantis_jaggeri&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Elephantis jaggeri (page does not exist)">Elephantis jaggeri</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Klotz &amp; De Grave, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crustacean" title="Crustacean">Crustacean</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Jagger, Mick"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mick_Jagger" title="Mick Jagger">Mick Jagger</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>Replacement name for <i>Elephantis natalensis</i> <span style="font-size:85%;">(Bouvier, 1925)</span> (formerly <i>Caridina natalensis</i>), a junior primary homonym of <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caridina_nilotica" title="Caridina nilotica">Caridina nilotica</a></i> var. <i>natalensis</i> <span style="font-size:85%;">De Man, 1908</span>. "The species name is dedicated to Mick Jagger, in reference to the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rolling_Stones" class="mw-redirect" title="Rolling Stones">Rolling Stones</a>' song "<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/(I_Can%27t_Get_No)_Satisfaction" title="(I Can't Get No) Satisfaction">(I Can't Get No) Satisfaction</a>", to continue the innuendo laden etymology of <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Elephantis_(genus)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Elephantis (genus) (page does not exist)">Elephantis</a></i>." (See <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Elephantis_(genus)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Elephantis (genus) (page does not exist)">Elephantis</a></i> in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_organisms_named_after_famous_people_(born_before_1900)" class="mw-redirect" title="List of organisms named after famous people (born before 1900)">List of organisms named after famous people (born before 1900)</a>)</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Rolling_Stones_04.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Rolling_Stones_04.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="140" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Rolling_Stones_04.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rolling_Stones_04.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1853" data-file-height="2354"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-228" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-228"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>227<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pristimantis_jorgevelosai" title="Pristimantis jorgevelosai">Eleutherodactylus jorgevelosai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Lynch, 1994</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frog" title="Frog">Frog</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Velosa, Jorge"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jorge_Velosa" title="Jorge Velosa">Jorge Velosa</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colombia" title="Colombia">Colombia</a>,
 which "takes the name of my friend and folklorist, Jorge Velosa Ruiz, 
whose music and poetry bring me so much pleasure". Another related 
species was concurrently named <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pristimantis_carranguerorum" title="Pristimantis carranguerorum">Eleutherodactylus carranguerorum</a></i>, after Velosa's band Los Carrangueros. Both have been subsequently moved to the genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pristimantis" title="Pristimantis">Pristimantis</a></i>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Velossa.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Velossa.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="121" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Velossa_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Velossa_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="468" data-file-height="514"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-229" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-229"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>228<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-230" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-230"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>229<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Elysia_chavelavargas&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Elysia chavelavargas (page does not exist)">Elysia chavelavargas</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ortea, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_slug" title="Sea slug">Sea slug</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Vargas, Chavela"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chavela_Vargas" title="Chavela Vargas">Chavela Vargas</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species native to the Pacific coast of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Costa_Rica" title="Costa Rica">Costa Rica</a>, named "In honour of the unique ranchera singer Chavela Vargas, a native of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heredia,_Costa_Rica" title="Heredia, Costa Rica">Heredia, Costa Rica</a>, and naturalized Mexican, like our colleague and friend Julio Magaña, organiser of the collection in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guanacaste_Conservation_Area" title="Guanacaste Conservation Area">Guanacaste</a>, as a technician of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Instituto_Nacional_de_Biodiversidad" title="Instituto Nacional de Biodiversidad">INBio</a>, an institution also based in Heredia. A name for the memory of a woman who <i>lived to die</i>
 and who, like Julio, travelled to a particular hell, from which Julio 
returned to see the end of INBio's Malacology Unit (2003) and the 
beginning of the Institution's decline."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Chavela_Vargas_(2009).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Chavela_Vargas_(2009)_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="86" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Chavela_Vargas_(2009)_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Chavela_Vargas_(2009).jpg 2x" data-file-width="1167" data-file-height="912"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-231" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-231"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>230<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Elysia_jaramilloi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Elysia jaramilloi (page does not exist)">Elysia jaramilloi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ortea, Moro &amp; Bacallado, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_slug" title="Sea slug">Sea slug</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Jaramillo, Julio"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Julio_Jaramillo" title="Julio Jaramillo">Julio Jaramillo</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species native to the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gal%C3%A1pagos_Islands" title="Galápagos Islands">Galápagos Islands</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ecuador" title="Ecuador">Ecuador</a>,
 and named "In honour of the Ecuadorian musician Julio Jaramillo 
(1935–1978), the "Nightingale of America", whose songs accompanied us in
 the multipurpose room of the ships on our expeditions to the Galápagos,
 at first as a misfortune and at the end as a pleasure. In his memory, 
every October 1 is celebrated as the Day of the Ecuadorian <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pasillo" title="Pasillo">Pasillo</a>, a true festival of music, which we would like to join with this dedication to the Ecuadorian Nightingale."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Julio_jaramillo_laurido2.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Julio_jaramillo_laurido2.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="99" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Julio_jaramillo_laurido2_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Julio_jaramillo_laurido2_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="954" data-file-height="862"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-232" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-232"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>231<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Elysia_manriquei&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Elysia manriquei (page does not exist)">Elysia manriquei</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ortea &amp; Moro, 2009</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_slug" title="Sea slug">Sea slug</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Manrique, César"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C%C3%A9sar_Manrique" title="César Manrique">César Manrique</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species native to the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canary_Islands" title="Canary Islands">Canary Islands</a> and named "in honour of César Manrique, illustrious son of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lanzarote" title="Lanzarote">Lanzarote</a>, a pioneer in defending what is now known as <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sustainable_development" title="Sustainable development">sustainable development</a> and an example of the struggle to preserve the harmony of the landscape as one of its elements."</td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-233" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-233"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>232<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Enteromius_mandelai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Enteromius mandelai (page does not exist)">Enteromius mandelai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Kambikambi, Kadye &amp; Chakona, 2021</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">Fish</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Mandela, Nelson"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nelson_Mandela" title="Nelson Mandela">Nelson Mandela</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barb_(fish)" title="Barb (fish)">barb</a> "named after <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Africa" title="South Africa">South Africa</a>'s first democratically elected head of state, President Nelson Rolihlahla Mandela, who was from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eastern_Cape_Province" class="mw-redirect" title="Eastern Cape Province">Eastern Cape Province</a>,
 where this species is endemic. The species is named in honour and 
recognition of his legacy and selfless contribution towards promotion of
 peace, democracy, human rights, equality, social justice and 
sustainable development."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit)_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="130" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit)_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit).jpg 2x" data-file-width="657" data-file-height="778"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-234" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-234"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>233<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Episimus_buarquei&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Episimus buarquei (page does not exist)">Episimus buarquei</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Brito &amp; Vargas, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moth" title="Moth">Moth</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Buarque, Chico"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chico_Buarque" title="Chico Buarque">Chico Buarque</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"named in honor of the Brazilian Francisco Buarque de Hollanda, 
better known as Chico Buarque, for his amazing contribution to the 
development of the '<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M%C3%BAsica_Popular_Brasileira" class="mw-redirect" title="Música Popular Brasileira">Música Popular Brasileira</a>'."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Chico_Buarque_in_2023.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Chico_Buarque_in_2023.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="142" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Chico_Buarque_in_2023_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Chico_Buarque_in_2023_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="749" data-file-height="967"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-235" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-235"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>234<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Eruga_gutfreundi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Eruga gutfreundi (page does not exist)">Eruga gutfreundi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Gauld, 1991</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Gutfreund, John"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Gutfreund" title="John Gutfreund">John Gutfreund</a></span></span></span></td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-BerenbaumBook2000_236-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BerenbaumBook2000-236"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>235<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Etheostoma_clinton" class="mw-redirect" title="Etheostoma clinton">Etheostoma clinton</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Mayden &amp; Layman, 2012</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">Fish</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Clinton, Bill"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bill_Clinton" title="Bill Clinton">Bill Clinton</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>The scientific name of the beaded darter, endemic to the upper <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caddo_River" title="Caddo River">Caddo</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ouachita_River" title="Ouachita River">Ouachita Rivers</a> in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arkansas" title="Arkansas">Arkansas</a>,
 honors Arkansas native Clinton for "his lasting environmental 
accomplishments in creating and expanding national monuments, preserving
 millions of acres of wilderness areas, his leadership and commitment 
during challenging economic times, and his continued commitment to 
global humanitarian issues and needs and peace".</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Bill_Clinton.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bill_Clinton.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="144" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bill_Clinton_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bill_Clinton.jpg.webp 2x" data-file-width="2299" data-file-height="3000"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-LaymanMayden2012_237-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-LaymanMayden2012-237"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>236<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-scientificamerican_238-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-scientificamerican-238"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>237<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Etheostoma_gore" title="Etheostoma gore">Etheostoma gore</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Layman &amp; Mayden, 2012</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">Fish</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Gore, Al"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al_Gore" title="Al Gore">Al Gore</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>The scientific name of the Cumberland darter, endemic to the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cumberland_River" title="Cumberland River">Cumberland River</a> drainage in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kentucky" title="Kentucky">Kentucky</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tennessee" title="Tennessee">Tennessee</a>,
 honors Tennessee native Gore for "his environmental vision, commitment,
 and accomplishments throughout decades of public service and his role 
in educating the public and raising awareness on the issue of global 
climate change".</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Al_Gore_by_JD_Lasica,_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Al_Gore_by_JD_Lasica,_(cropped)_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="157" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Al_Gore_by_JD_Lasica,_(cropped).jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Al_Gore_by_JD_Lasica,_(cropped)_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1545" data-file-height="2200"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-LaymanMayden2012_237-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-LaymanMayden2012-237"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>236<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-scientificamerican_238-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-scientificamerican-238"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>237<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Etheostoma_jimmycarter" class="mw-redirect" title="Etheostoma jimmycarter">Etheostoma jimmycarter</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Layman &amp; Mayden, 2012</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">Fish</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Carter, Jimmy"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jimmy_Carter" title="Jimmy Carter">Jimmy Carter</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>The scientific name of the bluegrass darter, endemic to the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Green_River_(Kentucky)" title="Green River (Kentucky)">Green River (Kentucky)</a>
 drainage, honors Carter for "his environmental leadership and 
accomplishments in the areas of national energy policy and wilderness 
protection, and his lifelong commitment to social justice and basic 
human rights".</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:JimmyCarterPortrait2.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/JimmyCarterPortrait2_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="135" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/JimmyCarterPortrait2_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/JimmyCarterPortrait2.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1650" data-file-height="2027"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-LaymanMayden2012_237-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-LaymanMayden2012-237"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>236<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-scientificamerican_238-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-scientificamerican-238"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>237<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Etmopterus_benchleyi" class="mw-redirect" title="Etmopterus benchleyi">Etmopterus benchleyi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Vásquez et al., 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shark" title="Shark">Shark</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Benchley, Peter"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_Benchley" title="Peter Benchley">Peter Benchley</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The species is named in honor of Peter Benchley, author of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jaws_(novel)" title="Jaws (novel)">Jaws</a>
 and subsequently an avid shark conservationist. His legacy, the 
Benchley Awards, recognizes outstanding achievements in ocean 
conservation. In line with Mr. Benchley's outreach efforts, the 
privilege of deciding a common name for this species was bestowed upon 
four young shark enthusiasts, ages 8 to 14, and relatives of the first 
author (VEV). The suggested common name, the Ninja Lanternshark, refers 
to the uniform black coloration and reduced photophore complement used 
as concealment in this species, somewhat reminiscent of the typical 
outfit and stealthy behavior of a Japanese ninja."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Ninja_lanternshark_Vasquez_et_al_2015.png" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ninja_lanternshark_Vasquez_et_al_2015_002.png" decoding="async" width="110" height="85" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ninja_lanternshark_Vasquez_et_al_2015_003.png 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ninja_lanternshark_Vasquez_et_al_2015.png 2x" data-file-width="720" data-file-height="554"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Jaws_(1974)_back_cover_featuring_a_portrait_photograph_of_Peter_Benchley_by_Alex_Gotfryd,_first_edition.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jaws_(1974)_back_cover_featuring_a_portrait_photograph_o_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="172" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jaws_(1974)_back_cover_featuring_a_portrait_photograph_of_Pe.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jaws_(1974)_back_cover_featuring_a_portrait_photograph_o_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1094" data-file-height="1708"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-239" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-239"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>238<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eubranchus_steinbecki" title="Eubranchus steinbecki">Eubranchus steinbecki</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Behrens, 1987</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nudibranch" title="Nudibranch">Sea slug</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Steinbeck, John"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Steinbeck" title="John Steinbeck">John Steinbeck</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>Named "to give recognition to the author and philosopher John Steinbeck [...], the man who not only influenced the works of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ed_Ricketts" title="Ed Ricketts">Edward "Doc" Ricketts</a>,
 but was himself so greatly influenced by Doc that some have speculated 
that Steinbeck may have joined the ranks of our colleagues had it not 
been for Ricketts['s] untimely death. Together they wrote <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Log_from_the_Sea_of_Cortez" title="The Log from the Sea of Cortez">The Sea of Cortez</a></i> and were near completion of <i>The Outer Shores</i>".</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:JohnSteinbeck_crop.JPG" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-JohnSteinbeck_crop.JPG" decoding="async" width="110" height="149" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-JohnSteinbeck_crop.JPG 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-JohnSteinbeck_crop.JPG 2x" data-file-width="1186" data-file-height="1604"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-240" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-240"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>239<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Eucharis_shajariani&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Eucharis shajariani (page does not exist)">Eucharis shajariani</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Lotfalizadeh &amp; Ghafouri Moghaddam, 2022</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Shajarian, Mohammad-Reza"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mohammad-Reza_Shajarian" title="Mohammad-Reza Shajarian">Mohammad-Reza Shajarian</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parasitoid" title="Parasitoid">parasitoid</a> of ants native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran" title="Iran">Iran</a>, "named in honor of Mohammad-Reza Shajarian (1940–2020), an Iranian vocalist and the greatest maestro of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Persian_classical_music" class="mw-redirect" title="Persian classical music">Persian classical music</a>. He has received several international awards and medals, including <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Golden_Picasso" class="mw-redirect" title="Golden Picasso">Golden Picasso</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UNESCO_Mozart_Medal" title="UNESCO Mozart Medal">UNESCO Mozart</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ordre_national_du_M%C3%A9rite" title="Ordre national du Mérite">National Order of Merit</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grammy" class="mw-redirect" title="Grammy">Grammy</a> [<i>sic</i>; nomination only], <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legion_of_Honour" title="Legion of Honour">French National Order of the Legion of Honor</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aga_Khan_Trust_for_Culture" title="Aga Khan Trust for Culture">Aga Khan Trust for Culture</a> and one of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/50_Great_Voices" title="50 Great Voices">US National Public Radio (NPR) great voices</a>."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Mohamdreza_Shajarian_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Mohamdreza_Shajarian_(cropped)_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="132" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Mohamdreza_Shajarian_(cropped)_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Mohamdreza_Shajarian_(cropped).jpg 2x" data-file-width="281" data-file-height="338"></a></span></td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Eupyrgops_mitoraji&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Eupyrgops mitoraji (page does not exist)">Eupyrgops mitoraji</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Bramanti, Bramanti &amp; Rukmane-Bārbale, 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weevil" title="Weevil">Weevil</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Mitoraj, Igor"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Igor_Mitoraj" title="Igor Mitoraj">Igor Mitoraj</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"in memory of the sculptor Igor Mitoraj (1944–2014), are [<i>sic</i>] genius and nature lover."</td>

<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Europatitan" title="Europatitan">Europatitan eastwoodi</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Torcida Fernández-Baldor <i>et al.</i>, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dinosaur" title="Dinosaur">Dinosaur</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Eastwood, Clint"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clint_Eastwood" title="Clint Eastwood">Clint Eastwood</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sauropod" class="mw-redirect" title="Sauropod">sauropod</a> dinosaur from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cretaceous" title="Cretaceous">Cretaceous</a> of northern <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Castile_and_Le%C3%B3n" title="Castile and León">Castile and León</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spain" title="Spain">Spain</a>, estimated to have been around 27 metres long. <br>"Dedicated to US actor Clint Eastwood, the protagonist of the film <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Good,_the_Bad_and_the_Ugly" title="The Good, the Bad and the Ugly">The Good, the Bad and the Ugly</a></i>, which was partially filmed near <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salas_de_los_Infantes" title="Salas de los Infantes">Salas de los Infantes</a>." (where the fossil remains were found)</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Europatitan.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Europatitan.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="104" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Europatitan_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Europatitan_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="891" data-file-height="844"></a></span></td>

<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Eurotherium_mapplethorpei&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Eurotherium mapplethorpei (page does not exist)">Eurotherium mapplethorpei</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Solé, Morlo, Schaal &amp; Lehmann, 2021</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hyaenodonta" title="Hyaenodonta">Hyaenodont</a> (an extinct order of mammals)</td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Mapplethorpe, Robert"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Mapplethorpe" title="Robert Mapplethorpe">Robert Mapplethorpe</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hyaenodontid" class="mw-redirect" title="Hyaenodontid">hyaenodontid</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eocene" title="Eocene">Eocene</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France" title="France">France</a>.</td>

<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Sole2021_189-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Sole2021-189"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>188<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Euryopis_mallah&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Euryopis mallah (page does not exist)">Euryopis mallah</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Zakerzade, Moradmand &amp; Jäger, 2022</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Mallah, Mahlagha"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mahlagha_Mallah" title="Mahlagha Mallah">Mahlagha Mallah</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cobweb_spider" class="mw-redirect" title="Cobweb spider">cobweb spider</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran" title="Iran">Iran</a>,
 "named in honour of Mahlagha Mallah (1917–2021), an environmental 
activist who was referred to as the "Mother of Iran's Environment". She 
was the founder of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Women%27s_Society_Against_Environmental_Pollution" title="Women's Society Against Environmental Pollution">Women's Society Against Environmental Pollution</a> based in Iran."</td>
<td></td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Eurypon_suassunai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Eurypon suassunai (page does not exist)">Eurypon suassunai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Santos, França &amp; Pinheiro, 2014</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sponge" title="Sponge">Sponge</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Suassuna, Ariano"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ariano_Suassuna" title="Ariano Suassuna">Ariano Suassuna</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species from the Northeastern coast of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil">Brazil</a>, "named in honor of the Late the famous writer Ariano Vilar Suassuna for his defense of the culture of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northeast_Region,_Brazil" title="Northeast Region, Brazil">Brazilian Northeast</a>."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Ariano_Suassuna.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ariano_Suassuna_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="176" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ariano_Suassuna.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Ariano_Suassuna.jpg 2x" data-file-width="552" data-file-height="885"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Eurysyllis_mercuryi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Eurysyllis mercuryi (page does not exist)">Eurysyllis mercuryi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Lucas, San Martín &amp; Parapar, 2012</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polychaete" title="Polychaete">Polychaete worm</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Mercury, Freddie"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freddie_Mercury" title="Freddie Mercury">Freddie Mercury</a></span></span></span></td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Freddie_Mercury_performing_in_New_Haven,_CT,_November_1977.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Freddie_Mercury_performing_in_New_Haven,_CT,_November_1977.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="163" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Freddie_Mercury_performing_in_New_Haven,_CT,_November__003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Freddie_Mercury_performing_in_New_Haven,_CT,_November__002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3534" data-file-height="5244"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-247" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-247"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>246<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Adustonotus_saramagoi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Adustonotus saramagoi (page does not exist)">Euschistus (Mitripus) saramagoi</a></i></span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Bianchi, Cioato &amp; Grazia, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/True_bug" class="mw-redirect" title="True bug">True bug</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Saramago, José"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_Saramago" title="José Saramago">José Saramago</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stink_bug" title="Stink bug">stink bug</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil">Brazil</a>, "Named in honor of José Saramago, for his contribution to literature. This late Portuguese writer, who had received the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobel_Prize_in_Literature" title="Nobel Prize in Literature">Nobel Prize in Literature</a> 1998, was responsible for the spread of prose in Portuguese around the [world]."<br>Subsequently transferred to genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Adustonotus&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Adustonotus (page does not exist)">Adustonotus</a></i>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Cropped_JSJoseSaramago.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Cropped_JSJoseSaramago.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="104" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Cropped_JSJoseSaramago_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Cropped_JSJoseSaramago_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="246" data-file-height="232"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-248" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-248"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>247<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-249" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-249"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>248<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Euschoengastia_gagarini&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Euschoengastia gagarini (page does not exist)">Euschoengastia gagarini</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Brennan, 1962</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mite" title="Mite">Mite</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Gagarin, Yuri"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yuri_Gagarin" title="Yuri Gagarin">Yuri Gagarin</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of four species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trombiculidae" title="Trombiculidae">chiggers</a> named concurrently after the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cosmonauts" class="mw-redirect" title="Cosmonauts">cosmonauts</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Astronauts" class="mw-redirect" title="Astronauts">astronauts</a> who participated in the first four crewed orbital spaceflights in 1961 and 1962 (see also <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Whartonia&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Whartonia (page does not exist)">Whartonia</a></i>). <br>"Named for Maj. Yuri Gagarin, USSR, who made the first orbit of the earth in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vostok_I" class="mw-redirect" title="Vostok I">Vostok I</a>, 12 April 1961."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Yuri_Gagarin_with_awards.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Yuri_Gagarin_with_awards_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="159" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Yuri_Gagarin_with_awards_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Yuri_Gagarin_with_awards.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1334" data-file-height="1927"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Brennan1962_250-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Brennan1962-250"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>249<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Euschoengastia_titovi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Euschoengastia titovi (page does not exist)">Euschoengastia titovi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Brennan, 1962</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mite" title="Mite">Mite</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Titov, Gherman"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gherman_Titov" title="Gherman Titov">Gherman Titov</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of four species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trombiculidae" title="Trombiculidae">chiggers</a> named concurrently after the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cosmonauts" class="mw-redirect" title="Cosmonauts">cosmonauts</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Astronauts" class="mw-redirect" title="Astronauts">astronauts</a> who participated in the first four crewed orbital spaceflights in 1961 and 1962 (see also <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Whartonia&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Whartonia (page does not exist)">Whartonia</a></i>). <br>"Named for Maj. Gherman Titov, USSR, who in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vostok_2" title="Vostok 2">Vostok II</a> made 17 orbits of the earth, 6 August 1961."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Gherman_Titov_(1962).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gherman_Titov_(1962)_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gherman_Titov_(1962).jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gherman_Titov_(1962)_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="220" data-file-height="293"></a></span></td>

American singer and songwriter known for his very theatrical rock 
concerts"</td>
