<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Extraordinarius_klausmeinei&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Extraordinarius klausmeinei (page does not exist)">Extraordinarius klausmeinei</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Rheims, 2019</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Meine, Klaus"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Klaus_Meine" title="Klaus Meine">Klaus Meine</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The specific name honours Klaus Meine, German singer, songwriter, lead singer of the hard rock band <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scorpions_(band)" title="Scorpions (band)">Scorpions</a>."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:AV0A1141_Klaus_Meine.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/AV0A1141_Klaus_Meine.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="165" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/AV0A1141_Klaus_Meine_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-AV0A1141_Klaus_Meine.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3840" data-file-height="5760"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Extraordinarius_253-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Extraordinarius-253"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>252<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exyrias_akihito" title="Exyrias akihito">Exyrias akihito</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gerald_R._Allen" title="Gerald R. Allen">Allen</a> &amp; <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Ernest_Randall" title="John Ernest Randall">Randall</a>, 2005</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">Fish</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Akihito" title="Akihito">Akihito</a></td>
<td>"in honour of the Emperor of Japan, in recognition of his significant contribution to our knowledge of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gobiid" class="mw-redirect" title="Gobiid">gobiid</a> systematics. Many of the type specimens of <i>E. akihito</i> were supplied by the Biological Laboratory of the Imperial Household in Tokyo."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Filamented_goby_(Exyrias_akihito)_(49604797968).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/120px-Filamented_goby_(Exyrias_akihito)_(49604797968).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="82" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/250px-Filamented_goby_(Exyrias_akihito)_(49604797968).jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="4191" data-file-height="3143"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Emperor_Akihito_cropped_1_Barack_Obama_Emperor_Akihito_and_Empress_Michiko_20140424_1.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Emperor_Akihito_cropped_1_Barack_Obama_Emperor_Akihito_and_E.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="137" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Emperor_Akihito_cropped_1_Barack_Obama_Emperor_Akihito_a_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Emperor_Akihito_cropped_1_Barack_Obama_Emperor_Akihito_a_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="996" data-file-height="1242"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-254" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-254"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>253<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr id="F">
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Facelinopsis_pacodelucia" title="Facelinopsis pacodelucia">Facelinopsis pacodelucia</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ortea, Moro &amp; Caballer, 2014</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_slug" title="Sea slug">Sea slug</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="de Lucía, Paco"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paco_de_Luc%C3%ADa" title="Paco de Lucía">Paco de Lucía</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"As a heartfelt tribute to the "master of the guitar", a cultural 
reference of the 20th century, the brilliant Spanish guitarist Paco de 
Lucía, a native of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Algeciras" title="Algeciras">Algeciras</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Province_of_C%C3%A1diz" title="Province of Cádiz">Cádiz</a>, in whose port is located the type locality of this singular species." Another species, found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Playa_del_Carmen" title="Playa del Carmen">Playa del Carmen</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico" title="Mexico">Mexico</a> (where Paco de Lucía died), was concurrently named <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Elysia_entredosaguas&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Elysia entredosaguas (page does not exist)">Elysia entredosaguas</a></i>, after de Lucía's album <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Entre_dos_aguas_(album)" title="Entre dos aguas (album)">Entre dos aguas</a></i>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Paco_de_Luc%C3%ADa_4.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Paco_de_Luc%25C3%25ADa_4_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="83" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Paco_de_Luc%25C3%25ADa_4_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Paco_de_Luc%C3%ADa_4.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1024" data-file-height="768"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-255" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-255"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>254<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Fanteichthys&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Fanteichthys (page does not exist)">Fanteichthys</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Carnevale, 2007</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">Fish</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Fante, John"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Fante" title="John Fante">John Fante</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A genus of fossil <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moridae" title="Moridae">codlings</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miocene" title="Miocene">Miocene</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Torricella_Peligna" title="Torricella Peligna">Torricella Peligna</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italy" title="Italy">Italy</a>. The name honours Italian-American writer John Fante, whose parents came from Torricella Peligna; plus the suffix <i>ichthys</i>, Greek for "fish".</td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Torricella_256-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Torricella-256"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>255<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Filistatinella_kahloae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Filistatinella kahloae (page does not exist)">Filistatinella kahloae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Magalhaes &amp; Ramírez, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Kahlo, Frida"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frida_Kahlo" title="Frida Kahlo">Frida Kahlo</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>This species is native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico" title="Mexico">Mexico</a>.</td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Damselfly" title="Damselfly">Damselfly</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elizabeth_II" title="Elizabeth II">Elizabeth II</a></td>
<td>"I named this species [...] after Her Majesty Elizabeth II the Queen
 of the United Kingdom (b. Elizabeth Alexandra Mary, London 21.iv.1926),
 on the occasion of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Platinum_Jubilee_of_Elizabeth_II" title="Platinum Jubilee of Elizabeth II">platinum jubilee</a>."</td>

<td>One of five species concurrently named in 1997 after people connected to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Beatles" title="The Beatles">The Beatles</a> (See also <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Struszia" title="Struszia">Struszia</a></i>).</td>

<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Frippia&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Frippia (page does not exist)">Frippia</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Bannikov &amp; Carnevale, 2012</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">Fish</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Fripp, Robert"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Fripp" title="Robert Fripp">Robert Fripp</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil genus of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Percoidei" title="Percoidei">percoid</a> fish from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eocene" title="Eocene">Eocene</a> deposits of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monte_Bolca" title="Monte Bolca">Monte Bolca</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italy" title="Italy">Italy</a>.<br>"It
 is our pleasure to name this genus after the British musician and 
composer Robert Fripp in recognition of his outstanding musical and 
cultural work."</td>

Dalí (1904–1989), whose peculiar moustache resembles the shape of the

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Galapa_gabito&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Galapa gabito (page does not exist)">Galapa gabito</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Huber, 2024</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="García Márquez, Gabriel"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gabriel_Garc%C3%ADa_M%C3%A1rquez" title="Gabriel García Márquez">Gabriel García Márquez</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>This species is native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colombia" title="Colombia">Colombia</a>,
 and its name "honors the Colombian novelist Gabriel García Márquez 
(1927–2014), considered one of the most significant authors of the 20th 
century and known affectionately as Gabo or Gabito in Latin America."</td>
<td></td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ganaspidium_didionae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ganaspidium didionae (page does not exist)">Ganaspidium didionae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Buffington, 2010</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>

<td>The wasp's range includes deserts of the American Southwest, setting of several of Didion's works.</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ganaspidium_flemingi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ganaspidium flemingi (page does not exist)">Ganaspidium flemingi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Buffington, 2010</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Fleming, Ian"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ian_Fleming" title="Ian Fleming">Ian Fleming</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>The <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Holotype" title="Holotype">holotype</a> was collected in the Bahamas, where Fleming was a "long time resident".</td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Garjainia_madiba" class="mw-redirect" title="Garjainia madiba">Garjainia madiba</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Gower <i>et al.</i>, 2014</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Archosaur" title="Archosaur">Archosaur</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Mandela, Nelson"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nelson_Mandela" title="Nelson Mandela">Nelson Mandela</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erythrosuchid" class="mw-redirect" title="Erythrosuchid">erythrosuchid</a> reptile from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Triassic" title="Triassic">Triassic</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Africa" title="South Africa">South Africa</a>,
 "named in honour of Nelson Mandela (1918–2013), the first fully 
representatively democratically elected president of South Africa 
(1994–1999). Mr Mandela was known affectionately as "Madiba"."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Garjainia_madiba.png" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Garjainia_madiba.png" decoding="async" width="110" height="62" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Garjainia_madiba_002.png 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Garjainia_madiba.png 2x" data-file-width="1992" data-file-height="1120"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gehyra_leopoldi" class="mw-redirect" title="Gehyra leopoldi">Gehyra leopoldi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Brongersma, 1930</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lizard" title="Lizard">Lizard</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leopold_III_of_Belgium" title="Leopold III of Belgium">Leopold III of Belgium</a></td>
<td></td>

<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-EponymRept_267-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-EponymRept-267"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>266<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Genlisea_hawkingii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Genlisea hawkingii (page does not exist)">Genlisea hawkingii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Silva, Płachno, Carvalho &amp; Miranda, 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flowering_plant" title="Flowering plant">Flowering plant</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Hawking, Stephen"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stephen_Hawking" title="Stephen Hawking">Stephen Hawking</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carnivorous_plant" title="Carnivorous plant">carnivorous plant</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil">Brazil</a>
 named "as homage to the great English theoretical physicist and 
cosmologist, Stephen William Hawking, who died on March 14, 2018. We 
were impressed with his life's trajectory and his outstanding 
discoveries in cosmology. He became a signpost not only for other 
scientists but for all people."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Stephen_Hawking.StarChild.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Stephen_Hawking.StarChild.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="158" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Stephen_Hawking.StarChild_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Stephen_Hawking.StarChild_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="250" data-file-height="359"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-268" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-268"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>267<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Geophagus_harreri&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Geophagus harreri (page does not exist)">Geophagus harreri</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jean-Pierre_Gosse" title="Jean-Pierre Gosse">Gosse</a>, 1976</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">Fish</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Harrer, Heinrich"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heinrich_Harrer" title="Heinrich Harrer">Heinrich Harrer</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"This new species is cordially dedicated to Professor H. Harrer from
 Kitzbühel, in gratitude for his help during ichthyological missions, 
among others in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suriname" title="Suriname">Surinam</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/French_Guiana" title="French Guiana">French Guiana</a> where this species was collected."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Harrer_Frankfurt_1997.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Harrer_Frankfurt_1997_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="135" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Harrer_Frankfurt_1997.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Harrer_Frankfurt_1997.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1949" data-file-height="2394"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-269" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-269"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>268<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Gibbacousteau_jacquesi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Gibbacousteau jacquesi (page does not exist)">Gibbacousteau jacquesi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Espinosa &amp; Ortea, 2013</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_snail" title="Sea snail">Sea snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Cousteau, Jacques"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jacques_Cousteau" title="Jacques Cousteau">Jacques Cousteau</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"Named in honour of Commander Jacques-Yves Cousteau, pioneer 
explorer of the marine environment, to whom we owe the perpetual opening
 of the frontier between sea and land. [...] [W]e baptise this species 
in homage to the man who [...] almost 50 years ago, started the 
Precontinente III experiment, where six oceananauts lived together for 
30 days at a depth of 100 m."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Gibbacousteau_jacquesi_(MNHN-IM-2000-26966).jpeg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gibbacousteau_jacquesi_(MNHN-IM-2000-26966)_002.jpeg" decoding="async" width="110" height="77" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gibbacousteau_jacquesi_(MNHN-IM-2000-26966).jpeg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Gibbacousteau_jacquesi_(MNHN-IM-2000-26966).jpeg 2x" data-file-width="7374" data-file-height="5181"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Cousteau1972_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Cousteau1972_(cropped).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="154" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Cousteau1972_(cropped).jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Cousteau1972_(cropped).jpg 2x" data-file-width="755" data-file-height="1060"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-270" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-270"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>269<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibberula_atwoodae" title="Gibberula atwoodae">Gibberula atwoodae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ortea, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_snail" title="Sea snail">Sea snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Atwood, Margaret"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Margaret_Atwood" title="Margaret Atwood">Margaret Atwood</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of 21 sea snails of the genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibberula" title="Gibberula">Gibberula</a></i> concurrently named after female winners of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_of_Asturias_Awards" class="mw-redirect" title="Prince of Asturias Awards">Prince of Asturias Awards</a> (see also <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_organisms_named_after_famous_people_(born_1950%E2%80%93present)" title="List of organisms named after famous people (born 1950–present)">List of organisms named after famous people (born 1950–present)</a>).<sup id="cite_ref-271" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-271"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>note 2<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>. <br>"Named
 in honour of Margaret Atwood (Ottawa, Canada, 1939), winner of the 2008
 Prince of Asturias Award for Literature, prolific poet, novelist, 
literary critic and political activist, with a prominent role in 
organisations such as <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amnesty_International" title="Amnesty International">Amnesty International</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BirdLife_International" title="BirdLife International">BirdLife International</a>, of which she is Honorary President. <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Handmaid%27s_Tale" title="The Handmaid's Tale">The Handmaid's Tale</a></i> (1985) is her most acclaimed work."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Gibberula_atwoodae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31653).jpeg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gibberula_atwoodae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31653)_002.jpeg" decoding="async" width="110" height="77" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gibberula_atwoodae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31653).jpeg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Gibberula_atwoodae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31653).jpeg 2x" data-file-width="6496" data-file-height="4548"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Margaret_Atwood_2015.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Margaret_Atwood_2015_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="165" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Margaret_Atwood_2015.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Margaret_Atwood_2015_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="727" data-file-height="1091"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-GibberulaAsturias_272-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GibberulaAsturias-272"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>270<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibberula_delarrochae" title="Gibberula delarrochae">Gibberula delarrochae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ortea, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_snail" title="Sea snail">Sea snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="de Larrocha, Alicia"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alicia_de_Larrocha" title="Alicia de Larrocha">Alicia de Larrocha</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of 21 sea snails of the genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibberula" title="Gibberula">Gibberula</a></i> concurrently named after female winners of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_of_Asturias_Awards" class="mw-redirect" title="Prince of Asturias Awards">Prince of Asturias Awards</a>. <br>"Named
 in honour of pianist Alicia de Larrocha (Barcelona, Spain, 1923–2009), 
winner of the 1994 Prince of Asturias Award for the Arts, renowned for 
her masterly interpretations of works by Spanish composers such as <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manuel_de_Falla" title="Manuel de Falla">Manuel de Falla</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Isaac_Alb%C3%A9niz" title="Isaac Albéniz">Isaac Albéniz</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enrique_Granados" title="Enrique Granados">Enrique Granados</a>."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Gibberula_delarrochae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31643).jpeg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gibberula_delarrochae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31643)_002.jpeg" decoding="async" width="110" height="77" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gibberula_delarrochae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31643).jpeg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Gibberula_delarrochae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31643).jpeg 2x" data-file-width="5906" data-file-height="4134"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Al%C3%ADcia_de_Larrocha_i_de_la_Calle_(1983).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Al%C3%ADcia_de_Larrocha_i_de_la_Calle_(1983).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="162" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Al%25C3%25ADcia_de_Larrocha_i_de_la_Calle_(1983)_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Al%25C3%25ADcia_de_Larrocha_i_de_la_Calle_(1983)_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1060" data-file-height="1564"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-GibberulaAsturias_272-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GibberulaAsturias-272"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>270<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibberula_hendricksae" title="Gibberula hendricksae">Gibberula hendricksae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ortea, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_snail" title="Sea snail">Sea snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Hendricks, Barbara"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barbara_Hendricks" title="Barbara Hendricks">Barbara Hendricks</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of 21 sea snails of the genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibberula" title="Gibberula">Gibberula</a></i> concurrently named after female winners of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_of_Asturias_Awards" class="mw-redirect" title="Prince of Asturias Awards">Prince of Asturias Awards</a>. <br>"Named
 in honour of opera singer Barbara Hendricks (Arkansas, USA, 1948 – 
Sweden), winner of the Prince of Asturias Award for the Arts in 2000, 
honorary ambassador for life of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UNHCR" class="mw-redirect" title="UNHCR">UNHCR</a>, with which she collaborated for 15 years in support of refugees; she was distinguished by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fran%C3%A7ois_Mitterrand" title="François Mitterrand">François Mitterrand</a> in 1992 with the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legion_of_Honour" title="Legion of Honour">Legion of Honour</a> of the French Republic."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Gibberula_hendricksae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31647).jpeg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gibberula_hendricksae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31647).jpeg" decoding="async" width="110" height="77" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gibberula_hendricksae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31647)_002.jpeg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gibberula_hendricksae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31647)_003.jpeg 2x" data-file-width="6201" data-file-height="4340"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Barbara_Hendricks_par_Claude_Truong-Ngoc_mars_2016.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Barbara_Hendricks_par_Claude_Truong-Ngoc_mars_2016_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="165" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Barbara_Hendricks_par_Claude_Truong-Ngoc_mars_2016_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Barbara_Hendricks_par_Claude_Truong-Ngoc_mars_2016.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3759" data-file-height="5639"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-GibberulaAsturias_272-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GibberulaAsturias-272"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>270<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibberula_leibovitzae" title="Gibberula leibovitzae">Gibberula leibovitzae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ortea, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_snail" title="Sea snail">Sea snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Leibovitz, Annie"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annie_Leibovitz" title="Annie Leibovitz">Annie Leibovitz</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of 21 sea snails of the genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibberula" title="Gibberula">Gibberula</a></i> concurrently named after female winners of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_of_Asturias_Awards" class="mw-redirect" title="Prince of Asturias Awards">Prince of Asturias Awards</a>. <br>"Named
 in honour of American photographer Anna Lou Leibovitz (Waterbury, 
1949), winner of the 2013 Prince of Asturias Award for Communication and
 Humanities, known mainly for her portraits of celebrities, she was the 
first woman to have her work exhibited at the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Portrait_Gallery_(United_States)" title="National Portrait Gallery (United States)">National Portrait Gallery</a> in Washington DC."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Gibberula_leibovitzae_(MNHN-IM-2009-31075).jpeg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gibberula_leibovitzae_(MNHN-IM-2009-31075).jpeg" decoding="async" width="110" height="77" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gibberula_leibovitzae_(MNHN-IM-2009-31075)_002.jpeg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Gibberula_leibovitzae_(MNHN-IM-2009-31075).jpeg 2x" data-file-width="8386" data-file-height="5870"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Annie_Leibovitz-SF-1-Crop.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Annie_Leibovitz-SF-1-Crop.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Annie_Leibovitz-SF-1-Crop_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Annie_Leibovitz-SF-1-Crop_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="942" data-file-height="1256"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-GibberulaAsturias_272-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GibberulaAsturias-272"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>270<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibberula_lessingae" title="Gibberula lessingae">Gibberula lessingae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ortea, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_snail" title="Sea snail">Sea snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Lessing, Doris"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doris_Lessing" title="Doris Lessing">Doris Lessing</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of 21 sea snails of the genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibberula" title="Gibberula">Gibberula</a></i> concurrently named after female winners of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_of_Asturias_Awards" class="mw-redirect" title="Prince of Asturias Awards">Prince of Asturias Awards</a>. <br>"Named
 in honour of British writer Doris Lessing (Kermanshah, Iran 1919 – 
London, 2013), winner of the 2001 Prince of Asturias Award for 
Literature; author of works such as the <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Children_of_Violence" title="Children of Violence">Children of Violence</a></i> series and <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Golden_Notebook" title="The Golden Notebook">The Golden Notebook</a></i>, considered the Bible of feminism, she was awarded the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobel_Prize_for_Literature" class="mw-redirect" title="Nobel Prize for Literature">Nobel Prize for Literature</a> in 2007."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Gibberula_lessingae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31648).jpeg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gibberula_lessingae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31648)_002.jpeg" decoding="async" width="110" height="77" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gibberula_lessingae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31648).jpeg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Gibberula_lessingae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31648).jpeg 2x" data-file-width="6378" data-file-height="4465"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Doris_Lessing_3.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Doris_Lessing_3_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="138" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Doris_Lessing_3.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Doris_Lessing_3.jpg 2x" data-file-width="592" data-file-height="740"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-GibberulaAsturias_272-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GibberulaAsturias-272"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>270<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibberula_martingaiteae" title="Gibberula martingaiteae">Gibberula martingaiteae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ortea, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_snail" title="Sea snail">Sea snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Martín Gaite, Carmen"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carmen_Mart%C3%ADn_Gaite" title="Carmen Martín Gaite">Carmen Martín Gaite</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of 21 sea snails of the genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibberula" title="Gibberula">Gibberula</a></i> concurrently named after female winners of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_of_Asturias_Awards" class="mw-redirect" title="Prince of Asturias Awards">Prince of Asturias Awards</a>. <br>"Named
 in honour of writer Carmen Martín Gaite (Salamanca, Spain, 1925–2000), 
winner of the 1988 Prince of Asturias Award for Literature, shared with 
Galician poet José Ángel Valente (1929–2000); she was the first woman to
 win the Spanish National Literature Prize (1978) for <i>El cuarto de atrás</i> and received the National Literature Prize in 1994 [again] for her work as a whole."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Carmen_Mart%C3%ADn_Gaite.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Carmen_Mart%25C3%25ADn_Gaite_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="151" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Carmen_Mart%C3%ADn_Gaite.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Carmen_Mart%25C3%25ADn_Gaite_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2620" data-file-height="3592"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-GibberulaAsturias_272-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GibberulaAsturias-272"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>270<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibberula_nussbaumae" title="Gibberula nussbaumae">Gibberula nussbaumae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ortea, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_snail" title="Sea snail">Sea snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Nussbaum, Martha"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martha_Nussbaum" title="Martha Nussbaum">Martha Nussbaum</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of 21 sea snails of the genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibberula" title="Gibberula">Gibberula</a></i> concurrently named after female winners of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_of_Asturias_Awards" class="mw-redirect" title="Prince of Asturias Awards">Prince of Asturias Awards</a>. <br>"Named
 in honour of American philosopher Martha C. Nussbaum (New York, 1947), 
distinguished in 2012 with the Prince of Asturias Award for Social 
Sciences, for making philosophy a more solid, more humane and less 
moribund activity than in previous decades, thanks to works such as <i>Hiding from Humanity: Disgust, Shame, and the Law</i>, where she makes a profound study of emotions."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Gibberula_nussbaumae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31657).jpeg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gibberula_nussbaumae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31657)_002.jpeg" decoding="async" width="110" height="77" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gibberula_nussbaumae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31657).jpeg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Gibberula_nussbaumae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31657).jpeg 2x" data-file-width="6555" data-file-height="4590"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Martha_Nussbaum_2010_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Martha_Nussbaum_2010_(cropped).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Martha_Nussbaum_2010_(cropped)_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Martha_Nussbaum_2010_(cropped)_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="797" data-file-height="1063"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-GibberulaAsturias_272-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GibberulaAsturias-272"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>270<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibberula_pignonae" title="Gibberula pignonae">Gibberula pignonae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ortea, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_snail" title="Sea snail">Sea snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Piñon, Nélida"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/N%C3%A9lida_Pi%C3%B1on" title="Nélida Piñon">Nélida Piñon</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of 21 sea snails of the genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibberula" title="Gibberula">Gibberula</a></i> concurrently named after female winners of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_of_Asturias_Awards" class="mw-redirect" title="Prince of Asturias Awards">Prince of Asturias Awards</a>. <br>"Named
 in honour of Nélida Piñón (Vila Isabel, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, 1937), 
laureate of the 2005 Prince of Asturias Award for Literature; a staunch 
defender of human rights and author of works such as <i>A república dos sonhos</i> (1984), <i>O pão de cada dia</i> (1996) and <i>Vozes do deserto</i> (2004), written with an exciting artistic narrative, based on reality, memory, fantasy and dreams."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Gibberula_pignonae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31649).jpeg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gibberula_pignonae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31649).jpeg" decoding="async" width="110" height="77" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gibberula_pignonae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31649)_003.jpeg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gibberula_pignonae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31649)_002.jpeg 2x" data-file-width="4961" data-file-height="3473"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:N%C3%A9lida_Pinon,_sem_data.tif" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/N%25C3%25A9lida_Pinon,_sem_data.tif_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="149" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/N%C3%A9lida_Pinon,_sem_data.tif.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/lossy-page1-220px-N%C3%A9lida_Pinon,_sem_data.tif.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2075" data-file-height="2809"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-GibberulaAsturias_272-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GibberulaAsturias-272"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>270<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibberula_robinsonae" title="Gibberula robinsonae">Gibberula robinsonae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ortea, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_snail" title="Sea snail">Sea snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Robinson, Mary"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mary_Robinson" title="Mary Robinson">Mary Robinson</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of 21 sea snails of the genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibberula" title="Gibberula">Gibberula</a></i> concurrently named after female winners of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_of_Asturias_Awards" class="mw-redirect" title="Prince of Asturias Awards">Prince of Asturias Awards</a>. <br>"Named
 in honour of Mary Robinson (Ballina, Ireland, 1927), winner of the 2006
 Prince of Asturias Award for Social Sciences, she was the first woman 
to become <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_Republic_of_Ireland" class="mw-redirect" title="President of the Republic of Ireland">President of the Republic of Ireland</a> (1990–1997), later becoming <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UN_High_Commissioner_for_Human_Rights" class="mw-redirect" title="UN High Commissioner for Human Rights">UN High Commissioner for Human Rights</a> (1997–2002). She holds honorary doctorates from 31 universities around the world."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Gibberula_robinsonae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31652).jpeg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gibberula_robinsonae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31652)_002.jpeg" decoding="async" width="110" height="77" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gibberula_robinsonae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31652)_003.jpeg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gibberula_robinsonae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31652).jpeg 2x" data-file-width="5256" data-file-height="3679"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Mary_Robinson_World_Economic_Forum_2013_crop.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Mary_Robinson_World_Economic_Forum_2013_crop.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="152" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Mary_Robinson_World_Economic_Forum_2013_crop_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Mary_Robinson_World_Economic_Forum_2013_crop.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2952" data-file-height="4088"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-GibberulaAsturias_272-8" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GibberulaAsturias-272"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>270<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Gibberula_sasakawai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Gibberula sasakawai (page does not exist)">Gibberula sasakawai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ortea &amp; Moro, 2024</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_snail" title="Sea snail">Sea snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Sasakawa, Yōhei"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Y%C5%8Dhei_Sasakawa" title="Yōhei Sasakawa">Yōhei Sasakawa</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>Its name "pays tribute to the illustrious Yōhei Sasakawa, president of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nippon_Foundation" title="Nippon Foundation">Nippon Foundation</a>, in recognition of his outstanding contribution to the Ocean Census program and his tireless support of marine research."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Yohei_Sasakawa_(2015).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Yohei_Sasakawa_(2015).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="132" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Yohei_Sasakawa_(2015)_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Yohei_Sasakawa_(2015).jpg 2x" data-file-width="651" data-file-height="780"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibberula_sassenae" title="Gibberula sassenae">Gibberula sassenae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ortea, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_snail" title="Sea snail">Sea snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Sassen, Saskia"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saskia_Sassen" title="Saskia Sassen">Saskia Sassen</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of 21 sea snails of the genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibberula" title="Gibberula">Gibberula</a></i> concurrently named after female winners of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_of_Asturias_Awards" class="mw-redirect" title="Prince of Asturias Awards">Prince of Asturias Awards</a>. <br>"Named
 in honour of Dutch sociologist Saskia Sassen (The Hague, 1949), 
distinguished in 2013 with the Prince of Asturias Award for Social 
Sciences for her contributions to the understanding of the phenomenon of
 globalisation and urban sociology with publications such as <i>The Global City</i> (1991)."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Gibberula_sassenae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31658).jpeg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gibberula_sassenae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31658).jpeg" decoding="async" width="110" height="77" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gibberula_sassenae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31658)_002.jpeg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Gibberula_sassenae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31658).jpeg 2x" data-file-width="5492" data-file-height="3845"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Saskia_Sassen_2012.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Saskia_Sassen_2012.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="116" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Saskia_Sassen_2012_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Saskia_Sassen_2012.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2229" data-file-height="2343"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-GibberulaAsturias_272-9" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GibberulaAsturias-272"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>270<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibberula_veilae" title="Gibberula veilae">Gibberula veilae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ortea, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_snail" title="Sea snail">Sea snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Veil, Simone"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simone_Veil" title="Simone Veil">Simone Veil</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of 21 sea snails of the genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibberula" title="Gibberula">Gibberula</a></i> concurrently named after female winners of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_of_Asturias_Awards" class="mw-redirect" title="Prince of Asturias Awards">Prince of Asturias Awards</a>. <br>"Named
 in honour of French politician Simone Veil (Nice, 1927), winner of the 
2005 Prince of Asturias Award for International Cooperation, for 
embodying the ideals and achievements of a united Europe. <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_European_Parliament" title="President of the European Parliament">President of the European Parliament</a> from 1979 to 1982, her honours include Grand Officer of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legion_of_Honour" title="Legion of Honour">Legion of Honour</a> (France) and the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlemagne_Prize" title="Charlemagne Prize">Charlemagne Prize</a> (Germany, 1981)."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Gibberula_veilae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31650).jpeg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gibberula_veilae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31650)_002.jpeg" decoding="async" width="110" height="77" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gibberula_veilae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31650).jpeg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Gibberula_veilae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31650).jpeg 2x" data-file-width="8150" data-file-height="5705"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Simone_Veil,_gymnase_Japy_2008_02_27_n3_ret.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Simone_Veil,_gymnase_Japy_2008_02_27_n3_ret.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="129" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Simone_Veil,_gymnase_Japy_2008_02_27_n3_ret_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Simone_Veil,_gymnase_Japy_2008_02_27_n3_ret_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1882" data-file-height="2200"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-GibberulaAsturias_272-10" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GibberulaAsturias-272"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>270<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibberula_zambranoae" title="Gibberula zambranoae">Gibberula zambranoae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ortea, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_snail" title="Sea snail">Sea snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Zambrano, María"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mar%C3%ADa_Zambrano" title="María Zambrano">María Zambrano</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of 21 sea snails of the genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibberula" title="Gibberula">Gibberula</a></i> concurrently named after female winners of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_of_Asturias_Awards" class="mw-redirect" title="Prince of Asturias Awards">Prince of Asturias Awards</a>. <br>"Named
 in honour of philosopher María Zambrano (Vélez-Málaga, Spain, 
1904–1991), exile and neighbour of Calzada, Havana, between 1948 and 
1953 [where the zoologist who named this species had established his 
base of operations], winner of the 1981 Prince of Asturias Award for 
Communication and Humanities, author of works such as <i>Claros del bosque</i> or <i>De la aurora</i>, where her philosophical proposal takes on a mystical air."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Gibberula_zambranoae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31642).jpeg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gibberula_zambranoae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31642).jpeg" decoding="async" width="110" height="77" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gibberula_zambranoae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31642)_002.jpeg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Gibberula_zambranoae_(MNHN-IM-2000-31642).jpeg 2x" data-file-width="7087" data-file-height="4961"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Mar%C3%ADa_Zambrano_ca._1918.JPG" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Mar%25C3%25ADa_Zambrano_ca._1918_002.JPG" decoding="async" width="110" height="138" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Mar%25C3%25ADa_Zambrano_ca._1918_003.JPG 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Mar%C3%ADa_Zambrano_ca._1918.JPG 2x" data-file-width="1360" data-file-height="1701"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-GibberulaAsturias_272-11" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GibberulaAsturias-272"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>270<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Gladiatoria_harrisi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Gladiatoria harrisi (page does not exist)">Gladiatoria harrisi</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Adrain, McAdams &amp; Westrop 2011</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trilobite" title="Trilobite">Trilobite</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Harris, Richard"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Harris" title="Richard Harris">Richard Harris</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of five trilobites of the genus <i>Gladiatoria</i> concurrently named after cast members of the 2000 film <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gladiator_(2000_film)" title="Gladiator (2000 film)">Gladiator</a></i> (see also <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_organisms_named_after_famous_people_(born_1950%E2%80%93present)" title="List of organisms named after famous people (born 1950–present)">List of organisms named after famous people (born 1950–present)</a>).</td>
<td></td>

<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Gladiat_274-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Gladiat-274"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>272<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Gladiatoria_reedi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Gladiatoria reedi (page does not exist)">Gladiatoria reedi</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Adrain, McAdams &amp; Westrop 2011</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trilobite" title="Trilobite">Trilobite</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Reed, Oliver"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oliver_Reed" title="Oliver Reed">Oliver Reed</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of five trilobites of the genus <i>Gladiatoria</i> concurrently named after cast members of the 2000 film <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gladiator_(2000_film)" title="Gladiator (2000 film)">Gladiator</a></i>.</td>
<td></td>

<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glycera_sheikhmujibi" title="Glycera sheikhmujibi">Glycera sheikhmujibi</a></i></span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Hossain &amp; Hutchings, 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polychaete_worm" class="mw-redirect" title="Polychaete worm">Polychaete worm</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Rahman, Sheikh Mujibur"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sheikh_Mujibur_Rahman" title="Sheikh Mujibur Rahman">Sheikh Mujibur Rahman</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A marine bloodworm endemic to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bangladesh" title="Bangladesh">Bangladesh</a>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Sheikh_Mujibur_Rahman_in_1950.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Sheikh_Mujibur_Rahman_in_1950_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="162" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Sheikh_Mujibur_Rahman_in_1950_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Sheikh_Mujibur_Rahman_in_1950.jpg 2x" data-file-width="598" data-file-height="880"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-275" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-275"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>273<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gnathia_jimmybuffetti" title="Gnathia jimmybuffetti">Gnathia jimmybuffetti</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Erasmus, Hadfield, Sikkel &amp; Smit, 2023</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crustacean" title="Crustacean">Crustacean</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Buffett, Jimmy"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jimmy_Buffett" title="Jimmy Buffett">Jimmy Buffett</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Isopoda" title="Isopoda">isopod</a> native to the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Florida_Keys" title="Florida Keys">Florida Keys</a>.
 Sikkel and his team are long-time fans of Jimmy Buffett's music, which 
is very associated with the Florida Keys, so they decided to name the 
new species after the musician. Buffett died only two months after the 
publication of the paper.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Jimmy_Buffett_on_USS_Harry_S_Truman_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jimmy_Buffett_on_USS_Harry_S_Truman_(cropped).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="152" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jimmy_Buffett_on_USS_Harry_S_Truman_(cropped)_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jimmy_Buffett_on_USS_Harry_S_Truman_(cropped)_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1036" data-file-height="1433"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-276" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-276"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>274<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-:0_277-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-:0-277"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>275<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gnathia_marleyi" title="Gnathia marleyi">Gnathia marleyi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Farquharson, Smit &amp; Sikkel, 2012</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crustacean" title="Crustacean">Crustacean</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Marley, Bob"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_Marley" title="Bob Marley">Bob Marley</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"named for the famous Caribbean singer, Bob Marley, as this species is as uniquely Caribbean as Bob Marley."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Gnathia_marleyi_-_female_with_eggs.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gnathia_marleyi_-_female_with_eggs.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="108" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gnathia_marleyi_-_female_with_eggs_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gnathia_marleyi_-_female_with_eggs_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1704" data-file-height="1667"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Bob-Marley.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bob-Marley_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="164" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bob-Marley_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bob-Marley.jpg 2x" data-file-width="500" data-file-height="744"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-278" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-278"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>276<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-279" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-279"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>277<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Godartiana_amadoi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Godartiana amadoi (page does not exist)">Godartiana amadoi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Paluch, Zacca &amp; Freitas, 2016</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Butterfly" title="Butterfly">Butterfly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Amado, Jorge"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jorge_Amado" title="Jorge Amado">Jorge Amado</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northeast_Region,_Brazil" title="Northeast Region, Brazil">Northeastern Brazil</a>,
 named "in honour of the famous Brazilian writer, Jorge Leal Amado de 
Faria, known as Jorge Amado [...]. Jorge Amado was born in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Itabuna" title="Itabuna">Itabuna</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bahia" title="Bahia">Bahia</a>, Brazil, and occupied a chair of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazilian_Academy_of_Letters" class="mw-redirect" title="Brazilian Academy of Letters">Brazilian Academy of Letters</a> from 1961 to 2001. He wrote more than 30 books, being best known worldwide by his notable books, <i>Gabriela, cravo e canela</i> [English title: <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gabriela,_Clove_and_Cinnamon" title="Gabriela, Clove and Cinnamon">Gabriela, Clove and Cinnamon</a></i>], <i>Capitães de Areia</i> [<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captains_of_the_Sands" title="Captains of the Sands">Captains of the Sands</a></i>] and <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tieta" title="Tieta">Tieta</a></i>.
 Furthermore, Jorge Amado also made a great contribution to cultural and
 social development through the establishment of the 'House of Jorge 
Amado Foundation' in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salvador,_Bahia" title="Salvador, Bahia">Salvador, Bahia</a>."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Jorge_Amado,_Headshot_2,_1988_(cropped).png" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jorge_Amado,_Headshot_2,_1988_(cropped)_003.png" decoding="async" width="110" height="163" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jorge_Amado,_Headshot_2,_1988_(cropped)_002.png 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jorge_Amado,_Headshot_2,_1988_(cropped).png 2x" data-file-width="2843" data-file-height="4208"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-280" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-280"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>278<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gorbiscape" title="Gorbiscape">Gorbiscape gorbachevi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alireza_Zamani" title="Alireza Zamani">Zamani</a> &amp; <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yuri_M._Marusik" title="Yuri M. Marusik">Marusik</a>, 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Gorbachev, Mikhail"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mikhail_Gorbachev" title="Mikhail Gorbachev">Mikhail Gorbachev</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"named after Mikhail S. Gorbachev, the first [<i>sic</i>] and last president of the Soviet Union, on the occasion of his 89th birthday (02 March 2020)."</td>

<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Gorbachev_(cropped).png" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gorbachev_(cropped)_002.png" decoding="async" width="110" height="143" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gorbachev_(cropped)_003.png 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gorbachev_(cropped).png 2x" data-file-width="894" data-file-height="1160"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Gravicalymene_bakeri&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Gravicalymene bakeri (page does not exist)">Gravicalymene bakeri</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Smith &amp; Ebach, 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trilobite" title="Trilobite">Trilobite</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Baker, Tom"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom_Baker" title="Tom Baker">Tom Baker</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"After Thomas Stewart Baker, the fourth actor to play the title character in the television series <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doctor_Who" title="Doctor Who">Doctor Who</a></i>, for inspiring the [...] authors to develop careers in science."</td>

<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Tom_Baker.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Tom_Baker.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="110" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Tom_Baker_002.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="3583" data-file-height="3583"></a></span></td>

<tr id="H">
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Hantzschia_beksinskii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Hantzschia beksinskii (page does not exist)">Hantzschia beksinskii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">M.Rybak, Kochman-Kędziora</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diatom" title="Diatom">Diatom</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Beksiński, Zdzisław"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zdzis%C5%82aw_Beksi%C5%84ski" title="Zdzisław Beksiński">Zdzisław Beksiński</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Banda_Islands" title="Banda Islands">Banda Islands</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indonesia" title="Indonesia">Indonesia</a>, described by scientists from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University_of_Rzesz%C3%B3w" title="University of Rzeszów">University of Rzeszów</a>.</td>
<td></td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Magnacarina_aldana&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Magnacarina aldana (page does not exist)">Hapalopus aldanus</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">West, 2000</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Alda, Alan"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alan_Alda" title="Alan Alda">Alan Alda</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"in honor of Mr. Alan Alda for conveying his interest in the natural sciences to the public as host of the television show <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scientific_American_Frontiers" title="Scientific American Frontiers">Scientific American Frontiers</a></i>."<br>Subsequently transferred to genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magnacarina" title="Magnacarina">Magnacarina</a></i>.</td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hapalotremus_chespiritoi" title="Hapalotremus chespiritoi">Hapalotremus chespiritoi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ferretti <i>et al.</i>, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chespirito" title="Chespirito">Chespirito</a></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peru" title="Peru">Peruvian</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tarantula" title="Tarantula">tarantula</a>
 named "in honour of Roberto Gómez Bolaños (1929–2014), commonly known 
by his pseudonym "Chespirito". He was [...] widely regarded as one of 
the most important Spanish-language humorists of the twentieth century. 
Curiously, the shape of the spermatheca of [the] female of <i>H. chespiritoi</i> sp. nov. resembles the small vinyl antennae of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/El_Chapul%C3%ADn_Colorado" title="El Chapulín Colorado">'Chapulín Colorado'</a>, a comical and bungling superhero created by R.G. Bolaños."</td>
<td></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Harryhausenia&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Harryhausenia (page does not exist)">Harryhausenia</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Boyko, 2004</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crustacean" title="Crustacean">Crustacean</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Harryhausen, Ray"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ray_Harryhausen" title="Ray Harryhausen">Ray Harryhausen</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A genus of fossil crabs from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oligocene" title="Oligocene">Oligocene</a> of Italy. <br>"Named
 for the great dynamator of fantasy film, Ray Harryhausen, in 
recognition of his long career during which he brought the imaginary to 
life on the screen."</td>
