<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Heckethornia_290-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Heckethornia-290"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>288<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Hedyotis_papafranciscoi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Hedyotis papafranciscoi (page does not exist)">Hedyotis papafranciscoi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Alejandro</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flowering_plant" title="Flowering plant">Flowering plant</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Francis, Pope"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pope_Francis" title="Pope Francis">Pope Francis</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>This species from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippines" title="Philippines">Philippines</a> was discovered by researchers of the Catholic <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University_of_Santo_Tomas" title="University of Santo Tomas">University of Santo Tomas</a> (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manila" title="Manila">Manila</a>)
 and "dedicated to Pope Francis, the reigning pope [...][at the time of 
the species description, 2015] of the Catholic Church. Jorge Mario 
Bergoglio chose Francis as his papal name in honor of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saint_Francis_of_Assisi" class="mw-redirect" title="Saint Francis of Assisi">Saint Francis of Assisi</a>. Francis is the first <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jesuit" class="mw-redirect" title="Jesuit">Jesuit</a> pope." Pope Francis had visited the university campus during his first papal visit to the Philippines, that same year.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Franciscus_in_2015.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Franciscus_in_2015.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="162" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Franciscus_in_2015_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Franciscus_in_2015_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1086" data-file-height="1598"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-291" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-291"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>289<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-292" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-292"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>290<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hellinsia_aguilerai" title="Hellinsia aguilerai">Hellinsia aguilerai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Gielis, 2011</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moth" title="Moth">Moth</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Roldós Aguilera, Jaime"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jaime_Rold%C3%B3s_Aguilera" title="Jaime Roldós Aguilera">Jaime Roldós Aguilera</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>This species is native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ecuador" title="Ecuador">Ecuador</a> and "named after president Jaime Roldos Aguilera from Ecuador, who died in an airplane accident in 1981."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Hellinsia_aguilerai.JPG" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Hellinsia_aguilerai.JPG" decoding="async" width="110" height="83" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Hellinsia_aguilerai_003.JPG 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Hellinsia_aguilerai_002.JPG 2x" data-file-width="348" data-file-height="263"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Jaime_Rold%C3%B3s_Aguilera.png" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jaime_Rold%C3%B3s_Aguilera.png" decoding="async" width="110" height="131" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jaime_Rold%25C3%25B3s_Aguilera_002.png 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jaime_Rold%25C3%25B3s_Aguilera_003.png 2x" data-file-width="256" data-file-height="304"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Gielis_2011_293-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Gielis_2011-293"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>291<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hemistomia_shostakovichi" title="Hemistomia shostakovichi">Hemistomia shostakovichi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Haase &amp; Bouchet, 1998</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freshwater_snail" title="Freshwater snail">Freshwater snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Shostakovich, Dmitri"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dmitri_Shostakovich" title="Dmitri Shostakovich">Dmitri Shostakovich</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"Dmitri Shostakovich (1906–1975) is one of the favourite composers of the first author."</td>
<td></td>

<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Hendrixella&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Hendrixella (page does not exist)">Hendrixella</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Bannikov &amp; Carnevale, 2009</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">Fish</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Hendrix, Jimi"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jimi_Hendrix" title="Jimi Hendrix">Jimi Hendrix</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A genus of fossil <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Percoidei" title="Percoidei">percoid</a> fish from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eocene" title="Eocene">Eocene</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monte_Bolca" title="Monte Bolca">Monte Bolca</a>.</td>

<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Hensonbatrachus&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Hensonbatrachus (page does not exist)">Hensonbatrachus</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Gardner &amp; Brinkman, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frog" title="Frog">Frog</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Henson, Jim"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jim_Henson" title="Jim Henson">Jim Henson</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A genus of fossil frogs from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cretaceous" title="Cretaceous">Cretaceous</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alberta" title="Alberta">Alberta</a>, Canada. The sole known species is named <i>H. kermiti</i>, after Henson's character <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kermit_the_Frog" title="Kermit the Frog">Kermit the Frog</a>.</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Hernandaria_chicomendesi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Hernandaria chicomendesi (page does not exist)">Hernandaria chicomendesi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">DaSilva &amp; Pinto-da-Rocha, 2010</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harvestman" class="mw-redirect" title="Harvestman">Harvestman</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Mendes, Chico"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chico_Mendes" title="Chico Mendes">Chico Mendes</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil">Brazil</a>, named "in honor of Chico Mendes (1944–1988), rubber extraction union leader who fought for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amazon_rainforest" title="Amazon rainforest">Amazon</a> preservation and against worker exploitation. He was killed by landlords as a reaction to his fight for the Amazon."</td>

<td>This species was described from a specimen collected in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel" title="Israel">Israel</a>; subsequently synonymised with <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Sarcophaga_kerteszi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Sarcophaga kerteszi (page does not exist)">Sarcophaga kerteszi</a></i>.</td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heteropoda_davidbowie" title="Heteropoda davidbowie">Heteropoda davidbowie</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Jäger, 2008</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Bowie, David"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Bowie" title="David Bowie">David Bowie</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The species name is honouring the rock-singer David Bowie – composer of the music album <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Rise_and_Fall_of_Ziggy_Stardust_and_the_Spiders_from_Mars" title="The Rise and Fall of Ziggy Stardust and the Spiders from Mars">The Rise and Fall of Ziggy Stardust and the Spiders from Mars</a></i>
 and interpreter of songs such as "Glass Spider"— who has been in [the] 
early years of his career sometimes as painted as the frontal view of 
the head of this new species, furthermore inspiring the author by his 
songs full of energy, creativity and open-mindedness."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:David_Bowie_spider.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/David_Bowie_spider_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="76" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/David_Bowie_spider_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/David_Bowie_spider.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1000" data-file-height="688"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:David-Bowie_Chicago_2002-08-08_photoby_Adam-Bielawski-cropped.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/David-Bowie_Chicago_2002-08-08_photoby_Adam-Bielawski-cr_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="129" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/David-Bowie_Chicago_2002-08-08_photoby_Adam-Bielawski-cr_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/David-Bowie_Chicago_2002-08-08_photoby_Adam-Bielawski-croppe.jpg 2x" data-file-width="342" data-file-height="400"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Jager2008_301-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Jager2008-301"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>299<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-BowieSpider_302-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BowieSpider-302"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>300<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Heteropoda_ernstulrichi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Heteropoda ernstulrichi (page does not exist)">Heteropoda ernstulrichi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Jäger, 2008</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Weizsäcker, Ernst Ulrich von"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ernst_Ulrich_von_Weizs%C3%A4cker" title="Ernst Ulrich von Weizsäcker">Ernst Ulrich von Weizsäcker</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"named in honour of Ernst Ulrich Michael freiherr Von Weizsäcker, 
German natural scientist and politician, for his efforts towards an 
ecological treatment of our planet and his ambition to reduce wasting of
 natural resources as described, e.g., in the book <i>Factor Four</i> he co-authored"</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Ernst_Ulrich_von_Weizs%C3%A4cker,_2010_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ernst_Ulrich_von_Weizs%C3%A4cker,_2010_(cropped).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="156" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ernst_Ulrich_von_Weizs%25C3%25A4cker,_2010_(cropped)_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Ernst_Ulrich_von_Weizs%C3%A4cker,_2010_(cropped).jpg 2x" data-file-width="1275" data-file-height="1805"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Jager2008_301-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Jager2008-301"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>299<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Heteropoda_hildebrandti&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Heteropoda hildebrandti (page does not exist)">Heteropoda hildebrandti</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Jäger, 2008</span></td>

<td><span data-sort-value="Hildebrandt, Dieter"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dieter_Hildebrandt" title="Dieter Hildebrandt">Dieter Hildebrandt</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"named in honour of the cabaret artist Dieter Hildebrandt for his long-term efforts trying to educate German politicians."</td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Uexküll, Carl Wolmar Jakob von"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Wolmar_Jakob_von_Uexk%C3%BCll" title="Carl Wolmar Jakob von Uexküll">Carl Wolmar Jakob von Uexküll</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"named after the founder of the alternative/green Nobel-prize Jakob von Uexkuell, who initiated the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Future_Council" title="World Future Council">World Future Council</a> searching for solutions against <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_overpopulation" title="Human overpopulation">global overpopulation</a> of humans and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Global_warming" class="mw-redirect" title="Global warming">global warming</a>, an issue treated also in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2007_United_Nations_Climate_Change_Conference" title="2007 United Nations Climate Change Conference">2007 United Nations Climate Change Conference</a> [in] <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bali" title="Bali">Bali</a>, the island, where this new species [was] collected"</td>
<td></td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">Fish</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Kalam, A. P. J. Abdul"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A._P._J._Abdul_Kalam" title="A. P. J. Abdul Kalam">A. P. J. Abdul Kalam</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Footballfish" title="Footballfish">footballfish</a> found in the waters of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andaman_and_Nicobar_Islands" title="Andaman and Nicobar Islands">Andaman and Nicobar Islands</a>,
 "named in honor of Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam, an eminent aerospace 
scientist and former President of India, for his many contributions to 
the field of space research and India's missile technology. He was very 
keen in encouraging students and greatly motivated them with his 
inspiring books and speeches."</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Hondurantemna_chespiritoi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Hondurantemna chespiritoi (page does not exist)">Hondurantemna chespiritoi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Rodrigues, Rivera, Reid &amp; Svenson, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mantis" title="Mantis">Mantis</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chespirito" title="Chespirito">Chespirito</a></td>
<td>"named after "Chespirito", the screen name of famous late Mexican TV
 comedian Roberto Gomez Bolaños. Chespirito created and portrayed 
several characters cherished across Latin America, including <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/El_Chavo_del_Ocho" title="El Chavo del Ocho">El Chavo del Ocho</a></i> and <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/El_Chapul%C3%ADn_Colorado" title="El Chapulín Colorado">El Chapulín Colorado</a></i>, the latter a sort of superhero whose outfit was inspired by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grasshopper" title="Grasshopper">grasshoppers</a> or "chapulines"."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Hondurantemna_chespiritoi_(10.3897-zookeys.680.11162)_Figure_18_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Hondurantemna_chespiritoi_(10.3897-zookeys.680.11162)_Figure.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="77" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Hondurantemna_chespiritoi_(10.3897-zookeys.680.11162)_Fi_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Hondurantemna_chespiritoi_(10.3897-zookeys.680.11162)_Fi_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="730" data-file-height="513"></a></span></td>

Abdul Kalam, who ignited young minds towards the real world of Science

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Huancabamba_kubricki&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Huancabamba kubricki (page does not exist)">Huancabamba kubricki</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Benedetti &amp; Pinto-da-Rocha, 2022</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harvestman" class="mw-redirect" title="Harvestman">Harvestman</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Kubrick, Stanley"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stanley_Kubrick" title="Stanley Kubrick">Stanley Kubrick</a></span></span></span></td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Kubrick_on_the_set_of_Barry_Lyndon_(1975_publicity_photo)_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Kubrick_on_the_set_of_Barry_Lyndon_(1975_publicity_photo)_(c.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="124" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Kubrick_on_the_set_of_Barry_Lyndon_(1975_publicity_photo_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Kubrick_on_the_set_of_Barry_Lyndon_(1975_publicity_photo_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="793" data-file-height="893"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-BenPin22_84-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BenPin22-84"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>83<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Hydraena_birendra&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Hydraena birendra (page does not exist)">Hydraena birendra</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Skale &amp; Jäch, 2009</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Birendra_of_Nepal" title="Birendra of Nepal">Birendra of Nepal</a></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hydraenidae" title="Hydraenidae">minute moss beetle</a> "named for King Birendra Bir Bikram Shah Dev (1945–2001), who is widely considered the best king to ever reign in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nepal" title="Nepal">Nepal</a>. He was seen as a symbol of national unity, who granted a democratic government. The type material of <i>Hydraena birendra</i>
 was collected [in Nepal] in 1983, 1995 and finally in 2001. In the same
 year King Birendra died tragically, murdered by his own son <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dipendra_of_Nepal" title="Dipendra of Nepal">Dipendra</a>."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Hydraena_(s.str.)_birendra_Skale_%26_J%C3%A4ch,_2008_(3643665089).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Hydraena_(s.str.)_birendra_Skale_&amp;_J%25C3%25A4ch,_2008_(3643_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="81" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Hydraena_(s.str.)_birendra_Skale_&amp;_J%25C3%25A4ch,_2008_(3643_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Hydraena_(s.str.)_birendra_Skale_&amp;_J%25C3%25A4ch,_2008_(36436650.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3679" data-file-height="2694"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Birendra_Bir_Bikram_Shah_c._1967_(restoration).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Birendra_Bir_Bikram_Shah_c._1967_(restoration)_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="164" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Birendra_Bir_Bikram_Shah_c._1967_(restoration).jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Birendra_Bir_Bikram_Shah_c._1967_(restoration).jpg 2x" data-file-width="1658" data-file-height="2476"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Hydraena_309-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Hydraena-309"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>307<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Hydraena_hillaryi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Hydraena hillaryi (page does not exist)">Hydraena hillaryi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Skale &amp; Jäch, 2009</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Hillary, Edmund"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edmund_Hillary" title="Edmund Hillary">Edmund Hillary</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hydraenidae" title="Hydraenidae">minute moss beetle</a>
 "Named for Sir Edmund P. Hillary [...], who died in early 2008, exactly
 when the description of this species was compiled. In 1953, Sir Edmund 
Hillary and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tenzing_Norgay" title="Tenzing Norgay">Tenzing Norgay</a> became the first climbers to reach the summit of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mount_Everest" title="Mount Everest">Mount Everest</a>. Hillary devoted much of his life to helping the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sherpa_people" title="Sherpa people">Sherpa people</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nepal" title="Nepal">Nepal</a> by founding the "<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Himalayan_Trust" title="Himalayan Trust">Himalayan Trust</a>".
 Through his efforts, schools and small hospitals were built in remote 
regions of Nepal. Furthermore, Hillary was Honorary President of "<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mountain_Wilderness" title="Mountain Wilderness">Mountain Wilderness</a>", a world-wide organization for preservation of mountain environment. <i>Hydraena hillaryi</i> lives near the foot of Mount Everest."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Hydraena_hillaryi_Skale_%26_J%C3%A4ch,_2008_(3739467925).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Hydraena_hillaryi_Skale_&amp;_J%25C3%25A4ch,_2008_(3739467925)_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="81" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Hydraena_hillaryi_Skale_&amp;_J%25C3%25A4ch,_2008_(3739467925)_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Hydraena_hillaryi_Skale_&amp;_J%C3%A4ch,_2008_(3739467925).jpg 2x" data-file-width="2797" data-file-height="2071"></a></span></td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Coltrane, John"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Coltrane" title="John Coltrane">John Coltrane</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hydraenidae" title="Hydraenidae">minute moss beetle</a> "Named in honor of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jazz" title="Jazz">jazz</a> great, the supreme saxophonist John Coltrane."</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Hydroptila_florestani&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Hydroptila florestani (page does not exist)">Hydroptila florestani</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Souza, Santos &amp; Takiya, 2014</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caddisfly" title="Caddisfly">Caddisfly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Fernandes, Florestan"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Florestan_Fernandes" title="Florestan Fernandes">Florestan Fernandes</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil">Brazilian</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microcaddisfly" class="mw-redirect" title="Microcaddisfly">microcaddisfly</a> "named in honor of the sociologist Florestan Fernandes, who published many texts opposing the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Military_dictatorship_in_Brazil" title="Military dictatorship in Brazil">Brazilian Military Government</a> and coordinated the "Escola Paulista de Sociologia" from 1964 to 1969."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Florestan_Fernandes_em_confer%C3%AAncia_no_Museu_de_Belas_Artes_(1964).tif" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/lossy-page1-110px-Florestan_Fernandes_em_confer%25C3%25AAncia_no.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="149" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Florestan_Fernandes_em_confer%25C3%25AAncia_no_Museu_de_Belas_Ar.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/lossy-page1-220px-Florestan_Fernandes_em_confer%25C3%25AAncia_no.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2076" data-file-height="2812"></a></span></td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caddisfly" title="Caddisfly">Caddisfly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Marighella, Carlos"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carlos_Marighella" title="Carlos Marighella">Carlos Marighella</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil">Brazilian</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microcaddisfly" class="mw-redirect" title="Microcaddisfly">microcaddisfly</a> "named in honor of Carlos Marighella, founder of the "<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A%C3%A7%C3%A3o_Libertadora_Nacional" title="Ação Libertadora Nacional">Ação Libertadora Nacional</a>", an movement of opposition to the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Military_dictatorship_in_Brazil" title="Military dictatorship in Brazil">Brazilian Military Government (1964–1985)</a>."</td>

<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil">Brazilian</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microcaddisfly" class="mw-redirect" title="Microcaddisfly">microcaddisfly</a> "named after Therezinha de Godoy Zerbini who organized the "Movimento Feminino Pela Anistia" in many Brazilian States."</td>

<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Hydroptila14_311-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Hydroptila14-311"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>309<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Hydroscapha_redfordi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Hydroscapha redfordi (page does not exist)">Hydroscapha redfordi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Maier <i>et al.</i>, 2010</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Redford, Robert"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Redford" title="Robert Redford">Robert Redford</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"This species is named in honor of actor/conservationist Robert 
Redford, whose 1972 portrayal of the semi-fictional Jeremiah Johnson in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jeremiah_Johnson_(film)" title="Jeremiah Johnson (film)">the film of the same name</a>
 brought attention to the character as well as the beauty of the region.
 One of us (MAI) was so affected by the film that he chose to spend his 
life and career in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rocky_Mountains" title="Rocky Mountains">Rockies</a>.
 The type locality of this species, Jerry Johnson Hot Springs, is named 
for Redford's character [NOTE: this is actually incorrect], but it is 
Redford's continuing work to safeguard the wild legacy of the Rocky 
Mountains that makes this name a fitting tribute."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Robert_Redford_1.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Robert_Redford_1_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="172" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Robert_Redford_1.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="653" data-file-height="1024"></a></span></td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Hylomyrma_lispectorae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Hylomyrma lispectorae (page does not exist)">Hylomyrma lispectorae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ulysséa, 2021</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ant" title="Ant">Ant</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Lispector, Clarice"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clarice_Lispector" title="Clarice Lispector">Clarice Lispector</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"named after Clarice Lispector (1920–1977), born Chaya Pinkhasovna Lispector, a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ukraine" title="Ukraine">Ukrainian</a>-<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil">Brazilian</a> novelist, poetess, and short story writer— <i>"Liberdade é pouco. O que eu desejo ainda não tem nome"</i>."</td>

<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Ulyssea21_313-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ulyssea21-313"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>311<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hyloscirtus_princecharlesi" class="mw-redirect" title="Hyloscirtus princecharlesi">Hyloscirtus princecharlesi</a></i></span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Coloma <i>et al.</i>, 2012</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frog" title="Frog">Frog</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_III" title="Charles III">Charles III</a></td>
<td>"The specific name <i>princecharlesi</i> is a patronym that honors 
His Royal Highness Charles, Prince of Wales (Charles Philip Arthur 
George Windsor). In his call to halt tropical deforestation, Prince 
Charles uses frogs as symbols, and his Rainforests SOS Campaign includes
 a video with a frog as a rainforest ambassador. For this reason he is 
affectionately known by the media as the 'frog prince'. Prince Charles 
is contributing significantly to the growth of awareness in the battle 
against tropical deforestation, climate change, and the catastrophic 
extinction of rainforest amphibians. His work is leading to increased 
awareness of these issues, and this increased awareness benefits 
biodiversity conservation, sustainability, alleviation of poverty, and 
ensures ecosystem services for present and future generations."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Hyloscirtus_princecharlesi.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Hyloscirtus_princecharlesi.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="73" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Hyloscirtus_princecharlesi.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Hyloscirtus_princecharlesi.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3555" data-file-height="2361"></a></span></td>

<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-314" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-314"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>312<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-315" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-315"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>313<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>

<td><span data-sort-value="Lula da Silva, Luiz Inácio"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luiz_In%C3%A1cio_Lula_da_Silva" title="Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva">Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva</a></span></span></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ichneumon_hodgkinae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ichneumon hodgkinae (page does not exist)">Ichneumon hodgkinae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Kittel, 2016</span></td>

<tr>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ichneumon_yalowae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ichneumon yalowae (page does not exist)">Ichneumon yalowae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Kittel, 2016</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Yalow, Rosalyn"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rosalyn_Yalow" class="mw-redirect" title="Rosalyn Yalow">Rosalyn Yalow</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>Replacement name for <i>Ichneumon varius</i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Gmelin, 1790</span>, which was preoccupied by <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ichneumon_varius&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ichneumon varius (page does not exist)">Ichneumon varius</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Pontoppidan, 1763</span>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Rosalyn_Yalow.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rosalyn_Yalow_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="123" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rosalyn_Yalow_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rosalyn_Yalow.jpg 2x" data-file-width="465" data-file-height="518"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-89Replacement_224-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-89Replacement-224"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>223<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ilomantis_ginsburgae" title="Ilomantis ginsburgae">Ilomantis ginsburgae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Brannoch &amp; Svenson, 2016</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mantis" title="Mantis">Mantis</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Ginsburg, Ruth Bader"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ruth_Bader_Ginsburg" title="Ruth Bader Ginsburg">Ruth Bader Ginsburg</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>The scientists who described this species pioneered a new method of 
identification; whereas the study of male genitals is typically used to 
classify insect species, they instead examined the female genitalia to 
establish the new species. It was then "named [...] in honor of Ruth 
Joan Bader Ginsburg, Associate Justice of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Supreme_Court_of_the_United_States" title="Supreme Court of the United States">Supreme Court of the United States</a>, for her relentless fight for gender equality, as well as for her sartorial appreciation of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jabot_(neckwear)" title="Jabot (neckwear)">jabot</a>, which is reminiscent of the postcervical plate of <i>Ilomantis</i>, a diagnostic character that embodies this judicial accessory." Upon learning about the name, Ginsburg commented "<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Metamorphosis" title="The Metamorphosis">Gregor Samsa woke up one morning to find himself changed into a big black bug</a>; Praying mantis, female too, is ever so much more attractive."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Ruth_Bader_Ginsburg_2016_portrait_cropped.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ruth_Bader_Ginsburg_2016_portrait_cropped_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="146" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ruth_Bader_Ginsburg_2016_portrait_cropped.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="1574" data-file-height="2082"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-320" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-320"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>318<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-321" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-321"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>319<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><br><sup id="cite_ref-322" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-322"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>320<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-323" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-323"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>321<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ilyodon_lennoni" title="Ilyodon lennoni">Ilyodon lennoni</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Meyer &amp; Förster, 1983</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">Fish</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Lennon, John"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Lennon" title="John Lennon">John Lennon</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Splitfin" class="mw-redirect" title="Splitfin">splitfin</a> found in the Chacambero river, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico" title="Mexico">Mexico</a>. Some sources consider it a synonym of <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ilyodon_whitei" title="Ilyodon whitei">Ilyodon whitei</a></i>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:John_Lennon_1969_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/John_Lennon_1969_(cropped).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="159" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/John_Lennon_1969_(cropped)_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/John_Lennon_1969_(cropped)_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="612" data-file-height="883"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-324" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-324"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>322<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-CofF_325-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CofF-325"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>323<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Impatiens_achudanandanii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Impatiens achudanandanii (page does not exist)">Impatiens achudanandanii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">V.S.A. Kumar, M.G. Govind &amp; Sindhu Arya</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flowering_plant" title="Flowering plant">Flowering plant</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Achuthanandan, V. S."><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/V._S._Achuthanandan" title="V. S. Achuthanandan">V. S. Achuthanandan</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Balsamine" class="mw-redirect" title="Balsamine">balsamine</a> native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kerala" title="Kerala">Kerala</a>, India, "named in honor of Mr. V.S. Achudanandan, former <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_chief_ministers_of_Kerala" title="List of chief ministers of Kerala">Chief Minister of the state of Kerala</a> for his ardent efforts in conservation of the pristine environment of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Western_Ghats" title="Western Ghats">Western Ghats</a>, especially <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mathikettan_Shola_National_Park" title="Mathikettan Shola National Park">Mathikettan Shola</a>."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:V._S._Achuthanandan.JPG" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/V._S._Achuthanandan_002.JPG" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/V._S._Achuthanandan_003.JPG 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/V._S._Achuthanandan.JPG 2x" data-file-width="492" data-file-height="656"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-326" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-326"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>324<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inbiocystiscus_tanialeonae" title="Inbiocystiscus tanialeonae">Inbiocystiscus tanialeonae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ortea &amp; Espinosa, 2016</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_snail" title="Sea snail">Sea snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="León, Tania"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tania_Le%C3%B3n" title="Tania León">Tania León</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"Named in honour of Cuban conductor and composer Tania León (Havana, 1943), to whom the fifth edition of the festival <i>Musiciennes en Guadeloupe et Martinique</i> was dedicated (May 2016), the same year in which the scientific expedition Martinique-2016 took place."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Tania_Leon_(Tania_Le%C3%B3n)_-_Honorees_at_the_2022_Kennedy_Center_Honors_Dinner_(52542377419)_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Tania_Leon_(Tania_Le%25C3%25B3n)_-_Honorees_at_the_2022_Kenn_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Tania_Leon_(Tania_Le%25C3%25B3n)_-_Honorees_at_the_2022_Kenn_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Tania_Leon_(Tania_Le%25C3%25B3n)_-_Honorees_at_the_2022_Kennedy_.jpg 2x" data-file-width="988" data-file-height="1317"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-OrteaEspinosa2016_327-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OrteaEspinosa2016-327"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>325<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intelcystiscus_gordonmoorei" title="Intelcystiscus gordonmoorei">Intelcystiscus gordonmoorei</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ortea &amp; Espinosa, 2001</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_snail" title="Sea snail">Sea snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Moore, Gordon"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gordon_Moore" title="Gordon Moore">Gordon Moore</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"In honour of Gordon Moore, co-founder of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intel" title="Intel">Intel</a>, and in recognition of his support for the taxonomy of the future". The genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intelcystiscus" title="Intelcystiscus">Intelcystiscus</a></i>, created concurrently, is named after Intel.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Rajiv_L_Gupta_George_Barclay_Gordon_Moore_ID2004_(cropped,_Moore).JPG" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rajiv_L_Gupta_George_Barclay_Gordon_Moore_ID2004_(croppe_003.JPG" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rajiv_L_Gupta_George_Barclay_Gordon_Moore_ID2004_(croppe_002.JPG 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rajiv_L_Gupta_George_Barclay_Gordon_Moore_ID2004_(cropped,_M.JPG 2x" data-file-width="710" data-file-height="947"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ipomoea_kahloae" title="Ipomoea kahloae">Ipomoea kahloae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Gonz.-Martínez, Lozada-Pérez &amp; Rios-Carr.</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flowering_plant" title="Flowering plant">Flowering plant</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Kahlo, Frida"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frida_Kahlo" title="Frida Kahlo">Frida Kahlo</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morning_glory" title="Morning glory">morning glory</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico" title="Mexico">Mexico</a>,
 whose name "honors the Mexican artist Frida Kahlo (1907–1954), one of 
the most influential Latin American artists of the 20th century. Frida 
Kahlo, besides being a painter, participated in many cultural, academic 
and political activities and was a social activist. Kahlo revived the 
roots of Mexican popular art and became a cultural reference point for 
the people of Mexico and its national identity." <br>Originally described as <i>Ipomoea kahloiae</i>, subsequently amended.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Frida_Kahlo,_by_Guillermo_Kahlo.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Frida_Kahlo,_by_Guillermo_Kahlo.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="165" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Frida_Kahlo,_by_Guillermo_Kahlo_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Frida_Kahlo,_by_Guillermo_Kahlo_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1197" data-file-height="1795"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-329" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-329"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>327<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ischnocnema_penaxavantinho&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ischnocnema penaxavantinho (page does not exist)">Ischnocnema penaxavantinho</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Giaretta, Toffoli &amp; Oliveira, 2007</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frog" title="Frog">Frog</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pena_Branca_%26_Xavantinho" title="Pena Branca &amp; Xavantinho">Pena Branca &amp; Xavantinho</a></td>
<td>A species from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil">Brazil</a> whose name "is an arbitrary fusion of two Portuguese words <i>pena</i> (meaning feather) and <i>xavantinho</i>
 (meaning little Xavante, a group of pre-colonization natives). These 
names were used by two regional singer brothers (Pena Branca and 
Xavantinho) who in their songs emphasized the beauty of the Brazilian 
nature and the countryside way of life. It is used as a noun in 
apposition and as homage to both artists."</td>
<td></td>
<td></td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ischnothyreus_gigeri&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ischnothyreus gigeri (page does not exist)">Ischnothyreus gigeri</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Richard, 2016</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Giger, H. R."><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/H._R._Giger" title="H. R. Giger">H. R. Giger</a></span></span></span></td>

<tr id="J">
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jaggermeryx" title="Jaggermeryx">Jaggermeryx</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Miller <i>et al.</i>, 2014</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Even-toed_ungulate" class="mw-redirect" title="Even-toed ungulate">Even-toed ungulate</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Jagger, Mick"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mick_Jagger" title="Mick Jagger">Mick Jagger</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Whippomorpha" title="Whippomorpha">whippomorph</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miocene" title="Miocene">Miocene</a>, related to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hippopotamuses" class="mw-redirect" title="Hippopotamuses">hippopotamuses</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Whales" class="mw-redirect" title="Whales">whales</a>,
 named "for Sir Mick Jagger, in recognition of his famous lips", since 
this animal was believed to have a "highly innervated muzzle with mobile
 and tactile lips".</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Jaggermeryx_naida.png" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jaggermeryx_naida.png" decoding="async" width="110" height="75" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jaggermeryx_naida_002.png 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jaggermeryx_naida_003.png 2x" data-file-width="878" data-file-height="600"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Rolling_Stones_04.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Rolling_Stones_04.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="140" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Rolling_Stones_04.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rolling_Stones_04.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1853" data-file-height="2354"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Janbechynea_georgepauljohnringo&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Janbechynea georgepauljohnringo (page does not exist)">Janbechynea georgepauljohnringo</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Santiago-Blay, 2004</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Beatles, The"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Beatles" title="The Beatles">The Beatles</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"honors the first name of the members of the 1960's British musical band, "The Beatles": <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Harrison" title="George Harrison">George Harrison</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_McCartney" title="Paul McCartney">Paul McCartney</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Lennon" title="John Lennon">John Lennon</a>, and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Starkey" class="mw-redirect" title="Richard Starkey">Richard Starkey</a> (a.k.a. "Ringo Starr")"</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Beatles_ad_1965_just_the_beatles_crop.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Beatles_ad_1965_just_the_beatles_crop_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="80" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Beatles_ad_1965_just_the_beatles_crop_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Beatles_ad_1965_just_the_beatles_crop.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1156" data-file-height="839"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Janibacter_hoylei" title="Janibacter hoylei">Janibacter hoylei</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Shivaji <i>et al.</i>, 2009</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bacterium" class="mw-redirect" title="Bacterium">Bacterium</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Hoyle, Fred"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fred_Hoyle" title="Fred Hoyle">Fred Hoyle</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A bacterium isolated from cryotubes used to collect air samples from
 the upper atmosphere at altitudes between 27 and 41&nbsp;km., "named 
after Sir Fred Hoyle, the famous English astronomer", who was one of the
 main proponents of the theory of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panspermia" title="Panspermia">panspermia</a>. Research was funded by ISRO (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indian_Space_Research_Organisation" class="mw-redirect" title="Indian Space Research Organisation">Indian Space Research Organisation</a>).</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Institute_of_Astronomy,_Statue_of_Sir_Fred_Hoyle.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Institute_of_Astronomy,_Statue_of_Sir_Fred_Hoyle.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Institute_of_Astronomy,_Statue_of_Sir_Fred_Hoyle_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Institute_of_Astronomy,_Statue_of_Sir_Fred_Hoyle_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3024" data-file-height="4032"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japewiella_dollypartoniana" title="Japewiella dollypartoniana">Japewiella dollypartoniana</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">J.L. Allen <i>et al.</i></span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lichen" title="Lichen">Lichen</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Parton, Dolly"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dolly_Parton" title="Dolly Parton">Dolly Parton</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"named in honor of Dolly Parton ... Parton rose to stardom ... in 
the mountains of eastern Tennessee on the edge of the Great Smoky 
Mountains where this species grows abundantly"</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Dolly_Parton_in_Nashville_2.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Dolly_Parton_in_Nashville_2.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="165" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Dolly_Parton_in_Nashville_2.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Dolly_Parton_in_Nashville_2.jpg 2x" data-file-width="730" data-file-height="1095"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Jasminum_bhumibolianum&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Jasminum bhumibolianum (page does not exist)">Jasminum bhumibolianum</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Chalermglin</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flowering_plant" title="Flowering plant">Flowering plant</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bhumibol_Adulyadej" title="Bhumibol Adulyadej">Bhumibol Adulyadej</a></td>
<td>A species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jasmine" title="Jasmine">jasmine</a> native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thailand" title="Thailand">Thailand</a>,
 "dedicated to His Majesty King Bhumibol Adulyadej on his 84th 
anniversary in recognition of the great efforts he has made to conserve 
native plants in Thailand."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Bhumibol_Adulyadej_2010-9-29_2_cropped.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/120px-Bhumibol_Adulyadej_2010-9-29_2_cropped.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="145" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/250px-Bhumibol_Adulyadej_2010-9-29_2_cropped.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="802" data-file-height="1058"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Jorunna_davidbowieii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Jorunna davidbowieii (page does not exist)">Jorunna davidbowieii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ortea &amp; Moro, 2016</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_slug" title="Sea slug">Sea slug</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Bowie, David"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Bowie" title="David Bowie">David Bowie</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"Because of its ability to change colour, this species is named 
after the brilliant musician and singer David Bowie, 'the chameleon', 
who passed away in January 2016, [and who] was the first to give music 
an image, associated with his own figure and his collection of works of 
art. <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lazarus_(soundtrack)" title="Lazarus (soundtrack)">Lazarus</a></i>, one of his last works, is a hymn to the hope of his resurrection."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:David-Bowie_Chicago_2002-08-08_photoby_Adam-Bielawski-cropped.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/David-Bowie_Chicago_2002-08-08_photoby_Adam-Bielawski-cr_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="129" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/David-Bowie_Chicago_2002-08-08_photoby_Adam-Bielawski-cr_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/David-Bowie_Chicago_2002-08-08_photoby_Adam-Bielawski-croppe.jpg 2x" data-file-width="342" data-file-height="400"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-338" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-338"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>336<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jotus_karllagerfeldi" title="Jotus karllagerfeldi">Jotus karllagerfeldi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Baehr, Schubert, &amp; Harms, 2019</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Lagerfeld, Karl"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karl_Lagerfeld" title="Karl Lagerfeld">Karl Lagerfeld</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"This species is a black and white spider which looked like Karl 
Lagerfeld and his signature look, as the spider has large black eyes, 
which reminded of his sunglasses and its black and white front legs were
 reminiscent of Lagerfeld's kent collar and handgloves."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Jotus_karllagerfeldi_A.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jotus_karllagerfeldi_A_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="79" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jotus_karllagerfeldi_A.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jotus_karllagerfeldi_A_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1959" data-file-height="1408"></a></span></td>

<td>A new genus for a bacterium isolated from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cupola_(ISS_module)" title="Cupola (ISS module)"><i>Cupola</i> module of the International Space Station</a>, "named after APJ Abdul Kalam (1934–2015), a well-known scientist who advanced space research in India."</td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lemmy" title="Lemmy">Lemmy</a></td>
<td>"Named in honor of Lemmy Kilmister of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mot%C3%B6rhead" title="Motörhead">Motörhead</a>, for musical inspiration during the course of this study."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Lemmy-02.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Lemmy-02.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="166" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Lemmy-02.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Lemmy-02.jpg 2x" data-file-width="498" data-file-height="750"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-343" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-343"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>341<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kankuamo_marquezi" title="Kankuamo marquezi">Kankuamo marquezi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Perafán, Galvis &amp; Gutiérrez, 2016</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="García Márquez, Gabriel"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gabriel_Garc%C3%ADa_M%C3%A1rquez" title="Gabriel García Márquez">Gabriel García Márquez</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tarantula" title="Tarantula">tarantula</a> endemic to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colombia" title="Colombia">Colombia</a>,
 named "in honor [of] Gabriel García Márquez (Aracataca, Colombia, 1927 –
 Mexico D.F., Mexico, 2014), who was a renowned Colombian writer, 
considered one of the most significant authors of the 20th century, and 
awarded the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1982_Nobel_Prize_in_Literature" title="1982 Nobel Prize in Literature">1982 Nobel Prize in Literature</a> for <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/One_Hundred_Years_of_Solitude" title="One Hundred Years of Solitude">One Hundred Years of Solitude</a></i>."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Kankuamo_Marquezi_(Male_Dorsal_View).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Kankuamo_Marquezi_(Male_Dorsal_View).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="166" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Kankuamo_Marquezi_(Male_Dorsal_View)_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Kankuamo_Marquezi_(Male_Dorsal_View)_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1002" data-file-height="1513"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Gabriel_Garcia_Marquez.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/120px-Gabriel_Garcia_Marquez.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="165" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/250px-Gabriel_Garcia_Marquez.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="427" data-file-height="640"></a></span></td>

<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Kepplerites_aigii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Kepplerites aigii (page does not exist)">Kepplerites aigii</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Mitta, 2008</span></td>

<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:%D0%93%D0%B5%D0%BD%D0%BD%D0%B0%D0%B4%D0%B8%D0%B9_%D0%90%D0%B9%D0%B3%D0%B8.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/%25D0%2593%25D0%25B5%25D0%25BD%25D0%25BD%25D0%25B0%25D0%25B4%25D0%25B8%25D0%25B9_%25D0%2590%25D0%25B.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="148" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/%25D0%2593%25D0%25B5%25D0%25BD%25D0%25BD%25D0%25B0%25D0%25B4%25D0%25B8%25D0%25B9_%25D0%2590%25_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/%25D0%2593%25D0%25B5%25D0%25BD%25D0%25BD%25D0%25B0%25D0%25B4%25D0%25B8%25D0%25B9_%25D0%2590%25_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="774" data-file-height="1040"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Khoratamia_phattharajani&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Khoratamia phattharajani (page does not exist)">Khoratamia phattharajani</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Deesri <i>et al.</i>, 2023</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">Fish</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bhumibol_Adulyadej" title="Bhumibol Adulyadej">Bhumibol Adulyadej</a></td>
<td>A fossil <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amiidae" title="Amiidae">bowfin</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cretaceous" title="Cretaceous">Cretaceous</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thailand" title="Thailand">Thailand</a>, whose name "derives from <i>Phatthara</i> + <i>Rajan</i>
 the designation of Somdet Phra Phatthara Maharat, a title given to King
 Bhumibol Adulyadej, (Rama IX) in recognition of his research dedication
 and support for breeding Nile tilapia (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oreochromis_niloticus" class="mw-redirect" title="Oreochromis niloticus">Oreochromis niloticus</a></i>),
 which has provided a new career for over a million Thai 
agriculturalists and became a primary protein source for the Thai 
people."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Bhumibol_Adulyadej_2010-9-29_2_cropped.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/120px-Bhumibol_Adulyadej_2010-9-29_2_cropped.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="145" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/250px-Bhumibol_Adulyadej_2010-9-29_2_cropped.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="802" data-file-height="1058"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Kokoppia_mandelai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Kokoppia mandelai (page does not exist)">Kokoppia mandelai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Hugo-Coetzee, 2014</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mite" title="Mite">Mite</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Mandela, Nelson"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nelson_Mandela" title="Nelson Mandela">Nelson Mandela</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Golden_Gate_Highlands_National_Park" title="Golden Gate Highlands National Park">Golden Gate Highlands National Park</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Africa" title="South Africa">South Africa</a> "named in honor of the late Mr Nelson Mandela, former president of South Africa. He wrote about the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Free_State_(province)" title="Free State (province)">Free State</a> (in which Golden Gate is situated) in his autobiography, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Long_Walk_to_Freedom" title="Long Walk to Freedom">Long Walk to Freedom</a></i>, the following: "The province of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orange_Free_State" title="Orange Free State">Orange Free State</a>
 has always had a magical effect on me....the Free State's landscape 
gladdens my heart no matter what my mood. When I am there, I feel that 
nothing can shut me in, that my thoughts can roam as far and wide as the
 horizons" (Mandela 1994)."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit)_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="130" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit)_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit).jpg 2x" data-file-width="657" data-file-height="778"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Komagataella_mondaviorum&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Komagataella mondaviorum (page does not exist)">Komagataella mondaviorum</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Naumov, Naumova &amp; Boundy-Mills, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yeast" title="Yeast">Yeast</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Mondavi, Robert"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Mondavi" title="Robert Mondavi">Robert Mondavi</a></span></span></span> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Margrit_Mondavi" title="Margrit Mondavi">Margrit Mondavi</a></td>
<td>"named in honor of the late Robert and Margrit Mondavi, honoring their tremendous impact on the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/California_wine" title="California wine">CA wine industry</a> and their generous and forward-thinking support of facilities and programs at the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University_of_California_Davis" class="mw-redirect" title="University of California Davis">University of California Davis</a> [where the strain was identified]."</td>

<td><span data-sort-value="Marley, Bob"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_Marley" title="Bob Marley">Bob Marley</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"This <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jamaica" title="Jamaica">Jamaican</a> species, which produces remarkable luminescent displays, is named in honour of the late Jamaican reggae musician, Bob Marley."</td>

<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Archiokrisna_garciamarquezi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Archiokrisna garciamarquezi (page does not exist)">Krisna garciamarquezi</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Dietrich &amp; Vega, 1995</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leafhopper" title="Leafhopper">Leafhopper</a></td>
