<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-350" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-350"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>348<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-351" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-351"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>349<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Kudoa_akihitoi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Kudoa akihitoi (page does not exist)">Kudoa akihitoi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Kasai, Setsuda &amp; Sato, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Myxozoan" class="mw-redirect" title="Myxozoan">Myxozoan</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Akihito" title="Akihito">Akihito</a></td>
<td>A parasite of <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Acanthogobius_hasta&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Acanthogobius hasta (page does not exist)">Acanthogobius hasta</a></i>, collected in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ariake_Sea" title="Ariake Sea">Ariake Sea</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan" title="Japan">Japan</a>, and "named in honor of Akihito, the reigning Emperor of Japan, who has a great interest in science and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ichthyology" title="Ichthyology">ichthyological research</a>, particularly the taxonomy of the family <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gobiidae" title="Gobiidae">Gobiidae</a> [to which the host species belongs], and has previously published in the field."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Emperor_Akihito_cropped_1_Barack_Obama_Emperor_Akihito_and_Empress_Michiko_20140424_1.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Emperor_Akihito_cropped_1_Barack_Obama_Emperor_Akihito_and_E.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="137" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Emperor_Akihito_cropped_1_Barack_Obama_Emperor_Akihito_a_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Emperor_Akihito_cropped_1_Barack_Obama_Emperor_Akihito_a_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="996" data-file-height="1242"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Kudoa2017_352-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Kudoa2017-352"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>350<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Kudoa_empressmichikoae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Kudoa empressmichikoae (page does not exist)">Kudoa empressmichikoae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Kasai, Setsuda &amp; Sato, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Myxozoan" class="mw-redirect" title="Myxozoan">Myxozoan</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Michiko, Empress"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Empress_Michiko" title="Empress Michiko">Empress Michiko</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A parasite of <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Acanthogobius_hasta&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Acanthogobius hasta (page does not exist)">Acanthogobius hasta</a></i>, collected in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ariake_Sea" title="Ariake Sea">Ariake Sea</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan" title="Japan">Japan</a>, and "named in honor of Empress Michiko, the wife of Japan's Emperor <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Akihito" title="Akihito">Akihito</a>, who unfailingly supports his role of monarch and its associated duties."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Empress_Michiko%27s_arrival_in_Manila_-_2016_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Empress_Michiko's_arrival_in_Manila_-_2016_(cropped).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="149" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Empress_Michiko's_arrival_in_Manila_-_2016_(cropped).jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Empress_Michiko's_arrival_in_Manila_-_2016_(cropped).jpg 2x" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="1219"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Kudoa2017_352-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Kudoa2017-352"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>350<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr id="L">
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lagenopolycystis_mandelai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Lagenopolycystis mandelai (page does not exist)">Lagenopolycystis mandelai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Willems &amp; Artois, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flatworm" title="Flatworm">Flatworm</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Mandela, Nelson"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nelson_Mandela" title="Nelson Mandela">Nelson Mandela</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Africa" title="South Africa">South Africa</a> named "in honour of Nelson Mandela (1918–2013), famous anti-apartheid activist, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobel_Peace_Prize" title="Nobel Peace Prize">Nobel Peace Prize</a> laureate (1993, together with <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frederik_Willem_de_Klerk" class="mw-redirect" title="Frederik Willem de Klerk">Frederik Willem de Klerk</a>) and former president of South Africa (1994–1999)."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit)_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="130" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit)_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit).jpg 2x" data-file-width="657" data-file-height="778"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-353" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-353"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>351<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lampanyctus_steinbecki" title="Lampanyctus steinbecki">Lampanyctus steinbecki</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rolf_Ling_Bolin" title="Rolf Ling Bolin">Bolin</a>, 1939</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">Fish</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Steinbeck, John"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Steinbeck" title="John Steinbeck">John Steinbeck</a></span></span></span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rolf_Ling_Bolin" title="Rolf Ling Bolin">Rolf L. Bolin</a>,
 the ichthyologist who described this species, was a friend of John 
Steinbeck (a serious amateur naturalist himself, who enjoyed studying 
the aquatic life of Monterey Bay and the Gulf of California). He 
received a signed first edition of one of Steinbeck's novels, and, 
touched by the gesture, decided to name a newly-discovered species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lanternfish" title="Lanternfish">lanternfish</a>
 after Steinbeck to honor him in return. However, soon afterwards, 
Steinbeck asked for the book back (for unknown reasons) and never 
returned it. Later, Bolin stated that he spent a great deal of time 
thereafter trying to synonymise <i>L. steinbecki</i> with any other species (thus invalidating the name), but did not succeed.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:JohnSteinbeck_crop.JPG" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-JohnSteinbeck_crop.JPG" decoding="async" width="110" height="149" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-JohnSteinbeck_crop.JPG 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-JohnSteinbeck_crop.JPG 2x" data-file-width="1186" data-file-height="1604"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-354" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-354"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>352<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lapisperla&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Lapisperla (page does not exist)">Lapisperla</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Sroka, Staniczek &amp; Kondratieff, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stonefly" class="mw-redirect" title="Stonefly">Stonefly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Rolling Stones, The"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Rolling_Stones" title="The Rolling Stones">The Rolling Stones</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of 2 genera and 7 species of fossil stoneflies found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burmese_amber" title="Burmese amber">Burmese amber</a>,
 and named concurrently in 2018 after The Rolling Stones and its members
 on the occasion of Mick Jagger's 75th birthday (see also species in the
 genera <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Electroneuria&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Electroneuria (page does not exist)">Electroneuria</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Largusoperla&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Largusoperla (page does not exist)">Largusoperla</a></i> and <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Petroperla&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Petroperla (page does not exist)">Petroperla</a></i>).<br>"Burmese amber is one of the oldest resins with insect inclusions, and stoneflies are one of the oldest <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pterygote" class="mw-redirect" title="Pterygote">pterygote</a>
 lineages. What lies closer at hand than to link fossil stoneflies in 
ancient stones with the Rolling Stones and to name the new species after
 the members of the oldest and greatest <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rock_%27n%27_Roll" class="mw-redirect" title="Rock 'n' Roll">Rock 'n' Roll</a>
 Band in the world. The [...] new family and genera are named after 'the
 Stones', and all present and former members of the Rolling Stones are 
honoured with their own species.[...] The first part of the name refers 
to the Rolling Stones and is derived from Latin 'lapis', meaning 
'stone', the suffix 'perla' refers to the stonefly genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perla_(stonefly)" title="Perla (stonefly)">Perla</a></i>."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Lapisperla_keithrichardsi_holotype_Fig3_A.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Lapisperla_keithrichardsi_holotype_Fig3_A_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="82" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Lapisperla_keithrichardsi_holotype_Fig3_A_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Lapisperla_keithrichardsi_holotype_Fig3_A.jpg 2x" data-file-width="585" data-file-height="438"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Rolling_Stones_1965.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rolling_Stones_1965.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="132" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rolling_Stones_1965_002.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="532" data-file-height="636"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-RollingStoneflies_227-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-RollingStoneflies-227"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>226<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lapisperla_keithrichardsi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Lapisperla keithrichardsi (page does not exist)">Lapisperla keithrichardsi</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Sroka, Staniczek &amp; Kondratieff, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stonefly" class="mw-redirect" title="Stonefly">Stonefly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Richards, Keith"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keith_Richards" title="Keith Richards">Keith Richards</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of 2 genera and 7 species of fossil stoneflies found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burmese_amber" title="Burmese amber">Burmese amber</a>,
 and named concurrently in 2018 after The Rolling Stones and its members
 on the occasion of Mick Jagger's 75th birthday (see also species in the
 genera <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Electroneuria&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Electroneuria (page does not exist)">Electroneuria</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Largusoperla&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Largusoperla (page does not exist)">Largusoperla</a></i> and <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Petroperla&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Petroperla (page does not exist)">Petroperla</a></i>).<br>"The name refers to Keith Richards, founding member and guitar player of the Rolling Stones, master of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keith_Richards#Guitarist" title="Keith Richards">ancient art of weaving</a>."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Lapisperla_keithrichardsi_holotype_Fig3_A.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Lapisperla_keithrichardsi_holotype_Fig3_A_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="82" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Lapisperla_keithrichardsi_holotype_Fig3_A_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Lapisperla_keithrichardsi_holotype_Fig3_A.jpg 2x" data-file-width="585" data-file-height="438"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Keith_Richards_2018.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Keith_Richards_2018.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Keith_Richards_2018_002.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="3000" data-file-height="4000"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-RollingStoneflies_227-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-RollingStoneflies-227"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>226<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Largusoperla_billwymani&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Largusoperla billwymani (page does not exist)">Largusoperla billwymani</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Sroka, Staniczek &amp; Kondratieff, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stonefly" class="mw-redirect" title="Stonefly">Stonefly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Wyman, Bill"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bill_Wyman" title="Bill Wyman">Bill Wyman</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of 2 genera and 7 species of fossil stoneflies found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cretaceous" title="Cretaceous">Cretaceous</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burmese_amber" title="Burmese amber">Burmese amber</a>,
 and named concurrently in 2018 after The Rolling Stones and its members
 on the occasion of Mick Jagger's 75th birthday (see also species in the
 genera <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Electroneuria&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Electroneuria (page does not exist)">Electroneuria</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lapisperla&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Lapisperla (page does not exist)">Lapisperla</a></i> and <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Petroperla&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Petroperla (page does not exist)">Petroperla</a></i>).<br>"The name refers to Bill Wyman, former bass player of the Rolling Stones until 1991."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Largusoperla_billwymani_holotype_fig9_A.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Largusoperla_billwymani_holotype_fig9_A_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="74" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Largusoperla_billwymani_holotype_fig9_A.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Largusoperla_billwymani_holotype_fig9_A.jpg 2x" data-file-width="583" data-file-height="392"></a></span></td>

<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Largusoperla_brianjonesi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Largusoperla brianjonesi (page does not exist)">Largusoperla brianjonesi</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Sroka, Staniczek &amp; Kondratieff, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stonefly" class="mw-redirect" title="Stonefly">Stonefly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Jones, Brian"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brian_Jones" title="Brian Jones">Brian Jones</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of 2 genera and 7 species of fossil stoneflies found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cretaceous" title="Cretaceous">Cretaceous</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burmese_amber" title="Burmese amber">Burmese amber</a>,
 and named concurrently in 2018 after The Rolling Stones and its members
 on the occasion of Mick Jagger's 75th birthday (see also species in the
 genera <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Electroneuria&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Electroneuria (page does not exist)">Electroneuria</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lapisperla&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Lapisperla (page does not exist)">Lapisperla</a></i> and <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Petroperla&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Petroperla (page does not exist)">Petroperla</a></i>).<br>"The name refers to Brian Jones, founding member and former guitar player of the Rolling Stones until 1969."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Largusoperla_brianjonesi_holotype_fig15_A.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Largusoperla_brianjonesi_holotype_fig15_A_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="82" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Largusoperla_brianjonesi_holotype_fig15_A.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Largusoperla_brianjonesi_holotype_fig15_A_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="584" data-file-height="437"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Largusoperla_charliewattsi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Largusoperla charliewattsi (page does not exist)">Largusoperla charliewattsi</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Sroka, Staniczek &amp; Kondratieff, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stonefly" class="mw-redirect" title="Stonefly">Stonefly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Watts, Charlie"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlie_Watts" title="Charlie Watts">Charlie Watts</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of 2 genera and 7 species of fossil stoneflies found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cretaceous" title="Cretaceous">Cretaceous</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burmese_amber" title="Burmese amber">Burmese amber</a>,
 and named concurrently in 2018 after The Rolling Stones and its members
 on the occasion of Mick Jagger's 75th birthday (see also species in the
 genera <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Electroneuria&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Electroneuria (page does not exist)">Electroneuria</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lapisperla&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Lapisperla (page does not exist)">Lapisperla</a></i> and <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Petroperla&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Petroperla (page does not exist)">Petroperla</a></i>).<br>"The
 name refers to Charlie Watts, drummer of the Rolling Stones, which is 
most adequate in regard of the pronounced drumming apparatus of the new 
species."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Largusoperla_charliewattsi_holotype_fig7_A.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Largusoperla_charliewattsi_holotype_fig7_A.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="74" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Largusoperla_charliewattsi_holotype_fig7_A_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Largusoperla_charliewattsi_holotype_fig7_A_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="581" data-file-height="389"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Charlie_Watts_on_drums_The_ABC_%26_D_of_Boogie_Woogie_(2010)_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Charlie_Watts_on_drums_The_ABC_&amp;_D_of_Boogie_Woogie_(201_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="127" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Charlie_Watts_on_drums_The_ABC_&amp;_D_of_Boogie_Woogie_(201_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Charlie_Watts_on_drums_The_ABC_&amp;_D_of_Boogie_Woogie_(2010)_(.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1149" data-file-height="1328"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-RollingStoneflies_227-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-RollingStoneflies-227"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>226<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Largusoperla_micktaylori&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Largusoperla micktaylori (page does not exist)">Largusoperla micktaylori</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Sroka, Staniczek &amp; Kondratieff, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stonefly" class="mw-redirect" title="Stonefly">Stonefly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Taylor, Mick"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mick_Taylor" title="Mick Taylor">Mick Taylor</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of 2 genera and 7 species of fossil stoneflies found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cretaceous" title="Cretaceous">Cretaceous</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burmese_amber" title="Burmese amber">Burmese amber</a>,
 and named concurrently in 2018 after The Rolling Stones and its members
 on the occasion of Mick Jagger's 75th birthday (see also species in the
 genera <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Electroneuria&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Electroneuria (page does not exist)">Electroneuria</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lapisperla&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Lapisperla (page does not exist)">Lapisperla</a></i> and <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Petroperla&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Petroperla (page does not exist)">Petroperla</a></i>).<br>"The
 name refers to Mick Taylor, guitar player of the Rolling Stones between
 1969 and 1975 with unmatched virtuosity and dexterity, which is 
reflected by the fingerlike, three-lobed subgenital plate of the new 
species."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Largusoperla_micktaylori_holotype_fig11_A.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Largusoperla_micktaylori_holotype_fig11_A_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="72" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Largusoperla_micktaylori_holotype_fig11_A_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Largusoperla_micktaylori_holotype_fig11_A.jpg 2x" data-file-width="584" data-file-height="384"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Mick_Taylor_3.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Mick_Taylor_3_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="166" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Mick_Taylor_3.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Mick_Taylor_3.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1059" data-file-height="1600"></a></span></td>

<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lasioglossum_hitchensi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Lasioglossum hitchensi (page does not exist)">Lasioglossum (Dialictus) hitchensi</a></i></span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Gibbs, 2012</span></td>

<td>Replacement name for <i>Lasioglossum (Dialictus) atlanticum</i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Mitchell, 1960</span>, a junior secondary homonym of <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lasioglossum_interruptum&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Lasioglossum interruptum (page does not exist)">Lasioglossum interruptum atlanticum</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">(Cockerell, 1938)</span></td>

famous Brazilian writers, born near the type locality of this species."</td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Galeano, Eduardo"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eduardo_Galeano" title="Eduardo Galeano">Eduardo Galeano</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ground_spider" title="Ground spider">ground spider</a> found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uruguay" title="Uruguay">Uruguay</a> and Northern <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina" title="Argentina">Argentina</a>,
 named "in honour of Eduardo Galeano (Montevideo, Uruguay 1940–2015), 
who was a renowned Uruguayan writer and is considered one of the most 
significant Latin American authors of the twentieth century."</td>

<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lemmysuchus" title="Lemmysuchus">Lemmysuchus</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Johnson, Young et al., 2017</span></td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lemmy" title="Lemmy">Lemmy</a></td>
<td>A fossil <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thalattosuchia" title="Thalattosuchia">thalattosuchian</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jurassic" title="Jurassic">Jurassic</a>. Its name means "Lemmy's crocodile".</td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lepidocephalichthys_zeppelini&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Lepidocephalichthys zeppelini (page does not exist)">Lepidocephalichthys zeppelini</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Havird <i>et al.</i>, 2010</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">Fish</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Led_Zeppelin" title="Led Zeppelin">Led Zeppelin</a></td>
<td>"The species name <i>zeppelini</i> is a reference to the 1968–1980 band Led Zeppelin. Use of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibson_EDS-1275" title="Gibson EDS-1275">Gibson EDS-1275</a> double-neck guitar by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jimmy_Page" title="Jimmy Page">Jimmy Page</a>
 reminded us of the diagnostic double lamina circularis of this 
species." The lead author also stated "I'm a big Led Zeppelin fan, and I
 was listening to them while I was working on the fish. The structure 
that makes this species unique just reminded me of the guitar that Jimmy
 Page played."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:LedZeppelinmontage.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/LedZeppelinmontage.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="110" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/LedZeppelinmontage_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/LedZeppelinmontage_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="566" data-file-height="566"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-360" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-360"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>358<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-361" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-361"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>359<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lepisiota_elbazi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Lepisiota elbazi (page does not exist)">Lepisiota elbazi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Sharaf &amp; Hita Garcia, 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ant" title="Ant">Ant</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="El-Baz, Farouk"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Farouk_El-Baz" title="Farouk El-Baz">Farouk El-Baz</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>The name "honors Prof. Farouk El-Baz, the Egyptian space scientist, 
Boston University, USA in recognition of his distinguished scientific 
achievements."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:F_Al-Baz.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/F_Al-Baz_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="186" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/F_Al-Baz.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="149" data-file-height="252"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-362" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-362"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>360<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Leporinus_villasboasorum&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Leporinus villasboasorum (page does not exist)">Leporinus villasboasorum</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Burns <i>et al.</i>, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">Fish</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Villas-B%C3%B4as_brothers" title="Villas-Bôas brothers">Villas-Bôas brothers</a></td>
<td>"Named in honor of Orlando, Cláudio and Leonardo Villas-Bôas, in 
recognition of their pioneering efforts to conserve and protect the rio <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xingu_River" title="Xingu River">Xingu</a>'s marvelous biodiversity, of which <i>Leporinus villasboasorum</i> forms part."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Leporinus_villasboasorum_(34827900073).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Leporinus_villasboasorum_(34827900073).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="54" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Leporinus_villasboasorum_(34827900073)_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Leporinus_villasboasorum_(34827900073)_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3719" data-file-height="1842"></a></span></td>
<td></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-auth_363-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-auth-363"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>361<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lepthercus_mandelai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Lepthercus mandelai (page does not exist)">Lepthercus mandelai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ríos-Tamayo &amp; Lyle, 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Mandela, Nelson"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nelson_Mandela" title="Nelson Mandela">Nelson Mandela</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mygalomorph" class="mw-redirect" title="Mygalomorph">mygalomorph</a> spider from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Africa" title="South Africa">South Africa</a>, named "in honor of Nelson Rolihlahla Mandela, first president of the democratic, post-apartheid South Africa."</td>
<td></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Leptomorphus_mandelai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Leptomorphus mandelai (page does not exist)">Leptomorphus mandelai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Borkent &amp; Wheeler, 2012</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fly" title="Fly">Fly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Mandela, Nelson"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nelson_Mandela" title="Nelson Mandela">Nelson Mandela</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fungus_gnat" title="Fungus gnat">fungus gnat</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Africa" title="South Africa">South Africa</a>, "named in honour of former South African President Nelson R. Mandela, in recognition of his role in ending <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apartheid" title="Apartheid">apartheid</a> in South Africa and for his advocacy of peace, reconciliation and social justice."</td>

and composer who preserved, revived, and further developed traditional <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M%C4%81ori_music" title="Māori music">Māori music</a>."</td>

<td>A fossil genus from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Palaeocene" class="mw-redirect" title="Palaeocene">Palaeocene</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jujuy_Province" title="Jujuy Province">Jujuy Province</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina" title="Argentina">Argentina</a>. The name is "wordplay from Castilian words <i>libélula</i>, meaning Odonata, and <i>libre</i>, meaning free; Lula."</td>

<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lontra_weiri" title="Lontra weiri">Lontra weiri</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Prassack, 2016</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Otter" title="Otter">Otter</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Weir, Bob"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_Weir" title="Bob Weir">Bob Weir</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"Etymology – Old English, 'wer', a structure used to trap fish, 
derivative of root of werian to 'dam up'. A specific epithet with dual 
etymology: weiri reflects the riverine habitat and piscivorous diet of 
river otters; it also honors <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grateful_Dead" title="Grateful Dead">Grateful Dead</a> guitarist, Bob Weir, in celebration of the band's 50th anniversary."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Bob_Weir_playing_with_Ratdog,_PNC_Bank_Arts_Center.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bob_Weir_playing_with_Ratdog,_PNC_Bank_Arts_Center_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bob_Weir_playing_with_Ratdog,_PNC_Bank_Arts_Center_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bob_Weir_playing_with_Ratdog,_PNC_Bank_Arts_Center.jpg 2x" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="1200"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loureedia" title="Loureedia">Loureedia</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Miller et al., 2012</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Reed, Lou"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lou_Reed" title="Lou Reed">Lou Reed</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A genus of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Velvet_spider" title="Velvet spider">velvet spiders</a> "named for Lou Reed, leader of the rock band <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Velvet_Underground" title="The Velvet Underground">The Velvet Underground</a> from 1965–1970."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Loureedia_annulipes_male2.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Loureedia_annulipes_male2_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="68" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Loureedia_annulipes_male2_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Loureedia_annulipes_male2.jpg 2x" data-file-width="340" data-file-height="210"></a></span></td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loxosceles_coheni" title="Loxosceles coheni">Loxosceles coheni</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alireza_Zamani" title="Alireza Zamani">Zamani</a>, Mirshamsi &amp; <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yuri_M._Marusik" title="Yuri M. <td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Cohen, Leonard"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leonard_Cohen" title="Leonard Cohen">Leonard Cohen</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"in honor of Leonard Norman Cohen [...] the most favorite artist of 
the first author, because his music kept him working during the long, 
cold, and dark winters of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Finland" title="Finland">Finland</a>."</td>

<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stag_beetle" title="Stag beetle">stag beetle</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Myanmar" title="Myanmar">Myanmar</a>, "named in honour of the late great patriot U Aung San, father of Myanmar independence."</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lunaceps_rothkoi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Lunaceps rothkoi (page does not exist)">Lunaceps rothkoi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Gustafsson &amp; Olsson, 2012</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Louse" title="Louse">Louse</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Rothko, Mark"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mark_Rothko" title="Mark Rothko">Mark Rothko</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"Named in honour of the painter Mark Rothko (1903–1970), whose painting <i>Saffron</i>
 (1957) is somewhat reminiscent of the colouration and distribution of 
dark and light areas in the head of the holotype. He is also one of the 
first author's favourite painters."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Consuelo_Kanaga,_Mark_Rothko._82.65.453.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Consuelo_Kanaga,_Mark_Rothko._82.65.453.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="93" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Consuelo_Kanaga,_Mark_Rothko._82.65.453_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Consuelo_Kanaga,_Mark_Rothko._82.65.453.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1536" data-file-height="1292"></a></span></td>

<tr id="M">
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mackenziurus_johnnyi" class="mw-redirect" title="Mackenziurus johnnyi">Mackenziurus johnnyi</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Adrain &amp; Edgecombe, 1997</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trilobite" title="Trilobite">Trilobite</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Ramone, Johnny"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Johnny_Ramone" title="Johnny Ramone">Johnny Ramone</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of four species concurrently named in 1997 after members of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Ramones" class="mw-redirect" title="The Ramones">The Ramones</a> (see also <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_organisms_named_after_famous_people_(born_1950%E2%80%93present)" title="List of organisms named after famous people (born 1950–present)">List of organisms named after famous people (born 1950–present)</a>).</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Johnny_Ramone.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Johnny_Ramone_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="144" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Johnny_Ramone.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Johnny_Ramone_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="550" data-file-height="720"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-silurian1997_83-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-silurian1997-83"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>82<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Mahajanganella_fridakahloae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Mahajanganella fridakahloae (page does not exist)">Mahajanganella fridakahloae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Lorenz, Loria, Harvey &amp; Harms, 2022</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pseudoscorpion" title="Pseudoscorpion">Pseudoscorpion</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Kahlo, Frida"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frida_Kahlo" title="Frida Kahlo">Frida Kahlo</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"This species is named after the Mexican artist Frida Kahlo de 
Rivera († 1954) whose unmistakable character were her striking eyebrows,
 which she included in many of her self-portraits. The species is 
reminiscent of her because of the strongly granulated cuticle above the 
second pair of eyes, which resemble 'eyebrows'."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Frida_Kahlo,_by_Guillermo_Kahlo.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Frida_Kahlo,_by_Guillermo_Kahlo.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="165" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Frida_Kahlo,_by_Guillermo_Kahlo_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Frida_Kahlo,_by_Guillermo_Kahlo_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1197" data-file-height="1795"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-LLHH2022_381-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-LLHH2022-381"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>379<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Mahajanganella_schwarzeneggeri&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Mahajanganella schwarzeneggeri (page does not exist)">Mahajanganella schwarzeneggeri</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Lorenz, Loria, Harvey &amp; Harms, 2022</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pseudoscorpion" title="Pseudoscorpion">Pseudoscorpion</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Schwarzenegger, Arnold"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arnold_Schwarzenegger" title="Arnold Schwarzenegger">Arnold Schwarzenegger</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>This species belongs to the group known as <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Feaellidae" title="Feaellidae">Hercules pseudoscorpions</a>, because of their "raptorial <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pedipalp" title="Pedipalp">pedipalps</a>
 with heavily armed and robust pedipalpal femora, resulting in a 
somewhat hulky appearance"; it was named "honoring Arnold 
Schwarzenegger, a famous former bodybuilder from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Austria" title="Austria">Austria</a>, known as an actor in the movie <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Terminator" title="The Terminator">Terminator</a></i>, former <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Governor_of_California" title="Governor of California">governor of California</a> and now supporting conservation programs."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Arnold_Schwarzenegger_by_Gage_Skidmore_4_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/120px-Arnold_Schwarzenegger_by_Gage_Skidmore_4_(cropped).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="140" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/250px-Arnold_Schwarzenegger_by_Gage_Skidmore_4_(cropped).jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="2030" data-file-height="2588"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-LLHH2022_381-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-LLHH2022-381"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>379<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Maisorthina_saroyani&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Maisorthina saroyani (page does not exist)">Maisorthina saroyani</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">García-Alcalde, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brachiopod" title="Brachiopod">Brachiopod</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Saroyan, William"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Saroyan" title="William Saroyan">William Saroyan</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orthida" title="Orthida">orthid</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Devonian" title="Devonian">Devonian</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spain" title="Spain">Spain</a>, "dedicated to William Saroyan, a North American writer of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armenia" title="Armenia">Armenian</a> origin, whose stories of great humanity captivated the author and continue to do so today."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:William_Saroyan_2.JPG" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/William_Saroyan_2_003.JPG" decoding="async" width="110" height="166" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/William_Saroyan_2_002.JPG 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/William_Saroyan_2.JPG 2x" data-file-width="2551" data-file-height="3840"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-382" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-382"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>380<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Malagasya_elvisi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Malagasya elvisi (page does not exist)">Malagasya elvisi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Cumberlidge, Soma, Leever &amp; Daniels, 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crustacean" title="Crustacean">Crustacean</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Presley, Elvis"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elvis_Presley" title="Elvis Presley">Elvis Presley</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The new species is named for the unusual fields of dense short <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Setae" class="mw-redirect" title="Setae">setae</a> lining the margins of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dactylus" title="Dactylus">dactyli</a>
 and part of the propodi [...], which gives the crab the appearance of 
wearing suede shoes on its feet (albeit a brown colour in the type 
specimen). The species epithet "elvisi" is [...] inspired by the song "<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blue_Suede_Shoes" title="Blue Suede Shoes">Blue Suede Shoes</a>" written by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Perkins" title="Carl Perkins">Carl Perkins</a> and made famous by Elvis Presley."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Elvis_Presley_1970.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Elvis_Presley_1970_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="170" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Elvis_Presley_1970_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Elvis_Presley_1970.jpg 2x" data-file-width="987" data-file-height="1521"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-383" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-383"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>381<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Malthinus_rifbjergi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Malthinus rifbjergi (page does not exist)">Malthinus rifbjergi</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Fanti &amp; Damgaard, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Rifbjerg, Klaus"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Klaus_Rifbjerg" title="Klaus Rifbjerg">Klaus Rifbjerg</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soldier_beetle" title="Soldier beetle">soldier beetle</a> found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eocene" title="Eocene">Eocene</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baltic_amber" title="Baltic amber">Baltic amber</a>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Klaus-rifbjerg_DSC03877_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Klaus-rifbjerg_DSC03877_(cropped).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="117" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Klaus-rifbjerg_DSC03877_(cropped)_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Klaus-rifbjerg_DSC03877_(cropped).jpg 2x" data-file-width="279" data-file-height="298"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-FantiDamgaard2018_80-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FantiDamgaard2018-80"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>79<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Malthodes_moellehavei&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Malthodes moellehavei (page does not exist)">Malthodes moellehavei</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Fanti &amp; Damgaard, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Møllehave, Johannes"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Johannes_M%C3%B8llehave" title="Johannes Møllehave">Johannes Møllehave</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soldier_beetle" title="Soldier beetle">soldier beetle</a> found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eocene" title="Eocene">Eocene</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baltic_amber" title="Baltic amber">Baltic amber</a>,
 "named in honour of the Danish priest, author and lecturer Johannes 
Volf Møllehave, to thank him for his work and to further recognize him 
for the awards that he has earned."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Johannes_M%C3%B8llehave_bogforum2011_9694.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Johannes_M%C3%B8llehave_bogforum2011_9694.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="73" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Johannes_M%25C3%25B8llehave_bogforum2011_9694_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Johannes_M%25C3%25B8llehave_bogforum2011_9694_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1000" data-file-height="667"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-FantiDamgaard2018_80-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FantiDamgaard2018-80"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>79<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Mandelara&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Mandelara (page does not exist)">Mandelara</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Malzacher &amp; Staniczek, 2016</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mayfly" title="Mayfly">Mayfly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Mandela, Nelson"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nelson_Mandela" title="Nelson Mandela">Nelson Mandela</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A genus from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Africa" title="South Africa">South Africa</a>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit)_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="130" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit)_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit).jpg 2x" data-file-width="657" data-file-height="778"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mandelia" class="mw-redirect" title="Mandelia">Mandelia</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Valdés &amp; Gosliner, 1999</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nudibranch" title="Nudibranch">Sea slug</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Mandela, Nelson"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nelson_Mandela" title="Nelson Mandela">Nelson Mandela</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"This <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Africa" title="South Africa">South African</a> genus is named <i>Mandelia</i> to honor Nelson Mandela, who led the struggle for a multiracial government in South Africa."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Mandelia_mirocornata.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Mandelia_mirocornata.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="67" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Mandelia_mirocornata_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Mandelia_mirocornata_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1092" data-file-height="664"></a></span></td>

<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-curious_64-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-curious-64"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>63<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-385" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-385"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>383<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Marshiella_lettermani&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Marshiella lettermani (page does not exist)">Marshiella lettermani</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Shaw, 2000</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Letterman, David"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Letterman" title="David Letterman">David Letterman</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The species name is a patronym for David Letterman, host of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Late_Show_with_David_Letterman" title="Late Show with David Letterman">The Late Show</a>,
 in appreciation for his outstanding contributions to late night 
entertainment. Many a dull day has been improved by his humour. It 
somehow seems appropriate that a really weird insect should be named in 
his honor."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:David_Letterman_2012.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/David_Letterman_2012.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="143" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/David_Letterman_2012_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/David_Letterman_2012_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="199" data-file-height="259"></a></span></td>
