</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masiakasaurus_knopfleri" class="mw-redirect" title="Masiakasaurus knopfleri">Masiakasaurus knopfleri</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Sampson, Carrano &amp; Forster, 2001</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dinosaur" title="Dinosaur">Dinosaur</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Knopfler, Mark"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mark_Knopfler" title="Mark Knopfler">Mark Knopfler</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"after singer/songwriter Mark Knopfler, whose music inspired expedition crews."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Masiakasaurus_BW_(flipped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Masiakasaurus_BW_(flipped).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="39" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Masiakasaurus_BW_(flipped)_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Masiakasaurus_BW_(flipped)_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="776" data-file-height="274"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:DSC08946_Mark_Knopfler_Emmylou_Harris_by_Volkan_Yuksel.JPG" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/DSC08946_Mark_Knopfler_Emmylou_Harris_by_Volkan_Yuksel_003.JPG" decoding="async" width="110" height="83" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/DSC08946_Mark_Knopfler_Emmylou_Harris_by_Volkan_Yuksel_002.JPG 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/DSC08946_Mark_Knopfler_Emmylou_Harris_by_Volkan_Yuksel.JPG 2x" data-file-width="2048" data-file-height="1536"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-387" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-387"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>385<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mastophora_dizzydeani" title="Mastophora dizzydeani">Mastophora dizzydeani</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Eberhard, 1981</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Dean, Dizzy"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dizzy_Dean" title="Dizzy Dean">Dizzy Dean</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bolas_spider" title="Bolas spider">bolas spider</a>
 that uses a sticky ball on the end of a thread to catch its prey. 
"Since this spider's livelihood depends on throwing a ball fast and 
accurately, it seems appropriate to name it in honor of one of the 
greatest baseball pitchers of all time, Jerome "Dizzy" Dean."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:DizzyDeanGoudeycard.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/DizzyDeanGoudeycard.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="134" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/DizzyDeanGoudeycard_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-DizzyDeanGoudeycard.jpg 2x" data-file-width="317" data-file-height="386"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-388" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-388"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>386<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Maxillaria_gorbatschowii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Maxillaria gorbatschowii (page does not exist)">Maxillaria gorbatschowii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Vásquez, Dodson &amp; Ibisch, 2001</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orchid" title="Orchid">Orchid</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Gorbachev, Mikhail"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mikhail_Gorbachev" title="Mikhail Gorbachev">Mikhail Gorbachev</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"in honor of Mikhail Gorbachev for his contribution to world peace and to nature conservation as president of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Green_Cross_International" title="Green Cross International">Green Cross International</a>." This species was dedicated to Gorbachev by a friend for his 70th birthday, through a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BIOPAT_%E2%80%93_Patrons_for_Biodiversity" title="BIOPAT – Patrons for Biodiversity">BIOPAT</a> sponsorship.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Gorbachev_(cropped).png" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gorbachev_(cropped)_002.png" decoding="async" width="110" height="143" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gorbachev_(cropped)_003.png 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gorbachev_(cropped).png 2x" data-file-width="894" data-file-height="1160"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-389" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-389"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>387<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-390" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-390"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>388<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><br><sup id="cite_ref-391" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-391"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>389<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Meenoplus_roddenberryi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Meenoplus roddenberryi (page does not exist)">Meenoplus roddenberryi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Hoch &amp; Naranjo, 2012</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hemiptera" title="Hemiptera">True bug</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Roddenberry, Gene"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gene_Roddenberry" title="Gene Roddenberry">Gene Roddenberry</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Troglobiont" class="mw-redirect" title="Troglobiont">cave-dwelling</a> species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Planthopper" title="Planthopper">planthopper</a> named "in honour of Gene Roddenberry (1921–1991), creator and producer of the famous U.S. science fiction tv-series <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Star_Trek" title="Star Trek">Star Trek</a>. The mission of its <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Starship_Enterprise" title="Starship Enterprise">starship Enterprise</a>
 "... to explore strange new worlds, to seek out new life ..., to boldly
 go where no one has gone before" applies – as much as to space – to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biospeleology" title="Biospeleology">biospeleology</a>.
 Gene Roddenberry was fascinated by the exploration of the unknown, and 
we are sure he would be delighted about the discovery of the new life 
form described here."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Gene_Roddenberry_crop.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Gene_Roddenberry_crop.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Gene_Roddenberry_crop.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Gene_Roddenberry_crop.jpg 2x" data-file-width="360" data-file-height="480"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Hoch_et_al_2012_392-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Hoch_et_al_2012-392"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>390<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Megachile_chomskyi" title="Megachile chomskyi">Megachile chomskyi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Sheffield, 2013</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bee" title="Bee">Bee</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Chomsky, Noam"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Noam_Chomsky" title="Noam Chomsky">Noam Chomsky</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>Named after Chomsky for "his many academic achievements and 
contributions as a linguist, philosopher, cognitive scientist, 
historian, political critic, activist and global champion of human 
rights and freedoms".</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Megachile_chomskyi_holotype_-_ZooKeys-283-043-g004.jpeg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Megachile_chomskyi_holotype_-_ZooKeys-283-043-g004.jpeg" decoding="async" width="110" height="82" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Megachile_chomskyi_holotype_-_ZooKeys-283-043-g004.jpeg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Megachile_chomskyi_holotype_-_ZooKeys-283-043-g004.jpeg 2x" data-file-width="1341" data-file-height="998"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Noam_Chomsky,_2004.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Noam_Chomsky,_2004_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Noam_Chomsky,_2004.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Noam_Chomsky,_2004_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1712" data-file-height="2288"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Sheffield2013_393-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Sheffield2013-393"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>391<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Megapropodiphora_arnoldi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Megapropodiphora arnoldi (page does not exist)">Megapropodiphora arnoldi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Brown, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fly" title="Fly">Fly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Schwarzenegger, Arnold"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arnold_Schwarzenegger" title="Arnold Schwarzenegger">Arnold Schwarzenegger</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>World's smallest known fly species. "The genus name is Latin for 
large foreleg, referring to the structure of the female. The specific 
epithet refers to Arnold Schwarzenegger, former governor of California, 
whose own greatly enlarged forelimbs distinguished him in his 
pre-political careers."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Arnold_Schwarzenegger_by_Gage_Skidmore_4_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/120px-Arnold_Schwarzenegger_by_Gage_Skidmore_4_(cropped).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="140" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/250px-Arnold_Schwarzenegger_by_Gage_Skidmore_4_(cropped).jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="2030" data-file-height="2588"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-394" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-394"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>392<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Megascops_stangiae" class="mw-redirect" title="Megascops stangiae">Megascops stangiae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Dantas <i>et al.</i>, 2021</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Owl" title="Owl">Owl</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Stang, Dorothy"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dorothy_Stang" title="Dorothy Stang">Dorothy Stang</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"We name this species in honor of the late Sister Dorothy Mae Stang 
(1931‒2005), who had worked on behalf of poor farmers and the 
environment in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazilian_Amazon" class="mw-redirect" title="Brazilian Amazon">Brazilian Amazon</a> region since the 1960s until she was brutally murdered by ranchers in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anap%C3%BA" class="mw-redirect" title="Anapú">Anapú</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Par%C3%A1" title="Pará">Pará</a>
 State. The common names Xingu Screech Owl (English) and Corujinha do 
Xingu (Portuguese) refer to the area where the species is found, between
 the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tapaj%C3%B3s" title="Tapajós">Tapajós</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xingu_River" title="Xingu River">Xingu</a> rivers, where Dorothy was very active as a community leader and ultimately was killed."</td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-395" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-395"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>393<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Melanoplus_nelsoni&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Melanoplus nelsoni (page does not exist)">Melanoplus nelsoni</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Hill, 2023</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grasshopper" title="Grasshopper">Grasshopper</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Nelson, Willie"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Willie_Nelson" title="Willie Nelson">Willie Nelson</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Texas" title="Texas">Texas</a>,
 USA, "Named in honor of Willie Nelson, an iconic American musician 
entertainer from central Texas whose music lifted our spirits while 
traveling between field sites during this study. After these last few 
summers, just like Mr. Nelson, we too have a little Texas in our souls."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Willie_Nelson_2009.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Willie_Nelson_2009.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="77" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Willie_Nelson_2009.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Willie_Nelson_2009.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3611" data-file-height="2544"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Melanoplus23_396-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Melanoplus23-396"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>394<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Melanoplus_walkeri&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Melanoplus walkeri (page does not exist)">Melanoplus walkeri</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Hill, 2023</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grasshopper" title="Grasshopper">Grasshopper</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Walker, Jerry Jeff"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jerry_Jeff_Walker" title="Jerry Jeff Walker">Jerry Jeff Walker</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Texas" title="Texas">Texas</a>,
 USA, "Named in honor of Jerry Jeff Walker, an iconic Texas musician 
whose most influential album was recorded near the type locality of this
 species in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luckenbach,_Texas" title="Luckenbach, Texas">Luckenbach</a>.
 Walker's songs such as "Hill Country Rain", "Leavin' Texas", and 
"Sangria Wine" brought me and my field team joy while traveling between 
field sites and added to the amazing ambiance of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edwards_Plateau" title="Edwards Plateau">Edwards Plateau</a>."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Jerry_Jeff_Walker.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jerry_Jeff_Walker_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="138" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jerry_Jeff_Walker_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jerry_Jeff_Walker.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1000" data-file-height="1256"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Melanoplus23_396-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Melanoplus23-396"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>394<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tmesiphantes_yupanqui" title="Tmesiphantes yupanqui">Melloleitaoina yupanqui</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Perafán &amp; Pérez-Miles, 2014</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Yupanqui, Atahualpa"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atahualpa_Yupanqui" title="Atahualpa Yupanqui">Atahualpa Yupanqui</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tarantula" title="Tarantula">tarantula</a> described from specimens collected near <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pergamino" title="Pergamino">Pergamino</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina" title="Argentina">Argentina</a>, where Yupanqui was born. Subsequently transferred to genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tmesiphantes" title="Tmesiphantes">Tmesiphantes</a></i>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Atahualpa_Yupanqui_por_Foto_Estudio_Luisita.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Atahualpa_Yupanqui_por_Foto_Estudio_Luisita_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="110" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Atahualpa_Yupanqui_por_Foto_Estudio_Luisita.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Atahualpa_Yupanqui_por_Foto_Estudio_Luisita_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="640" data-file-height="640"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-PeraPere14_397-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PeraPere14-397"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>395<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Tmesi2019_398-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Tmesi2019-398"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>396<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Menabites_tsirananai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Menabites tsirananai (page does not exist)">Menabites tsirananai</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maurice_Collignon" title="Maurice Collignon">Collignon</a>, 1969</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ammonite" class="mw-redirect" title="Ammonite">Ammonite</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Tsiranana, Philibert"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philibert_Tsiranana" title="Philibert Tsiranana">Philibert Tsiranana</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil species from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cretaceous" title="Cretaceous">Cretaceous</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Madagascar" title="Madagascar">Madagascar</a>, "dedicated to Mr. Tsiranana, President of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malagasy_Republic" title="Malagasy Republic">Malagasy Republic</a>,
 to thank him for all that Malagasy Geology owes him, in which he 
continues to take an interest in its research and its multiple 
applications."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Philibert_Tsiranana_1962.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Philibert_Tsiranana_1962_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="146" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Philibert_Tsiranana_1962_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Philibert_Tsiranana_1962.jpg 2x" data-file-width="531" data-file-height="705"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-399" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-399"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>397<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Meoneura_meszarosi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Meoneura meszarosi (page does not exist)">Meoneura meszarosi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Stuke &amp; Freidberg, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fly" title="Fly">Fly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Meszaros, Michu"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michu_Meszaros" title="Michu Meszaros">Michu Meszaros</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>Flies of the genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Meoneura" title="Meoneura">Meoneura</a></i>
 are very small (1–2&nbsp;mm). "The new species is dedicated to the 
Hungarian-born American actor Mihály 'Michu' Mészáros (1939–2016). Only 
84&nbsp;cm tall, he became famous as the "smallest man in the world" 
performing at the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ringling_Bros." class="mw-redirect" title="Ringling Bros.">Ringling Bros.</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barnum_%26_Bailey_Circus" class="mw-redirect" title="Barnum &amp; Bailey Circus">Barnum &amp; Bailey Circus</a> and later as a TV and film actor. He played the role of the alien in the sitcom <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ALF_(TV_series)" title="ALF (TV series)">ALF</a></i> and pictured a strange extraterrestrial creature as an adorable personage."</td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-400" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-400"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>398<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mercurana" title="Mercurana">Mercurana</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Abraham et al., 2013</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frog" title="Frog">Frog</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Mercury, Freddie"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freddie_Mercury" title="Freddie Mercury">Freddie Mercury</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"derived from 'Mercury' as a tribute to Freddie Mercury, late lead singer of the British rock band <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Queen_(band)" title="Queen (band)">Queen</a>, whose vibrant music inspires the authors, in combination with <i>Rana</i> (Linnaeus, 1758), a suffix commonly used for many frog taxa."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Mercurana_myristicapaulstris.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Mercurana_myristicapaulstris.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="73" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Mercurana_myristicapaulstris_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Mercurana_myristicapaulstris_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="5184" data-file-height="3456"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Freddie_Mercury_performing_in_New_Haven,_CT,_November_1977.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Freddie_Mercury_performing_in_New_Haven,_CT,_November_1977.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="163" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Freddie_Mercury_performing_in_New_Haven,_CT,_November__003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Freddie_Mercury_performing_in_New_Haven,_CT,_November__002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3534" data-file-height="5244"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Abraham_et_al_2013_401-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Abraham_et_al_2013-401"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>399<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Mesabolivar_amadoi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Mesabolivar amadoi (page does not exist)">Mesabolivar amadoi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Huber, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Amado, Jorge"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jorge_Amado" title="Jorge Amado">Jorge Amado</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cellar_spider" class="mw-redirect" title="Cellar spider">cellar spider</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil">Brazil</a>, "Named for Jorge Amado (1912–2001), Brazilian writer, author of <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gabriela,_Clove_and_Cinnamon" title="Gabriela, Clove and Cinnamon">Gabriela, Cravo e Canela</a></i>."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Jorge_Amado,_Headshot_2,_1988_(cropped).png" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jorge_Amado,_Headshot_2,_1988_(cropped)_003.png" decoding="async" width="110" height="163" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jorge_Amado,_Headshot_2,_1988_(cropped)_002.png 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jorge_Amado,_Headshot_2,_1988_(cropped).png 2x" data-file-width="2843" data-file-height="4208"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-HuberMesa_130-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HuberMesa-130"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>129<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Mesabolivar_claricae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Mesabolivar claricae (page does not exist)">Mesabolivar claricae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Huber, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Lispector, Clarice"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clarice_Lispector" title="Clarice Lispector">Clarice Lispector</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cellar_spider" class="mw-redirect" title="Cellar spider">cellar spider</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil">Brazil</a>, "Named for Clarice Lispector (1920–1977), Brazilian writer, daughter of Russian-Jewish immigrants, author of <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Near_to_the_Wild_Heart" title="Near to the Wild Heart">Perto do coração selvagem</a></i>."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Clarice_Lispector_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Clarice_Lispector_(cropped)_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="156" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Clarice_Lispector_(cropped).jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Clarice_Lispector_(cropped).jpg 2x" data-file-width="276" data-file-height="392"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-HuberMesa_130-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HuberMesa-130"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>129<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Mesobuthus_brutus&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Mesobuthus brutus (page does not exist)">Mesobuthus brutus</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Fet <i>et al.</i>, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scorpion" title="Scorpion">Scorpion</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brutus_(Czech_band)" title="Brutus (Czech band)">Brutus (Czech band)</a></td>

<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Unho%C5%A1%C5%A5_-_pr%C5%AFb%C4%9Bh_Unho%C5%A1%C5%A5sk%C3%BDch_slavnost%C3%AD_na_V%C3%A1clavsk%C3%A9m_n%C3%A1m%C4%9Bst%C3%AD_v_%C5%99%C3%ADjnu_2024,_koncert_hudebn%C3%AD_skupiny_Brutus_(3).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Unho%25C5%25A1%25C5%25A5_-_pr%25C5%25AFb%25C4%259Bh_Unho%25C5%25A1%25C5%25A5sk%25C3%25BD.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="83" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Unho%25C5%25A1%25C5%25A5_-_pr%25C5%25AFb%25C4%259Bh_Unho%25C5%25A1%25C5%25A5sk%25C_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Unho%25C5%25A1%25C5%25A5_-_pr%25C5%25AFb%25C4%259Bh_Unho%25C5%25A1%25C5%25A5sk%25C_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="4032" data-file-height="3024"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-402" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-402"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>400<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Mesochorus_elionae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Mesochorus elionae (page does not exist)">Mesochorus elionae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Kittel, 2016</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Elion, Gertrude B."><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gertrude_B._Elion" title="Gertrude B. Elion">Gertrude B. Elion</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>Replacement name for <i>Mesochorus niger</i> <span style="font-size:85%;">(Dasch, 1974)</span>, which had originally been described as <i>Piestetron nigrum</i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Dasch, 1974</span>, and was transferred to the genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mesochorus" title="Mesochorus">Mesochorus</a></i> in 1993; when <i>Plectochorus niger</i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Kusigemati, 1967</span> was transferred to the same genus in 1997, becoming <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Mesochorus_niger&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Mesochorus niger (page does not exist)">Mesochorus niger</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">(Kusigemati, 1967)</span>, <i>Mesochorus niger</i> <span style="font-size:85%;">(Dasch, 1974)</span> became a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Junior_homonym" class="mw-redirect" title="Junior homonym">junior homonym</a>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Gertrude_Elion.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Gertrude_Elion.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="133" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Gertrude_Elion.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Gertrude_Elion.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3320" data-file-height="4000"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-89Replacement_224-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-89Replacement-224"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>223<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Mesochorus_leviae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Mesochorus leviae (page does not exist)">Mesochorus leviae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Kittel, 2016</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Levi-Montalcini, Rita"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rita_Levi-Montalcini" title="Rita Levi-Montalcini">Rita Levi-Montalcini</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>Replacement name for <i>Mesochorus inflatus</i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Schwenke, 1999</span>, which was preoccupied by <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Mesochorus_inflatus&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Mesochorus inflatus (page does not exist)">Mesochorus inflatus</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Dasch, 1971</span>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Rita_Levi_Montalcini.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Rita_Levi_Montalcini.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Rita_Levi_Montalcini.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Rita_Levi_Montalcini.jpg 2x" data-file-width="428" data-file-height="571"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-89Replacement_224-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-89Replacement-224"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>223<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Mesopolobus_delafuentei&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Mesopolobus delafuentei (page does not exist)">Mesopolobus delafuentei</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Nieves-Aldrey, Gil-Tapetado &amp; Askew, 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Rodríguez de la Fuente, Félix"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/F%C3%A9lix_Rodr%C3%ADguez_de_la_Fuente" title="Félix Rodríguez de la Fuente">Félix Rodríguez de la Fuente</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The species honours the memory of Dr. Félix Rodríguez de la Fuente 
on the centennial of his birth [actually 92 years had passed; the 
article was published in a monograph honouring Rodríguez de la Fuente on
 the 40th anniversary of his death]. Dr Rodríguez de la Fuente is one of
 the people who contributed most to the conservation of wildlife in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spain" title="Spain">Spain</a>
 and he was a model for a whole generation of biologists and naturalists
 in this country." "The first author is honored to describe this species
 after Dr. Félix Rodríguez de la Fuente, naturalist, excellent 
communicator and pioneer of conservation in Spain, a figure who knew how
 to awaken in me, as in many other young Spaniards of the time, an early
 vocation for zoology, and love and fascination for Nature."</td>
<td></td>

<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Millardaspis_milsteadi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Millardaspis milsteadi (page does not exist)">Millardaspis milsteadi</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">McAdams, Adrain &amp; Karim, 2018</span></td>

<td>Named after Divine's birth name, Glenn Milstead.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Divine-by-origa.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Divine-by-origa.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="85" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Divine-by-origa_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Divine-by-origa_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="567" data-file-height="437"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Ibexaspis2018_199-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ibexaspis2018-199"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>198<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Miscophus_qaboosi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Miscophus qaboosi (page does not exist)">Miscophus qaboosi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Schmid-Egger &amp; Al-Jahdhami, 2022</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qaboos_bin_Said" title="Qaboos bin Said">Qaboos bin Said</a></td>
<td>A species native to the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arabian_Peninsula" title="Arabian Peninsula">Arabian Peninsula</a>, "named in honour to [<i>sic</i>] the late Sultan Qaboos who was president of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oman" title="Oman">Oman</a> for 40 years and one of the very important persons in Oman."</td>
<td></td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flowering_plant" title="Flowering plant">Flowering plant</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sirikit" title="Sirikit">Sirikit</a></td>
<td>A tree of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soursop_family" class="mw-redirect" title="Soursop family">soursop family</a> endemic to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thailand" title="Thailand">Thailand</a>.</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Mitromica_carildae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Mitromica carildae (page does not exist)">Mitromica carildae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Espinosa &amp; Ortea, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_snail" title="Sea snail">Sea snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Oliver Labra, Carilda"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carilda_Oliver_Labra" title="Carilda Oliver Labra">Carilda Oliver Labra</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>Species described from specimens collected in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Varadero" title="Varadero">Varadero</a> beach, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matanzas_Province" title="Matanzas Province">Matanzas Province</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cuba" title="Cuba">Cuba</a>, "Named in honour of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matanzas" title="Matanzas">Matanzas</a>
 poet Carilda Oliver Labra, for her 96 years of fruitful life, whose 
work, full of the purest and most delicate feminine sensuality, is a 
true hymn to love and life."</td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Mizotrechus_edithpiafae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Mizotrechus edithpiafae (page does not exist)">Mizotrechus edithpiafae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terry_Erwin" title="Terry Erwin">Erwin</a>, 2011</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Piaf, Edith"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edith_Piaf" class="mw-redirect" title="Edith Piaf">Edith Piaf</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"based on the full name of Edith Piaf, the famous French singer 
[...], whose voice had an incredible range of diversity, as is that 
found in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carabidae" class="mw-redirect" title="Carabidae">carabid</a> species richness of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guyane" class="mw-redirect" title="Guyane">Guyane</a>, and who sang a variety of "<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Torch_songs" class="mw-redirect" title="Torch songs">torch songs</a>",
 and here I play on the word "torch", the same word that applies to what
 is used to ignite the trees of the unique tropical rainforests of South
 America, an Armageddon in our own times."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Edith_Piaf_Harcourt_1950_1.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Edith_Piaf_Harcourt_1950_1.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Edith_Piaf_Harcourt_1950_1_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Edith_Piaf_Harcourt_1950_1_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="540" data-file-height="721"></a></span></td>

<td><span data-sort-value="Laforêt, Marie"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marie_Lafor%C3%AAt" title="Marie Laforêt">Marie Laforêt</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"based on the full stage name of Marie Laforêt, the famous French 
actress and singer [...], whose voice has a range of diversity like that
 found in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carabidae" class="mw-redirect" title="Carabidae">carabid</a> species richness of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guyane" class="mw-redirect" title="Guyane">Guyane</a>, and who sang a variety of "<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Torch_songs" class="mw-redirect" title="Torch songs">torch songs</a>",
 and here I play on the word "torch", the same word that applies to what
 is used to ignite the trees of the unique tropical rainforests of South
 America, an Armageddon in our own times."</td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mirabal_sisters" title="Mirabal sisters">Mirabal sisters</a></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cellar_spider" class="mw-redirect" title="Cellar spider">cellar spider</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dominican_Republic" title="Dominican Republic">Dominican Republic</a>, whose name "honours the Mirabal sisters, who fervently opposed the dictatorship of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rafael_Trujillo" title="Rafael Trujillo">Trujillo</a>, and formed a group of opponents known as Las Mariposas (The Butterflies). Three of them were assassinated in 1960".</td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Mycomya_bowiei&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Mycomya bowiei (page does not exist)">Mycomya bowiei</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Omad &amp; Pessacq, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fly" title="Fly">Fly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Bowie, David"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Bowie" title="David Bowie">David Bowie</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"in honour of David Bowie, who through his voice and music made our lives better."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:David-Bowie_Chicago_2002-08-08_photoby_Adam-Bielawski-cropped.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/David-Bowie_Chicago_2002-08-08_photoby_Adam-Bielawski-cr_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="129" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/David-Bowie_Chicago_2002-08-08_photoby_Adam-Bielawski-cr_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/David-Bowie_Chicago_2002-08-08_photoby_Adam-Bielawski-croppe.jpg 2x" data-file-width="342" data-file-height="400"></a></span></td>

<td>"I really enjoy his music and have had a great appreciation of him 
as an activist for peace and justice," (discoverer Jason) Bond said of 
Young.</td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crustacean" title="Crustacean">Crustacean</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Holland, Agnieszka"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agnieszka_Holland" title="Agnieszka Holland">Agnieszka Holland</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>Identified by scientists of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University_of_%C5%81%C3%B3d%C5%BA" title="University of Łódź">University of Łódź</a> and "dedicated to Agnieszka Holland, Polish film director and screenwriter, one of Poland's most recognized filmmakers."</td>

<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:U_Thant_(1963).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/U_Thant_(1963)_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/U_Thant_(1963).jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/U_Thant_(1963)_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1013" data-file-height="1353"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Naganishia_kalamii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Naganishia kalamii (page does not exist)">Naganishia kalamii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Venkateswaran, P. Leo &amp; N.K. Singh (2023)</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fungus" title="Fungus">Fungus</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Kalam, A. P. J. Abdul"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A._P._J._Abdul_Kalam" title="A. P. J. Abdul Kalam">A. P. J. Abdul Kalam</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fungal strain isolated during the construction and assembly of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mars_2020" title="Mars 2020">Mars 2020</a> mission components at <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NASA" title="NASA">NASA</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cleanroom" title="Cleanroom">cleanrooms</a>, and named in honor of Indian aerospace scientist A. P. J. Abdul Kalam (two of the taxon authors are Indian).</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:A._P._J._Abdul_Kalam_in_2008.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/A._P._J._Abdul_Kalam_in_2008.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/A._P._J._Abdul_Kalam_in_2008_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/A._P._J._Abdul_Kalam_in_2008_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1624" data-file-height="2165"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-421" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-421"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>419<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Nama_chaslavskae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Nama chaslavskae (page does not exist)">Nama chaslavskae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Meregalli &amp; Borovec, 2023</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weevil" title="Weevil">Weevil</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Čáslavská, Věra"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/V%C4%9Bra_%C4%8C%C3%A1slavsk%C3%A1" title="Věra Čáslavská">Věra Čáslavská</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"This species is named after Věra Čáslavská (1942–2016). She was an 
artistic gymnast and Czech sports official. In addition to her gymnastic
 success, she was known for her consistent outspoken support of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prague_Spring" title="Prague Spring">Czechoslovak democratization movement in 1968</a>. After the Soviet invasion, Čáslavská′s actions resulted in her becoming a <i>persona non grata</i>
 in the new regime. She was forced into retirement and for many years 
was denied the right to travel, work, and attend sporting events."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Vera_Caslavska.JPG" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Vera_Caslavska.JPG" decoding="async" width="110" height="201" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Vera_Caslavska.JPG 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Vera_Caslavska.JPG 2x" data-file-width="332" data-file-height="608"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Nama23_422-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Nama23-422"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>420<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Nama_ginobartalii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Nama ginobartalii (page does not exist)">Nama ginobartalii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Meregalli &amp; Borovec, 2023</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weevil" title="Weevil">Weevil</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Bartali, Gino"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gino_Bartali" title="Gino Bartali">Gino Bartali</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"Gino Bartali (1914–2000) was a champion road cyclist. Bartali 
earned respect for his work helping Jews who were being persecuted by 
the Nazis during the time of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_Social_Republic" title="Italian Social Republic">Italian Social Republic</a> and used his fame to carry messages and documents to the Italian Resistance. In 2013 he was awarded the honorific <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Righteous_Among_the_Nations" title="Righteous Among the Nations">Righteous Among the Nations</a>."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Gino_Bartali_1963.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Gino_Bartali_1963.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="136" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Gino_Bartali_1963.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Gino_Bartali_1963.jpg 2x" data-file-width="831" data-file-height="1024"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Nama23_422-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Nama23-422"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>420<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Nama_peternormani&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Nama peternormani (page does not exist)">Nama peternormani</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Meregalli &amp; Borovec, 2023</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weevil" title="Weevil">Weevil</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Norman, Peter"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_Norman" title="Peter Norman">Peter Norman</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"Peter Norman (1942–2006) was an Australian track athlete, who won the silver medal in the 200 metres at the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1968_Summer_Olympics" title="1968 Summer Olympics">1968 Summer Olympics in Mexico City</a>. During the medal ceremony he wore a badge of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olympic_Project_for_Human_Rights" title="Olympic Project for Human Rights">Olympic Project for Human Rights</a> in support of fellow athletes <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Carlos" title="John Carlos">John Carlos</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tommie_Smith" title="Tommie Smith">Tommie Smith</a>.
 Returning home after the race, he was violently condemned by the 
Australian media for what he did during the award ceremony and 
continually boycotted by sports officials, being forever excluded from 
competitive racing. It was only in 2012 that the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australian_Parliament" class="mw-redirect" title="Australian Parliament">Australian Parliament</a> passed a belated rehabilitation."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Peter_Norman_1970-01.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Peter_Norman_1970-01.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="154" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Peter_Norman_1970-01_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Peter_Norman_1970-01_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="737" data-file-height="1032"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Nama23_422-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Nama23-422"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>420<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Nama_startorum&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Nama startorum (page does not exist)">Nama startorum</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Meregalli &amp; Borovec, 2023</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weevil" title="Weevil">Weevil</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Start, FC"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Death_Match" title="The Death Match">FC Start</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"In 1942 in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kiev" class="mw-redirect" title="Kiev">Kiev</a>, under <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reichskommissariat_Ukraine" title="Reichskommissariat Ukraine">Nazi occupation</a>,
 former footballers linked to the resistance organised a football team, 
named START F.C. The Nazis organised a tournament with five other teams,
 all linked to the Nazi regime. The START team won all the competitions,
 thus providing strong psychological support for the civil resistance 
against the invaders. The species is dedicated to these sportsmen and, 
by extension, to people fighting for their freedom."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Death_match_bill.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Death_match_bill.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="155" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Death_match_bill.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Death_match_bill.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2064" data-file-height="2915"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Nama23_422-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Nama23-422"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>420<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Nama_switzerae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Nama switzerae (page does not exist)">Nama switzerae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Meregalli &amp; Borovec, 2023</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weevil" title="Weevil">Weevil</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Switzer, Kathrine"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kathrine_Switzer" title="Kathrine Switzer">Kathrine Switzer</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"Kathrine Virginia Switzer (born 1947) is an American marathon runner. In 1967 she became the first woman to run the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boston_Marathon" title="Boston Marathon">Boston Marathon</a> as an officially registered competitor. During her run race manager <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jock_Semple" title="Jock Semple">Jock Semple</a> assaulted Switzer, trying to grab her bib number and thereby remove her from official competition. She was inducted into the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Women%27s_Hall_of_Fame" title="National Women's Hall of Fame">National Women's Hall of Fame</a> in 2011 for creating a social revolution by empowering women around the world through running."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Kathrine_Switzer_at_the_2011_Berlin_Marathon_Expo.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Kathrine_Switzer_at_the_2011_Berlin_Marathon_Expo.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="185" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Kathrine_Switzer_at_the_2011_Berlin_Marathon_Expo_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Kathrine_Switzer_at_the_2011_Berlin_Marathon_Expo_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1053" data-file-height="1772"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Nama23_422-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Nama23-422"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>420<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Namalycastis_jaya" title="Namalycastis jaya">Namalycastis jaya</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Magesh et al., 2012</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polychaete" title="Polychaete">Polychaete worm</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Jayalalithaa, J."><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Jayalalithaa" title="J. Jayalalithaa">J. Jayalalithaa</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species from the coast of Southern India, named in honour of former <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chief_minister_of_Tamil_Nadu" class="mw-redirect" title="Chief minister of Tamil Nadu">chief minister of Tamil Nadu</a> Dr. J. Jayalalithaa's contributions towards education for the impoverished people of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tamil_Nadu" title="Tamil Nadu">Tamil Nadu</a>, a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federated_state" title="Federated state">state</a> in southern India, as well as her support for scientific research.</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Namalycastis_jaya_Holotype_illustrations.png" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Namalycastis_jaya_Holotype_illustrations.png" decoding="async" width="110" height="160" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Namalycastis_jaya_Holotype_illustrations.png 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Namalycastis_jaya_Holotype_illustrations_002.png 2x" data-file-width="1438" data-file-height="2096"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:J_Jayalalithaa.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/J_Jayalalithaa.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="138" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/J_Jayalalithaa_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/J_Jayalalithaa_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="656" data-file-height="820"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Mageshetal2012_423-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Mageshetal2012-423"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>421<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Nannotrigona_gaboi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Nannotrigona gaboi (page does not exist)">Nannotrigona gaboi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Jaramillo, Ospina &amp; Gonzalez, 2019</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bee" title="Bee">Bee</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="García Márquez, Gabriel"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gabriel_Garc%C3%ADa_M%C3%A1rquez" title="Gabriel García Márquez">Gabriel García Márquez</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stingless_bee" title="Stingless bee">stingless bee</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colombia" title="Colombia">Colombia</a> whose name "honors the Colombian novelist, short-story writer, screenwriter, journalist, and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1982_Nobel_Prize_in_Literature" title="1982 Nobel Prize in Literature">1982 Nobel Prize</a> laureate Gabriel José de la Concordia García Márquez (6 March 1927–17 April 2014), also known affectionately as Gabo."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Gabriel_Garcia_Marquez.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/120px-Gabriel_Garcia_Marquez.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="165" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/250px-Gabriel_Garcia_Marquez.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="427" data-file-height="640"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-424" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-424"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>422<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Narcissus_yepesii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Narcissus yepesii (page does not exist)">Narcissus yepesii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">S.Ríos, D.Rivera, Alcaraz &amp; Obón</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flowering_plant" title="Flowering plant">Flowering plant</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Yepes, Narciso"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Narciso_Yepes" title="Narciso Yepes">Narciso Yepes</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daffodil" class="mw-redirect" title="Daffodil">daffodil</a>
 or narcissus endemic to Southern Spain, described in 1999 and "named in
 memory of the recently deceased concert guitar player and world famous 
musician Narciso Yepes, born in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lorca,_Spain" title="Lorca, Spain">Lorca (Murcia)</a>, roughly 100&nbsp;km east of the species' type locality."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Narciso_yepes_teatrocolon_1962.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Narciso_yepes_teatrocolon_1962.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Narciso_yepes_teatrocolon_1962_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Narciso_yepes_teatrocolon_1962_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="638" data-file-height="854"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-425" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-425"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>423<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Nausicaamantis_miyazakii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Nausicaamantis miyazakii (page does not exist)">Nausicaamantis miyazakii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Mériguet, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mantis" title="Mantis">Mantis</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Miyazaki, Hayao"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hayao_Miyazaki" title="Hayao Miyazaki">Hayao Miyazaki</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"This species is dedicated to the creator of the work <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nausica%C3%A4_of_the_Valley_of_the_Wind_(manga)" title="Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind (manga)">Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind</a></i>, Hayao Miyazaki. The author, sensitive to our environment, places nature at the centre of several of his works." The genus <i>Nausicaamantis</i>, created concurrently "is dedicated to the manga <i>Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind</i> (<i>Kaze no tani no Naushika</i>)
 by Hayao Miyazaki, published between 1982 and 1995 [...] In this 
ecological fable, the heroine, Nausicaä, a naturalist and benevolent 
character, explores the relationship between humans and a hostile nature
 in a universe where humanity is in its twilight. Insects play a central
 role." <br>This species was described from a single specimen collected in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Madagascar" title="Madagascar">Madagascar</a> in 1906 (112 years before publication) and preserved in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Museum_of_Natural_History,_France" title="National Museum of Natural History, France">National Museum of Natural History, France</a>; its current conservation status is unknown and it may be extinct.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Hayao_Miyazaki_cropped_3_Hayao_Miyazaki_201211.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/120px-Hayao_Miyazaki_cropped_3_Hayao_Miyazaki_201211.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="129" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/250px-Hayao_Miyazaki_cropped_3_Hayao_Miyazaki_201211.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="1770" data-file-height="2073"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-426" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-426"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>424<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Neacomys_vargasllosai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Neacomys vargasllosai (page does not exist)">Neacomys vargasllosai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Hurtado &amp; Pacheco, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rodent" title="Rodent">Rodent</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Vargas Llosa, Mario"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mario_Vargas_Llosa" title="Mario Vargas Llosa">Mario Vargas Llosa</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"in tribute to Mario Vargas Llosa, Peruvian writer and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobel_Prize_in_Literature" title="Nobel Prize in Literature">Nobel Prize winner in Literature</a> 2011. Mario Vargas Llosa was born in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arequipa" title="Arequipa">Arequipa</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peru" title="Peru">Peru</a> (as did [the lead author]), and lived in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bolivia" title="Bolivia">Bolivia</a> (as the current range of <i>N. vargasllosai</i>) the first years of his childhood until he returned back to Peru. He studied Law and Literature in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universidad_Nacional_Mayor_de_San_Marcos" class="mw-redirect" title="Universidad Nacional Mayor de San Marcos">Universidad Nacional Mayor de San Marcos</a>, alma mater of [the authors]"</td>
<td></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Neocybaeina_burnetti&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Neocybaeina burnetti (page does not exist)">Neocybaeina burnetti</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Bennett, 2023</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>

<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-RCC23_188-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-RCC23-188"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>187<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neopalpa_donaldtrumpi" title="Neopalpa donaldtrumpi">Neopalpa donaldtrumpi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Nazari, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moth" title="Moth">Moth</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Trump, Donald"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump" title="Donald Trump">Donald Trump</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>Named due to the resemblance of scales on the head of the moth to Trump's hairstyle</td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Neoperla_teresa&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Neoperla teresa (page does not exist)">Neoperla teresa</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Stark &amp; Sivec, 2008</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stonefly" class="mw-redirect" title="Stonefly">Stonefly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Heinz, Teresa"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teresa_Heinz" title="Teresa Heinz">Teresa Heinz</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The species name [...] honors Teresa Heinz Kerry in recognition of 
her indomitable spirit, wise "opinions" and her strong support of 
environmental issues".</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Teresa_Heinz_Kerry_2013.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Teresa_Heinz_Kerry_2013.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="142" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Teresa_Heinz_Kerry_2013_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Teresa_Heinz_Kerry_2013.jpg 2x" data-file-width="384" data-file-height="496"></a></span></td>
