</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Neopicobia_hepburni&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Neopicobia hepburni (page does not exist)">Neopicobia hepburni</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Glowska &amp; Laniecka, 2014</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mite" title="Mite">Mite</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Hepburn, Audrey"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Audrey_Hepburn" title="Audrey Hepburn">Audrey Hepburn</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"This new species is dedicated to Audrey Hepburn, British actress and humanitarian, for her unique personality and charm."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Audrey_Hepburn_1956_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Audrey_Hepburn_1956_(cropped).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="165" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Audrey_Hepburn_1956_(cropped)_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Audrey_Hepburn_1956_(cropped).jpg 2x" data-file-width="270" data-file-height="405"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-431" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-431"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>429<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neoplecostomus_watersi" title="Neoplecostomus watersi">Neoplecostomus watersi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Silva, Reia, Zawadzki &amp; Roxo, 2019</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catfish" title="Catfish">Catfish</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Waters, Roger"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roger_Waters" title="Roger Waters">Roger Waters</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A freshwater catfish from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paran%C3%A1_River" title="Paraná River">Paraná River</a> basin in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil">Brazil</a>, named "in honor [of] George Roger Waters, an English composer, singer and guitar player from the rock 'n' roll band <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pink_Floyd" title="Pink Floyd">Pink Floyd</a>,
 for his talent as [a] musician and social awareness around [the] world,
 specially his brave concerns [with] Brazilian economic, social and 
politic[al] issues."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Roger_Waters,_San_Jose,_20170607.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Roger_Waters,_San_Jose,_20170607.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="118" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Roger_Waters,_San_Jose,_20170607_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Roger_Waters,_San_Jose,_20170607_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2059" data-file-height="2202"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-432" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-432"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>430<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Neotrichia_bellinii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Neotrichia bellinii (page does not exist)">Neotrichia bellinii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Santos &amp; Nessimian, 2009</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caddisfly" title="Caddisfly">Caddisfly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Bellini, Hilderaldo"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hilderaldo_Bellini" title="Hilderaldo Bellini">Hilderaldo Bellini</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of twelve Brazilian species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hydroptilidae" title="Hydroptilidae">microcaddisflies</a> named in conmemoration of the 50th anniversary of the first <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup" title="FIFA World Cup">FIFA World Cup</a> won by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team" title="Brazil national football team">Brazil</a> (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1958_FIFA_World_Cup" title="1958 FIFA World Cup">Sweden '58</a>), after the eleven players that participated in the final match and the team coach.<br>"This species is named in honor of Bellini (Hilderaldo Luiz Bellini), <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captain_(association_football)" title="Captain (association football)">captain</a> of the Brazilian soccer team of 1958."</td>
<td></td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caddisfly" title="Caddisfly">Caddisfly</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Didi_(footballer,_born_1928)" title="Didi (footballer, born 1928)">Didi</a></td>
<td>One of twelve Brazilian species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hydroptilidae" title="Hydroptilidae">microcaddisflies</a> named in conmemoration of the 50th anniversary of the first <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup" title="FIFA World Cup">FIFA World Cup</a> won by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team" title="Brazil national football team">Brazil</a> (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1958_FIFA_World_Cup" title="1958 FIFA World Cup">Sweden '58</a>), after the eleven players that participated in the final match and the team coach.<br>"This species is named in honor of Didi (Valdir Pereira), <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Midfielder" title="Midfielder">midfielder</a> of the Brazilian soccer team of 1958."</td>

<td>One of twelve Brazilian species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hydroptilidae" title="Hydroptilidae">microcaddisflies</a> named in conmemoration of the 50th anniversary of the first <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup" title="FIFA World Cup">FIFA World Cup</a> won by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team" title="Brazil national football team">Brazil</a> (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1958_FIFA_World_Cup" title="1958 FIFA World Cup">Sweden '58</a>), after the eleven players that participated in the final match and the team coach.<br>"This species is named in honor of Djalma Santos (Dejalma dos Santos), attacking <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Defender_(association_football)#Full-back" title="Defender (association football)">full-back</a> of the Brazilian soccer team of 1958."</td>

<td>One of twelve Brazilian species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hydroptilidae" title="Hydroptilidae">microcaddisflies</a> named in conmemoration of the 50th anniversary of the first <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup" title="FIFA World Cup">FIFA World Cup</a> won by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team" title="Brazil national football team">Brazil</a> (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1958_FIFA_World_Cup" title="1958 FIFA World Cup">Sweden '58</a>), after the eleven players that participated in the final match and the team coach.<br>"This species is named in honor of Vicente Ítalo Feola, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manager_(association_football)" title="Manager (association football)">coach</a> of the Brazilian team of 1958."</td>

<td>One of twelve Brazilian species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hydroptilidae" title="Hydroptilidae">microcaddisflies</a> named in conmemoration of the 50th anniversary of the first <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup" title="FIFA World Cup">FIFA World Cup</a> won by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team" title="Brazil national football team">Brazil</a> (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1958_FIFA_World_Cup" title="1958 FIFA World Cup">Sweden '58</a>), after the eleven players that participated in the final match and the team coach.<br>"This species is named in honor of Garrincha (Manoel Francisco dos Santos), <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Midfielder#Winger" title="Midfielder">right winger</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forward_(association_football)" title="Forward (association football)">forward</a> of the Brazilian soccer team of 1958."</td>

<td>One of twelve Brazilian species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hydroptilidae" title="Hydroptilidae">microcaddisflies</a> named in conmemoration of the 50th anniversary of the first <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup" title="FIFA World Cup">FIFA World Cup</a> won by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team" title="Brazil national football team">Brazil</a> (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1958_FIFA_World_Cup" title="1958 FIFA World Cup">Sweden '58</a>), after the eleven players that participated in the final match and the team coach.<br>"This new species is named in honor of Gilmar (Gilmar dos Santos Neves), <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Goalkeeper_(association_football)" title="Goalkeeper (association football)">goalkeeper</a> of the Brazilian soccer team of 1958."</td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Neotrichia_zagalloi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Neotrichia zagalloi (page does not exist)">Neotrichia zagalloi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Santos &amp; Nessimian, 2009</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caddisfly" title="Caddisfly">Caddisfly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Zagallo, Mário"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M%C3%A1rio_Zagallo" title="Mário Zagallo">Mário Zagallo</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of twelve Brazilian species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hydroptilidae" title="Hydroptilidae">microcaddisflies</a> named in conmemoration of the 50th anniversary of the first <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup" title="FIFA World Cup">FIFA World Cup</a> won by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team" title="Brazil national football team">Brazil</a> (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1958_FIFA_World_Cup" title="1958 FIFA World Cup">Sweden '58</a>), after the eleven players that participated in the final match and the team coach.<br>"This species is named in honor of Zagallo (Mário Zagallo), left <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forward_(association_football)" title="Forward (association football)">forward</a> of the Brazilian soccer team of 1958."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Zagalo,_Fundo_Correio_da_Manh%C3%A3_-_3.tif" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Zagalo,_Fundo_Correio_da_Manh%25C3%25A3_-_3.tif_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="173" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Zagalo,_Fundo_Correio_da_Manh%25C3%25A3_-_3.tif_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Zagalo,_Fundo_Correio_da_Manh%C3%A3_-_3.tif.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1979" data-file-height="3118"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Brazil1958_433-10" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Brazil1958-433"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>431<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Neotrichia_zitoi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Neotrichia zitoi (page does not exist)">Neotrichia zitoi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Santos &amp; Nessimian, 2009</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caddisfly" title="Caddisfly">Caddisfly</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zito_(footballer,_born_1932)" title="Zito (footballer, born 1932)">Zito</a></td>
<td>One of twelve Brazilian species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hydroptilidae" title="Hydroptilidae">microcaddisflies</a> named in conmemoration of the 50th anniversary of the first <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup" title="FIFA World Cup">FIFA World Cup</a> won by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team" title="Brazil national football team">Brazil</a> (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1958_FIFA_World_Cup" title="1958 FIFA World Cup">Sweden '58</a>), after the eleven players that participated in the final match and the team coach.<br>"This species is named in honor of Zito (José Ely de Miranda), <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Midfielder#Defensive_midfielder" title="Midfielder">defensive [midfielder]</a> of the Brazilian soccer team of 1958."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Zito_en_1962.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Zito_en_1962.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Zito_en_1962_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Zito_en_1962.jpg 2x" data-file-width="539" data-file-height="721"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Brazil1958_433-11" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Brazil1958-433"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>431<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neruda_(genus)" class="mw-redirect" title="Neruda (genus)">Neruda</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Turner, 1976</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Butterfly" title="Butterfly">Butterfly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Neruda, Pablo"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pablo_Neruda" title="Pablo Neruda">Pablo Neruda</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Subgenus" title="Subgenus">subgenus</a> of the genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heliconius" title="Heliconius">Heliconius</a></i>.<br>"In continuance of [the] tradition [of using names associated with poetry and the arts for the genus <i>Heliconius</i>], and recalling that the butterflies are South American, the new subgenus is named after the author of <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canto_General#The_Heights_of_Macchu_Picchu" title="Canto General">Alturas de Macchu Picchu</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Veinte_Poemas_de_Amor" class="mw-redirect" title="Veinte Poemas de Amor">Veinte Poemas de Amor</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Residencia_en_la_Tierra" class="mw-redirect" title="Residencia en la Tierra">Residencia en la Tierra</a></i> etc. Señor Pablo Neruda graciously consented to the use of his name, although sadly he did not live to see this paper written."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Neruda_aoede_aoede_MHNT_dos.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Neruda_aoede_aoede_MHNT_dos_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="67" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Neruda_aoede_aoede_MHNT_dos_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Neruda_aoede_aoede_MHNT_dos.jpg 2x" data-file-width="5700" data-file-height="3476"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Pablo_Neruda_1963.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Pablo_Neruda_1963_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="140" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Pablo_Neruda_1963_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Pablo_Neruda_1963.jpg 2x" data-file-width="738" data-file-height="936"></a></span></td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nerudia" title="Nerudia">Nerudia</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Huber, 2000</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Neruda, Pablo"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pablo_Neruda" title="Pablo Neruda">Pablo Neruda</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>This genus is endemic to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chile" title="Chile">Chile</a>.</td>

<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Huber2000_436-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Huber2000-436"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>434<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Nesticus_dykemanae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Nesticus dykemanae (page does not exist)">Nesticus dykemanae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Hedin &amp; Milne, 2023</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Dykeman, Wilma"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wilma_Dykeman" title="Wilma Dykeman">Wilma Dykeman</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scaffold_web_spider" title="Scaffold web spider">scaffold web spider</a> endemic to a small area of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Great_Smoky_Mountains_National_Park" title="Great Smoky Mountains National Park">Great Smoky Mountains National Park</a> on the border between <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tennessee" title="Tennessee">Tennessee</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Carolina" title="North Carolina">North Carolina</a>,
 USA, "Named to honor Wilma Dykeman (1920–2006), a writer, speaker, 
teacher, historian, and environmentalist who spent most of her life in 
western North Carolina and eastern Tennessee. Mrs. Dykeman was devoted 
to social justice and environmental integrity, discussing Appalachian 
water pollution in her classic 1955 book <i>The French Broad</i>, and sharing a social justice award in 1957 for her co-authored book <i>Neither Black Nor White</i>."</td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-437" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-437"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>435<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Noergaardia&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Noergaardia (page does not exist)">Noergaardia</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Fanti &amp; Damgaard, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Nørgaard, Lise"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lise_N%C3%B8rgaard" title="Lise Nørgaard">Lise Nørgaard</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A genus of fossil <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soldier_beetle" title="Soldier beetle">soldier beetles</a> found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eocene" title="Eocene">Eocene</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baltic_amber" title="Baltic amber">Baltic amber</a>,
 "named in honour of the Danish author, journalist, debater and 
scriptwriter Lise Nørgaard [...] as congratulation for her 100th 
birthday (1917–2017) and in honour of her decades of contributions to 
the Danish cultural treasure chest. She is a pioneer in consumer 
journalism, has fought for women's rights and equality and, with her 
strong personality, has influenced and impacted Danish culture."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Lise_N%C3%B8rgaard.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Lise_N%25C3%25B8rgaard_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="156" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Lise_N%C3%B8rgaard.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Lise_N%C3%B8rgaard.jpg 2x" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="849"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Nordus_elytisi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Nordus elytisi (page does not exist)">Nordus elytisi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Chatzimanolis, 2004</span></td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Notiospathius_johnlennoni&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Notiospathius johnlennoni (page does not exist)">Notiospathius johnlennoni</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">De Jesús-Bonilla <i>et al.</i>, 2011</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Lennon, John"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Lennon" title="John Lennon">John Lennon</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>In honor of the 30th anniversary of Lennon's death</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:John_Lennon_1969_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/John_Lennon_1969_(cropped).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="159" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/John_Lennon_1969_(cropped)_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/John_Lennon_1969_(cropped)_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="612" data-file-height="883"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-441" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-441"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>439<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Notogomphus_maathaiae" title="Notogomphus maathaiae">Notogomphus maathaiae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Clausnitzer &amp; Dijkstra, 2005</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dragonfly" title="Dragonfly">Dragonfly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Maathai, Wangari"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wangari_Maathai" class="mw-redirect" title="Wangari Maathai">Wangari Maathai</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"Wangari Maathai, the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobel_Peace_prize" class="mw-redirect" title="Nobel Peace prize">Nobel Peace laureate</a>
 for 2004 and the first African woman to be honoured with this prize, 
was rewarded for her tireless effort to protect Africa's natural 
environment through sustainable solutions for human development. She has
 focused on the protection of Africa's last remaining and fast shrinking
 forests, which led to the foundation of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Green_Belt_Movement" title="Green Belt Movement">Green Belt Movement</a>.
 The Nobel Committee's choice for 2004 emphasizes the importance of the 
protection of the world's natural resources in the fight against 
poverty. Safeguarding forests and watersheds will not only benefit the 
livelihood of individual human beings, but also secure a peaceful future
 for mankind. We wish to acknowledge Wangari Maathai and her 
achievements by naming a forest dwelling odonate from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenya" title="Kenya">Kenya</a> in her honour"</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Wangari_Maathai_in_2001.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Wangari_Maathai_in_2001_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="177" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Wangari_Maathai_in_2001.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Wangari_Maathai_in_2001_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="466" data-file-height="751"></a></span></td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dinosaur" title="Dinosaur">Dinosaur</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Buñuel, Luis"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luis_Bu%C3%B1uel" title="Luis Buñuel">Luis Buñuel</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>An <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iguanodontian" class="mw-redirect" title="Iguanodontian">iguanodontian</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jurassic" title="Jurassic">Jurassic</a> of eastern Spain. The name "honours Luis Buñuel, a prestigious Spanish film director born in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Province_of_Teruel" title="Province of Teruel">province of Teruel</a>." (where the fossils were found).</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ogyges_handali&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ogyges handali (page does not exist)">Ogyges handali</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Cano, 2014</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Handal, Schafik"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Schafik_Handal" class="mw-redirect" title="Schafik Handal">Schafik Handal</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"Named in honor of Commander Dr. Schafik Handal, officially 
recognized as "Hijo Meritísimo de la Ciudad de San Salvador" 
["Meritorious Son of the City of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Salvador" title="San Salvador">San Salvador</a>"] and "Honor al Mérito Centroamericano" ["Central American Merit Honor"], for his efforts in favor of the peace in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Central_America" title="Central America">Central America</a>."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Shafikhandal.JPG" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Shafikhandal.JPG" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Shafikhandal_002.JPG 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Shafikhandal.JPG 2x" data-file-width="480" data-file-height="640"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Oiclus_cousteaui&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Oiclus cousteaui (page does not exist)">Oiclus cousteaui</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ythier, 2019</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scorpion" title="Scorpion">Scorpion</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Cousteau, Jacques"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jacques_Cousteau" title="Jacques Cousteau">Jacques Cousteau</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>The name "honours Mr. Jacques-Yves Cousteau (1910-1997), French 
oceanographic explorer, for his contribution to the creation of the 
National Park of Pigeon, also called <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/R%C3%A9serve_Cousteau" title="Réserve Cousteau">Cousteau reserve</a>, where the new species was found."</td>
<td></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Olea_hensoni&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Olea hensoni (page does not exist)">Olea hensoni</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Filho, Paulay, &amp; Krug, 2019</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_slug" title="Sea slug">Sea slug</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Henson, Jim"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jim_Henson" title="Jim Henson">Jim Henson</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>An <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Egg_predation" title="Egg predation">ovivorous</a>
 (egg-eating) species "named in honor of Jim Henson, creator of the 
muppets who educated and entertained generations of children while they 
ate their eggs for breakfast. As <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kermit_the_Frog" title="Kermit the Frog">Kermit the Frog</a> famously sang, "It's Not Easy Bein' Green," a fitting allusion to the one lineage of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sacoglossan" class="mw-redirect" title="Sacoglossan">sacoglossans</a> that evolved away from herbivory among their many green relatives."</td>
<td></td>

<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ombilinichthys_yamini" class="mw-redirect" title="Ombilinichthys yamini">Ombilinichthys yamini</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Murray <i>et al.</i>, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">Fish</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Yamin, Mohammad"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mohammad_Yamin" title="Mohammad Yamin">Mohammad Yamin</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gourami" title="Gourami">gourami</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eocene" title="Eocene">Eocene</a> deposits found in Talawi, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sumatra" title="Sumatra">Sumatra</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indonesia" title="Indonesia">Indonesia</a>,
 "Named for Mohammad Yamin (1903–1962), historian, poet, playwright, and
 politician, who was born in Talawi, and was named a 'National Hero of 
Indonesia' in part for his role during the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indonesian_National_Revolution" title="Indonesian National Revolution">Indonesian Revolution for Independence</a>."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Ombilinichthys_yamini.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ombilinichthys_yamini_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="82" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ombilinichthys_yamini_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ombilinichthys_yamini.jpg 2x" data-file-width="4116" data-file-height="3072"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Mohammad_Yamin,_Kami_Perkenalkan_(1954),_p31.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Mohammad_Yamin,_Kami_Perkenalkan_(1954),_p31.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="144" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Mohammad_Yamin,_Kami_Perkenalkan_(1954),_p31_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Mohammad_Yamin,_Kami_Perkenalkan_(1954),_p31_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1099" data-file-height="1439"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Oniketia_akihitoi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Oniketia akihitoi (page does not exist)">Oniketia akihitoi</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Marramà, Giusberti &amp; Carnevale, 2022</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">Fish</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Akihito" title="Akihito">Akihito</a></td>
<td>A fossil <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gobiidae" title="Gobiidae">goby</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oligocene" title="Oligocene">Oligocene</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italy" title="Italy">Italy</a>, whose name "honours Akihito, Emperor Emeritus of Japan and renowned <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ichthyologist" class="mw-redirect" title="Ichthyologist">ichthyologist</a>, for his remarkable contributions to the study of extant gobies."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Emperor_Akihito_cropped_1_Barack_Obama_Emperor_Akihito_and_Empress_Michiko_20140424_1.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Emperor_Akihito_cropped_1_Barack_Obama_Emperor_Akihito_and_E.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="137" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Emperor_Akihito_cropped_1_Barack_Obama_Emperor_Akihito_a_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Emperor_Akihito_cropped_1_Barack_Obama_Emperor_Akihito_a_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="996" data-file-height="1242"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-MarrGiCar_139-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-MarrGiCar-139"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>138<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Onocephala_chicomendes&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Onocephala chicomendes (page does not exist)">Onocephala chicomendes</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Monné, Monné, Botero &amp; Carelli, 2016</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>

<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Longhorn_beetle" title="Longhorn beetle">longhorn beetle</a> known only from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Itatiaia_National_Park" title="Itatiaia National Park">Itatiaia National Park</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil">Brazil</a>.</td>
<td></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ophiohamus_georgemartini&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ophiohamus georgemartini (page does not exist)">Ophiohamus georgemartini</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">O'Hara &amp; Harding, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brittle_star" title="Brittle star">Brittle star</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Martin, George R. R."><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_R._R._Martin" title="George R. R. Martin">George R. R. Martin</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"Named after the author, George R.R. Martin, because the large 
marginal disc spines of the new species look similar to the crown on the
 cover of his second book in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Song_of_Ice_and_Fire" title="A Song of Ice and Fire"><i>Game of Thrones</i> series</a>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Clash_of_Kings" title="A Clash of Kings">A Clash of Kings</a></i>."</td>
<td></td>

<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ophiopetagno&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ophiopetagno (page does not exist)">Ophiopetagno</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Thuy, Eriksson &amp; Numberger-Thuy, 2022</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brittle_star" title="Brittle star">Brittle star</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Petagno, Joe"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_Petagno" title="Joe Petagno">Joe Petagno</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil species from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Silurian" title="Silurian">Silurian</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gotland" title="Gotland">Gotland</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sweden" title="Sweden">Sweden</a>,
 which "honours "heavy metal painter" Joe Petagno in recognition of his 
artistic talent and ability to integrate palaeontological imagery into 
his art pieces, to the enrichment of both the music scene and the world 
of science"</td>

<td>A fossil species from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Silurian" title="Silurian">Silurian</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gotland" title="Gotland">Gotland</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sweden" title="Sweden">Sweden</a> "named after John H. Bonham (RIP), also known as 'Bonzo'’, former drummer of rock band <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Led_Zeppelin" title="Led Zeppelin">Led Zeppelin</a>, for raising drumming in rock music to a new level."</td>

<td>A fossil species from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Silurian" title="Silurian">Silurian</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gotland" title="Gotland">Gotland</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sweden" title="Sweden">Sweden</a>
 "named after American rock band Kansas, for producing some of the most 
inspiring songs in the history of rock music, including "<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carry_On_Wayward_Son" title="Carry On Wayward Son">Carry On Wayward Son</a>" and "<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dust_in_the_Wind" title="Dust in the Wind">Dust in the Wind</a>"."</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oreodera_kawasae" title="Oreodera kawasae">Oreodera kawasae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Santos-Silva, Van Roie &amp; Jocqué, 2021</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Kawas, Jeannette"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jeannette_Kawas" title="Jeannette Kawas">Jeannette Kawas</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Longhorn_beetle" title="Longhorn beetle">longhorn beetle</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Honduras" title="Honduras">Honduras</a>
 "named after Blanca Jeannette Kawas Fernández [...] in honor of her 
never-ending efforts to conserve the fauna and flora of Honduras. She 
co-established the Prolansate Foundation, which is still committed to 
protecting the environment while improving the quality of life of the 
local communities. Jeanette was murdered at her home in February 1995."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Oreodera_kawasae_(10.5852-ejt.2021.764.1469)_Figures_13%E2%80%9319.png" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Oreodera_kawasae_(10.5852-ejt.2021.764.1469)_Figures_13%25_003.png" decoding="async" width="110" height="157" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Oreodera_kawasae_(10.5852-ejt.2021.764.1469)_Figures_13%25E2%258.png 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Oreodera_kawasae_(10.5852-ejt.2021.764.1469)_Figures_13%25_002.png 2x" data-file-width="1903" data-file-height="2716"></a></span></td>
<td></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ornamentula_miyazakii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ornamentula miyazakii (page does not exist)">Ornamentula miyazakii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Minowa &amp; Garraffoni, 2021</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gastrotrich" title="Gastrotrich">Hairyback worm</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Miyazaki, Hayao"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hayao_Miyazaki" title="Hayao Miyazaki">Hayao Miyazaki</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"dedicated to animation director Hayao Miyazaki, a highly notorious animator and filmmaker. He animated the fantasy film <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Princess_Mononoke" title="Princess Mononoke">Princess Mononoke</a></i>, and illustrated the character Forest Spirit [...], that at nighttime turns [in]to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daidarabotchi" title="Daidarabotchi">Daidarabotchi</a>, resembling the specimen".</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Ornamentula_miyazakii_(10.3897-zoologia.38.e56781)_Figures_4%E2%80%938.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ornamentula_miyazakii_(10.3897-zoologia.38.e56781)_Figur_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="160" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ornamentula_miyazakii_(10.3897-zoologia.38.e56781)_Figures_4.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="1578" data-file-height="2290"></a></span></td>

<td><span data-sort-value="Nicholson, Jack"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jack_Nicholson" title="Jack Nicholson">Jack Nicholson</a></span></span></span></td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Notoungulate" class="mw-redirect" title="Notoungulate">Notoungulate</a> (an extinct order of mammals)</td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_Purple" title="Deep Purple">Deep Purple</a></td>
<td>A fossil <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henricosborniidae" title="Henricosborniidae">Henricosborniid</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eocene" title="Eocene">Eocene</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina" title="Argentina">Argentina</a>.
 "Named after the British rock band Deep Purple, and in allusion to Las 
Violetas Farm, the locality in which the holotype was found (Spanish <i>violeta</i>, purple)."</td>

<td><span data-sort-value="Welles, Orson"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orson_Welles" title="Orson Welles">Orson Welles</a></span></span></span></td>

<td>A genus of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parasitoid_wasp" title="Parasitoid wasp">parasitoid wasps</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chile" title="Chile">Chile</a>, whose name "honors the author George Orwell, the brilliant and seemingly clairvoyant writer of political science fiction".</td>

<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:9-_Vilnius-Maison_verte-DSC05368-Chiune_Sugihara.JPG" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/9-_Vilnius-Maison_verte-DSC05368-Chiune_Sugihara_002.JPG" decoding="async" width="110" height="139" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/9-_Vilnius-Maison_verte-DSC05368-Chiune_Sugihara_003.JPG 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/9-_Vilnius-Maison_verte-DSC05368-Chiune_Sugihara.JPG 2x" data-file-width="1944" data-file-height="2459"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ozicrypta_tuckeri" title="Ozicrypta tuckeri">Ozicrypta tuckeri</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Raven &amp; Churchill, 1994</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Tucker, Perc"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perc_Tucker" title="Perc Tucker">Perc Tucker</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brushed_trapdoor_spider" class="mw-redirect" title="Brushed trapdoor spider">brushed trapdoor spider</a> endemic to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Queensland" title="Queensland">Queensland</a>, Australia, named "for Mr Perc Tucker, 1919–1980, Member of the Legislative Assembly for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electoral_district_of_Townsville_North" title="Electoral district of Townsville North">Townsville North</a>, 1960–1969, for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electoral_district_of_Townsville_West" title="Electoral district of Townsville West">Townsville West</a> 1969–1974, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deputy_Leader_of_the_Opposition_(Queensland)" title="Deputy Leader of the Opposition (Queensland)">Deputy Leader of the Opposition</a> 1966–1974, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leader_of_the_Opposition_(Queensland)" title="Leader of the Opposition (Queensland)">Leader</a> 1974, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/City_of_Townsville#Mayors" title="City of Townsville">Mayor of Townsville</a> 1970–1980 [<i>sic</i>, actually 1976–1980], who was well known in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Townsville" title="Townsville">Townsville</a> region [the type locality] and highly respected for his many contributions to the community."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Perc_Tucker_1974_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Perc_Tucker_1974_(cropped).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="154" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Perc_Tucker_1974_(cropped)_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Perc_Tucker_1974_(cropped)_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="282" data-file-height="395"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Raven1994_467-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Raven1994-467"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>465<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr id="P">
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pachygnatha_zappa" title="Pachygnatha zappa">Pachygnatha zappa</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Bosmans &amp; Bosselaers, 1994</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Zappa, Frank"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Zappa" title="Frank Zappa">Frank Zappa</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>An <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orb-weaver_spider" title="Orb-weaver spider">orb-weaver spider</a> which has a black marking under its abdomen curiously reminiscent of Frank Zappa's mustache.</td>
<td></td>

<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pachyrhinosaurus_perotorum" class="mw-redirect" title="Pachyrhinosaurus perotorum">Pachyrhinosaurus perotorum</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Hanelt et al., 2012</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dinosaur" title="Dinosaur">Dinosaur</a></td>

<td>"In recognition of members of the Perot family (Margot and H. Ross 
Perot and their children), who have demonstrated a long history of 
supporting science and science education for the public."</td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_lily" class="mw-redirect" title="Sea lily">Sea lily</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Pärt, Arvo"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arvo_P%C3%A4rt" title="Arvo Pärt">Arvo Pärt</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil species from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Silurian" title="Silurian">Silurian</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Estonia" title="Estonia">Estonia</a>, "Named after Arvo Pärt, an Estonian composer of classical and sacred music, including the violin concerto <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tabula_Rasa_(P%C3%A4rt)" title="Tabula Rasa (Pärt)">Tabula Rasa</a></i>."</td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Urvina, Hermelinda"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hermelinda_Urvina" title="Hermelinda Urvina">Hermelinda Urvina</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tarantula" title="Tarantula">tarantula</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ecuador" title="Ecuador">Ecuador</a>
 named "in honour of Hermelinda Urvina Mayorga (1905–2008), an 
Ecuadorian aviator who was the first woman in South America to earn a 
pilot licence. She was also a friend of the pioneering American aviator <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amelia_Earhart" title="Amelia Earhart">Amelia Earhart</a> (1897–1937)."</td>

<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Papasula_abbotti_costelloi" class="mw-redirect" title="Papasula abbotti costelloi">Papasula abbotti costelloi</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Steadman et al., 1988</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bird" title="Bird">Bird</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Costello, Lou"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lou_Costello" title="Lou Costello">Lou Costello</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>An extinct subspecies whose remains have been found in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marquesas_islands" class="mw-redirect" title="Marquesas islands">Marquesas islands</a>, named in allusion to comedy team <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abbott_and_Costello" title="Abbott and Costello">Abbott and Costello</a>; however, the patronym <i>abbotti</i> honors ornithologist <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Louis_Abbott" title="William Louis Abbott">William Louis Abbott</a>, not <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bud_Abbott" title="Bud Abbott">Bud Abbott</a>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Lou_Costello_in_Africa_Screams.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Lou_Costello_in_Africa_Screams.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="137" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Lou_Costello_in_Africa_Screams.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Lou_Costello_in_Africa_Screams.jpg 2x" data-file-width="270" data-file-height="336"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-curious_64-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-curious-64"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>63<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-471" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-471"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>469<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Paraboea_bhumiboliana&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Paraboea bhumiboliana (page does not exist)">Paraboea bhumiboliana</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Triboun &amp; Chuchan</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flowering_plant" title="Flowering plant">Flowering plant</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bhumibol_Adulyadej" title="Bhumibol Adulyadej">Bhumibol Adulyadej</a></td>
<td>A species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gesneriad" class="mw-redirect" title="Gesneriad">gesneriad</a> native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thailand" title="Thailand">Thailand</a>. "The specific epithet refers to the collection locality in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bhumibol_Dam" title="Bhumibol Dam">Bhumibol Dam</a> area in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lamphun_Province" class="mw-redirect" title="Lamphun Province">Lamphun</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tak_Province" class="mw-redirect" title="Tak Province">Tak Provinces</a>
 in Thailand. The name also honours His Majesty King Bhumibol of 
Thailand who has taken a keen interest in the conservation of forests 
and the relationship between people and the environment. This species is
 dedicated to him on the occasion of his 84th Birthday." The plant was 
given the vernacular name "bhumibolin" (ภมพลนทร) by King Bhumibol 
himself.</td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>

<td>A species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Velvet_spider" title="Velvet spider">velvet spider</a> named "in honor of Elvis Aaron Presley, king of rock and roll and subject of innumerable black <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Velvet_painting" title="Velvet painting">velvet paintings</a>."</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Paramicromerys_rabeariveloi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Paramicromerys rabeariveloi (page does not exist)">Paramicromerys rabeariveloi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Huber, 2003</span></td>

<td><span data-sort-value="Rabearivelo, Jean-Joseph"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jean-Joseph_Rabearivelo" title="Jean-Joseph Rabearivelo">Jean-Joseph Rabearivelo</a></span></span></span></td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Paraserica_camillerii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Paraserica camillerii (page does not exist)">Paraserica camillerii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ahrens, Fabrizi, &amp; Liu, 2017</span></td>

<td>"This new species is dedicated to the Sicilian writer, Andrea Camillieri [<i>sic</i>], whose books accompanied [the first author's] work on Chinese Sericini over all the years."</td>

<td>A fossil from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Silurian" title="Silurian">Silurian</a> of Canada. McLauchlan's surname was misspelt in the paper where the species was described and named.</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Peinaleopolynoe_elvisi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Peinaleopolynoe elvisi (page does not exist)">Peinaleopolynoe elvisi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Hatch &amp; Rouse, 2020</span></td>

<td>"named after the legendary King of Rock and Roll, Elvis Presley; the
 iridescent golden/pink elytra are reminiscent of the sparkly, sequined 
costumes he favored in his late career."</td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Peloridinannus_curly&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Peloridinannus curly (page does not exist)">Peloridinannus curly</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Weirauch &amp; Frankenberg, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/True_bug" class="mw-redirect" title="True bug">True bug</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Howard, Curly"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Curly_Howard" title="Curly Howard">Curly Howard</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"Named after Jerome (Curly) Howard, one of the "Three Stooges", for the comical appearance of this species". One of three <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Schizopteridae" title="Schizopteridae">schizopterid</a> bugs named concurrently after the 1934–1946 <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Three_Stooges" class="mw-redirect" title="Three Stooges">Three Stooges</a> (see also <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_organisms_named_after_famous_people_(born_1800%E2%80%931899)" title="List of organisms named after famous people (born 1800–1899)">List of organisms named after famous people (born 1800–1899)</a>).</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Curlyhoward.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Curlyhoward.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="138" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Curlyhoward_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Curlyhoward_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="476" data-file-height="596"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Stooges_482-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Stooges-482"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>480<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Peloridinannus_larry&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Peloridinannus larry (page does not exist)">Peloridinannus larry</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Weirauch &amp; Frankenberg, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/True_bug" class="mw-redirect" title="True bug">True bug</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Fine, Larry"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Larry_Fine" title="Larry Fine">Larry Fine</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"Named after Larry Fine, one of the "Three Stooges", for the comical appearance of this species". One of three <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Schizopteridae" title="Schizopteridae">schizopterid</a> bugs named concurrently after the 1934–1946 <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Three_Stooges" class="mw-redirect" title="Three Stooges">Three Stooges</a> (see also <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_organisms_named_after_famous_people_(born_1800%E2%80%931899)" title="List of organisms named after famous people (born 1800–1899)">List of organisms named after famous people (born 1800–1899)</a>).</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Larry_Fine_in_a_promotional_image_from_1962.png" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Larry_Fine_in_a_promotional_image_from_1962.png" decoding="async" width="110" height="165" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Larry_Fine_in_a_promotional_image_from_1962.png 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Larry_Fine_in_a_promotional_image_from_1962.png 2x" data-file-width="534" data-file-height="801"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perirehaedulus_richardsi" title="Perirehaedulus richardsi">Perirehaedulus richardsi</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Adrain &amp; Edgecombe, 1995</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trilobite" title="Trilobite">Trilobite</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Richards, Keith"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keith_Richards" title="Keith Richards">Keith Richards</a></span></span></span></td>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aegrotocatellus_jaggeri" class="mw-redirect" title="Aegrotocatellus jaggeri">Aegrotocatellus jaggeri</a></i> was named concurrently to honor fellow <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Rolling_Stones" title="The Rolling Stones">Rolling Stones</a> member <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mick_Jagger" title="Mick Jagger">Mick Jagger</a>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Keith_Richards_2018.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Keith_Richards_2018.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Keith_Richards_2018_002.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="3000" data-file-height="4000"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-AdrainEdge95_22-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AdrainEdge95-22"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>21<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-CSN_44-10" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CSN-44"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>43<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Petroperla&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Petroperla (page does not exist)">Petroperla</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Sroka, Staniczek &amp; Kondratieff, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stonefly" class="mw-redirect" title="Stonefly">Stonefly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Rolling Stones, The"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Rolling_Stones" title="The Rolling Stones">The Rolling Stones</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of 2 genera and 7 species of fossil stoneflies found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burmese_amber" title="Burmese amber">Burmese amber</a>,
 and named concurrently in 2018 after The Rolling Stones and its members
 on the occasion of Mick Jagger's 75th birthday (see also species in the
 genera <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Electroneuria&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Electroneuria (page does not exist)">Electroneuria</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lapisperla&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Lapisperla (page does not exist)">Lapisperla</a></i> and <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Largusoperla&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Largusoperla (page does not exist)">Largusoperla</a></i>).<br>"Burmese amber is one of the oldest resins with insect inclusions, and stoneflies are one of the oldest <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pterygote" class="mw-redirect" title="Pterygote">pterygote</a>
 lineages. What lies closer at hand than to link fossil stoneflies in 
ancient stones with the Rolling Stones and to name the new species after
 the members of the oldest and greatest <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rock_%27n%27_Roll" class="mw-redirect" title="Rock 'n' Roll">Rock 'n' Roll</a>
 Band in the world. The [...] new family and genera are named after 'the
 Stones', and all present and former members of the Rolling Stones are 
honoured with their own species.[...] The first part of the compound 
noun refers to the Rolling Stones and is derived from Latin 'petra', 
meaning 'stone', the second part 'perla', refers to the stonefly genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perla_(stonefly)" title="Perla (stonefly)">Perla</a></i>."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Petroperla_mickjaggeri_holotype_Fig1_A.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Petroperla_mickjaggeri_holotype_Fig1_A_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="83" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Petroperla_mickjaggeri_holotype_Fig1_A_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Petroperla_mickjaggeri_holotype_Fig1_A.jpg 2x" data-file-width="585" data-file-height="439"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Rolling_Stones_1965.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rolling_Stones_1965.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="132" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rolling_Stones_1965_002.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="532" data-file-height="636"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-RollingStoneflies_227-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-RollingStoneflies-227"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>226<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Petroperla_mickjaggeri&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Petroperla mickjaggeri (page does not exist)">Petroperla mickjaggeri</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Sroka, Staniczek &amp; Kondratieff, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stonefly" class="mw-redirect" title="Stonefly">Stonefly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Jagger, Mick"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mick_Jagger" title="Mick Jagger">Mick Jagger</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of 2 genera and 7 species of fossil stoneflies found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burmese_amber" title="Burmese amber">Burmese amber</a>,
 and named concurrently in 2018 after The Rolling Stones and its members
 on the occasion of Mick Jagger's 75th birthday (see also species in the
 genera <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Electroneuria&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Electroneuria (page does not exist)">Electroneuria</a></i>, <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lapisperla&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Lapisperla (page does not exist)">Lapisperla</a></i> and <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Largusoperla&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Largusoperla (page does not exist)">Largusoperla</a></i>).<br>"The name refers to Sir Mick Jagger, founding member, harmonica player, and lead singer of the Rolling Stones."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Petroperla_mickjaggeri_holotype_Fig1_A.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Petroperla_mickjaggeri_holotype_Fig1_A_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="83" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Petroperla_mickjaggeri_holotype_Fig1_A_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Petroperla_mickjaggeri_holotype_Fig1_A.jpg 2x" data-file-width="585" data-file-height="439"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Rolling_Stones_04.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Rolling_Stones_04.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="140" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Rolling_Stones_04.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rolling_Stones_04.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1853" data-file-height="2354"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pheidole_harrisonfordi" title="Pheidole harrisonfordi">Pheidole harrisonfordi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Wilson, 2003</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ant" title="Ant">Ant</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Ford, Harrison"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harrison_Ford" title="Harrison Ford">Harrison Ford</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"Named in honor of Harrison Ford, in recognition of his outstanding 
contribution in service and support to tropical conservation, hence the 
habitats in which the <i>Pheidole</i> ants will continue to exist."</td>

and support to tropical conservation, hence the habitats in which the <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pheidole" title="Pheidole">Pheidole</a></i> ants will continue to exist."</td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phialella_zappai" title="Phialella zappai">Phialella zappai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Boero, 1987</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jellyfish" title="Jellyfish">Jellyfish</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Zappa, Frank"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Zappa" title="Frank Zappa">Frank Zappa</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>Named as a plan to meet Zappa, who stated "There is nothing I'd like better than having a jellyfish named after me".</td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pseudophilautus_mooreorum" title="Pseudophilautus mooreorum">Philautus mooreorum</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Meegaskumbura &amp; Manamendra-Arachchi, 2005</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frog" title="Frog">Frog</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Moore, Gordon"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gordon_Moore" title="Gordon Moore">Gordon Moore</a></span></span></span> and Betty Moore</td>
<td>"honouring the benefactors of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gordon_and_Betty_Moore_Foundation" title="Gordon and Betty Moore Foundation">Moore Foundation</a>,
 Dr. Gordon and Betty Moore (b. California, 1929 and 1928, 
respectively), in appreciation of their support of the Global Amphibian 
Assessment and decades of philanthropic work in science and 
conservation."<br>Subsequently transferred to genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pseudophilautus" title="Pseudophilautus">Pseudophilautus</a></i>.</td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Gritts, Franklin"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franklin_Gritts" title="Franklin Gritts">Franklin Gritts</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cellar_spider" class="mw-redirect" title="Cellar spider">cellar spider</a> native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Carolina" title="North Carolina">North Carolina</a>, USA. Gritts was also known as Oau Nah Jusah ("They Have Returned" in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cherokee_language" title="Cherokee language">Cherokee</a>)</td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Pholcus_kingi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Pholcus kingi (page does not exist)">Pholcus kingi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Huber, 2011</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="King Jr., Martin Luther"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martin_Luther_King_Jr." title="Martin Luther King Jr.">Martin Luther King Jr.</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cellar_spider" class="mw-redirect" title="Cellar spider">cellar spider</a> native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tennessee" title="Tennessee">Tennessee</a>, USA.</td>

<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cellar_spider" class="mw-redirect" title="Cellar spider">cellar spider</a> native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tanzania" title="Tanzania">Tanzania</a>.</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Cantikus_sudhami&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Cantikus sudhami (page does not exist)">Pholcus sudhami</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Huber, 2011</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Sudham, Pira"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pira_Sudham" title="Pira Sudham">Pira Sudham</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cellar_spider" class="mw-redirect" title="Cellar spider">cellar spider</a> native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thailand" title="Thailand">Thailand</a>. Subsequently transferred to genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cantikus" title="Cantikus">Cantikus</a></i>.</td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Photinus_fridakhaloae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Photinus fridakhaloae (page does not exist)">Photinus fridakhaloae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Zaragoza-Caballero &amp; González-Ramírez, 2023</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Firefly" title="Firefly">Firefly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Kahlo, Frida"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frida_Kahlo" title="Frida Kahlo">Frida Kahlo</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>This species, described from a holotype collected in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jalisco" title="Jalisco">Jalisco</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico" title="Mexico">Mexico</a>, was "dedicated to the renowned Mexican painter and activist Magdalena Carmen Frida Khalo [<i>sic</i>] Calderón, whose paintings have broken frontiers."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Frida_Kahlo,_by_Guillermo_Kahlo.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Frida_Kahlo,_by_Guillermo_Kahlo.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="165" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Frida_Kahlo,_by_Guillermo_Kahlo_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Frida_Kahlo,_by_Guillermo_Kahlo_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1197" data-file-height="1795"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Photinus_juanrulfoi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Photinus juanrulfoi (page does not exist)">Photinus juanrulfoi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Zaragoza-Caballero &amp; Domínguez-León, 2023</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Firefly" title="Firefly">Firefly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Rulfo, Juan"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juan_Rulfo" title="Juan Rulfo">Juan Rulfo</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>This species, described from specimens collected in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Durango" title="Durango">Durango</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico" title="Mexico">Mexico</a>, was "dedicated to the outstanding Mexican writer Juan Rulfo, renowned for his works <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/El_Llano_en_llamas" title="El Llano en llamas">El Llano en llamas</a></i> and <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pedro_P%C3%A1ramo" title="Pedro Páramo">Pedro Páramo</a></i>."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Rulfo_por_Lyon.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rulfo_por_Lyon.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="153" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rulfo_por_Lyon_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rulfo_por_Lyon_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="724" data-file-height="1008"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phrixotrichus_jara" title="Phrixotrichus jara">Phrixotrichus jara</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Perafán &amp; Pérez-Miles, 2014</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Jara, Víctor"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/V%C3%ADctor_Jara" title="Víctor Jara">Víctor Jara</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tarantula" title="Tarantula">tarantula</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chile" title="Chile">Chile</a>, named "as a recognition to Victor Jara, famous Chilean singer who was killed in 1973, during the government of the dictator <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Augusto_Pinochet" title="Augusto Pinochet">Augusto Pinochet</a>."</td>
<td></td>
