<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phyllodactylus_benedettii" title="Phyllodactylus benedettii">Phyllodactylus benedettii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ramírez-Reyes &amp; Flores-Villela, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lizard" title="Lizard">Lizard</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Benedetti, Mario"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mario_Benedetti" title="Mario Benedetti">Mario Benedetti</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico" title="Mexico">Mexican</a> species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gecko" title="Gecko">gecko</a> "dedicated to the memory of the great <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uruguay" title="Uruguay">Uruguayan</a>
 writer Mario Benedetti in recognition of his prolific literary 
production and critical thinking of great importance in the political 
and social life of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Latin_America" title="Latin America">Latin America</a>."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Mario_Benedetti.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Mario_Benedetti.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="129" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Mario_Benedetti_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Mario_Benedetti_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="300" data-file-height="351"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phyllodytes_amadoi" title="Phyllodytes amadoi">Phyllodytes amadoi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Vörös, Ribeiro Dias &amp; Solé, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frog" title="Frog">Frog</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Amado, Jorge"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jorge_Amado" title="Jorge Amado">Jorge Amado</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"for Jorge Amado, a Brazilian modernist writer who had an enormous 
influence on Brazilian literature. He lived in the same region where the
 new species was discovered and he adored frogs and enjoyed collecting 
all kinds of objects that were related to them. As a well-travelled man,
 he grew a big collection of these "frog-souvenirs" from all over the 
world, which are partially on display in his home in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salvador,_Bahia" title="Salvador, Bahia">Salvador</a>, Brazil."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Phyllodytes_amadoi_Foto_Mirco_Sol%C3%A9.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Phyllodytes_amadoi_Foto_Mirco_Sol%25C3%25A9_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="73" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Phyllodytes_amadoi_Foto_Mirco_Sol%C3%A9.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Phyllodytes_amadoi_Foto_Mirco_Sol%25C3%25A9_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1152" data-file-height="768"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phylloscopus_emilsalimi" class="mw-redirect" title="Phylloscopus emilsalimi">Phylloscopus emilsalimi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Rheindt <i>et al.</i>, 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bird" title="Bird">Bird</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Salim, Emil"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emil_Salim" title="Emil Salim">Emil Salim</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leaf_warbler" title="Leaf warbler">leaf warbler</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taliabu" class="mw-redirect" title="Taliabu">Taliabu</a> island in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indonesia" title="Indonesia">Indonesia</a>,
 named "after Prof Emil Salim, former Minister of Environment of the 
Republic of Indonesia and eminent environmentalist whose actions have 
contributed to more stringent international guidelines regulating 
extractive industries and mining, thereby benefitting many countries' 
natural communities, including Indonesia."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Emil_Salim,_Dewan_Pengarah_BRIN.png" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Emil_Salim,_Dewan_Pengarah_BRIN_002.png" decoding="async" width="110" height="134" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Emil_Salim,_Dewan_Pengarah_BRIN.png 1.5x" data-file-width="297" data-file-height="363"></a></span></td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frog" title="Frog">Frog</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Clapton, Eric"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eric_Clapton" title="Eric Clapton">Eric Clapton</a></span></span></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pinkfloydia" title="Pinkfloydia">Pinkfloydia</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Dimitrov &amp; Hormiga, 2011</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pink_Floyd" title="Pink Floyd">Pink Floyd</a></td>
<td>"Pink Floyd was an innovative group that created music (with) an eclectic mixture of styles. <i>Pinkfloydia</i> has very unusual morphological features and its name aims to reflect its uniqueness."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Pink_Floyd_(1989).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Pink_Floyd_(1989)_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="75" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Pink_Floyd_(1989).jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Pink_Floyd_(1989)_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="872" data-file-height="598"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-DIMITROV_2011_494-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DIMITROV_2011-494"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>492<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lepidothrix_vilasboasi" class="mw-redirect" title="Lepidothrix vilasboasi">Pipra vilasboasi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Helmut_Sick" title="Helmut Sick">Sick</a>, 1959</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bird" title="Bird">Bird</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Villas-B%C3%B4as_brothers" title="Villas-Bôas brothers">Villas-Bôas brothers</a></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manakin" title="Manakin">manakin</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amazon_rainforest" title="Amazon rainforest">Amazon rainforest</a>. Subsequently transferred to genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lepidothrix" title="Lepidothrix">Lepidothrix</a></i>.</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Lepidothrix_vilasboasi_MNB_59.27_DSCF5194_cropped.png" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Lepidothrix_vilasboasi_MNB_59.27_DSCF5194_cropped_002.png" decoding="async" width="110" height="88" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Lepidothrix_vilasboasi_MNB_59.27_DSCF5194_cropped_003.png 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Lepidothrix_vilasboasi_MNB_59.27_DSCF5194_cropped.png 2x" data-file-width="1222" data-file-height="976"></a></span></td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pterophyllum_leopoldi" title="Pterophyllum leopoldi">Plataxoides leopoldi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jean-Pierre_Gosse" title="Jean-Pierre Gosse">Gosse</a>, 1963</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">Fish</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leopold_III_of_Belgium" title="Leopold III of Belgium">Leopold III of Belgium</a></td>
<td>A freshwater angelfish species from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amazon_River" title="Amazon River">Amazon River</a>, named in honor of King Leopold III of Belgium, who sponsored the 1962 Amazon expedition and helped collect the type specimens.<br>Subsequently transferred to genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pterophyllum" title="Pterophyllum">Pterophyllum</a></i>.</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Pleisticanthoides_piccardorum&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Pleisticanthoides piccardorum (page does not exist)">Pleisticanthoides piccardorum</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ng &amp; Richer de Forges, 2012</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crustacean" title="Crustacean">Crustacean</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Piccard, Auguste"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Auguste_Piccard" title="Auguste Piccard">Auguste Piccard</a></span></span></span> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jacques_Piccard" title="Jacques Piccard">Jacques Piccard</a></td>
<td>"The name honors the Piccard family, Auguste Piccard (1884–1962), the inventor of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bathyscaphe" title="Bathyscaphe">bathyscaphe</a>, and his son, Jacques Ernest-Jean Piccard (1922–2008), who, together with U.S. Navy officer <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Don_Walsh" title="Don Walsh">Don Walsh</a>, were the first men to dive to a record depth of 10,915 m in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mariana_Trench" title="Mariana Trench">Mariana Trench</a> in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trieste_(bathyscaphe)" title="Trieste (bathyscaphe)">Trieste</a> on January 23, 1960."</td>

his trips with the <i>Nordkaperen</i> ship."</td>

<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Podocotyle_nimoyi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Podocotyle nimoyi (page does not exist)">Podocotyle nimoyi</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Blend, Dronen &amp; Armstrong, 2016</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trematoda" title="Trematoda">Fluke</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Nimoy, Leonard"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leonard_Nimoy" title="Leonard Nimoy">Leonard Nimoy</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A marine fluke that parasitises <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grenadiers_(fish)" title="Grenadiers (fish)">grenadiers</a> in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gulf_of_Mexico" title="Gulf of Mexico">Gulf of Mexico</a>.<br> "named in honor of the passing of Leonard Nimoy, an actor in the <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Star_Trek" title="Star Trek">Star Trek</a></i> television series and movies. His fictional character, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mr._Spock" class="mw-redirect" title="Mr. Spock">Mr. Spock</a>, and his career strongly influenced one of us in childhood to pursue a career in science."</td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bhumibol_Adulyadej" title="Bhumibol Adulyadej">Bhumibol Adulyadej</a></td>
<td>"Named after the King of Thailand Bhumibol Adulyadej who died on October 13, 2016."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Bhumibol_Adulyadej_2010-9-29_2_cropped.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/120px-Bhumibol_Adulyadej_2010-9-29_2_cropped.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="145" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/250px-Bhumibol_Adulyadej_2010-9-29_2_cropped.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="802" data-file-height="1058"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-504" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-504"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>502<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Indochinamon_bhumibol&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Indochinamon bhumibol (page does not exist)">Potamon bhumibol</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Naiyanetr, 2001</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crustacean" title="Crustacean">Crustacean</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bhumibol_Adulyadej" title="Bhumibol Adulyadej">Bhumibol Adulyadej</a></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freshwater_crab" title="Freshwater crab">freshwater crab</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thailand" title="Thailand">Thailand</a>,
 named "in honour of His Majesty King Bhumibol Adulyadej at the occasion
 of His Majesty's 72nd birthday, as a token of respect and recognition 
of the great interest shown by His Majesty in the natural history and 
conservation of wildlife in Thailand. His Majesty the King graciously 
permitted the use of His name for this remarkable and most interesting 
species, which is the largest species of freshwater crab known from 
Thailand."<br>Subsequently transferred to genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indochinamon" title="Indochinamon">Indochinamon</a></i>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Bhumibol_Adulyadej_2010-9-29_2_cropped.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/120px-Bhumibol_Adulyadej_2010-9-29_2_cropped.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="145" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/250px-Bhumibol_Adulyadej_2010-9-29_2_cropped.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="802" data-file-height="1058"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-505" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-505"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>503<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-506" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-506"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>504<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Potamotrygon_leopoldi" class="mw-redirect" title="Potamotrygon leopoldi">Potamotrygon leopoldi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Castex &amp; Castello, 1970</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stingray" title="Stingray">Stingray</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leopold_III_of_Belgium" title="Leopold III of Belgium">Leopold III of Belgium</a></td>
<td>A South American freshwater stingray known as <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xingu_River" title="Xingu River">Xingu River</a>
 ray, white-blotched river stingray, or polka-dot stingray, named in 
honor of Leopold III, sponsor of scientific studies at the Institut 
Royal des Sciences Naturelles de Belgique.</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:White-blotched_River_Stingray_Potamotrygon_leopoldi_2284px.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/White-blotched_River_Stingray_Potamotrygon_leopoldi_22_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="67" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/White-blotched_River_Stingray_Potamotrygon_leopoldi_2284px.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/White-blotched_River_Stingray_Potamotrygon_leopoldi_22_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2284" data-file-height="1400"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Leopold_III_(1934).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Leopold_III_(1934)_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="143" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Leopold_III_(1934).jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Leopold_III_(1934).jpg 2x" data-file-width="561" data-file-height="730"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-ETYFish_Myliobat_507-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ETYFish_Myliobat-507"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>505<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Potosa_elsanto&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Potosa elsanto (page does not exist)">Potosa elsanto</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Cruz-López, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harvestman" class="mw-redirect" title="Harvestman">Harvestman</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Santo, El"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/El_Santo" title="El Santo">El Santo</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"in honor to Rodolfo Guzmán Huerta, a.k.a "El Santo", an emblematic Mexican wrestler and actor who was born in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hidalgo_(state)" title="Hidalgo (state)">Hidalgo, Mexico</a>, where the type locality is located."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Tulancingo_(60)_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Tulancingo_(60)_(cropped).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="149" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Tulancingo_(60)_(cropped)_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Tulancingo_(60)_(cropped)_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="986" data-file-height="1338"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Predatoroonops" title="Predatoroonops">Predatoroonops schwarzeneggeri</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Brescovit, Rheims &amp; Ott, 2012</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Schwarzenegger, Arnold"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arnold_Schwarzenegger" title="Arnold Schwarzenegger">Arnold Schwarzenegger</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>The generic name <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Predatoroonops" title="Predatoroonops">Predatoroonops</a></i> "is a contraction of "Predator <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oonops" title="Oonops">Oonops</a></i>," taken from the science-fiction action movie <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Predator_(film)" title="Predator (film)">Predator</a></i>. The name refers the fact that all species show the frontal area of the male <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chelicerae" title="Chelicerae">chelicerae</a> with modified structures that resemble the face of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Predator_(fictional_species)" title="Predator (fictional species)">Predator character</a> [...]. It is also a homage to the 25th anniversary of this blockbuster success." Schwarzenegger is the star of the film.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Arnold_Schwarzenegger_by_Gage_Skidmore_4_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/120px-Arnold_Schwarzenegger_by_Gage_Skidmore_4_(cropped).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="140" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/250px-Arnold_Schwarzenegger_by_Gage_Skidmore_4_(cropped).jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="2030" data-file-height="2588"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Predatoronops_509-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Predatoronops-509"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>507<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Predatoroonops" title="Predatoroonops">Predatoroonops stani</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Pereira &amp; Labarque, 2021</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Winston, Stan"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stan_Winston" title="Stan Winston">Stan Winston</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>The specific name honors Stanley "Stan" Winston, responsible for the visual effects in the movie <i>Predator</i> of 1987, a category in which the movie was nominated for an <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Academy_Award_for_Best_Visual_Effects" title="Academy Award for Best Visual Effects">Oscar</a> in 1988."</td>
<td></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Preseucoela_imallshookupis" title="Preseucoela imallshookupis">Preseucoela imallshookupis</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Buffington, 2004</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Presley, Elvis"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elvis_Presley" title="Elvis Presley">Elvis Presley</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>The genus name derives from Presley's last name, while the specific name derives from Presley's song "<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/All_Shook_Up" title="All Shook Up">All Shook Up</a>".</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Priolepis_akihitoi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Priolepis akihitoi (page does not exist)">Priolepis akihitoi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Hoese &amp; <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Helen_K._Larson" title="Helen K. "This species is known under the name Koku-ten-benkeihaze in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan" title="Japan">Japan</a> and Emperor Reefgoby in Australia."</td>

<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Emperor_Akihito_cropped_1_Barack_Obama_Emperor_Akihito_and_Empress_Michiko_20140424_1.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Emperor_Akihito_cropped_1_Barack_Obama_Emperor_Akihito_and_E.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="137" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Emperor_Akihito_cropped_1_Barack_Obama_Emperor_Akihito_a_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Emperor_Akihito_cropped_1_Barack_Obama_Emperor_Akihito_a_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="996" data-file-height="1242"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pristimantis_chomskyi" class="mw-redirect" title="Pristimantis chomskyi">Pristimantis chomskyi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Páez &amp; Ron, 2019</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frog" title="Frog">Frog</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Chomsky, Noam"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Noam_Chomsky" title="Noam Chomsky">Noam Chomsky</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"a patronym for Noam Chomsky, US-born theoretical linguist and one 
of the most cited modern scholars. Chomsky is the founder of modern 
linguistics. He developed the concept of "<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universal_grammar" title="Universal grammar">universal grammar</a>," an innate cognitive capacity, shared by all humans, which allows to learn and communicate through complex speech".</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Noam_Chomsky,_2004.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Noam_Chomsky,_2004_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Noam_Chomsky,_2004.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Noam_Chomsky,_2004_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1712" data-file-height="2288"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Pristimantis2019_513-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Pristimantis2019-513"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>511<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Pristimantis_ledzeppelin&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Pristimantis ledzeppelin (page does not exist)">Pristimantis ledzeppelin</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Brito-Zapata &amp; Reyes-Puig, 2021</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frog" title="Frog">Frog</a></td>

Zeppelin was a British rock band formed in London in 1968, one of the 
most influential bands throughout the 1970s, and progenitors of both 
hard rock and heavy metal"</td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Proctophyllodes_carmenmirandae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Proctophyllodes carmenmirandae (page does not exist)">Proctophyllodes carmenmirandae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Pedroso &amp; Hernandes, 2021</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mite" title="Mite">Mite</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Miranda, Carmen"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carmen_Miranda" title="Carmen Miranda">Carmen Miranda</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A parasitic <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Feather_mite" title="Feather mite">feather mite</a> that affects the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rufous-collared_sparrow" title="Rufous-collared sparrow">Rufous-collared sparrow</a> (<i>Zonotrichia capensis</i>) in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil">Brazil</a>, "named after the famous Portuguese-born Brazilian female singer Carmen Miranda (1909–1955), who made famous the song "<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tico-Tico_no_Fub%C3%A1" title="Tico-Tico no Fubá">Tico-Tico no Fubá</a>", composed by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zequinha_de_Abreu" title="Zequinha de Abreu">Zequinha de Abreu</a> in 1917, which is about the Rufous-collared Sparrow (<i>Z. capensis</i>) that is eating her corn meals."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Carmen_Miranda_in_That_Night_in_Rio_(1941).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Carmen_Miranda_in_That_Night_in_Rio_(1941).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="137" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Carmen_Miranda_in_That_Night_in_Rio_(1941)_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Carmen_Miranda_in_That_Night_in_Rio_(1941)_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1770" data-file-height="2200"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-515" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-515"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>513<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Promyrmekiaphila_korematsui&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Promyrmekiaphila korematsui (page does not exist)">Promyrmekiaphila korematsui</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Bond, Jochim, Quayle &amp; Starrett, 2024</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Korematsu, Fred"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fred_Korematsu" title="Fred Korematsu">Fred Korematsu</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trapdoor_spider" class="mw-redirect" title="Trapdoor spider">trapdoor spider</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Francisco_Bay_Area" title="San Francisco Bay Area">San Francisco Bay Area</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/California" title="California">California</a>, named in honor of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oakland" class="mw-redirect" title="Oakland">Oakland</a>-born Fred Toyosaburo Korematsu by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UC_Davis" class="mw-redirect" title="UC Davis">UC Davis</a> scientists. "Korematsu was awarded the United States <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Presidential_Medal_of_Freedom" title="Presidential Medal of Freedom">Presidential Medal of Freedom</a> in 1998 in recognition of his lifelong dedication as a civil rights activist and his resistance to the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internment_of_Japanese_Americans" title="Internment of Japanese Americans">incarceration of Japanese Americans in concentration camps</a> during World War II."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Fred_Korematsu.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Fred_Korematsu.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="168" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Fred_Korematsu_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Fred_Korematsu.jpg 2x" data-file-width="202" data-file-height="308"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-516" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-516"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>514<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>

<td><span class="nowrap"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Propionibacterium_acnes_type_zappae" title="Propionibacterium acnes type zappae"><i>Propionibacterium acnes</i> type Zappae</a></span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Campisano et al., 2014</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bacterium" class="mw-redirect" title="Bacterium">Bacterium</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Zappa, Frank"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Zappa" title="Frank Zappa">Frank Zappa</a></span></span></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Protognathinus_spielbergi" class="mw-redirect" title="Protognathinus spielbergi">Protognathinus spielbergi</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Chalumeau &amp; Brochier, 2001</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Spielberg, Steven"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steven_Spielberg" title="Steven Spielberg">Steven Spielberg</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stag_beetle" title="Stag beetle">stag beetle</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eocene" title="Eocene">Eocene</a>, found at the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Messel_pit" class="mw-redirect" title="Messel pit">Messel pit</a>, Germany. <br> "We are pleased to dedicate this exceptional species to the director Stephen [<i>sic</i>] Spielberg, whose film <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jurassic_Park_(film)" title="Jurassic Park (film)">Jurassic Park</a></i> contributed to the revival of interest in the earth's ancient past."</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Prunum_quini&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Prunum quini (page does not exist)">Prunum quini</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ortea &amp; Espinosa, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_snail" title="Sea snail">Sea snail</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quini" title="Quini">Quini</a></td>
<td>"Dedicated to Quini (Enrique Castro) in heartfelt tribute to "the 
sorcerer", a master of soccer and a great human being", "Named in honour
 of Quini (Enrique Castro, 1950–2018), a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">football</a>
 sage and a good person of the generation of the authors, who passed 
away on a sad day of February leaving us his spirit, his legend and a 
rallying cry for ever: Now Quini now, now Quini... GOOOAL, from heaven."
 This species was found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Havana" title="Havana">Havana</a>, a city twinned with <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gij%C3%B3n" title="Gijón">Gijón</a>, Quini's adoptive hometown; it was also found to share the same habitats as <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prunum_gijon" title="Prunum gijon">Prunum gijon</a></i>, which is named after Gijón.</td>

<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psephophorus_terrypratchetti" class="mw-redirect" title="Psephophorus terrypratchetti">Psephophorus terrypratchetti</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Köhler, 1995</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turtle" title="Turtle">Turtle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Pratchett, Terry"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terry_Pratchett" title="Terry Pratchett">Terry Pratchett</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil species of marine turtle from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eocene" title="Eocene">Eocene</a>
 of New Zealand. "In honour of the British novelist Terry Pratchett, 
whose wonderful style and great sense of humour, combined with his deep 
affection for turtles, merits the naming of this new species after him".
 Pratchett wrote a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Discworld" title="Discworld">series of fantasy books</a> set on a world carried on the back of a giant turtle.</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Psephophorus_NT_small.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Psephophorus_NT_small.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="83" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Psephophorus_NT_small_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Psephophorus_NT_small_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="450"></a></span></td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Pseudapanteles_alfiopivai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Pseudapanteles alfiopivai (page does not exist)">Pseudapanteles alfiopivai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Fernández-Triana &amp; Whitfield, 2014</span></td>

<td>"in recognition of his many years of administrative support to ... <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Instituto_Nacional_de_Biodiversidad" title="Instituto Nacional de Biodiversidad">INBio</a> ... and of his policy efforts on behalf of conserving biodiversity in Costa Rica."</td>
<td></td>

<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Fernandez-Triana_et_al_2014_523-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Fernandez-Triana_et_al_2014-523"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>521<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Pseudapanteles_margaritapenonae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Pseudapanteles margaritapenonae (page does not exist)">Pseudapanteles margaritapenonae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Fernández-Triana &amp; Whitfield, 2014</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Penón, Margarita"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Margarita_Pen%C3%B3n" title="Margarita Penón">Margarita Penón</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"who listened patiently ... and thereby set the process in motion 
that protects all of these wasps and hundreds of thousands of other ACG 
species."</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Pseudharpinia_bonhami&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Pseudharpinia bonhami (page does not exist)">Pseudharpinia bonhami</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Andrade &amp; Senna, 2020</span></td>

<td><span data-sort-value="Bonham, John"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Bonham" title="John Bonham">John Bonham</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of four species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amphipoda" title="Amphipoda">amphipods</a> named concurrently after the members of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Led_Zeppelin" title="Led Zeppelin">Led Zeppelin</a>.<br>"Named
 after John Bonham (1948–1980), drummer of the band Led Zeppelin, who 
inspired many generations of musicians with his outstanding talent and 
unique way of playing."</td>

<td><span data-sort-value="Jones (musician), John Paul"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Paul_Jones_(musician)" title="John Paul Jones (musician)">John Paul Jones (musician)</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of four species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amphipoda" title="Amphipoda">amphipods</a> named concurrently after the members of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Led_Zeppelin" title="Led Zeppelin">Led Zeppelin</a>.<br>"Named
 after John Paul Jones, artistic name of John Richard Baldwin also known
 as Jonesy, bassist/keyboardist of the band Led Zeppelin, as a homage to
 his brilliance and contributions to music as a multi-instrumentalist."</td>

<td>One of four species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amphipoda" title="Amphipoda">amphipods</a> named concurrently after the members of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Led_Zeppelin" title="Led Zeppelin">Led Zeppelin</a>.<br>"Named
 after Jimmy Page, artistic name of James Patrick Page, guitarist and 
founder of the band Led Zeppelin, considered one of the most influential
 guitarists in the world, inspiring not only musicians but we both 
authors during scientific discussions."</td>

<td>Identified by scientists of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University_of_%C5%81%C3%B3d%C5%BA" title="University of Łódź">University of Łódź</a> and "dedicated to Wisława Szymborska, a Polish poet and essayist, a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobel_Prize_in_Literature" title="Nobel Prize in Literature">Nobel Prize Laureate in literature</a>."</td>
<td></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Pseudotrogulus_pagu&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Pseudotrogulus pagu (page does not exist)">Pseudotrogulus pagu</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">DaSilva &amp; Pinto-da-Rocha, 2010</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harvestman" class="mw-redirect" title="Harvestman">Harvestman</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pagu" title="Pagu">Pagu</a></td>
<td>A species from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S%C3%A3o_Paulo_state" class="mw-redirect" title="São Paulo state">São Paulo state</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil">Brazil</a>,
 named after "Patrícia Galvão, nickname "Pagu" (1910–1962), who was a 
socialist playwright and modernist writer. She was born and lived in São
 Paulo state, where she was a feminist symbol and organized worker's 
struggle."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Patricia_Galvao.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Patricia_Galvao.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="146" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Patricia_Galvao_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Patricia_Galvao_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="383" data-file-height="510"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ptenothrix_dalii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ptenothrix dalii (page does not exist)">Ptenothrix dalii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Zeppelini, Ferreira &amp; Oliveira 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Springtail" title="Springtail">Springtail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Dalí, Salvador"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salvador_Dal%C3%AD" title="Salvador Dalí">Salvador Dalí</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The name refers to the single pair of labral <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chaeta" title="Chaeta">chaetae</a>, one each side somewhat like the world famous Salvador Dali's moustache."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Salvador_Dali_NYWTS.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Salvador_Dali_NYWTS_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="143" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Salvador_Dali_NYWTS_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Salvador_Dali_NYWTS.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3140" data-file-height="4096"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-527" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-527"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>525<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ptomaphagus_thebeatles&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ptomaphagus thebeatles (page does not exist)">Ptomaphagus thebeatles</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Menno_Schilthuizen" title="Menno Schilthuizen">Schilthuizen</a>, Latella &amp; Njunjić, 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Beatles, The"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Beatles" title="The Beatles">The Beatles</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>The <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Holotype" title="Holotype">holotype</a> of this beetle was collected from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vondelpark" title="Vondelpark">Vondelpark</a>, in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amsterdam" title="Amsterdam">Amsterdam</a> (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Netherlands" title="Netherlands">Netherlands</a>). "Named for the band The Beatles, which no beetle has yet been named after [NOTE:This is incorrect; the leaf beetle <i>Janbechynea  georgepauljohnringo</i>, also on this list, had been named in 2004, but the author was not aware of it]. The name also commemorates the '<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bed-ins_for_Peace" class="mw-redirect" title="Bed-ins for Peace">Bed in for Peace</a>' by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Lennon" title="John Lennon">John Lennon</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yoko_Ono" title="Yoko Ono">Yoko Ono</a> in the nearby <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hilton_Amsterdam" title="Hilton Amsterdam">Hilton Hotel</a> [of Amsterdam], exactly 50 years (to the day) prior to the collection date of the holotype."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Beatles_ad_1965_just_the_beatles_crop.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Beatles_ad_1965_just_the_beatles_crop_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="80" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Beatles_ad_1965_just_the_beatles_crop_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Beatles_ad_1965_just_the_beatles_crop.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1156" data-file-height="839"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-528" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-528"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>526<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Pycnogonum_cesairei&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Pycnogonum cesairei (page does not exist)">Pycnogonum cesairei</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Sabroux, Hassanin &amp; Corbari, 2022</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_spider" title="Sea spider">Sea spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Césaire, Aimé"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aim%C3%A9_C%C3%A9saire" title="Aimé Césaire">Aimé Césaire</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>This species is native to the waters of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martinique" title="Martinique">Martinique</a>.</td>

<tr id="Q">
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Quadrophenia_daltreyi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Quadrophenia daltreyi (page does not exist)">Quadrophenia daltreyi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Rifkind, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Daltrey, Roger"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roger_Daltrey" title="Roger Daltrey">Roger Daltrey</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of four species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Checkered_beetle" class="mw-redirect" title="Checkered beetle">checkered beetles</a> named concurrently after the members of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Who" title="The Who">The Who</a>. The genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Quadrophenia_(genus)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Quadrophenia (genus) (page does not exist)">Quadrophenia</a></i> was also created concurrently, and named after <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quadrophenia" title="Quadrophenia">The Who's concept album</a>.</td>

<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Retrooecobius_chomskyi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Retrooecobius chomskyi (page does not exist)">Retrooecobius chomskyi</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Wunderlich, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Chomsky, Noam"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Noam_Chomsky" title="Noam Chomsky">Noam Chomsky</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oecobiidae" title="Oecobiidae">disc web spider</a> found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cretaceous" title="Cretaceous">Cretaceous</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burmese_amber" title="Burmese amber">Burmese amber</a>. "This peculiar spider species is named in honour [of] Noam Chomsky, who – according to the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_Times" class="mw-redirect" title="New York Times">New York Times</a>
 – is probably the most important and influential living intellectual 
human and an excellent social critic. In my opinion Chomsky's view of 
anarchism makes sense in a world full of corrupt, inhuman and criminal 
political, economic and religious leaders. [...] This many-sided author 
compared also excellently the evolution of languages with the evolution 
of animals."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Noam_Chomsky,_2004.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Noam_Chomsky,_2004_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Noam_Chomsky,_2004.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Noam_Chomsky,_2004_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1712" data-file-height="2288"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-533" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-533"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>531<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Rhinatrema_gilbertogili&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Rhinatrema gilbertogili (page does not exist)">Rhinatrema gilbertogili</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Maciel, Sampaio, Hoogmoed &amp; Schneider, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caecilian" title="Caecilian">Caecilian</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Gil, Gilberto"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gilberto_Gil" title="Gilberto Gil">Gilberto Gil</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil">Brazil</a>,
 named  "in homage to the Brazilian musician (singer and composer), 
Gilberto Passos Gil Moreira, better known as "Gilberto Gil" (born in 
1942), in recognition of his great contributions to Brazilian music. 
"Aqui e agora," "Drão," "Esotérico," "Estrela," "Palco," and "Tempo Rei"
 are some of the most beautiful songs produced by Gilberto Gil. The 
artist is also known for participating in environmental protection 
projects."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:FESTIVAL_SENSACIONAL_CELEBRA_-_GILBERTO_GIL_E_MAYRA_ANDRADE_(53003067977)_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/FESTIVAL_SENSACIONAL_CELEBRA_-_GILBERTO_GIL_E_MAYRA_ANDRADE_.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="151" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/FESTIVAL_SENSACIONAL_CELEBRA_-_GILBERTO_GIL_E_MAYRA_ANDR_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/FESTIVAL_SENSACIONAL_CELEBRA_-_GILBERTO_GIL_E_MAYRA_ANDR_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="938" data-file-height="1285"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-534" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-534"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>532<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rhipidura_habibiei" class="mw-redirect" title="Rhipidura habibiei">Rhipidura habibiei</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Rheindt <i>et al.</i>, 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bird" title="Bird">Bird</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Habibie, B. J."><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/B._J._Habibie" title="B. J. Habibie">B. J. Habibie</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fantail" title="Fantail">fantail</a> endemic to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peleng" title="Peleng">Peleng</a> island in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indonesia" title="Indonesia">Indonesia</a>, named "in honor of the late Bacharuddin Jusuf Habibie (deceased 11 Sep 2019), the third <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_the_Republic_of_Indonesia" class="mw-redirect" title="President of the Republic of Indonesia">president of the Republic of Indonesia</a>.
 President Habibie was known as a keen environmentalist and contributed 
greatly to the science and conservation of nature in Indonesia."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Bacharuddin_Jusuf_Habibie_official_portrait.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bacharuddin_Jusuf_Habibie_official_portrait.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="127" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bacharuddin_Jusuf_Habibie_official_portrait_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bacharuddin_Jusuf_Habibie_official_portrait_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1200" data-file-height="1383"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Rheindt2020_492-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Rheindt2020-492"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>490<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Rhodinia_tenzingyatsoi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Rhodinia tenzingyatsoi (page does not exist)">Rhodinia tenzingyatsoi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Naumann, 2001</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moth" title="Moth">Moth</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/14th_Dalai_Lama" title="14th Dalai Lama">Tenzin Gyatso, 14th Dalai Lama</a></td>
<td>This species is native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tibet" title="Tibet">Tibet</a>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Face_detail,_Tenzin_Gyatso_-_14th_Dalai_Lama_(2012)_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Face_detail,_Tenzin_Gyatso_-_14th_Dalai_Lama_(2012)_(cro_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="137" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Face_detail,_Tenzin_Gyatso_-_14th_Dalai_Lama_(2012)_(cro_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Face_detail,_Tenzin_Gyatso_-_14th_Dalai_Lama_(2012)_(cropped.jpg 2x" data-file-width="738" data-file-height="920"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-535" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-535"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>533<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rhynchocyon_chrysopygus" class="mw-redirect" title="Rhynchocyon chrysopygus">Rhynchocyon chrysopygus mandelai</a></i></span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Agwanda <i>et al.</i>, 2021</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elephant_shrew" title="Elephant shrew">Elephant shrew</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Mandela, Nelson"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nelson_Mandela" title="Nelson Mandela">Nelson Mandela</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A subspecies of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Golden-rumped_elephant_shrew" class="mw-redirect" title="Golden-rumped elephant shrew">golden-rumped elephant shrew</a> found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lamu_county" class="mw-redirect" title="Lamu county">Lamu county</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenya" title="Kenya">Kenya</a>.
 "Our choice of epithet derives from the severe and persisting 
insecurity in the taxon range, stemming from decades-long lack of peace 
in bordering Somaliland [<i>sic</i>; meaning <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Somalia" title="Somalia">Somalia</a>].
 Thus, we wish to honor the late Nelson Mandela as the inspiring beacon 
for peace and prosperity in Africa and link his name with a unique and 
precious expression of Kenya's and Africa's endemic fauna. We propose 
the common name "Mandela's sengi" in English ("sengi ya Mandela" in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kiswahili" class="mw-redirect" title="Kiswahili">Kiswahili</a>) for this new form"</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit)_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="130" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit)_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit).jpg 2x" data-file-width="657" data-file-height="778"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-536" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-536"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>534<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-537" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-537"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>535<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Rissoella_dalii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Rissoella dalii (page does not exist)">Rissoella dalii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ortea, Espinosa &amp; Magaña, 2004</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_snail" title="Sea snail">Sea snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Dalí, Salvador"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salvador_Dal%C3%AD" title="Salvador Dalí">Salvador Dalí</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"Named in homage to the brilliant painter Salvador Dalí, on the 
centenary of his birth. Dalí frequently incorporated snails in his 
works, from the individual <i>Seashell</i> (1928) to <i>The Path to Enigma</i> (1981), including the drawings of land snails in <i>50 Magic Secrets to Paint</i> (1947) and <i>Dalí illustrious Casanova</i> (1967), with special mention of <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Madonna_of_Port_Lligat" title="The Madonna of Port Lligat">The Madonna of Port Lligat</a></i> (1949 and 1950)."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Salvador_Dali_NYWTS.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Salvador_Dali_NYWTS_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="143" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Salvador_Dali_NYWTS_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Salvador_Dali_NYWTS.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3140" data-file-height="4096"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-538" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-538"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>536<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roa_rumsfeldi" title="Roa rumsfeldi">Roa rumsfeldi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luiz_A._Rocha" title="Luiz A. Rocha">Rocha</a> <i>et al.</i>, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">Fish</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Rumsfeld, Donald"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Rumsfeld" title="Donald Rumsfeld">Donald Rumsfeld</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Butterflyfish" title="Butterflyfish">butterflyfish</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippines" title="Philippines">Philippines</a>,
 named "to honor Donald Rumsfeld who immortalized the quote: "there are 
known knowns; there are things we know we know. We also know there are 
known unknowns; that is to say we know there are some things we do not 
know. But there are also unknown unknowns – the ones we don't know we 
don't know." He said that when referring to the uncertainties of war, 
but we think it applies perfectly to the taxonomy of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mesophotic_coral_reef" title="Mesophotic coral reef">MCE</a> species: We only realized this species was new after we took a good look at it here at the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/California_Academy_of_Sciences" title="California Academy of Sciences">[Steinhart] aquarium in San Francisco</a>, so we think it's a perfect example of an unknown unknown."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Roa_rumsfeldi.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Roa_rumsfeldi_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="81" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Roa_rumsfeldi_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Roa_rumsfeldi.jpg 2x" data-file-width="800" data-file-height="588"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Rumsfeld1.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rumsfeld1.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="138" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rumsfeld1_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rumsfeld1_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2400" data-file-height="3000"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-539" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-539"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>537<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roddenberryus" title="Roddenberryus">Roddenberryus</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Sánchez-Ruiz &amp; Bonaldo, 2023</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Roddenberry, Gene"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gene_Roddenberry" title="Gene Roddenberry">Gene Roddenberry</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A genus of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caponiidae" title="Caponiidae">caponiid</a> spiders named "honoring Eugene Wesley Roddenberry Sr, the creator of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Star_Trek" title="Star Trek">Star Trek</a>, a science fiction media franchise that inspired generations of kids to pursue scientific careers."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Roddenberryus_sargi.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Roddenberryus_sargi_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="138" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Roddenberryus_sargi_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Roddenberryus_sargi.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1010" data-file-height="1270"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Gene_Roddenberry_crop.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Gene_Roddenberry_crop.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Gene_Roddenberry_crop.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Gene_Roddenberry_crop.jpg 2x" data-file-width="360" data-file-height="480"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-540" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-540"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>538<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Romblonella_coryae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Romblonella coryae (page does not exist)">Romblonella coryae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">General &amp; Buenavente, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ant" title="Ant">Ant</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Aquino, Corazón"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coraz%C3%B3n_Aquino" class="mw-redirect" title="Corazón Aquino">Corazón Aquino</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippines" title="Philippines">Philippines</a>,
 "named in honor of our late former President, Corazon C. Aquino (known 
to all Filipinos by her nickname "Cory"), who led the country out of the
 dictatorship era. It is fitting that a genus named after a Philippine 
island (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romblon,_Romblon" title="Romblon, Romblon">Romblon</a>) has a species named after a modern Filipino hero."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Corazon_Aquino_1986.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Corazon_Aquino_1986_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Corazon_Aquino_1986_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Corazon_Aquino_1986.jpg 2x" data-file-width="894" data-file-height="1192"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Rostropria_garbo&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Rostropria garbo (page does not exist)">Rostropria garbo</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Early &amp; Naumann, 1990</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Garbo, Greta"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greta_Garbo" title="Greta Garbo">Greta Garbo</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diapriidae" title="Diapriidae">Diapriid</a> wasp described as "a solitary female".</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:RH_Louise_Garbo2.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/RH_Louise_Garbo2_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="133" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/RH_Louise_Garbo2_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/RH_Louise_Garbo2.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1024" data-file-height="1237"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-CSN_44-13" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CSN-44"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>43<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-542" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-542"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>540<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rotaovula_hirohitoi" title="Rotaovula hirohitoi">Rotaovula hirohitoi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Cate &amp; Azuma, 1973</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_snail" title="Sea snail">Sea snail</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hirohito" title="Hirohito">Hirohito</a></td>
<td>"The name of this new species honors His Majesty, Emperor Hirohito of Japan, who is an ardent patron of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malacology" title="Malacology">malacology</a>."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Keizer_Hirohito_1971.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Keizer_Hirohito_1971.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="134" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Keizer_Hirohito_1971.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Keizer_Hirohito_1971.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1011" data-file-height="1230"></a></span></td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="James, Elmore"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elmore_James" title="Elmore James">Elmore James</a></span></span></span></td>

<tr id="S">
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Sacoproteus_browni&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Sacoproteus browni (page does not exist)">Sacoproteus browni</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Krug <i>et al.</i>, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_slug" title="Sea slug">Sea slug</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Brown, Bob"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_Brown" title="Bob Brown">Bob Brown</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species from Australia "Named in honor of Robert James "Bob" Brown, former Parliamentary Leader of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australian_Greens" title="Australian Greens">Australian Greens</a>,
 for his life's work fighting to protect the environment and to achieve 
equality for all people regardless of sexual orientation."</td>

<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tympanoctomys_loschalchalerosorum" class="mw-redirect" title="Tympanoctomys loschalchalerosorum">Salinoctomys loschalchalerosorum</a></i></span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Mares, Braun, Barquez &amp; Diaz, 2000</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rodent" title="Rodent">Rodent</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Los_Chalchaleros" title="Los Chalchaleros">Los Chalchaleros</a></td>
<td>The researcher in charge of the naming stated that he named the new 
species after Los Chalchaleros because his crews had sung their songs 
during thirty years of field research across Argentina.<br>Subsequently transferred to genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tympanoctomys" title="Tympanoctomys">Tympanoctomys</a></i>.</td>

<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Sanaungulus_ghitaenoerbyae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Sanaungulus ghitaenoerbyae (page does not exist)">Sanaungulus ghitaenoerbyae</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Fanti, Damgaard &amp; Ellenberger 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Nørby, Ghita"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ghita_N%C3%B8rby" title="Ghita Nørby">Ghita Nørby</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soldier_beetle" title="Soldier beetle">soldier beetle</a> found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cretaceous" title="Cretaceous">Cretaceous</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burmese_amber" title="Burmese amber">Burmese amber</a>,
 "named in honor of the Danish actress Ghita Nørby, as thank[s] for 
decades (over 60 years: 1956-today) of contributions to the Danish 
theater and film scene."</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Sarcoglottis_wernerherzogii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Sarcoglottis wernerherzogii (page does not exist)">Sarcoglottis wernerherzogii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Collantes, Edquén &amp; Salazar</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orchid" title="Orchid">Orchid</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Herzog, Werner"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Werner_Herzog" title="Werner Herzog">Werner Herzog</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species described from specimens collected in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Machu_Picchu" title="Machu Picchu">Machu Picchu</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Choquequirao" title="Choquequirao">Choquequirao</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peru" title="Peru">Peru</a>, and "named in honor of the great poet and filmmaker Werner Herzog (Munich, 1942), whose iconic films <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aguirre,_the_Wrath_of_God" title="Aguirre, the Wrath of God">Aguirre, the Wrath of God</a></i> (1972) and <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fitzcarraldo" title="Fitzcarraldo">Fitzcarraldo</a></i> (1982) reveal the natural magnificence of Machupicchu and the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peruvian_Amazon" class="mw-redirect" title="Peruvian Amazon">Peruvian Amazon</a>."</td>
<td></td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Schismatothele_benedettii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Schismatothele benedettii (page does not exist)">Schismatothele benedettii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Panzera, Perdomo &amp; Pérez-Miles, 2011</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>

<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil">Brazilian</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tarantula" title="Tarantula">tarantula</a> named "in honour of Mario Benedetti, the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uruguay" title="Uruguay">Uruguayan</a> writer and poet recognised as one of the most important in the Spanish language, who passed away in 2009."</td>
