<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-ETYFNemachRY_552-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ETYFNemachRY-552"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>550<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Schistura_pridii" title="Schistura pridii">Schistura pridii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chavalit_Vidthayanon" title="Chavalit Vidthayanon">Vidthayanon</a>, 2003</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">Fish</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pridi_Banomyong" title="Pridi Banomyong">Pridi Banomyong</a></td>
<td>A blind cave loach endemic to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thailand" title="Thailand">Thailand</a>, named "in honor of the late Pridi Bhanomyong (1900–1983), politician, statesman and Thai Prime Minister who founded <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thammasart_University" class="mw-redirect" title="Thammasart University">Thammasart University</a>, which plays an important role in the development of social sciences in Thailand."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Pridi_Banomyong-portrait.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Pridi_Banomyong-portrait.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="145" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Pridi_Banomyong-portrait_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Pridi_Banomyong-portrait_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="315" data-file-height="416"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Scinax_fontanarrosai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Scinax fontanarrosai (page does not exist)">Scinax fontanarrosai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Baldo <i>et al.</i>, 2019</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frog" title="Frog">Frog</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Fontanarrosa, Roberto"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roberto_Fontanarrosa" title="Roberto Fontanarrosa">Roberto Fontanarrosa</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tree_frog" title="Tree frog">tree frog</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina" title="Argentina">Argentina</a>,
 "named in honor [of] the writer and cartoonist Roberto "El Negro" 
Fontanarrosa (1944–2007), in recognition of his vast contribution to the
 Argentinean culture. His work always included elements of nature, like 
the amphibians."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Scinax_fontanarrosai.tiff" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Scinax_fontanarrosai.tiff.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="73" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Scinax_fontanarrosai.tiff_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Scinax_fontanarrosai.tiff_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="511" data-file-height="338"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Scutacarus_shajariani&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Scutacarus shajariani (page does not exist)">Scutacarus shajariani</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Sobhi &amp; Hajiqanbar, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mite" title="Mite">Mite</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Shajarian, Mohammad-Reza"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mohammad-Reza_Shajarian" title="Mohammad-Reza Shajarian">Mohammad-Reza Shajarian</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A parasitic mite found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran" title="Iran">Iran</a>, and "named in honor of Mr. Mohammadreza Shajarian, the living legend of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Persian_traditional_music" title="Persian traditional music">Persian traditional music</a>."</td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serendipaceratops_arthurcclarkei" class="mw-redirect" title="Serendipaceratops arthurcclarkei">Serendipaceratops arthurcclarkei</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Rich &amp; Vickers-Rich, 2003</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dinosaur" title="Dinosaur">Dinosaur</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Clarke, Arthur C."><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arthur_C._Clarke" title="Arthur C. Clarke">Arthur C. Clarke</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"Named in honour of Sir Arthur C. Clarke, who inspired both of us in
 our youth with his writings and who in his youth was lured into science
 by dinosaurs." Clarke, who was a personal friend of the authors, 
reportedly told friends "I've had an asteroid named after me and I've 
had a dinosaur named after me, now what's there to live for?"</td>
<td></td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weevil" title="Weevil">Weevil</a></td>

<td>A species found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Africa" title="South Africa">South Africa</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Namibia" title="Namibia">Namibia</a>, "dedicated to Nelson Mandela 'Madiba' for the role he played in the history of the Republic of South Africa."</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Showajidaia" title="Showajidaia">Showajidaia</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Korshunova <i>et al.</i>, 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_slug" title="Sea slug">Sea slug</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hirohito" title="Hirohito">Hirohito</a></td>
<td>"From the Japanese Shōwa jidai (昭和時代) meaning '<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sh%C5%8Dwa_era" title="Shōwa era">Shōwa era</a>' corresponding to the reign of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sh%C5%8Dwa_Emperor" class="mw-redirect" title="Shōwa Emperor">Shōwa Emperor</a> Hirohito in reference to the collection of the type material for the type species of this genus <i>C. sagamiensis</i> by Hirohito."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Cadlinella_sagamiensis.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Cadlinella_sagamiensis_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="83" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Cadlinella_sagamiensis_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Cadlinella_sagamiensis.jpg 2x" data-file-width="320" data-file-height="240"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Showapolynoe&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Showapolynoe (page does not exist)">Showapolynoe</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Imajima, 1997</span></td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Sinatra, Frank"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Sinatra" title="Frank Sinatra">Frank Sinatra</a></span></span></span></td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Frank_Sinatra_(1957_studio_portrait_close-up).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Frank_Sinatra_(1957_studio_portrait_close-up)_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="145" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Frank_Sinatra_(1957_studio_portrait_close-up)_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Frank_Sinatra_(1957_studio_portrait_close-up).jpg 2x" data-file-width="1212" data-file-height="1595"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Singafrotypa_mandela&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Singafrotypa mandela (page does not exist)">Singafrotypa mandela</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Kuntner &amp; Hormiga, 2002</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Mandela, Nelson"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nelson_Mandela" title="Nelson Mandela">Nelson Mandela</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>This <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Africa" title="South Africa">South African</a> species "is named after Nelson Mandela in honor of his struggle against Apartheid."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit)_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="130" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit)_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit).jpg 2x" data-file-width="657" data-file-height="778"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Kuntner&amp;Hormiga_2002_563-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Kuntner&amp;Hormiga_2002-563"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>561<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Sisicus_volutasilex&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Sisicus volutasilex (page does not exist)">Sisicus volutasilex</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Dupérré &amp; Paquin, 2007</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Rolling Stones, The"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Rolling_Stones" title="The Rolling Stones">The Rolling Stones</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The epithet is formed by the contraction of <i>volutabundus, a, um</i>: rolling, and <i>silex</i>: pebble/stone, because the shape of the epigynum closely resembles the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tongue_and_lips_logo" title="Tongue and lips logo">tongue logo</a> used by the rock band the Rolling Stones."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Rolling_Stones_1965.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rolling_Stones_1965.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="132" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rolling_Stones_1965_002.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="532" data-file-height="636"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-564" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-564"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>562<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Socca_elvispresleyi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Socca elvispresleyi (page does not exist)">Socca elvispresleyi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Framenau, Castanheira &amp; Vink, 2022</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Presley, Elvis"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elvis_Presley" title="Elvis Presley">Elvis Presley</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>An Australian <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orb-weaver_spider" title="Orb-weaver spider">orb-weaver spider</a>
 named "in honour of the late Elvis Aaron Presley (1935–1977), an iconic
 American singer and actor and known as 'the King of Rock and Roll', due
 to some resemblance of the apical lobe of the terminal apophysis of the
 male <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pedipalp" title="Pedipalp">pedipalp</a> to his <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pompadour_(hairstyle)" title="Pompadour (hairstyle)">pompadour tuft</a>, a haircut very common in the 1950s and a very characteristic feature of Elvis."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Elvis_Presley_1970.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Elvis_Presley_1970_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="170" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Elvis_Presley_1970_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Elvis_Presley_1970.jpg 2x" data-file-width="987" data-file-height="1521"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Socca22_565-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Socca22-565"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>563<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Socca_johnnywarreni&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Socca johnnywarreni (page does not exist)">Socca johnnywarreni</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Framenau, Castanheira &amp; Vink, 2022</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Warren, Johnny"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Johnny_Warren" title="Johnny Warren">Johnny Warren</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>An Australian <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orb-weaver_spider" title="Orb-weaver spider">orb-weaver spider</a>
 named "honouring the late Johnny Warren MBE, OAM (1943–2004), who was 
an Australian international soccer player, but also coach, 
administrator, writer and broadcaster who was instrumental in bringing 
'The World Game' to a wider audience in Australia. He played 42 
international matches for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australia_men%27s_national_soccer_team" title="Australia men's national soccer team">Australia</a>, including 24 as a team captain and also played in Australia's first world cup in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1974_FIFA_World_Cup" title="1974 FIFA World Cup">Germany in 1974</a>." Genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Socca_(spider)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Socca (spider) (page does not exist)">Socca</a></i> is named after the game of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soccer" class="mw-redirect" title="Soccer">soccer</a>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Johnny_Warren_1968_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Johnny_Warren_1968_(cropped)_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="154" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Johnny_Warren_1968_(cropped).jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Johnny_Warren_1968_(cropped)_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="286" data-file-height="401"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Socca22_565-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Socca22-565"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>563<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Socca_levyashini&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Socca levyashini (page does not exist)">Socca levyashini</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Framenau, Castanheira &amp; Vink, 2022</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Yashin, Lev"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lev_Yashin" title="Lev Yashin">Lev Yashin</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>An Australian <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orb-weaver_spider" title="Orb-weaver spider">orb-weaver spider</a>
 named "honouring the 'Black Spider', the late Lev Yashin (1929–1990), 
one of the greatest goalkeepers football has ever seen. He played 78 
games for the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_Union_national_football_team" title="Soviet Union national football team">Soviet Union's soccer team</a>, winning the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Association_football_at_the_1956_Summer_Olympics" title="Association football at the 1956 Summer Olympics">1956 Olympic Games</a> [held in Melbourne, Australia] and the first European championship, the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1960_European_Nations%27_Cup" title="1960 European Nations' Cup">1960 European Nations' Cup</a>." Genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Socca_(spider)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Socca (spider) (page does not exist)">Socca</a></i> is named after the game of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soccer" class="mw-redirect" title="Soccer">soccer</a>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:LevYashin.JPG" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-LevYashin.JPG" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-LevYashin.JPG 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-LevYashin.JPG 2x" data-file-width="747" data-file-height="996"></a></span></td>

<td><span data-sort-value="Mendes, Chico"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chico_Mendes" title="Chico Mendes">Chico Mendes</a></span></span></span></td>

<td></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Solibacillus_kalamii" title="Solibacillus kalamii">Solibacillus kalamii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Checinska Sielaff <i>et al.</i>, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bacterium" class="mw-redirect" title="Bacterium">Bacterium</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Kalam, A. P. J. Abdul"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A._P._J._Abdul_Kalam" title="A. P. J. Abdul Kalam">A. P. J. Abdul Kalam</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>This bacterium was isolated from a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HEPA" title="HEPA">HEPA</a> filter used on board the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Space_Station" title="International Space Station">International Space Station</a>, where it had been in service for 40 months. The filter was later analysed at the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jet_Propulsion_Laboratory" title="Jet Propulsion Laboratory">Jet Propulsion Laboratory</a> (JPL), the foremost lab of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NASA" title="NASA">NASA</a>
 for work on interplanetary travel. The bacterium was named in honour of
 Abdul Kalam, who was a renowned aerospace scientist and who had 
received some early training at NASA in 1963.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:A._P._J._Abdul_Kalam_in_2008.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/A._P._J._Abdul_Kalam_in_2008.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/A._P._J._Abdul_Kalam_in_2008_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/A._P._J._Abdul_Kalam_in_2008_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1624" data-file-height="2165"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Souvanna_phoumai" class="mw-redirect" title="Souvanna phoumai">Souvanna phoumai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Breuning, 1963</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Souvanna_Phouma" title="Souvanna Phouma">Souvanna Phouma</a></td>
<td>This species was described from specimens collected in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laos" title="Laos">Laos</a>;
 The genus and species names were created concurrently to honor the 
Laotian Prime Minister in office at the time. Subsequently, this species
 was synonymised with﻿ <i>Mispila signata</i> <span style="font-size:85%;">(Pic, 1926)</span>, which was transferred to the still valid genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Souvanna" title="Souvanna">Souvanna</a></i>, and therefore renamed as <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Souvanna_signata" class="mw-redirect" title="Souvanna signata">Souvanna signata</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">(Pic, 1926)</span>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Vice_President_Spiro_Agnew_and_Prince_Souvanna_Phouma_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Vice_President_Spiro_Agnew_and_Prince_Souvanna_Phouma_(cropp.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="153" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Vice_President_Spiro_Agnew_and_Prince_Souvanna_Phouma_(c_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Vice_President_Spiro_Agnew_and_Prince_Souvanna_Phouma_(c_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="959" data-file-height="1330"></a></span></td>

<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bar-winged_wren-babbler" title="Bar-winged wren-babbler">Spelaeornis troglodytoides indiraji</a></i></span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ripley et al., 1991</span></td>

of the Delhi Birdwatching Society, the late Prime Minister of India,

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spintharus_berniesandersi" title="Spintharus berniesandersi">Spintharus berniesandersi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Agnarsson &amp; Sargeant, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Sanders, Bernie"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bernie_Sanders" title="Bernie Sanders">Bernie Sanders</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cobweb_spider" class="mw-redirect" title="Cobweb spider">cobweb spider</a> native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cuba" title="Cuba">Cuba</a>, described by scientists of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University_of_Vermont" title="University of Vermont">University of Vermont</a>; "The species epithet honours the great <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vermont" title="Vermont">Vermont</a> senator Bernie Sanders, a tireless fighter for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_rights" title="Human rights">human rights</a> and equality, and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Environmentalism" title="Environmentalism">environmentally aware</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Social_democracy" title="Social democracy">social democracy</a>."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Bernie_Sanders_in_March_2020_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bernie_Sanders_in_March_2020_(cropped)_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bernie_Sanders_in_March_2020_(cropped)_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bernie_Sanders_in_March_2020_(cropped).jpg 2x" data-file-width="2113" data-file-height="2824"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Agnarssonetal2018_574-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Agnarssonetal2018-574"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>572<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spintharus_davidbowiei" title="Spintharus davidbowiei">Spintharus davidbowiei</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Agnarsson &amp; Chomitz, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Bowie, David"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Bowie" title="David Bowie">David Bowie</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The species epithet honours the great artist David Bowie who passed
 away prematurely in 2016, but whose music will continue to inspire the 
generations to come."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:David-Bowie_Chicago_2002-08-08_photoby_Adam-Bielawski-cropped.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/David-Bowie_Chicago_2002-08-08_photoby_Adam-Bielawski-cr_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="129" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/David-Bowie_Chicago_2002-08-08_photoby_Adam-Bielawski-cr_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/David-Bowie_Chicago_2002-08-08_photoby_Adam-Bielawski-croppe.jpg 2x" data-file-width="342" data-file-height="400"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Agnarssonetal2018_574-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Agnarssonetal2018-574"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>572<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Spygoria_zappania&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Spygoria zappania (page does not exist)">Spygoria zappania</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Salak &amp; Lescinsky, 1999</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ediacaran_biota" title="Ediacaran biota">Ediacaran biota</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Zappa, Frank"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Zappa" title="Frank Zappa">Frank Zappa</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cloudinid" class="mw-redirect" title="Cloudinid">Cloudinid</a> from the Early <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cambrian" title="Cambrian">Cambrian</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nevada" title="Nevada">Nevada</a>, USA.<br>"The
 specific name honors the late Frank Zappa, musician, composer, 
politician, whose mission paralleled that of the earliest 
paleontologists: to challenge conventional and traditional beliefs when 
such beliefs lacked roots in logic and reason."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Frank_Zappa_1973_2.JPG" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Frank_Zappa_1973_2.JPG" decoding="async" width="110" height="136" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Frank_Zappa_1973_2.JPG 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Frank_Zappa_1973_2.JPG 2x" data-file-width="1091" data-file-height="1345"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-575" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-575"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>573<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Stactobiella_martynovi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Stactobiella martynovi (page does not exist)">Stactobiella solzhenitsyni</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Sykora &amp; Weaver, 1978</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caddisfly" title="Caddisfly">Caddisfly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Solzhenitsyn, Aleksandr"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aleksandr_Solzhenitsyn" title="Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn">Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"I take much pleasure in naming this species for Mr. Aleksander I. 
Solzhenitsyn, the great Russian author, who once shared the same country
 with the closest relative of the new species—<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Stactobiella_biramosa&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Stactobiella biramosa (page does not exist)">Stactobiella biramosa</a></i> Martynov."<br>Subsequently synonymised with <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Stactobiella_martynovi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Stactobiella martynovi (page does not exist)">Stactobiella martynovi</a></i>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Aleksandr_Solzhenitsyn_1974crop.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Aleksandr_Solzhenitsyn_1974crop.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="138" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Aleksandr_Solzhenitsyn_1974crop_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Aleksandr_Solzhenitsyn_1974crop_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1704" data-file-height="2136"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-576" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-576"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>574<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stasimopus_mandelai" title="Stasimopus mandelai">Stasimopus mandelai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Hendrixson &amp; Bond, 2004</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Mandela, Nelson"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nelson_Mandela" title="Nelson Mandela">Nelson Mandela</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"honoring Nelson Mandela, the former president of South Africa and 
one of the great moral leaders of our time." This species is known only 
from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Great_Fish_River_Nature_Reserve" title="Great Fish River Nature Reserve">Great Fish River Nature Reserve</a> in South Africa.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit)_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="130" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit)_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit).jpg 2x" data-file-width="657" data-file-height="778"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Stegophiura_miyazakii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Stegophiura miyazakii (page does not exist)">Stegophiura miyazakii</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ishida <i>et al.</i>, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brittle_star" title="Brittle star">Brittle star</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Miyazaki, Hayao"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hayao_Miyazaki" title="Hayao Miyazaki">Hayao Miyazaki</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil species from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cretaceous" title="Cretaceous">Cretaceous</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan" title="Japan">Japan</a>, "Named in honour of Hayao Miyazaki, co-founder of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Studio_Ghibli" title="Studio Ghibli">Studio Ghibli</a>, an animation studio in Japan, to pay tribute to his anime lifework, in particular the masterpiece <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ponyo" title="Ponyo">Ponyo</a></i> that celebrates marine biodiversity. In addition, Hayao Miyazaki's favourite novelist, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soseki_Natsume" class="mw-redirect" title="Soseki Natsume">Soseki Natsume</a>, lived in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kumamoto_Prefecture" title="Kumamoto Prefecture">Kumamoto Prefecture</a>, where the new ophiuroid fossils were found."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Hayao_Miyazaki_cropped_3_Hayao_Miyazaki_201211.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/120px-Hayao_Miyazaki_cropped_3_Hayao_Miyazaki_201211.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="129" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/250px-Hayao_Miyazaki_cropped_3_Hayao_Miyazaki_201211.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="1770" data-file-height="2073"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Stenetra_miyazakii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Stenetra miyazakii (page does not exist)">Stenetra miyazakii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Tselikh &amp; Burks, 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Miyazaki, Hayao"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hayao_Miyazaki" title="Hayao Miyazaki">Hayao Miyazaki</a></span></span></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Stenotarsus_monterrosoi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Stenotarsus monterrosoi (page does not exist)">Stenotarsus monterrosoi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Arriaga-Varela <i>et al.</i>, 2013</span></td>

<td>"This small–sized species from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guatemala" title="Guatemala">Guatemala</a> is dedicated to the late Guatemalan author Augusto Monterroso, who mastered the art of short narrative."</td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Stenotarsus_rulfoi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Stenotarsus rulfoi (page does not exist)">Stenotarsus rulfoi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Arriaga-Varela <i>et al.</i>, 2013</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>

<td>"This species is dedicated to the prominent Mexican writer Juan Rulfo, who lived his youth at <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Gabriel,_Jalisco" title="San Gabriel, Jalisco">San Gabriel</a> town, 20 kilometers away from the type locality."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Rulfo_por_Lyon.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rulfo_por_Lyon.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="153" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rulfo_por_Lyon_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Rulfo_por_Lyon_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="724" data-file-height="1008"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-ArriagaV2013_580-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ArriagaV2013-580"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>578<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Stephenympha&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Stephenympha (page does not exist)">Stephenympha</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Viloria, 2022</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Butterfly" title="Butterfly">Butterfly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Stephen, Henry"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_Stephen_(musician)" title="Henry Stephen (musician)">Henry Stephen</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A genus from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venezuela" title="Venezuela">Venezuela</a>
 "named in remembrance of the internationally renowned Venezuelan 
musician, actor, composer and extraordinary singer, Henry Stephen".</td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Viloria2022_581-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Viloria2022-581"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>579<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Stephenympha_pauliana&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Stephenympha pauliana (page does not exist)">Stephenympha pauliana</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Viloria, 2022</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Butterfly" title="Butterfly">Butterfly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="McCartney, Paul"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_McCartney" title="Paul McCartney">Paul McCartney</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"This new species is named after Paul McCartney [...], an animal 
rights advocate, but best known and celebrated as a highly creative and 
original songwriter, singer and musician. His remarkable artistic work 
has achieved an unprecedented cultural impact worldwide over the last 
sixty years."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Paul_McCartney_live_in_Dublin.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Paul_McCartney_live_in_Dublin.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Paul_McCartney_live_in_Dublin.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Paul_McCartney_live_in_Dublin.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1200" data-file-height="1600"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Viloria2022_581-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Viloria2022-581"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>579<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Sternolophus_mandelai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Sternolophus mandelai (page does not exist)">Sternolophus mandelai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Nasserzadeh &amp; Komarek, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Mandela, Nelson"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nelson_Mandela" title="Nelson Mandela">Nelson Mandela</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"Named in honor of the great philanthropist, anti-apartheid revolutionary leader and politician Nelson Mandela from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Africa" title="South Africa">South Africa</a> who died on 5 December 2013. Preparing the description was coincident with the national mourning period of his death."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit)_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="130" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit)_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit).jpg 2x" data-file-width="657" data-file-height="778"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-582" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-582"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>580<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Stigmatomma_pagei&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Stigmatomma pagei (page does not exist)">Stigmatomma pagei</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Hamer, Pierce &amp; Guénard, 2023</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ant" title="Ant">Ant</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Page, Jimmy"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jimmy_Page" title="Jimmy Page">Jimmy Page</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"named after the guitarist of the rock band <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Led_Zeppelin" title="Led Zeppelin">Led Zeppelin</a>
 and acclaimed guitar hero, James Patrick Page, known as Jimmy Page. 
While Jimmy Page wanted to become a biologist as a child but turned into
 music instead, there is no doubt that he has inspired generations of 
biologists, including the authors of this work."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Jimmy_Page_at_the_Echo_music_award_2013.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jimmy_Page_at_the_Echo_music_award_2013_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="165" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jimmy_Page_at_the_Echo_music_award_2013.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jimmy_Page_at_the_Echo_music_award_2013_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1366" data-file-height="2048"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-583" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-583"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>581<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Strepsicrates_gattii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Strepsicrates gattii (page does not exist)">Strepsicrates gattii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Vargas-Ortiz &amp; Vargas, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moth" title="Moth">Moth</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Gatti, Eduardo"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eduardo_Gatti" title="Eduardo Gatti">Eduardo Gatti</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leafroller" class="mw-redirect" title="Leafroller">leafroller</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atacama_Desert" title="Atacama Desert">Atacama Desert</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chile" title="Chile">Chile</a>, "dedicated to the great Eduardo Gatti for his outstanding contribution to Chilean popular music."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Eduardo_Gatti.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Eduardo_Gatti_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="73" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Eduardo_Gatti_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Eduardo_Gatti.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2000" data-file-height="1329"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-584" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-584"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>582<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strumigenys_ayersthey" title="Strumigenys ayersthey">Strumigenys ayersthey</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Booher &amp; Hoenle, 2021</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ant" title="Ant">Ant</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Ayers, Jeremy"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jeremy_Ayers" title="Jeremy Ayers">Jeremy Ayers</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"In contrast to the traditional naming practices that identify 
individuals as one of two distinct genders, we have chosen a 
non-Latinized portmanteau [...] representing people that do not identify
 with conventional binary gender assignments [...]. The 'they' 
recognizes non-binary gender identifiers in order to reflect recent 
evolution in English pronoun use – 'they, them, their' and address a 
more inclusive and expansive understanding of non-neutral gender 
identification. <i>Strumigenys ayersthey</i> sp. nov. is thus 
inclusively named in honor of Jeremy Ayers for the multitude of humans 
among the spectrum of gender who have been unrepresented under 
traditional naming practices. Jeremy was a multifaceted and beloved <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Athens,_Georgia" title="Athens, Georgia">Athens-based (GA, USA)</a>
 artist and activist whose humanity and achievements defied the limits 
of categorized classification. Jeremy brought an intellectual and 
playful, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pan_(god)" title="Pan (god)">Pan</a>-
like curiosity to every aspect of his life. He was a writer, 
philosopher, painter, musician, activist, photographer, gardener, and 
exploder of boundaries who transformed the culture that surrounded him. 
His deep appreciation of the variety and minute details of the natural 
world astounded all who knew him. In the spirit of Jeremy, we also 
propose that the -they suffix can be used for singular honorific names 
of non-binary identifiers in compliance with the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ICZN" class="mw-redirect" title="ICZN">ICZN</a>."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Strumigenys_ayersthey_(10.3897-zookeys.1036.62034)_Figure_3.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Strumigenys_ayersthey_(10.3897-zookeys.1036.62034)_Figure_3.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="44" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Strumigenys_ayersthey_(10.3897-zookeys.1036.62034)_Figu_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Strumigenys_ayersthey_(10.3897-zookeys.1036.62034)_Figu_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1512" data-file-height="604"></a></span></td>
<td></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-585" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-585"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>583<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>

<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avalanchurus_lennoni" class="mw-redirect" title="Avalanchurus lennoni">Struszia (Avalanchurus) lennoni</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Edgecombe &amp; Chatterton, 1993</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trilobite" title="Trilobite">Trilobite</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Lennon, John"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Lennon" title="John Lennon">John Lennon</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of four species concurrently named in 1993 after the members of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Beatles" title="The Beatles">The Beatles</a>. Subgenus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avalanchurus" title="Avalanchurus">Avalanchurus</a></i> was subsequently elevated to genus level.</td>

<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-silurian1997_83-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-silurian1997-83"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>82<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Stygocapitella_berniei&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Stygocapitella berniei (page does not exist)">Stygocapitella berniei</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Cerca, Meyer, Purschke &amp; Struck, 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polychaete" title="Polychaete">Polychaete worm</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Sanders, Bernie"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bernie_Sanders" title="Bernie Sanders">Bernie Sanders</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The species name reflects upon field collection. The field 
collection site is in a private property, and while collecting, the 
caretaker of the property mentioned we could collect sand as long as we 
would support a progressive such as Bernie Sanders. The species honours 
Bernie Sanders for his efforts of inclusiveness, diversity and 
protection of minorities and underrepresented groups."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Bernie_Sanders_in_March_2020_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bernie_Sanders_in_March_2020_(cropped)_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bernie_Sanders_in_March_2020_(cropped)_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bernie_Sanders_in_March_2020_(cropped).jpg 2x" data-file-width="2113" data-file-height="2824"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-CercaMPS20_587-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CercaMPS20-587"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>585<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Stygocapitella_josemariobrancoi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Stygocapitella josemariobrancoi (page does not exist)">Stygocapitella josemariobrancoi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Cerca, Meyer, Purschke &amp; Struck, 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polychaete" title="Polychaete">Polychaete worm</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Branco, José Mário"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_M%C3%A1rio_Branco" title="José Mário Branco">José Mário Branco</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The name honors José Mário Branco, an important Portuguese singer 
whose music inspired whole generations. JC was hearing his music in the 
field."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Jos%C3%A9_M%C3%A1rio_Branco_by_Rita_Carmo.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jos%C3%A9_M%C3%A1rio_Branco_by_Rita_Carmo.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="110" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jos%25C3%25A9_M%25C3%25A1rio_Branco_by_Rita_Carmo_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Jos%C3%A9_M%C3%A1rio_Branco_by_Rita_Carmo.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2086" data-file-height="2078"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-CercaMPS20_587-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CercaMPS20-587"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>585<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Stygocapitella_zecai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Stygocapitella zecai (page does not exist)">Stygocapitella zecai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Cerca, Meyer, Purschke &amp; Struck, 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polychaete" title="Polychaete">Polychaete worm</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Afonso, José"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_Afonso" title="José Afonso">José Afonso</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"While collecting in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henningsv%C3%A6r" title="Henningsvær">Henningsvær</a>, JC was hearing Zeca Afonso, an important freedom fighter whose songs inspired generations. The name honors him."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Jos%C3%A9_Afonso_by_Henrique_Matos_001.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Jos%C3%A9_Afonso_by_Henrique_Matos_001.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="150" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jos%C3%A9_Afonso_by_Henrique_Matos_001.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Jos%C3%A9_Afonso_by_Henrique_Matos_001.jpg 2x" data-file-width="782" data-file-height="1066"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Suberea_etiennei&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Suberea etiennei (page does not exist)">Suberea etiennei</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">van Soest, Kaiser &amp; Van Syoc, 2011</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sponge" title="Sponge">Sponge</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Étienne, Jean-Louis"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jean-Louis_%C3%89tienne" title="Jean-Louis Étienne">Jean-Louis Étienne</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"Named after Jean-Louis Etienne, the leader of the 2004/5 Expedition to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%8Ele_Clipperton" class="mw-redirect" title="Île Clipperton">Île Clipperton</a>, who brought the significant collection of Clipperton sponges to the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mus%C3%A9um_national_d%27Histoire_naturelle" class="mw-redirect" title="Muséum national d'Histoire naturelle">Muséum national d'Histoire naturelle</a>, Paris." (this being one of those sponges).</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Jean-Louis_Etienne.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jean-Louis_Etienne_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="73" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jean-Louis_Etienne.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Jean-Louis_Etienne.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3888" data-file-height="2592"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Sulawesidrobia_abreui&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Sulawesidrobia abreui (page does not exist)">Sulawesidrobia abreui</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Zielske, Glaubrecht &amp; Haase, 2011</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snail" title="Snail">Snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Abreu, José Antonio"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_Antonio_Abreu" title="José Antonio Abreu">José Antonio Abreu</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"named after José Antonio Abreu, a Venezuelan composer and founder of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/El_Sistema" title="El Sistema">El Sistema</a>, a network which enables underprivileged children to get a musical education."</td>

<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Antonio_ABREU.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Antonio_ABREU_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="151" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Antonio_ABREU.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="559" data-file-height="768"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Sulawesidrobia_soedjatmokoi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Sulawesidrobia soedjatmokoi (page does not exist)">Sulawesidrobia soedjatmokoi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Zielske, Glaubrecht &amp; Haase, 2011</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snail" title="Snail">Snail</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soedjatmoko" title="Soedjatmoko">Soedjatmoko</a></td>
<td>"named after Soedjatmoko Mangundiningrat, an Indonesian peace activist and honoree of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ramon_Magsaysay_Award" title="Ramon Magsaysay Award">Ramon Magsaysay Award</a>, the prestigious Asian equivalent of the Nobel Peace Prize."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Soedjatmoko,_Duta_Besar_RI_untuk_Amerika_Serikat_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Soedjatmoko,_Duta_Besar_RI_untuk_Amerika_Serikat_(crop_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="138" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Soedjatmoko,_Duta_Besar_RI_untuk_Amerika_Serikat_(cropped).jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="944" data-file-height="1180"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Zielske2011_589-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Zielske2011-589"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>587<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Sulawesidrobia_yunusi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Sulawesidrobia yunusi (page does not exist)">Sulawesidrobia yunusi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Zielske, Glaubrecht &amp; Haase, 2011</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snail" title="Snail">Snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Yunus, Muhammad"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Muhammad_Yunus" title="Muhammad Yunus">Muhammad Yunus</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"named after the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobel_Peace_Prize" title="Nobel Peace Prize">Nobel Peace Prize</a> Laureate Muhammad Yunus, a Bangladeshi economist and founder of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grameen_Bank" title="Grameen Bank">Grameen Bank</a>, which among other activities makes micro credits available for the foundation of small companies"</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Muhammad_Yunus_-_World_Economic_Forum_Annual_Meeting_2012.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Muhammad_Yunus_-_World_Economic_Forum_Annual_Meeting_2.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="158" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Muhammad_Yunus_-_World_Economic_Forum_Annual_Meeting_2012.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Muhammad_Yunus_-_World_Economic_Forum_Annual_Meeting_2.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2216" data-file-height="3184"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Zielske2011_589-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Zielske2011-589"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>587<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Suturoglypta_leali&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Suturoglypta leali (page does not exist)">Suturoglypta leali</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Espinosa &amp; Ortea, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_snail" title="Sea snail">Sea snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Leal, Eusebio"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eusebio_Leal" title="Eusebio Leal">Eusebio Leal</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species described from specimens collected from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Havana_Harbor" title="Havana Harbor">Havana Harbor</a> in the mid-20th century, "named in honour of Dr. Eusebio Leal Spengler, Historian of the City of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Havana" title="Havana">Havana</a>,
 who is part of the city's history in his own right. Finding a new 
species, born of the bay's past, can have no better destiny than to bear
 the name of the man who has made Havana a different city in a uniform 
world."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:(Eusebio_Leal_Spengler)_La_naci%C3%B3n_cubana_ha_reconocido_a_C%C3%A9spedes_como_el_Iniciador.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/(Eusebio_Leal_Spengler)_La_naci%25C3%25B3n_cubana_ha_reconoc_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="87" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/(Eusebio_Leal_Spengler)_La_naci%25C3%25B3n_cubana_ha_reconocido_.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/(Eusebio_Leal_Spengler)_La_naci%25C3%25B3n_cubana_ha_reconoc_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="860" data-file-height="684"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Saturoglypta_590-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Saturoglypta-590"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>588<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Suturoglypta_orboniana&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Suturoglypta orboniana (page does not exist)">Suturoglypta orboniana</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Espinosa &amp; Ortea, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_snail" title="Sea snail">Sea snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Orbón, Julián"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juli%C3%A1n_Orb%C3%B3n" title="Julián Orbón">Julián Orbón</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cuba" title="Cuba">Cuba</a>, "named after Julián Orbon (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avil%C3%A9s" title="Avilés">Avilés</a>, 1925), a Spanish-Cuban musician who in 1958 adapted simple verses by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_Mart%C3%AD" title="José Martí">José Martí</a> to the melody of "<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guantanamera" title="Guantanamera">La Guantanamera</a>" [<i>sic</i>], composed in the 1930s by the popular musician <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jose%C3%ADto_Fern%C3%A1ndez" title="Joseíto Fernández">Joseíto Fernández</a>. From that moment on, the humble song reached a universal dimension."</td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Saturoglypta_590-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Saturoglypta-590"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>588<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syllipsimopodi_bideni" class="mw-redirect" title="Syllipsimopodi bideni">Syllipsimopodi bideni</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Whalen &amp; Landman, 2022</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cephalopod" title="Cephalopod">Cephalopod</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Biden, Joe"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_Biden" title="Joe Biden">Joe Biden</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil basal species from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carboniferous" title="Carboniferous">Carboniferous</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bear_Gulch_Limestone" title="Bear Gulch Limestone">Bear Gulch Limestone</a>,
 named "... to celebrate the recently inaugurated (at the time of 
submission) 46th President of the United States, Joseph R. Biden"</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Syllipsimopodi_bideni.webp" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Syllipsimopodi_bideni.webp_002.png" decoding="async" width="110" height="93" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Syllipsimopodi_bideni.webp_003.png 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Syllipsimopodi_bideni.webp.png 2x" data-file-width="999" data-file-height="843"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Joe_Biden_presidential_portrait.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Joe_Biden_presidential_portrait.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="138" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Joe_Biden_presidential_portrait_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Joe_Biden_presidential_portrait_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2400" data-file-height="3000"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Whalen_Landman_591-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Whalen_Landman-591"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>589<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sylvilagus_palustris_hefneri" title="Sylvilagus palustris hefneri">Sylvilagus palustris hefneri</a></i></span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Lazell, 1984</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rabbit" title="Rabbit">Rabbit</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Hefner, Hugh"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hugh_Hefner" title="Hugh Hefner">Hugh Hefner</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>Known as the Lower Keys marsh rabbit, this subspecies was "named for
 Hugh M. Hefner, whose corporation has generously supported field work 
on this and other species." Hefner's <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Playboy_Enterprises" class="mw-redirect" title="Playboy Enterprises">Playboy Enterprises</a> famously has a rabbit as its logo.</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Lower_Keys_marsh_rabbit.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Lower_Keys_marsh_rabbit.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="61" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Lower_Keys_marsh_rabbit.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Lower_Keys_marsh_rabbit.jpg 2x" data-file-width="520" data-file-height="289"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Hugh_Hefner_05-16-2009.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Hugh_Hefner_05-16-2009.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="138" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Hugh_Hefner_05-16-2009_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Hugh_Hefner_05-16-2009_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="487" data-file-height="609"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-592" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-592"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>590<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Synagelides_walesai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Synagelides walesai (page does not exist)">Synagelides walesai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Bohdanowicz, 1987</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Wałęsa, Lech"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lech_Wa%C5%82%C4%99sa" title="Lech Wałęsa">Lech Wałęsa</a></span></span></span></td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Lech_Wa%C5%82%C4%99sa_(8036260819).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Lech_Wa%25C5%2582%25C4%2599sa_(8036260819)_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="127" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Lech_Wa%C5%82%C4%99sa_(8036260819).jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Lech_Wa%25C5%2582%25C4%2599sa_(8036260819)_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="768" data-file-height="889"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Synagelides_wyszynskii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Synagelides wyszynskii (page does not exist)">Synagelides wyszynskii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Bohdanowicz, 1987</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Wyszyński, Stefan"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stefan_Wyszy%C5%84ski" title="Stefan Wyszyński">Stefan Wyszyński</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>Subsequently synonymised with <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Synagelides_martensi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Synagelides martensi (page does not exist)">Synagelides martensi</a></i>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Stefan_Wyszy%C5%84ski.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Stefan_Wyszy%25C5%2584ski_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="152" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Stefan_Wyszy%C5%84ski.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Stefan_Wyszy%25C5%2584ski_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1484" data-file-height="2048"></a></span></td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Synalpheus_pinkfloydi" title="Synalpheus pinkfloydi">Synalpheus pinkfloydi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Anker <i>et al.</i>, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crustacean" title="Crustacean">Crustacean</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pink_Floyd" title="Pink Floyd">Pink Floyd</a></td>
<td>"Named after the well-known British rock band Pink Floyd, inspired 
by the bright pink-red claw of the new species. Suggested vernacular 
name: Pink Floyd pistol shrimp."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Synalpheus_pinkfloydi_(full_res)_by_Arthur_Anker.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Synalpheus_pinkfloydi_(full_res)_by_Arthur_Anker.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="80" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Synalpheus_pinkfloydi_(full_res)_by_Arthur_Anker_002.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="3762" data-file-height="2730"></a></span></td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Synopeas_saintexuperyi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Synopeas saintexuperyi (page does not exist)">Synopeas saintexuperyi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Buhl, 1997</span></td>
