<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Buhl1997_596-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Buhl1997-596"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>594<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr id="T">
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tachymenoides_harrisonfordi" title="Tachymenoides harrisonfordi">Tachymenoides harrisonfordi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Lehr, Cusi, Fernandez, Vera &amp; Catenazzi, 2023</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snake" title="Snake">Snake</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Ford, Harrison"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harrison_Ford" title="Harrison Ford">Harrison Ford</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"We dedicate this species to Harrison Ford, actor and conservationist, in recognition of his work for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conservation_International" title="Conservation International">Conservation International</a> and his voice for nature (e.g., '<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nature_Is_Speaking" title="Nature Is Speaking">Nature is speaking</a> – Harrison Ford is The Ocean')."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Harrison_Ford_by_Gage_Skidmore_3.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Harrison_Ford_by_Gage_Skidmore_3.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="155" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Harrison_Ford_by_Gage_Skidmore_3.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Harrison_Ford_by_Gage_Skidmore_3.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2376" data-file-height="3352"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-597" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-597"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>595<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Taeniogonalos_latae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Taeniogonalos latae (page does not exist)">Taeniogonalos latae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Polaszek &amp; Binoy, 2022</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Mangeshkar, Lata"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lata_Mangeshkar" title="Lata Mangeshkar">Lata Mangeshkar</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trigonalidae" title="Trigonalidae">trigonalid</a>
 wasp from India, named "after the Indian playback singer Lata 
Mangeshkar (1929–2022) known as the Nightingale of India, one of the 
greatest and most influential singers with a distinguished career 
spanning over seven decades. We dedicate the species to her memory, 
fondly remembering the timeless song "<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lag_Jaa_Gale" title="Lag Jaa Gale">Lag Ja Gale</a>" from the film <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Woh_Kaun_Thi%3F" title="Woh Kaun Thi?">Woh Kaun Thi</a></i> (1964)."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Lata_Mangeshkar_-_still_29065_crop.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Lata_Mangeshkar_-_still_29065_crop_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="100" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Lata_Mangeshkar_-_still_29065_crop.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Lata_Mangeshkar_-_still_29065_crop.jpg 2x" data-file-width="440" data-file-height="400"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-598" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-598"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>596<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-599" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-599"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>597<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Taeniopteryx_mercuryi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Taeniopteryx mercuryi (page does not exist)">Taeniopteryx mercuryi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Fochetti &amp; Nicolai, 1996</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stonefly" class="mw-redirect" title="Stonefly">Stonefly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Mercury, Freddie"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freddie_Mercury" title="Freddie Mercury">Freddie Mercury</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The discoverer of this species (P. Nicolai) wishes that it will be 
named after the great singer and artist Freddie Mercury [...], who died 
prematurely in London in 1991. Dr. Nicolai, in such way, wishes to pay 
homage to him and to his musical work, with the certainty of awarding a 
kind of honour that Freddie has not yet received." (this was the first 
organism to be named after Mercury)</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Freddie_Mercury_performing_in_New_Haven,_CT,_November_1977.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Freddie_Mercury_performing_in_New_Haven,_CT,_November_1977.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="163" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Freddie_Mercury_performing_in_New_Haven,_CT,_November__003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Freddie_Mercury_performing_in_New_Haven,_CT,_November__002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3534" data-file-height="5244"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-600" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-600"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>598<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Tanytarsus_chicomendesi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Tanytarsus chicomendesi (page does not exist)">Tanytarsus chicomendesi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Dantas, Hamada &amp; Gilka, 2023</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fly" title="Fly">Fly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Mendes, Chico"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chico_Mendes" title="Chico Mendes">Chico Mendes</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"a tribute to Francisco Alves Mendes Filho, better known as "Chico 
Mendes", a Brazilian rubber tapper, trade union leader and 
environmentalist. He fought to preserve the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amazon_rainforest" title="Amazon rainforest">Amazon rainforest</a> and advocated for the human rights of Brazilian peasants and Indigenous peoples. Chico Mendes was born and lived in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acre_(state)" title="Acre (state)">Acre</a>, the same Brazilian state where the new species was found, and he was cowardly assassinated on 22 December 1988."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Chico_Mendes_in_1988_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Chico_Mendes_in_1988_(cropped)_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Chico_Mendes_in_1988_(cropped).jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Chico_Mendes_in_1988_(cropped)_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="1200"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-601" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-601"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>599<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Tapinothrix_clintonii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Tapinothrix clintonii (page does not exist)">Tapinothrix clintonii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Bohunická &amp; Johansen, 2011</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bacterium" class="mw-redirect" title="Bacterium">Bacterium</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Clinton, Bill"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bill_Clinton" title="Bill Clinton">Bill Clinton</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"named in honor of President William Jefferson Clinton, in 
recognition of his efforts to provide protection for the ecosystems and 
landscapes now set aside in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grand_Staircase%E2%80%93Escalante_National_Monument" title="Grand Staircase–Escalante National Monument">Grand Staircase–Escalante National Monument</a>." [where the specimens were collected]</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Bill_Clinton.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bill_Clinton.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="144" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bill_Clinton_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Bill_Clinton.jpg.webp 2x" data-file-width="2299" data-file-height="3000"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-602" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-602"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>600<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Tarkus_squirei&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Tarkus squirei (page does not exist)">Tarkus squirei</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Carnevale &amp; Pietsch, 2011</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">Fish</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Squire, Chris"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chris_Squire" title="Chris Squire">Chris Squire</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ogcocephalidae" title="Ogcocephalidae">batfish</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eocene" title="Eocene">Eocene</a> deposits of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monte_Bolca" title="Monte Bolca">Monte Bolca</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italy" title="Italy">Italy</a>
 named "after the British musician and composer Christopher Russell 
Edward 'Chris' Squire, commonly known by his nickname 'Fish'". The genus
 <i>Tarkus</i>, created concurrently, "is taken from the suite released in 1971 by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emerson,_Lake_%26_Palmer" title="Emerson, Lake &amp; Palmer">Keith Emerson, Greg Lake and Carl Palmer</a>, which depicts <i>Tarkus</i>
 as an armoured half armadillo/half tank creature, [...] in reference to
 the thick dermal covering of bony tubercles that characterize this 
genus."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Tarkus_squirei.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Tarkus_squirei.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="79" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Tarkus_squirei_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Tarkus_squirei.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1245" data-file-height="896"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Chris_Squire_Beacon_Theatre_2013-04-09.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Chris_Squire_Beacon_Theatre_2013-04-09_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Chris_Squire_Beacon_Theatre_2013-04-09.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Chris_Squire_Beacon_Theatre_2013-04-09_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3456" data-file-height="4608"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-603" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-603"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>601<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Tasmanocaecilius_truchanasi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Tasmanocaecilius truchanasi (page does not exist)">Tasmanocaecilius truchanasi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Schmidt &amp; New, 2008</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barklouse" class="mw-redirect" title="Barklouse">Barklouse</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Truchanas, Olegas"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olegas_Truchanas" title="Olegas Truchanas">Olegas Truchanas</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>This species is endemic to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tasmania" title="Tasmania">Tasmania</a>, where Truchanas was a conservation campaigner and nature photographer.</td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-PsocopteraTasmania_604-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PsocopteraTasmania-604"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>602<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Technomyrmex_montaseri&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Technomyrmex montaseri (page does not exist)">Technomyrmex montaseri</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Sharaf, Collingwood &amp; Aldawood, 2011</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ant" title="Ant">Ant</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Montaser, Salah"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salah_Montaser" title="Salah Montaser">Salah Montaser</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>Montaser was a personal friend of the lead author.</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Teresirogas_nolani&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Teresirogas nolani (page does not exist)">Teresirogas nolani</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Quicke &amp; Butcher, 2014</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Nolan, Sidney"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sidney_Nolan" title="Sidney Nolan">Sidney Nolan</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>An Australian <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parasitoid_wasp" title="Parasitoid wasp">parasitoid wasp</a> "Named after the famed Australian artist, Sidney Robert Nolan (1917–1972) well known for his <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ned_Kelly" title="Ned Kelly">Ned Kelly</a> series of paintings."</td>

known for his evocative paintings of the Australian landscape."</td>

 and cognitive scientist. Dennett's work has been the focus of many late
 night debates in close social circles just as he adds the necessary

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mite" title="Mite">Mite</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Hitchens, Christopher"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christopher_Hitchens" title="Christopher Hitchens">Christopher Hitchens</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"after the late Christopher Eric Hitchens, the English author, journalist, and literary critic. As <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sam_Harris" title="Sam Harris">Sam Harris</a>' wife, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annaka_Harris" title="Annaka Harris">Annaka</a>,
 said: "Nothing Hitchens does is ever boring." Hitchens has inspired 
thousands of free-thinkers to remain clever and engaged in our attempts 
to understand the world around us."</td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_urchin" title="Sea urchin">Sea urchin</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Trump, Donald"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump" title="Donald Trump">Donald Trump</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil species from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cretaceous" title="Cretaceous">Cretaceous</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Texas" title="Texas">Texas</a>,
 USA. "The name will become a permanent part of the scientific record," 
said Thompson. "Obviously, I'm probably voting for him. I want change 
[...] I'd love for him to change the world, or at least the politics of 
the United States."</td>

<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Andersen, Benny"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benny_Andersen" title="Benny Andersen">Benny Andersen</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soldier_beetle" title="Soldier beetle">soldier beetle</a> found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eocene" title="Eocene">Eocene</a> <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baltic_amber" title="Baltic amber">Baltic amber</a>,
 "named in honour of the Danish songwriter, poet, author, composer and 
pianist Benny Andersen, in recognition of his long, successful career."</td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Theognete_weiri&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Theognete weiri (page does not exist)">Theognete weiri</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Anderson 2010</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weevil" title="Weevil">Weevil</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Weir, Peter"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_Weir" title="Peter Weir">Peter Weir</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A species of lesser weevil from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico" title="Mexico">Mexico</a>. The dedication was arranged through a donation to Nature Discovery Fund of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canadian_Museum_of_Nature" title="Canadian Museum of Nature">Canadian Museum of Nature</a> by members of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patrick_O%27Brian" title="Patrick O'Brian">Patrick O'Brian</a> fansite <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.hmssurprise.org/">The Gunroom of HMSSurprise.org</a>, in appreciation for Weir's film <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Master_and_Commander:_The_Far_Side_of_the_World" title="Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World">Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World</a></i>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:PeterWeirApr2011.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/PeterWeirApr2011_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="140" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/PeterWeirApr2011_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/PeterWeirApr2011.jpg 2x" data-file-width="647" data-file-height="824"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-612" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-612"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>610<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tianchisaurus_nedegoapeferima" class="mw-redirect" title="Tianchisaurus nedegoapeferima">Tianchisaurus nedegoapeferima</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Dong, 1993</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dinosaur" title="Dinosaur">Dinosaur</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Neill, Sam"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sam_Neill" title="Sam Neill">Sam Neill</a></span></span></span>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laura_Dern" title="Laura Dern">Laura Dern</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jeff_Goldblum" title="Jeff Goldblum">Jeff Goldblum</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Attenborough" title="Richard Attenborough">Richard Attenborough</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_Peck" title="Bob Peck">Bob Peck</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martin_Ferrero" title="Martin Ferrero">Martin Ferrero</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ariana_Richards" title="Ariana Richards">Ariana Richards</a>, and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Mazzello" title="Joseph Mazzello">Joseph Mazzello</a></td>
<td>Actors involved in the 1993 film <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jurassic_Park_(film)" title="Jurassic Park (film)">Jurassic Park</a></i>: <b>Ne</b>ill, <b>De</b>rn, <b>Go</b>ldblum, <b>A</b>ttenborough, <b>Pe</b>ck, <b>Fe</b>rrero, <b>Ri</b>chards, and <b>Ma</b>zzello. The type specimen was informally referred to as "Jurassosaurus". The species name was proposed by director <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steven_Spielberg" title="Steven Spielberg">Steven Spielberg</a>.</td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Tmesiphantes_amadoi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Tmesiphantes amadoi (page does not exist)">Tmesiphantes amadoi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Yamamoto <i>et al.</i>, 2007</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Amado, Jorge"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jorge_Amado" title="Jorge Amado">Jorge Amado</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tarantula" title="Tarantula">tarantula</a> native to the Brazilian state of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bahia" title="Bahia">Bahia</a>, where Jorge Amado was born.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Jorge_Amado,_Headshot_2,_1988_(cropped).png" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jorge_Amado,_Headshot_2,_1988_(cropped)_003.png" decoding="async" width="110" height="163" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jorge_Amado,_Headshot_2,_1988_(cropped)_002.png 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Jorge_Amado,_Headshot_2,_1988_(cropped).png 2x" data-file-width="2843" data-file-height="4208"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Tmesi2007_613-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Tmesi2007-613"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>611<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Tmesiphantes_bethaniae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Tmesiphantes bethaniae (page does not exist)">Tmesiphantes bethaniae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Yamamoto <i>et al.</i>, 2007</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Bethânia, Maria"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maria_Beth%C3%A2nia" title="Maria Bethânia">Maria Bethânia</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tarantula" title="Tarantula">tarantula</a> native to the Brazilian state of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bahia" title="Bahia">Bahia</a>, where Maria Bethânia was born.</td>
<td></td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Tmesiphantes_caymmii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Tmesiphantes caymmii (page does not exist)">Tmesiphantes caymmii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Yamamoto <i>et al.</i>, 2007</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Caymmi, Dorival"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dorival_Caymmi" title="Dorival Caymmi">Dorival Caymmi</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tarantula" title="Tarantula">tarantula</a> native to the Brazilian state of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bahia" title="Bahia">Bahia</a>, where Dorival Caymmi was born.</td>

<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tomognathus" title="Tomognathus">Tomognathus gigeri</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Cavin &amp; Giner, 2012</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">Fish</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Giger, H. R."><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/H._R._Giger" title="H. R. Giger">H. R. Giger</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amiiformes" title="Amiiformes">bowfin</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cretaceous" title="Cretaceous">Cretaceous</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France" title="France">France</a>, named "In honour of Hans Ruedi Giger, the designer of the monster of the movie <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alien_(film)" title="Alien (film)">Alien</a></i> (1979), a beast that possesses an inner mouth reminiscent of the dermopalatine/coronoid jaw of the fossil studied."</td>

<td>A marine worm native to the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Atlantic_Ocean" class="mw-redirect" title="South Atlantic Ocean">Atlantic</a> coasts of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina" title="Argentina">Argentina</a> and Southern <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil">Brazil</a>.</td>

Nelson Rolihlahla Mandela, who celebrated his 20 years of freedom on 11 
February 2010."</td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Trichopelma_cheguevarai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Trichopelma cheguevarai (page does not exist)">Trichopelma cheguevarai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ríos-Tamayo, 2024</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Guevara, Che"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Che_Guevara" title="Che Guevara">Che Guevara</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tarantula" title="Tarantula">tarantula</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cuba" title="Cuba">Cuba</a>,
 named "in honour of Ernesto "Che" Guevara, an Argentinian revolutionary
 (later a nationalized Cuban), who fought for the liberation of Cuba and
 Latin America."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Che_Guevara_-_Guerrillero_Heroico_by_Alberto_Korda.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Che_Guevara_-_Guerrillero_Heroico_by_Alberto_Korda_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="127" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Che_Guevara_-_Guerrillero_Heroico_by_Alberto_Korda.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Che_Guevara_-_Guerrillero_Heroico_by_Alberto_Korda.jpg.webp 2x" data-file-width="2827" data-file-height="3274"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-RiosTamayo2024_621-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-RiosTamayo2024-621"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>619<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Trichopelma_fidelcastroi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Trichopelma fidelcastroi (page does not exist)">Trichopelma fidelcastroi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ríos-Tamayo, 2024</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Castro, Fidel"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fidel_Castro" title="Fidel Castro">Fidel Castro</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tarantula" title="Tarantula">tarantula</a> known only from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Holgu%C3%ADn_Province" title="Holguín Province">Holguín Province</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cuba" title="Cuba">Cuba</a>,
 named "in honour of Fidel Alejandro Castro Ruz, the historical leader 
of the Cuban revolution who was born in Holguín province."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Fidel_Castro_2012.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Fidel_Castro_2012.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="167" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Fidel_Castro_2012.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Fidel_Castro_2012.jpg 2x" data-file-width="313" data-file-height="476"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-RiosTamayo2024_621-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-RiosTamayo2024-621"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>619<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Triplocania_garciamarquezi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Triplocania garciamarquezi (page does not exist)">Triplocania garciamarquezi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">González-Obando, Carrejo-Gironza &amp; García Aldrete, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barklouse" class="mw-redirect" title="Barklouse">Barklouse</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="García Márquez, Gabriel"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gabriel_Garc%C3%ADa_M%C3%A1rquez" title="Gabriel García Márquez">Gabriel García Márquez</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The specific name honors the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobel_Prize_in_Literature" title="Nobel Prize in Literature">Nobel Prize</a> Gabriel García Márquez, as <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colombia" title="Colombia">Colombian</a> and Neotropical as the <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Triplocania&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Triplocania (page does not exist)">Triplocania</a></i> species here studied."</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Triplocania_hawkingi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Triplocania hawkingi (page does not exist)">Triplocania hawkingi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">González-Obando, Carrejo-Gironza &amp; García Aldrete, 2021</span></td>

<td><span data-sort-value="Hawking, Stephen"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stephen_Hawking" title="Stephen Hawking">Stephen Hawking</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"This species is dedicated to Stephen William Hawking, theoretical 
physicist, cosmologist, and author. In works of popular science he wrote
 several books, among them <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Brief_History_of_Time:_From_the_Big_Bang_to_Black_Holes" class="mw-redirect" title="A Brief History of Time: From the Big Bang to Black Holes">A Brief History of Time: From the Big Bang to Black Holes</a></i>"</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Tsitsikamma_(Clavicaulis)_madiba&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Tsitsikamma (Clavicaulis) madiba (page does not exist)">Tsitsikamma (Clavicaulis) madiba</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Samaai, Kelly, Payne &amp; Ngwakum 2020</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sponge" title="Sponge">Sponge</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Mandela, Nelson"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nelson_Mandela" title="Nelson Mandela">Nelson Mandela</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poecilosclerida" title="Poecilosclerida">Poecilosclerid</a> sponge from the coasts of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Africa" title="South Africa">South Africa</a>,
 "Named in honour of the great South African president Nelson Rolihlahla
 Mandela, also known by his clan name "Madiba", liberation struggle hero
 and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobel_Peace_Prize" title="Nobel Peace Prize">Nobel Peace Prize</a> laureate, who passed away on 5 December 2013 at the age of 95."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit)_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="130" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit)_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit).jpg 2x" data-file-width="657" data-file-height="778"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-629" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-629"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>627<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tutusius" title="Tutusius">Tutusius</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Gess &amp; Ahlberg, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stem_tetrapoda" title="Stem tetrapoda">Stem tetrapod</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Tutu, Desmond"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Desmond_Tutu" title="Desmond Tutu">Desmond Tutu</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A genus of fossil tetrapods from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Devonian" title="Devonian">Devonian</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Africa" title="South Africa">South Africa</a>.
 The senior author stated "When I was thinking about names for them, it 
occurred to me that these tetrapods led the way from these rather anoxic
 swamps out into the sunshine. And it seems to me that in many ways, 
that was a metaphor for what Desmond Tutu had done."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Archbishop-Tutu-medium.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Archbishop-Tutu-medium_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="165" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Archbishop-Tutu-medium_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Archbishop-Tutu-medium.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1152" data-file-height="1728"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-630" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-630"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>628<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-631" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-631"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>629<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr id="U">
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Udea_nicholsae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Udea nicholsae (page does not exist)">Udea nicholsae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Mally, 2022</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moth" title="Moth">Moth</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Nichols, Nichelle"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nichelle_Nichols" title="Nichelle Nichols">Nichelle Nichols</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grass_moth" class="mw-redirect" title="Grass moth">grass moth</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tanzania" title="Tanzania">Tanzania</a>,
 "named in honour of the late American actress Nichelle Nichols 
(December 28, 1932 – July 30, 2022), best known for her portrayal of 
communications officer <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nyota_Uhura" title="Nyota Uhura">Nyota Uhura</a> on board the starship USS Enterprise in the science-fiction television series <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Star_Trek:_The_Original_Series" title="Star Trek: The Original Series">Star Trek</a></i> as well as in six following feature films." The paper was published just four months after Nichols's demise.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Nichelle_Nichols,_NASA_Recruiter_-_GPN-2004-00017.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nichelle_Nichols,_NASA_Recruiter_-_GPN-2004-00017.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="138" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nichelle_Nichols,_NASA_Recruiter_-_GPN-2004-00017_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nichelle_Nichols,_NASA_Recruiter_-_GPN-2004-00017_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2240" data-file-height="2815"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-632" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-632"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>630<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ummidia_waunekaae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ummidia waunekaae (page does not exist)">Ummidia waunekaae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Godwin &amp; <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jason_Bond" title="Jason Bond">Bond</a>, 2021</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Wauneka, Annie Dodge"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annie_Dodge_Wauneka" title="Annie Dodge Wauneka">Annie Dodge Wauneka</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trapdoor_spider" class="mw-redirect" title="Trapdoor spider">trapdoor spider</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Mexico" title="New Mexico">New Mexico</a>, named "in honor of Annie Dodge Wauneka (1910–1997), influential member of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Navajo_Nation" title="Navajo Nation">Navajo Nation</a> who worked tirelessly to improve education and health of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Navajo" title="Navajo">Navajo</a>. Among other awards, she was bestowed the United States <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Presidential_Medal_of_Freedom" title="Presidential Medal of Freedom">Presidential Medal of Freedom</a> in 1963 by President <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lyndon_B._Johnson" title="Lyndon B. Johnson">Lyndon B. Johnson</a>."</td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Ummidia21_633-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ummidia21-633"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>631<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uroballus_carlei" title="Uroballus carlei">Uroballus carlei</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Logunov &amp; Obenauer, 2019</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Carle, Eric"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eric_Carle" title="Eric Carle">Eric Carle</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jumping_spider" title="Jumping spider">jumping spider</a> that mimics the appearance of a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lichen_moth" class="mw-redirect" title="Lichen moth">lichen moth</a>
 caterpillar, "dedicated to Eric Carle (b. 1929), the American 
illustrator and author of more than 70 books for children and adults. 
His most renowned books include <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Very_Hungry_Caterpillar" title="The Very Hungry Caterpillar">The Very Hungry Caterpillar</a></i>, which chronicles the growth and metamorphosis of a caterpillar, and <i>The Very Busy Spider</i>.
 Indeed, these and other books by Eric Carle provide the first conscious
 contact of young readers with the natural world, being innovative tools
 for early-age environmental and biodiversity education." The species 
description was published on the occasion of Carle's 90th birthday and 
the 50th anniversary of the first publication of <i>The Very Hungry Caterpillar</i>.</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Uroballus_carlei_male.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Uroballus_carlei_male_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="97" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Uroballus_carlei_male_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Uroballus_carlei_male.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1918" data-file-height="1700"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Eric_Carle_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Eric_Carle_(cropped)_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="142" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Eric_Carle_(cropped)_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Eric_Carle_(cropped).jpg 2x" data-file-width="559" data-file-height="724"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-634" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-634"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>632<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr id="V">
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mugilogobius_rambaiae" title="Mugilogobius rambaiae">Vaimosa rambaiae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hugh_McCormick_Smith" title="Hugh McCormick Smith">H.M. Smith</a>, 1945</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">Fish</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rambai_Barni" title="Rambai Barni">Rambai Barni</a></td>
<td>"Special permission to use her name for this species was obtained 
from Her Majesty Rambai Barni, former Queen of Siam, and at a reception 
and exhibit given by the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siam_Society" title="Siam Society">Siam Society</a>
 in honor of their majesties on January 8, 1934, a water-color painting,
 made by the talented Thai artist Luang Masya Chitrakarn, was presented 
to her majesty. The painting represented several life-size examples of 
the fish in their natural habitat."<br>Subsequently transferred to genus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mugilogobius" title="Mugilogobius">Mugilogobius</a></i>.</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Mugilogobius_rambaiae.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Mugilogobius_rambaiae_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="66" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Mugilogobius_rambaiae.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Mugilogobius_rambaiae_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="310" data-file-height="187"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:HM_Queen_Rambhai.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/HM_Queen_Rambhai_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="138" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/HM_Queen_Rambhai.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/HM_Queen_Rambhai_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="731" data-file-height="917"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Vallaris_zappai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Vallaris zappai (page does not exist)">Vallaris zappai</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Wessels <i>et al.</i>, 2001</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rodent" title="Rodent">Rodent</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Zappa, Frank"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Zappa" title="Frank Zappa">Frank Zappa</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gerbillinae" title="Gerbillinae">gerbil</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miocene" title="Miocene">Miocene</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anatolia" title="Anatolia">Anatolia</a>. Zappa's music was the favourite of one of the authors to listen to while carrying out their research.</td>
<td></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Velundella&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Velundella (page does not exist)">Velundella</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Pánek, Táborský &amp; Čepička, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Protist" title="Protist">Protist</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Velvet Underground, The"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Velvet_Underground" title="The Velvet Underground">The Velvet Underground</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A genus of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jakobid" title="Jakobid">Jakobids</a>
 "named after the Velvet Underground, an American rock band that 
represent underground music and is often considered as one of the most 
important and influential groups of the 1960s."</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Venezillo_moreirai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Venezillo moreirai (page does not exist)">Venezillo moreirai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Campos-Filho, Carpio-Díaz &amp; Bichuette, 2023</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crustacean" title="Crustacean">Crustacean</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Moreira, Moraes"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moraes_Moreira" title="Moraes Moreira">Moraes Moreira</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A Brazilian <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Woodlouse" title="Woodlouse">woodlouse</a> "named <i>in memoriam</i>
 of the Brazilian musician Antônio Carlos Moraes Pires, also known as 
Moraes Moreira. The musician was born in the municipality of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Itua%C3%A7u" title="Ituaçu">Ituaçu</a> [the type locality], and he was famous for his engagement with the Brazilian cultural movement "<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Novos_Baianos" title="Novos Baianos">Novos Baianos</a>", with compositions allusive to the culture of the country".</td>
<td></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Vigdisia_praesidens&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Vigdisia praesidens (page does not exist)">Vigdisia praesidens</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Agnarsson, Kuntner, Yu &amp; Gregorič, 2024</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vigd%C3%ADs_Finnbogad%C3%B3ttir" title="Vigdís Finnbogadóttir">Vigdís Finnbogadóttir</a></td>
<td>"The genus name, feminine in gender, honors Vigdís Finnbogadóttir, former president of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iceland" title="Iceland">Iceland</a>
 (1980–1996) and the first democratically elected female president in 
the world. Vigdís shares the spider's elegance and wits."; "The species 
ephithet <i>praesidens</i> is a noun in apposition, honoring the presidential legacy of Vigdís Finnbogadóttir." The lead author for this <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Madagascar" title="Madagascar">Malagasy</a> species is from Iceland.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Vigdis_Finnbogadottir_(1985).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Vigdis_Finnbogadottir_(1985).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Vigdis_Finnbogadottir_(1985)_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Vigdis_Finnbogadottir_(1985)_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="761" data-file-height="1014"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Vologesia_rollingstones&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Vologesia rollingstones (page does not exist)">Vologesia rollingstones</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Schlüter &amp; Wiese, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_urchin" title="Sea urchin">Sea urchin</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Rolling Stones, The"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Rolling_Stones" title="The Rolling Stones">The Rolling Stones</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil species from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cretaceous" title="Cretaceous">Cretaceous</a> of Northern <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spain" title="Spain">Spain</a>, "Named after British <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rock%27n%27Roll" class="mw-redirect" title="Rock'n'Roll">Rock'n'Roll</a> band The Rolling Stones for the song "<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gimme_Shelter" title="Gimme Shelter">Gimme Shelter</a>" (1969) and all the rest."</td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Mirpurina_blezai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Mirpurina blezai (page does not exist)">Volvarina (Mirpurina) blezai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ortea, 2019</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_snail" title="Sea snail">Sea snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Cruz, Francisco Xavier da"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Francisco_Xavier_da_Cruz" title="Francisco Xavier da Cruz">Francisco Xavier da Cruz</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marginellidae" title="Marginellidae">margin shell</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cape_Verde" title="Cape Verde">Cape Verde</a>, "Named in honour of Francisco Xavier da Cruz (1905–1958), native of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S%C3%A3o_Vicente,_Cape_Verde" title="São Vicente, Cape Verde">São Vicente</a>
 and immortalised as B. Leza, musician, composer, performer, writer, 
researcher, pedagogue and poet. Author of the poem "Mar Azul", our 
common home, and master of the cadenced rhythm we know today as <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morna_(music)" title="Morna (music)">Morna</a>, the hallmark of Cape Verdean music". Immediately after the formal description, within the same paper, subgenus <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mirpurina" title="Mirpurina">Mirpurina</a></i> was elevated to genus status.</td>

<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volvarina_dulcemariae" title="Volvarina dulcemariae">Volvarina dulcemariae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Espinosa &amp; Ortea, 1998</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_snail" title="Sea snail">Sea snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Loynaz, Dulce María"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dulce_Mar%C3%ADa_Loynaz" title="Dulce María Loynaz">Dulce María Loynaz</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marginellidae" title="Marginellidae">margin shell</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cuba" title="Cuba">Cuba</a>, "named in honour of the late Cuban poet Dulce María Loynaz [...] and in gratitude for her contribution to the book <i><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20210115201057/https://www.programaecomar.com/FabulasdelMar2020.pdf">Fábulas del Mar</a></i> [<i>Fables of the Sea</i>, a children's book sponsored by the second author, which Loynaz wrote the prologue for]."</td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volvarina_milanesi" title="Volvarina milanesi">Volvarina milanesi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Espinosa, Ortea &amp; Pina-Amargós, 2022</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_snail" title="Sea snail">Sea snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Milanés, Pablo"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pablo_Milan%C3%A9s" title="Pablo Milanés">Pablo Milanés</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marginellidae" title="Marginellidae">margin shell</a> from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cuba" title="Cuba">Cuba</a>, "Dedicated to the Cuban singer-songwriter Pablo Milanés (Bayamo, 1943 – Madrid, 2022), one of the founders of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nueva_trova" title="Nueva trova">Nueva Trova Cubana</a> [...] With Pablo we shared a way of thinking about our daily work. <i>If I don't live the song I don't sing it</i>, Pablo used to say. <i>If we don't collect the new species we don't describe them</i>, we use to say."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Pablo_milanes.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Pablo_milanes_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="73" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Pablo_milanes.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Pablo_milanes_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="4000" data-file-height="2667"></a></span></td>
