</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volvarina_saramagoi" title="Volvarina saramagoi">Volvarina saramagoi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Espinosa, Ortea &amp; Moro, 2013</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_snail" title="Sea snail">Sea snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Saramago, José"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_Saramago" title="José Saramago">José Saramago</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"in honour of José de Sousa Saramago, illustrious Portuguese writer and poet, winner of the 1998 <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobel_Prize_for_Literature" class="mw-redirect" title="Nobel Prize for Literature">Nobel Prize for Literature</a>, who chose <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lanzarote" title="Lanzarote">Lanzarote</a> [where the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Holotype" title="Holotype">holotype</a> was collected] as his refuge and residence at the end of his life; he died on 18.6.2010 in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/T%C3%ADas" class="mw-redirect" title="Tías">Tías</a>."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Cropped_JSJoseSaramago.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Cropped_JSJoseSaramago.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="104" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Cropped_JSJoseSaramago_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Cropped_JSJoseSaramago_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="246" data-file-height="232"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-644" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-644"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>642<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volvarina_sofiae" title="Volvarina sofiae">Volvarina sofiae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Ortea &amp; Espinosa, 1998</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_snail" title="Sea snail">Sea snail</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Sofía of Spain, Queen"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Queen_Sof%C3%ADa_of_Spain" title="Queen Sofía of Spain">Queen Sofía of Spain</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>This species was described from specimens collected in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jardines_del_Rey" title="Jardines del Rey">Jardines del Rey</a> ("Gardens of the King") islands in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cuba" title="Cuba">Cuba</a>, and named after Queen Sofía to celebrate the visit of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monarchy_of_Spain" title="Monarchy of Spain">King and Queen of Spain</a> to Cuba arranged for the following year after publication (1999) (the first ever by Spanish monarchs). The sea slug species <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Chelidonura_juancarlosi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Chelidonura juancarlosi (page does not exist)">Chelidonura juancarlosi</a></i>, found in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jardines_de_la_Reina" title="Jardines de la Reina">Jardines de la Reina</a> ("Gardens of the Queen"), was named concurrently after her husband King <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juan_Carlos_I" title="Juan Carlos I">Juan Carlos I</a>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Spain.QueenSofia.01.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Spain.QueenSofia.01.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="146" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Spain.QueenSofia.01.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Spain.QueenSofia.01.jpg 2x" data-file-width="480" data-file-height="639"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-KingSpain_143-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-KingSpain-143"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>142<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Vulcanobatrachus_mandelai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Vulcanobatrachus mandelai (page does not exist)">Vulcanobatrachus mandelai</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linda_Trueb" title="Linda Trueb">Trueb</a>, Ross &amp; Smith, 2005</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frog" title="Frog">Frog</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Mandela, Nelson"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nelson_Mandela" title="Nelson Mandela">Nelson Mandela</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil species from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cretaceous" title="Cretaceous">Cretaceous</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marydale" title="Marydale">Marydale</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Africa" title="South Africa">South Africa</a>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit)_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="130" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit)_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Nelson_Mandela-2008_(edit).jpg 2x" data-file-width="657" data-file-height="778"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-645" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-645"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>643<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Vunicothoe&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Vunicothoe (page does not exist)">Vunicothoe</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Boyko, 2009</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crustacean" title="Crustacean">Crustacean</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Velvet Underground, The"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Velvet_Underground" title="The Velvet Underground">The Velvet Underground</a></span></span></span> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nico" title="Nico">Nico</a></td>
<td>"<i>Vunicothoe</i> is a combination of the root "nicothöe" from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicothoe" title="Nicothoe">the copepod genus name</a> derived from the name of one of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harpies" class="mw-redirect" title="Harpies">harpies</a>
 of Greek mythology, with the prefix "vu" as a contraction of the words 
"Velvet Underground." This generic epithet pays homage to the seminal 
musical recording <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Velvet_Underground_%26_Nico" title="The Velvet Underground &amp; Nico">The Velvet Underground &amp; Nico</a></i>, as performed by <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lou_Reed" title="Lou Reed">Lou Reed</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Cale" title="John Cale">John Cale</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sterling_Morrison" title="Sterling Morrison">Sterling Morrison</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maureen_Tucker" class="mw-redirect" title="Maureen Tucker">Maureen Tucker</a>, and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nico" title="Nico">Nico</a> (a pseudonym for Christa Paffgen), released in 1967 with the infamous peel-a-banana cover art by producer <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andy_Warhol" title="Andy Warhol">Andy Warhol</a>."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Velvet_Underground_%26_Nico_publicity_photo.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Velvet_Underground_&amp;_Nico_publicity_photo.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="137" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Velvet_Underground_&amp;_Nico_publicity_photo_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Velvet_Underground_&amp;_Nico_publicity_photo_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1585" data-file-height="1977"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-646" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-646"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>644<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr id="W">
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Whartonia_carpenteri" title="Whartonia carpenteri">Whartonia carpenteri</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Brennan, 1962</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mite" title="Mite">Mite</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Carpenter, Scott"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scott_Carpenter" title="Scott Carpenter">Scott Carpenter</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of four species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trombiculidae" title="Trombiculidae">chiggers</a> named concurrently after the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cosmonauts" class="mw-redirect" title="Cosmonauts">cosmonauts</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Astronauts" class="mw-redirect" title="Astronauts">astronauts</a> who participated in the first four crewed orbital spaceflights in 1961 and 1962 (see also <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Euschoengastia" title="Euschoengastia">Euschoengastia</a></i>). <br>"Named for Lt. Cmdr. Malcolm Scott Carpenter., USA, who completed three orbits of the earth in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aurora_7" class="mw-redirect" title="Aurora 7">Aurora VII</a>, 24 May 1962."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:M._Scott_Carpenter.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-M._Scott_Carpenter.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="138" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-M._Scott_Carpenter.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-M._Scott_Carpenter.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2400" data-file-height="3000"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Brennan1962_250-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Brennan1962-250"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>249<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Whartonia_glenni&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Whartonia glenni (page does not exist)">Whartonia glenni</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Brennan, 1962</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mite" title="Mite">Mite</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Glenn, John"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Glenn" title="John Glenn">John Glenn</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>One of four species of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trombiculidae" title="Trombiculidae">chiggers</a> named concurrently after the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cosmonauts" class="mw-redirect" title="Cosmonauts">cosmonauts</a> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Astronauts" class="mw-redirect" title="Astronauts">astronauts</a> who participated in the first four crewed orbital spaceflights in 1961 and 1962 (see also <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Euschoengastia" title="Euschoengastia">Euschoengastia</a></i>). <br>"Named for Lt. Col. John H. Glenn Jr., USA, who made three orbits of the earth in Friendship II [<i>sic</i>; the name was actually <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Friendship_7" class="mw-redirect" title="Friendship 7">Friendship 7</a>], 20 February 1962."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:JohnGlenn.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/JohnGlenn_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="137" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/JohnGlenn_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/JohnGlenn.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1590" data-file-height="1987"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Brennan1962_250-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Brennan1962-250"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>249<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wolongia_papafrancisi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Wolongia papafrancisi (page does not exist)">Wolongia papafrancisi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Malamel, Nafin, Sankaran &amp; Sebastian, 2018</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Francis, Pope"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pope_Francis" title="Pope Francis">Pope Francis</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"This species is dedicated to Pope Francis, the present reigning 
Pope of the Catholic Church in honour of his great contributions as an 
environmental conservationist."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Franciscus_in_2015.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Franciscus_in_2015.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="162" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Franciscus_in_2015_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Franciscus_in_2015_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1086" data-file-height="1598"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-647" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-647"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>645<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wormaldia_boteroi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Wormaldia boteroi (page does not exist)">Wormaldia boteroi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Muñoz-Quesada &amp; Holzenthal, 2015</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caddisfly" title="Caddisfly">Caddisfly</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Botero, Fernando"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fernando_Botero" title="Fernando Botero">Fernando Botero</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colombia" title="Colombia">Colombian</a> species "named in honor of the Colombian painter and sculptor Dr. Fernando Botero (born in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medell%C3%ADn" title="Medellín">Medellín</a>,
 1932), in recognition of his outstanding artwork. The widened inferior 
appendages of the male genitalia of this new species, remind us of the 
fat or inflated forms of the characters of Dr. Botero."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Fernando_Botero_(2018).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Fernando_Botero_(2018).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Fernando_Botero_(2018).jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Fernando_Botero_(2018).jpg 2x" data-file-width="629" data-file-height="838"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Wormaldia15_648-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Wormaldia15-648"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>646<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wrightia_sirikitiae&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Wrightia sirikitiae (page does not exist)">Wrightia sirikitiae</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">D.J.Middleton &amp; Santisuk</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flowering_plant" title="Flowering plant">Flowering plant</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sirikit" title="Sirikit">Sirikit</a></td>
<td>A plant from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dogbane_family" class="mw-redirect" title="Dogbane family">dogbane family</a> native to <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thailand" title="Thailand">Thailand</a>,
 named "in honour of Her Majesty Queen Sirikit of Thailand who has long 
been interested in the diversity and complexity of natural ecological 
systems. She has initiated a number of projects related to the 
conservation of biological diversity."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:%E0%B9%82%E0%B8%A1%E0%B8%81%E0%B8%A3%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%8A%E0%B8%B4%E0%B8%99%E0%B8%B5_Scientific_name_Wrightia_sirikitiae_D.J._Middleton_%26_Santisuk._FAMILY_APOCYNACEAE_(2).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/%25E0%25B9%2582%25E0%25B8%25A1%25E0%25B8%2581%25E0%25B8%25A3%25E0%25B8%25B2%25E0%25B8%258A%25E_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="73" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/%25E0%25B9%2582%25E0%25B8%25A1%25E0%25B8%2581%25E0%25B8%25A3%25E0%25B8%25B2%25E0%25B8%258A%25E_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/%25E0%25B9%2582%25E0%25B8%25A1%25E0%25B8%2581%25E0%25B8%25A3%25E0%25B8%25B2%25E0%25B8%258A%25E0%25B8.jpg 2x" data-file-width="4752" data-file-height="3168"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Queen_Sirikit_1960.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Queen_Sirikit_1960.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="159" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Queen_Sirikit_1960.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/220px-Queen_Sirikit_1960.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1600" data-file-height="2311"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-649" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-649"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>647<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr id="X">
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xanthosomnium" title="Xanthosomnium">Xanthosomnium</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Wahl &amp; Sime, 2002</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tangerine_Dream" title="Tangerine Dream">Tangerine Dream</a></td>
<td>"The genus is named after the musical group Tangerine Dream, the choice of discriminating ichneumonologists. From the Greek <i>xanthos</i>, yellow or yellowish-red (the closest equivalent to 'tangerine' in a classical language) and the Latin <i>somnium</i>, dream."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Tangerine-dream-ebw-6.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Tangerine-dream-ebw-6.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="83" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Tangerine-dream-ebw-6_002.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="2272" data-file-height="1704"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-WahlSime2002_650-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WahlSime2002-650"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>648<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xanthosomnium_froesei" class="mw-redirect" title="Xanthosomnium froesei">Xanthosomnium froesei</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Wahl &amp; Sime, 2002</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Froese, Edgar"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edgar_Froese" title="Edgar Froese">Edgar Froese</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"Named after Edgar Froese, the founder and continuity behind Tangerine Dream."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Tangerine-dream-ebw-2_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Tangerine-dream-ebw-2_(cropped).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="103" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Tangerine-dream-ebw-2_(cropped)_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Tangerine-dream-ebw-2_(cropped)_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1156" data-file-height="1081"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-WahlSime2002_650-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WahlSime2002-650"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>648<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Xyalophora_tedjoansi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Xyalophora tedjoansi (page does not exist)">Xyalophora tedjoansi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">van Noort, Buffington &amp; Forshage, 2014</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wasp" title="Wasp">Wasp</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Joans, Ted"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ted_Joans" title="Ted Joans">Ted Joans</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The specific epithet [...] is to commemorate the 
American-cosmopolitan poet Ted Joans (1928–2003), a surrealist, beat, 
black power and jazz activist who made <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mali" title="Mali">Mali</a> [where this species is found] one of his several homes in the world. The <i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Xyalophora&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Xyalophora (page does not exist)">Xyalophora</a></i> spine may suggest the horn of Joans' totemic rhino."</td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-651" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-651"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>649<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Xylotrechus_haveli&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Xylotrechus haveli (page does not exist)">Xylotrechus haveli</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Viktora, 2021</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Havel, Václav"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/V%C3%A1clav_Havel" title="Václav Havel">Václav Havel</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Longhorn_beetle" title="Longhorn beetle">longhorn beetle</a> species from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vietnam" title="Vietnam">Vietnam</a>
 described by a Czech scientist, "dedicated to Václav Havel (1936–2011),
 writer, playwright, Defender of Human and Civil Rights, the last 
President of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Czechoslovakia" title="Czechoslovakia">Czechoslovakia</a> and the first President of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Czech_Republic" title="Czech Republic">Czech Republic</a>."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:V%C3%A1clav_Havel_(2008)_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/V%25C3%25A1clav_Havel_(2008)_(cropped)_003.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="135" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/V%C3%A1clav_Havel_(2008)_(cropped).jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/V%25C3%25A1clav_Havel_(2008)_(cropped)_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="579" data-file-height="708"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Viktora21_652-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Viktora21-652"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>650<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Xylotrechus_kryli&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Xylotrechus kryli (page does not exist)">Xylotrechus kryli</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Viktora, 2021</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beetle" title="Beetle">Beetle</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Kryl, Karel"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karel_Kryl" title="Karel Kryl">Karel Kryl</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Longhorn_beetle" title="Longhorn beetle">longhorn beetle</a> species from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Philippines" class="mw-redirect" title="The Philippines">The Philippines</a>
 described by a Czech scientist, "dedicated to Karel Kryl (1944–1994), 
Czech singer and poet, one of the most important representatives of the 
Czech protest song in 1968–1989."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Karel_Kryl_v_roce_1990.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Karel_Kryl_v_roce_1990_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="152" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Karel_Kryl_v_roce_1990_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Karel_Kryl_v_roce_1990.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1472" data-file-height="2040"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Viktora21_652-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Viktora21-652"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>650<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr id="Y">
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Yanomamius_raonii&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Yanomamius raonii (page does not exist)">Yanomamius raonii</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Bertani &amp; Almeida, 2021</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider" title="Spider">Spider</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raoni_Metuktire" title="Raoni Metuktire">Raoni Metuktire</a></td>
<td>A species native to the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amazon_basin" title="Amazon basin">Amazon basin</a>, named after the indigenous leader Raoni Metuktire, a Brazilian environmentalist and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indigenist" class="mw-redirect" title="Indigenist">indigenist</a>, for his decades-long struggle to defend the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amazon_rainforest" title="Amazon rainforest">Amazon rainforest</a> and its sites. The genus name honours the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yanomami_people" class="mw-redirect" title="Yanomami people">Yanomami people</a>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Cacique_Raoni_(2013).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Cacique_Raoni_(2013).jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="145" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Cacique_Raoni_(2013).jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Cacique_Raoni_(2013).jpg 2x" data-file-width="2146" data-file-height="2832"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-653" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-653"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>651<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-654" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-654"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>652<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ypsolopha_chicoi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ypsolopha chicoi (page does not exist)">Ypsolopha chicoi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Vargas, 2021</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moth" title="Moth">Moth</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Buarque, Chico"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chico_Buarque" title="Chico Buarque">Chico Buarque</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"<i>Ypsolopha chicoi</i> sp. n. is named in honour of the eminent 
Brazilian musician and composer Chico Buarque (Francisco Buarque de 
Hollanda), for all his wonderful contribution to the "<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M%C3%BAsica_Popular_Brasileira" class="mw-redirect" title="Música Popular Brasileira">Música Popular Brasileira</a>"."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Ypsolopha_chicoi_(10.3897-BDJ.9.e72306)_Figure_1.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ypsolopha_chicoi_(10.3897-BDJ.9.e72306)_Figure_1.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="67" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ypsolopha_chicoi_(10.3897-BDJ.9.e72306)_Figure_1_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Ypsolopha_chicoi_(10.3897-BDJ.9.e72306)_Figure_1_002.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2362" data-file-height="1445"></a></span></td>

<tr id="Z">
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Zanclea_hirohitoi&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Zanclea hirohitoi (page does not exist)">Zanclea hirohitoi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Boero, Bouillon &amp; Gravili, 2000</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jellyfish" title="Jellyfish">Jellyfish</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hirohito" title="Hirohito">Hirohito</a></td>
<td>"This species is dedicated to the late Hirohito, Emperor of Japan, distinguished <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hydrozoa" title="Hydrozoa">hydrozoan</a> taxonomist, who first described material referable to this species."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Keizer_Hirohito_1971.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Keizer_Hirohito_1971.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="134" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Keizer_Hirohito_1971.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Keizer_Hirohito_1971.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1011" data-file-height="1230"></a></span></td>

<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zappa_(fish)" class="mw-redirect" title="Zappa (fish)">Zappa</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Murdy, 1989</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">Fish</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Zappa, Frank"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Zappa" title="Frank Zappa">Frank Zappa</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"The generic name is in honour of Frank Zappa for his articulate and sagacious defense of the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/First_Amendment" class="mw-redirect" title="First Amendment">First Amendment</a> of the U.S. Constitution." (referring to his intervention at the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parents_Music_Resource_Center" title="Parents Music Resource Center">PMRC Senate Hearings</a>)</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Frank_Zappa_1973_2.JPG" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Frank_Zappa_1973_2.JPG" decoding="async" width="110" height="136" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Frank_Zappa_1973_2.JPG 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Frank_Zappa_1973_2.JPG 2x" data-file-width="1091" data-file-height="1345"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-657" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-657"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>655<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-658" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-658"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>656<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><span class="nowrap"><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Zappaichthys&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Zappaichthys (page does not exist)">Zappaichthys</a></i> †</span> <span style="font-size:85%;">Carnevale &amp; Collette, 2014</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fish" title="Fish">Fish</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Zappa, Frank"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Zappa" title="Frank Zappa">Frank Zappa</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>A fossil genus of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toadfish" title="Toadfish">toadfish</a> from the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miocene" title="Miocene">Miocene</a> of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Austria" title="Austria">Austria</a>.</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Frank_Zappa_1973_2.JPG" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/110px-Frank_Zappa_1973_2.JPG" decoding="async" width="110" height="136" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/165px-Frank_Zappa_1973_2.JPG 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Frank_Zappa_1973_2.JPG 2x" data-file-width="1091" data-file-height="1345"></a></span></td>

</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Zaprionus_aungsani&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Zaprionus aungsani (page does not exist)">Zaprionus aungsani</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Wynn &amp; Toda, 1988</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fly" title="Fly">Fly</a></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aung_San" title="Aung San">Aung San</a></td>
<td>A fruit fly from <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Myanmar" title="Myanmar">Myanmar</a>, "dedicated to the late general Aung San, the national leader of Burma."</td>
<td></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Aung_San_color_portrait.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Aung_San_color_portrait_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="141" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Aung_San_color_portrait_003.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Aung_San_color_portrait.jpg 2x" data-file-width="300" data-file-height="384"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-660" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-660"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>658<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Zasphinctus_sarowiwai&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Zasphinctus sarowiwai (page does not exist)">Zasphinctus sarowiwai</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Hita Garcia <i>et al.</i>, 2017</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ant" title="Ant">Ant</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Saro-Wiwa, Ken"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ken_Saro-Wiwa" title="Ken Saro-Wiwa">Ken Saro-Wiwa</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"in honour of the famous Nigerian writer, environmentalist, and 
human rights activist Kenule Beeson "Ken" Saro-Wiwa. By naming a species
 from threatened rainforest habitats after him, we want to acknowledge 
his environmental legacy and draw attention to the often-problematic 
conservation situation in most Afrotropical rainforests."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Zasphinctus_(10.3897-zookeys.693.13012)_Figure_9.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Zasphinctus_(10.3897-zookeys.693.13012)_Figure_9.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="119" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Zasphinctus_(10.3897-zookeys.693.13012)_Figure_9_002.jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Zasphinctus_(10.3897-zookeys.693.13012)_Figure_9_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1512" data-file-height="1636"></a></span></td>
<td></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-Zasphinctus_661-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Zasphinctus-661"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>659<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td><i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zimmerius_chicomendesi" class="mw-redirect" title="Zimmerius chicomendesi">Zimmerius chicomendesi</a></i> <span style="font-size:85%;">Whitney, Schunck, Rêgo &amp; Silveira2, 2013</span></td>
<td><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bird" title="Bird">Bird</a></td>
<td><span data-sort-value="Mendes, Chico"><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chico_Mendes" title="Chico Mendes">Chico Mendes</a></span></span></span></td>
<td>"Francisco "Chico" Alves Mendes Filho (1944–1988) was a man wise 
beyond the borders of his time and space. He learned to use the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amazon_rainforest" title="Amazon rainforest">Amazon rainforest</a>
 by living in it and understood the fundamental importance of 
preservation of natural resources as well as the dire socio-economic 
consequences of their destruction – and [...] [he] was able to make that
 knowledge count in the international arena. We have no doubt that 
Mendes and his message, during the last few years of his short life, did
 more to educate such agencies as the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inter-American_Development_Bank" title="Inter-American Development Bank">Inter-American Development Bank</a>
 to more wisely distribute funding toward sustainable uses in Amazonia 
than has any other individual. If Mendes were alive today, we cannot 
help but imagine that Brazil would be far ahead of where it is in the 
development of a truly sustainable Amazonia in reasonable harmony with 
indigenous peoples and colonists. In bringing this obscure little bird 
to the light of science, we call up the spirit of Chico Mendes to help 
us all get it right."</td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Zimmerius_chicomendesi_-_Chico%27s_Tyrannulet.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Zimmerius_chicomendesi_-_Chico's_Tyrannulet_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="83" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Zimmerius_chicomendesi_-_Chico's_Tyrannulet.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="1500" data-file-height="1131"></a></span></td>
<td><span class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Frameless"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Chico_Mendes_in_1988_(cropped).jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Chico_Mendes_in_1988_(cropped)_002.jpg" decoding="async" width="110" height="147" class="mw-file-element" srcset="List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Chico_Mendes_in_1988_(cropped).jpg 1.5x, List%20of%20organisms%20named%20after%20famous%20people%20(born%201900%E2%80%931949)%20-%20Wikipedia_files/Chico_Mendes_in_1988_(cropped)_003.jpg 2x" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="1200"></a></span></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><sup id="cite_ref-662" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-662"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>660<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</td></tr>
</tbody><tfoot></tfoot></table>

<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="Notes">Notes</h2><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_organisms_named_after_famous_people_(born_1900%E2%80%931949)&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" title="Edit section: Notes"><span>edit</span></a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></div>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1239543626">.mw-parser-output .reflist{margin-bottom:0.5em;list-style-type:decimal}@media screen{.mw-parser-output .reflist{font-size:90%}}.mw-parser-output .reflist .references{font-size:100%;margin-bottom:0;list-style-type:inherit}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns-2{column-width:30em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns-3{column-width:25em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns{margin-top:0.3em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns ol{margin-top:0}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns li{page-break-inside:avoid;break-inside:avoid-column}.mw-parser-output .reflist-upper-alpha{list-style-type:upper-alpha}.mw-parser-output .reflist-upper-roman{list-style-type:upper-roman}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-alpha{list-style-type:lower-alpha}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-greek{list-style-type:lower-greek}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-roman{list-style-type:lower-roman}</style><div class="reflist">
<div class="mw-references-wrap"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-2"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-2" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Entomologist <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terry_Erwin" title="Terry Erwin">Terry Erwin</a>, for instance, has over 50 eponymous organisms.<sup id="cite_ref-ZooKeys75_1-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ZooKeys75-1"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>1<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-271"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-271" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Of the 21 women honoured, 12 are in this section of the list, 7 are in the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_organisms_named_after_famous_people_(born_1950%E2%80%93present)" title="List of organisms named after famous people (born 1950–present)">List of organisms named after famous people (born 1950–present)</a> and the remaining two are not listed because they are natural scientists: <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jane_Goodall" title="Jane Goodall">Jane Goodall</a> (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibberula_goodallae" title="Gibberula goodallae">Gibberula goodallae</a></i>) and <a href="https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linda_R._Watkins" class="extiw" title="es:Linda R. Watkins">Linda R. Watkins</a> (<i><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibberula_watkinsae" title="Gibberula watkinsae">Gibberula watkinsae</a></i>).</span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>

<li id="cite_note-7"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-7" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFCarvalhoReis2020" class="citation journal cs1">Carvalho, T. "A New Miniature Species of <i>Acanthobunocephalus</i> (Silurifomes: Aspredinidae) from the Lower Purus River Basin, Amazon Basin, Brazil". <i>Copeia</i>. <b>108</b> (2): <span class="nowrap">347–</span>357. <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1643%2Fci-19-309">10.1643/ci-19-309</a>. <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S2CID_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="S2CID (identifier)">S2CID</a>&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://api.semanticscholar.org/CorpusID:219740702">219740702</a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Copeia&amp;rft.atitle=A+New+Miniature+Species+of+Acanthobunocephalus+%28Silurifomes%3A+Aspredinidae%29+from+the+Lower+Purus+River+Basin%2C+Amazon+Basin%2C+Brazil&amp;rft.volume=108&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.pages=%3Cspan+class%3D%22nowrap%22%3E347-%3C%2Fspan%3E357&amp;rft.date=2020&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1643%2Fci-19-309&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fapi.semanticscholar.org%2FCorpusID%3A219740702%23id-name%3DS2CID&amp;rft.aulast=Carvalho&amp;rft.aufirst=T.+P.&amp;rft.au=Reis%2C+R.+E.&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AList+of+organisms+named+after+famous+people+%28born+1900%E2%80%931949%29" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-16"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-16" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFVargas2020" class="citation journal cs1">Vargas, H.A. <li id="cite_note-17"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-17" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFDe_CarvalhoAnguloKokubumBarrera2019" class="citation journal cs1">De

M.B.; Haddad, C.F.B.; Giaretta, A.A. (2019). "A New Cryptic Species of 
the <i>Adenomera andreae</i> Clade from Southwestern Amazonia (Anura, Leptodactylidae)". <i>Herpetologica</i>. <b>75</b> (3): <span class="nowrap">233–</span>246. <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1655%2FD-18-00049">10.1655/D-18-00049</a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Herpetologica&amp;rft.atitle=A+New+Cryptic+Species+of+the+Adenomera+andreae+Clade+from+Southwestern+Amazonia+%28Anura%2C+Leptodactylidae%29&amp;rft.volume=75&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.pages=%3Cspan+class%3D%22nowrap%22%3E233-%3C%2Fspan%3E246&amp;rft.date=2019&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1655%2FD-18-00049&amp;rft.aulast=De+Carvalho&amp;rft.aufirst=T.R.&amp;rft.au=Angulo%2C+A.&amp;rft.au=Kokubum%2C+M.N.C.&amp;rft.au=Barrera%2C+D.A.&amp;rft.au=De+Souza%2C+M.B.&amp;rft.au=Haddad%2C+C.F.B.&amp;rft.au=Giaretta%2C+A.A.&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AList+of+organisms+named+after+famous+people+%28born+1900%E2%80%931949%29" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Rutelinae2024-18"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Rutelinae2024_18-0"><span class="cite-accessibility-label">Jump up to: </span><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Rutelinae2024_18-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Rutelinae2024_18-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Rutelinae2024_18-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFLimbourgDekoninckSeidel2024" class="citation journal cs1">Limbourg, P.; Dekoninck, W.; Seidel, M. <li id="cite_note-Agathidium2005-26"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Agathidium2005_26-0"><span class="cite-accessibility-label">Jump up to: </span><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Agathidium2005_26-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Agathidium2005_26-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFMillerWheeler2005" class="citation journal cs1">Miller, K. </li>
<li id="cite_note-Cornell1-27"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Cornell1_27-0"><span class="cite-accessibility-label">Jump up to: </span><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Cornell1_27-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Cornell1_27-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFLang2005" class="citation web cs1">Lang, Susan (4 May 2005). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://news.cornell.edu/stories/2005/05/president-bush-calls-say-thanks-slime-mold-beetle">"President Bush calls to say thanks for the slime-mold beetle"</a>. <i>Cornell Chronicle</i>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Cornell+Chronicle&amp;rft.atitle=President+Bush+calls+to+say+thanks+for+the+slime-mold+beetle&amp;rft.date=2005-05-04&amp;rft.aulast=Lang&amp;rft.aufirst=Susan&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fnews.cornell.edu%2Fstories%2F2005%2F05%2Fpresident-bush-calls-say-thanks-slime-mold-beetle&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AList+of+organisms+named+after+famous+people+%28born+1900%E2%80%931949%29" class="Z3988"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-Butcheretal2012-37"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Butcheretal2012_37-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFButcherSmithSharkeyQuicke2012" class="citation journal cs1">Butcher, B. A.; Smith, M. A.; Sharkey, M. J.; Quicke, D. L. J. (2012). "A turbo-taxonomic study of Thai <i>Aleiodes</i> (<i>Aleiodes</i>) and <i>Aleiodes</i> (<i>Arcaleiodes</i>)(Hymenoptera: Braconidae: Rogadinae) based largely on COI barcoded specimens, with rapid descriptions of 179 new species". <i>Zootaxa</i>. <b>3457</b>: <span class="nowrap">1–</span>232. <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.11646%2Fzootaxa.3457.1.1">10.11646/zootaxa.3457.1.1</a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Zootaxa&amp;rft.atitle=A+turbo-taxonomic+study+of+Thai+Aleiodes+%28Aleiodes%29+and+Aleiodes+%28Arcaleiodes%29%28Hymenoptera%3A+Braconidae%3A+Rogadinae%29+based+largely+on+COI+barcoded+specimens%2C+with+rapid+descriptions+of+179+new+species&amp;rft.volume=3457&amp;rft.pages=%3Cspan+class%3D%22nowrap%22%3E1-%3C%2Fspan%3E232&amp;rft.date=2012&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.11646%2Fzootaxa.3457.1.1&amp;rft.aulast=Butcher&amp;rft.aufirst=B.+A.&amp;rft.au=Smith%2C+M.+A.&amp;rft.au=Sharkey%2C+M.+J.&amp;rft.au=Quicke%2C+D.+L.+J.&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AList+of+organisms+named+after+famous+people+%28born+1900%E2%80%931949%29" class="Z3988"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-38"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-38" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFÁlvarez-Padilla2007" class="citation journal cs1">Álvarez-Padilla, F. (2007). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1111%2Fj.1096-3642.2007.00304.x">"Systematics of the spider genus <i>Metabus</i>
 O. P.-Cambridge, 1899 (Araneoidea: Tetragnathidae) with additions to 
the tetragnathid fauna of Chile and comments on the phylogeny of 
Tetragnathidae"</a>. <i>Zoological Journal of the Linnean Society</i>. <b>151</b> (2): <span class="nowrap">285–</span>335. <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<span class="id-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1111%2Fj.1096-3642.2007.00304.x">10.1111/j.1096-3642.2007.00304.x</a></span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Zoological+Journal+of+the+Linnean+Society&amp;rft.atitle=Systematics+of+the+spider+genus+Metabus+O.+P.-Cambridge%2C+1899+%28Araneoidea%3A+Tetragnathidae%29+with+additions+to+the+tetragnathid+fauna+of+Chile+and+comments+on+the+phylogeny+of+Tetragnathidae&amp;rft.volume=151&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.pages=%3Cspan+class%3D%22nowrap%22%3E285-%3C%2Fspan%3E335&amp;rft.date=2007&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1111%2Fj.1096-3642.2007.00304.x&amp;rft.aulast=%C3%81lvarez-Padilla&amp;rft.aufirst=F.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fdoi.org%2F10.1111%252Fj.1096-3642.2007.00304.x&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AList+of+organisms+named+after+famous+people+%28born+1900%E2%80%931949%29" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-PereGabrMiglBona08-46"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-PereGabrMiglBona08_46-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFPérez-MilesGabrielMiglioBonaldo2008" class="citation cs2">Pérez-Miles, F.; Gabriel, R.; Miglio, L.; Bonaldo, A.; Gallon, R.; Jimenez, J. (2008), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.researchgate.net/publication/49142847">"<i>Ami</i>, a new Theraphosid genus from Central and South America, with the description of six new species (Araneae: Mygalomorphae)"</a>, <i>Zootaxa</i>, <b>1915</b>: <span class="nowrap">54–</span>68, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.11646%2Fzootaxa.1915.1.3">10.11646/zootaxa.1915.1.3</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S2CID_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="S2CID (identifier)">S2CID</a>&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://api.semanticscholar.org/CorpusID:80861683">80861683</a><span class="reference-accessdate">, retrieved <span class="nowrap">1 March</span> 2022</span> – via ResearchGate</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Zootaxa&amp;rft.atitle=Ami%2C+a+new+Theraphosid+genus+from+Central+and+South+America%2C+with+the+description+of+six+new+species+%28Araneae%3A+Mygalomorphae%29&amp;rft.volume=1915&amp;rft.pages=%3Cspan+class%3D%22nowrap%22%3E54-%3C%2Fspan%3E68&amp;rft.date=2008&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.11646%2Fzootaxa.1915.1.3&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fapi.semanticscholar.org%2FCorpusID%3A80861683%23id-name%3DS2CID&amp;rft.aulast=P%C3%A9rez-Miles&amp;rft.aufirst=F.&amp;rft.au=Gabriel%2C+R.&amp;rft.au=Miglio%2C+L.&amp;rft.au=Bonaldo%2C+A.&amp;rft.au=Gallon%2C+R.&amp;rft.au=Jimenez%2C+J.+J.&amp;rft.au=Bertani%2C+R.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.researchgate.net%2Fpublication%2F49142847&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AList+of+organisms+named+after+famous+people+%28born+1900%E2%80%931949%29" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-PereGabrSher19-47"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-PereGabrSher19_47-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFPérez-MilesGabrielSherwood2019" class="citation cs2">Pérez-Miles, F.; Gabriel, R. &amp; Sherwood, D. (2019), <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.researchgate.net/publication/334825767">"<i>Neischnocolus</i> Petrunkevitch, 1925, senior synonym of <i>Ami</i> Perez-Miles, 2008 and <i>Barropelma</i> Chamberlin, 1940 (Araneae: Theraphosidae)"</a>, <i>Arachnology</i>, <b>18</b> (2): <span class="nowrap">150–</span>155, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.13156%2Farac.2018.18.2.150">10.13156/arac.2018.18.2.150</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S2CID_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="S2CID (identifier)">S2CID</a>&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://api.semanticscholar.org/CorpusID:201308911">201308911</a><span class="reference-accessdate">, retrieved <span class="nowrap">1 March</span> 2022</span> – via ResearchGate</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Arachnology&amp;rft.atitle=Neischnocolus+Petrunkevitch%2C+1925%2C+senior+synonym+of+Ami+Perez-Miles%2C+2008+and+Barropelma+Chamberlin%2C+1940+%28Araneae%3A+Theraphosidae%29&amp;rft.volume=18&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.pages=%3Cspan+class%3D%22nowrap%22%3E150-%3C%2Fspan%3E155&amp;rft.date=2019&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.13156%2Farac.2018.18.2.150&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fapi.semanticscholar.org%2FCorpusID%3A201308911%23id-name%3DS2CID&amp;rft.aulast=P%C3%A9rez-Miles&amp;rft.aufirst=F.&amp;rft.au=Gabriel%2C+R.&amp;rft.au=Sherwood%2C+D.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.researchgate.net%2Fpublication%2F334825767&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AList+of+organisms+named+after+famous+people+%28born+1900%E2%80%931949%29" class="Z3988"></span></span>

</li>
<li id="cite_note-57"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-57" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFSokolovCarltonCornell2004" class="citation journal cs1">Sokolov,

<li id="cite_note-Arenivaga-66"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Arenivaga_66-0"><span class="cite-accessibility-label">Jump up to: </span><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Arenivaga_66-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFHopkins2014" class="citation journal cs1">Hopkins, H. href="https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/24624022">24624022</a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=ZooKeys&amp;rft.atitle=A+revision+of+the+genus+Arenivaga+%28Rehn%29+%28Blattodea%2C+Corydiidae%29%2C+with+descriptions+of+new+species+and+key+to+the+males+of+the+genus&amp;rft.issue=384&amp;rft.pages=%3Cspan+class%3D%22nowrap%22%3E1-%3C%2Fspan%3E256&amp;rft.date=2014&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov%2Fpmc%2Farticles%2FPMC3950428%23id-name%3DPMC&amp;rft_id=info%3Apmid%2F24624022&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.3897%2Fzookeys.384.6197&amp;rft_id=info%3Abibcode%2F2014ZooK..384....1H&amp;rft.aulast=Hopkins&amp;rft.aufirst=H.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov%2Fpmc%2Farticles%2FPMC3950428&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AList+of+organisms+named+after+famous+people+%28born+1900%E2%80%931949%29" </li>

<li id="cite_note-77"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-77" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFManegoldLouchart2012" class="citation journal cs1">Manegold, A.; Louchart, A. (2012). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.researchgate.net/publication/235217983">"Biogeographic

<li id="cite_note-BenPin22-84"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-BenPin22_84-0"><span class="cite-accessibility-label">Jump up to: </span><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-BenPin22_84-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-BenPin22_84-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-BenPin22_84-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-BenPin22_84-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-BenPin22_84-5"><sup><i><b>f</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-BenPin22_84-6"><sup><i><b>g</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-BenPin22_84-7"><sup><i><b>h</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-BenPin22_84-8"><sup><i><b>i</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-BenPin22_84-9"><sup><i><b>j</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-BenPin22_84-10"><sup><i><b>k</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFBenedettiPinto-da-Rocha2022" class="citation journal cs1">Benedetti, A.R.; Pinto-da-Rocha, R. (2022). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.3897%2Fasp.80.e73829">"Systematic
 revision and total evidence phylogenetic analysis of the Andean family

 new genera and twenty new species"</a>. <i>Arthropod Systematics &amp; Phylogeny</i>. <b>80</b>: <span class="nowrap">309–</span>388. <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<span class="id-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.3897%2Fasp.80.e73829">10.3897/asp.80.e73829</a></span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Arthropod+Systematics+%26+Phylogeny&amp;rft.atitle=Systematic+revision+and+total+evidence+phylogenetic+analysis+of+the+Andean+family+Metasarcidae+Kury%2C+1994+%28Opiliones%3A+Laniatores%29%2C+with+description+of+two+new+genera+and+twenty+new+species&amp;rft.volume=80&amp;rft.pages=%3Cspan+class%3D%22nowrap%22%3E309-%3C%2Fspan%3E388&amp;rft.date=2022&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.3897%2Fasp.80.e73829&amp;rft.aulast=Benedetti&amp;rft.aufirst=A.R.&amp;rft.au=Pinto-da-Rocha%2C+R.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fdoi.org%2F10.3897%252Fasp.80.e73829&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AList+of+organisms+named+after+famous+people+%28born+1900%E2%80%931949%29" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-85"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-85" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFYakovlevLászlóMüllerKravchenko2020" class="citation journal cs1">Yakovlev RV, László GM, Müller GC, Kravchenko VD (30 September 2020). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.15298%2Frusentj.29.3.08">"Brief review of the <i>Azygophleps legraini</i>
 Yakovlev et Saldaitis, 2011 species group (Lepidoptera: Cossidae: 
Zeuzerinae) with descriptions of three new species from western Africa"</a>. <i>Russian Entomol. J</i>. <b>29</b> (3): <span class="nowrap">289–</span>294. <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<span class="id-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.15298%2Frusentj.29.3.08">10.15298/rusentj.29.3.08</a></span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Russian+Entomol.+J.&amp;rft.atitle=Brief+review+of+the+Azygophleps+legraini+Yakovlev+et+Saldaitis%2C+2011+species+group+%28Lepidoptera%3A+Cossidae%3A+Zeuzerinae%29+with+descriptions+of+three+new+species+from+western+Africa&amp;rft.volume=29&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.pages=%3Cspan+class%3D%22nowrap%22%3E289-%3C%2Fspan%3E294&amp;rft.date=2020-09-30&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.15298%2Frusentj.29.3.08&amp;rft.aulast=Yakovlev&amp;rft.aufirst=RV&amp;rft.au=L%C3%A1szl%C3%B3%2C+GM&amp;rft.au=M%C3%BCller%2C+GC&amp;rft.au=Kravchenko%2C+VD&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fdoi.org%2F10.15298%252Frusentj.29.3.08&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AList+of+organisms+named+after+famous+people+%28born+1900%E2%80%931949%29" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Seuylemez20-86"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Seuylemez20_86-0"><span class="cite-accessibility-label">Jump up to: </span><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Seuylemez20_86-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFSeuylemezianOttWolfFragante2020" class="citation journal cs1">Seuylemezian A, Ott L, Wolf S, Fragante J, Yip O, Pukall R, Schumann P, Vaishampayan P (February 2020). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1099%2Fijsem.0.003714">"<i>Bacillus glennii</i> sp. nov. and <i>Bacillus saganii</i> sp. nov., isolated from the vehicle assembly building at Kennedy Space Center where the Viking spacecraft were assembled"</a>. <i>Int. J. Syst. Evol. Microbiol</i>. <b>70</b> (1): <span class="nowrap">71–</span>76. <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<span class="id-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1099%2Fijsem.0.003714">10.1099/ijsem.0.003714</a></span>. <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PMID_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="PMID (identifier)">PMID</a>&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/31622233">31622233</a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Int.+J.+Syst.+Evol.+Microbiol.&amp;rft.atitle=Bacillus+glennii+sp.+nov.+and+Bacillus+saganii+sp.+nov.%2C+isolated+from+the+vehicle+assembly+building+at+Kennedy+Space+Center+where+the+Viking+spacecraft+were+assembled&amp;rft.volume=70&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.pages=%3Cspan+class%3D%22nowrap%22%3E71-%3C%2Fspan%3E76&amp;rft.date=2020-02&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1099%2Fijsem.0.003714&amp;rft_id=info%3Apmid%2F31622233&amp;rft.aulast=Seuylemezian&amp;rft.aufirst=A&amp;rft.au=Ott%2C+L&amp;rft.au=Wolf%2C+S&amp;rft.au=Fragante%2C+J&amp;rft.au=Yip%2C+O&amp;rft.au=Pukall%2C+R&amp;rft.au=Schumann%2C+P&amp;rft.au=Vaishampayan%2C+P&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fdoi.org%2F10.1099%252Fijsem.0.003714&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AList+of+organisms+named+after+famous+people+%28born+1900%E2%80%931949%29" class="Z3988"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-92"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-92" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFVolynkinHuangIvanova2019" class="citation journal cs1">Volynkin, A.V.; Huang, S.Y; Ivanova, M.S. <li id="cite_note-93"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-93" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFWillisMurrayMegirian1990" class="citation journal cs1">Willis, P.; Murray, P.; Megirian, D. <li id="cite_note-94"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-94" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFMirshamsiZamaniMarusik2015" class="citation journal cs1">Mirshamsi,
 O.; Zamani, A.; Marusik, Y. M. (2015). "A survey of Hersiliidae 
(Arachnida: Araneae) of Iran with description of one new genus and two 
new species". <i>Journal of Natural History</i>. <b>50</b> (<span class="nowrap">23–</span>24): <span class="nowrap">1447–</span>1461. <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1080%2F00222933.2015.1113318">10.1080/00222933.2015.1113318</a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Journal+of+Natural+History&amp;rft.atitle=A+survey+of+Hersiliidae+%28Arachnida%3A+Araneae%29+of+Iran+with+description+of+one+new+genus+and+two+new+species&amp;rft.volume=50&amp;rft.issue=%3Cspan+class%3D%22nowrap%22%3E23%E2%80%93%3C%2Fspan%3E24&amp;rft.pages=%3Cspan+class%3D%22nowrap%22%3E1447-%3C%2Fspan%3E1461&amp;rft.date=2015&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1080%2F00222933.2015.1113318&amp;rft.aulast=Mirshamsi&amp;rft.aufirst=O.&amp;rft.au=Zamani%2C+A.&amp;rft.au=Marusik%2C+Y.+M.&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AList+of+organisms+named+after+famous+people+%28born+1900%E2%80%931949%29" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-95"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-95" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFJażdżewskaZiemkiewicz2019" class="citation journal cs1">Jażdżewska,

species (Crustacea) from sunken wood described using integrative 
taxonomy". <i>Progress in Oceanography</i>. <b>172</b>: <span class="nowrap">1–</span>13. <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bibcode_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Bibcode (identifier)">Bibcode</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://ui.adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/2019PrOce.172....1J">2019PrOce.172....1J</a>. <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1016%2Fj.pocean.2018.12.012">10.1016/j.pocean.2018.12.012</a>. <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S2CID_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="S2CID (identifier)">S2CID</a>&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://api.semanticscholar.org/CorpusID:134362190">134362190</a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Progress+in+Oceanography&amp;rft.atitle=A+new+abyssal+amphipod+species+%28Crustacea%29+from+sunken+wood+described+using+integrative+taxonomy&amp;rft.volume=172&amp;rft.pages=%3Cspan+class%3D%22nowrap%22%3E1-%3C%2Fspan%3E13&amp;rft.date=2019&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fapi.semanticscholar.org%2FCorpusID%3A134362190%23id-name%3DS2CID&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1016%2Fj.pocean.2018.12.012&amp;rft_id=info%3Abibcode%2F2019PrOce.172....1J&amp;rft.aulast=Ja%C5%BCd%C5%BCewska&amp;rft.aufirst=Anna+Maria&amp;rft.au=Ziemkiewicz%2C+Aleksandra&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AList+of+organisms+named+after+famous+people+%28born+1900%E2%80%931949%29" class="Z3988"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-102"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-102" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFAndradeSouza-Filho2022" class="citation journal cs1">Andrade, R. <li id="cite_note-111"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-111" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFBergueCoimbra2023" class="citation journal cs1">Bergue, C. oceanic areas, with description of a new bradleyine genus"</a>. <i>Anais da Academia Brasileira de Ciências</i>. <b>95</b> (Suppl. 2): e20220369. <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<span class="id-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1590%2F0001-3765202320220369">10.1590/0001-3765202320220369</a></span>. <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hdl_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Hdl (identifier)">hdl</a>:<span class="id-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://hdl.handle.net/10183%2F270955">10183/270955</a></span>. <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PMID_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="PMID (identifier)">PMID</a>&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/38126431">38126431</a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Anais+da+Academia+Brasileira+de+Ci%C3%AAncias&amp;rft.atitle=The+genus+Bradleya+Hornibrook%2C+1952+%28Crustacea%3A+Ostracoda%29+in+South+America+and+adjacent+oceanic+areas%2C+with+description+of+a+new+bradleyine+genus&amp;rft.volume=95&amp;rft.issue=Suppl.+2&amp;rft.pages=e20220369&amp;rft.date=2023&amp;rft_id=info%3Ahdl%2F10183%2F270955&amp;rft_id=info%3Apmid%2F38126431&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1590%2F0001-3765202320220369&amp;rft.aulast=Bergue&amp;rft.aufirst=C.+T.&amp;rft.au=Coimbra%2C+J.+C.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fdoi.org%2F10.1590%252F0001-3765202320220369&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AList+of+organisms+named+after+famous+people+%28born+1900%E2%80%931949%29" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-112"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-112" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFSrokaStaniczek2020" class="citation journal cs1">Sroka,

<li id="cite_note-TeruelTuriel-120"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-TeruelTuriel_120-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFTeruelTuriel2020" class="citation journal cs1">Teruel, R.; Turiel, C. (2020). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.researchgate.net/publication/348153104">"The genus <i>Buthus</i> Leach, 1815 (Scorpiones: Buthidae) in the Iberian Peninsula.
